character_words: Water. Earth. Fire. Air. My grandmother used to tell me stories about the old days: a time of peace when the Avatar kept balance between the Water Tribes, Earth Kingdom, Fire Nation and Air Nomads. But that all changed when the Fire Nation attacked. Only the Avatar mastered all four elements; only he could stop the ruthless firebenders. But when the world needed him most, he vanished. A hundred years have passed, and the Fire Nation is nearing victory in the war. Two years ago, my father and the men of my tribe journeyed to the Earth Kingdom to help fight against the Fire Nation, leaving me and my brother to look after our tribe. Some people believe that the Avatar was never reborn into the Air Nomads and that the cycle is broken, but I haven't lost hope. I still believe that, somehow, the Avatar will return to save the world.
writer: ‎Michael Dante DiMartino, Bryan Konietzko, Aaron Ehasz, Peter Goldfinger, Josh Stolberg

character_words: Water. Earth. Fire. Air. Long ago, the four nations lived together in harmony. Then, everything changed when the Fire Nation attacked. Only the Avatar, master of all four elements, could stop them, but when the world needed him most, he vanished. A hundred years passed, and my brother and I discovered the new Avatar, an airbender named Aang. And although his airbending skills are great, he has a lot to learn before he's ready to save anyone. But I believe Aang can save the world.
writer: Michael Dante DiMartino, Bryan Konietzko, Aaron Ehasz, Peter Goldfinger, Josh Stolberg

character_words: Wait 'til you see it, Katara! The Air Temple is one of the most beautiful places in the world!
Aang, I know you're excited,  but it's been a hundred years since you've been home.
Aang, I know you're excited,  but it's been a hundred years since you've been home.
That's why I'm so excited!
It's just that ... a lot can change in all that time.
I know, but I need to see it for myself.
Wake up, Sokka! Air Temple, here we come!
Wake up, Sokka! Air Temple, here we come!
Uggh! Sleep now. Temple later.
Sokka! Wake up!  There's a prickle snake in your sleeping bag!
Sokka! Wake up!  There's a prickle snake in your sleeping bag!
scene_description: [Aang moves the stick up and down the sleeping bag, only touching Sokka with the tip of it.]

character_words: Ahh!  Get it off! Get it off!  Ahh!
scene_description: [He lazily opens one eye before yelling out in horror.]

character_words: Ahh!  Get it off! Get it off!  Ahh!
scene_description: [He quickly rises and hops around, still inside the sleeping bag.]

character_words: Ahh!  Get it off! Get it off!  Ahh!
scene_description: [After two hops, Sokka slams flat to the ground.]

character_words: Great! You're awake! Let's go!
Uncle, I want the repairs made as quickly as possible. I don't want to stay too long and risk losing his trail.
You mean the Avatar?
Don't mention his name on these docks!  Once word gets out that he's alive, every firebender will be out looking for him, and I don't want anyone getting in the way!
scene_description: [Turns around sharply to face Iroh, as he slightly backs off.]

character_words: Don't mention his name on these docks!  Once word gets out that he's alive, every firebender will be out looking for him, and I don't want anyone getting in the way!
Getting in the way of what,  Prince Zuko?
scene_description: [Iroh and Zuko turn, with shocked expressions on their face, toward the camera in the direction the sound came from.]

character_words: Getting in the way of what,  Prince Zuko?
scene_description: [Close-up of a man with big sideburns dressed in a Fire Nation uniform.]

character_words: Captain Zhao.
It's commander now. And  General Iroh. Great hero of our nation.
It's commander now. And  General Iroh. Great hero of our nation.
Retired general.
The Fire Lord's brother and son are welcome guests anytime. What brings you to my harbor?
Our ship is being repaired.
That's quite a bit of damage.
Yes.  You wouldn't believe what happened.  Uncle! Tell Commander Zhao what happened.
scene_description: [He holds up one finger, while Iroh stares disinterested in front of him.]

character_words: Yes.  You wouldn't believe what happened.  Uncle! Tell Commander Zhao what happened.
scene_description: [He glances at his uncle, and angrily commands him as he gestures at Zhao.]

character_words: Yes. I will do that.  It was incredible!  What? Did we crash or something?
scene_description: [Iroh's eyes open wide in surprise, as he is addressed by Zuko.]

character_words: Yes. I will do that.  It was incredible!  What? Did we crash or something?
scene_description: [He happily holds his hand up and relates enthusiastically.]

character_words: Yes. I will do that.  It was incredible!  What? Did we crash or something?
scene_description: [To Zuko, from the corner of his mouth in a confused tone.]

character_words: Yes! Right into ... an Earth Kingdom ship!
Really? You must regale me with all of the thrilling details.  Join me for a drink?
Really? You must regale me with all of the thrilling details.  Join me for a drink?
scene_description: [Smirks while he gets into Zuko's face.]

character_words: Sorry, but we have to go.
scene_description: [He averts his gaze and begins to walk away.]

character_words: Prince Zuko, show Commander Zhao your respect.  We would be honored to join you. Do you have any ginseng tea? It's my favorite.
scene_description: [Removes his hand from Zuko's shoulder as he faces Zhao while Zuko just slants his eyes.]

character_words: Hey, stomach? Be quiet, all right? I'm trying to find us some food.
Hey! Who ate all of my blubbered seal jerky?!
scene_description: [Accusingly to the two in front of him.]

character_words: Oh. That was food?  I used it to start the campfire last night.  Sorry.
Oh. That was food?  I used it to start the campfire last night.  Sorry.
Oh. That was food?  I used it to start the campfire last night.  Sorry.
scene_description: [The hint of a smile can be heard.]

character_words: You what?!  No wonder the flames smelled so good.
You what?!  No wonder the flames smelled so good.
scene_description: [Looks up before slanting his eyes and groans. Longing.]

character_words: The Patola Mountain range! We're almost there!
Aang, before we get to the temple, I want to talk to you about the airbenders.
What about 'em?
Well, I just want you to be prepared for what you might see. The Fire Nation is ruthless.  They killed my mother, and they could have done the same to your people.
Well, I just want you to be prepared for what you might see. The Fire Nation is ruthless.  They killed my mother, and they could have done the same to your people.
Just because no one has seen an airbender, doesn't mean the Fire Nation killed them all. They probably escaped!
scene_description: [Ponders over her words for a bit. Hopefully.]

character_words: I know it's hard to accept.
You don't understand, Katara. The only way to get to an airbender temple is on a flying bison, and I doubt the Fire Nation has any flying bison!  Right, Appa?
scene_description: [Cheerfully, as Katara moves her hand back to her side.]

character_words: You don't understand, Katara. The only way to get to an airbender temple is on a flying bison, and I doubt the Fire Nation has any flying bison!  Right, Appa?
Yip yip!
There it is. The Southern Air Temple.
Aang, it's amazing!
We're home, buddy! We're home.
We're home, buddy! We're home.
scene_description: [His eyes squint a bit in happiness.]

character_words: ... And by the year's end, the Earth Kingdom capital will be under our rule.  The Fire Lord will finally claim victory in this war.
scene_description: [Shift to a bird view of the tent, revealing Zuko, sitting at a table, and Iroh, standing in the corner, looking at some weapons that are placed against the wall. Zhao turns around.]

character_words: If my father thinks the rest of the world will follow him willingly, then he is a fool!
Two years at sea have done little to temper your tongue. So, how is your search for the Avatar going?
Eh.. My fault, entirely.
We haven't found him yet.
Did you really expect to? The Avatar died a hundred years ago.  Along with the rest of the airbenders.  Unless you have found some evidence that the Avatar is alive?
scene_description: [Close-up of Zuko, as he slants his eyes.]

character_words: Did you really expect to? The Avatar died a hundred years ago.  Along with the rest of the airbenders.  Unless you have found some evidence that the Avatar is alive?
scene_description: [Close-up of Zhao, whose face contorts in an evil expression.]

character_words: No.  Nothing.
No.  Nothing.
Prince Zuko, the Avatar is the only one who can stop the Fire Nation from winning this war.  If you have an ounce of loyalty left, you'll tell me what you found.
scene_description: [With an expression of disbelief on his face, as he rises from his chair.]

character_words: Prince Zuko, the Avatar is the only one who can stop the Fire Nation from winning this war.  If you have an ounce of loyalty left, you'll tell me what you found.
I haven't found  anything.  It's like you said. The Avatar probably died a long time ago.  Come on, Uncle, we're going.
scene_description: [Looks up at Zhao and his tone becomes slightly more aggressive.]

character_words: I haven't found  anything.  It's like you said. The Avatar probably died a long time ago.  Come on, Uncle, we're going.
scene_description: [Close-up, as he continues on a softer tone, slightly mockingly.]

character_words: I haven't found  anything.  It's like you said. The Avatar probably died a long time ago.  Come on, Uncle, we're going.
Commander Zhao, we interrogated the crew as you instructed. They confirmed Prince Zuko had the Avatar in custody,  but let him escape.
Now remind me,  how, exactly, was your ship damaged?
Now remind me,  how, exactly, was your ship damaged?
scene_description: [Close-up of Zuko's face, as Zhao walks up to him and leans over to talk into Zuko's ear. Zuko slants his eyes.]

character_words: So where do I get something to eat?
You're lucky enough to be one of the first outsiders to ever visit an airbender temple, and all you can think about is food?
I'm just a simple guy, with simple needs.
So that's where my friends and I would play airball,  and over there  is where the bison would sleep, and ...
So that's where my friends and I would play airball,  and over there  is where the bison would sleep, and ...
scene_description: [The camera shifts to a shot of a stadium consisting of many tall poles.]

character_words: So that's where my friends and I would play airball,  and over there  is where the bison would sleep, and ...
scene_description: [The camera pans to the right to reveal the trio again.]

character_words: So that's where my friends and I would play airball,  and over there  is where the bison would sleep, and ...
What's wrong?
This place used to be full of monks and lemurs and bison. Now there's just a bunch of weeds.  I can't believe how much things have changed.
This place used to be full of monks and lemurs and bison. Now there's just a bunch of weeds.  I can't believe how much things have changed.
scene_description: [His eyes squint with sadness. The shot changes to a back view of Aang as he stands on the ledge; his clothes flutter in the wind, a dead tree at each side of him. In a sad tone.]

character_words: So uh, this airball game. How do you play?
scene_description: [Cheerfully trying to distract Aang from his sadness.]

character_words: Aang, seven!  Sokka, zero!
scene_description: [Smiling broadly, he stretches out his arms above his head.]

character_words: Aang, seven!  Sokka, zero!
scene_description: [He forms a Zero with his hands and makes a circular movement with his whole body.]

character_words: Making him feel better is putting me in a world of hurt.  Katara, check this out.
Making him feel better is putting me in a world of hurt.  Katara, check this out.
scene_description: [He erects himself, but before he gets up completely, his eyes widen when he sees something in front of him and he crawls to the front. The camera shifts to reveal an old Fire Nation helmet lying in the snow. It has been battered by the elements, and shows signs of cracks and burns. He looks up at his sister.]

character_words: Fire Nation.
We should tell him.
Aang! There's something you need to see.
Okay!
scene_description: [Aang runs to them from the airball court, still playing with the hollow ball. Cheerfully.]

character_words: What is it?
Uh ... Just a new waterbending move I learned.
scene_description: [Innocently holds her hands behind her back.]

character_words: Nice one! But enough practicing,  we have a whole temple to see!
scene_description: [Excited as he turns around and start walking away.]

character_words: You know, you can't protect him forever.
scene_description: [Brushes the last of the snow from his head and shoulders.]

character_words: Katara, firebenders were here. You can't pretend they weren't.
I can for Aang's sake. If he finds out that the Fire Nation invaded his home, he'll be devastated.
Hey guys!  I want you to meet somebody!
Hey guys!  I want you to meet somebody!
scene_description: [The two look up and see Aang standing in front of a statue of a monk, turning around and pointing toward it.]

character_words: Who's that?
Monk Gyatso! The greatest airbender in the world.  He taught me everything I know.
Monk Gyatso! The greatest airbender in the world.  He taught me everything I know.
scene_description: [Scene switches to a frontal view of the statue as Aang turns around again toward the siblings while gesturing at the statue.]

character_words: But the true secret, is in the gooey center.
Hmm ...
My ancient cake-making technique isn't the only thing on your mind, is it, Aang?
scene_description: [With a calm, soothing and understanding voice.]

character_words: This whole Avatar thing, m-maybe the monks made a mistake.
The only mistake they made was telling you before you turned sixteen, but we can't concern ourselves with what was. We must act on what is.
But Gyatso? How do I know if I'm ready for this?
Your questions will be answered when you're old enough to enter the air temple sanctuary. Inside, you will meet someone who will guide you on your journey.
scene_description: [Cut back to a close shot of Gyatso with Aang sitting on the ledge in the background.]

character_words: Who is it?
When you are ready, he will reveal himself to you.  Now, are you going to help me with these cakes,  or not?
scene_description: [Cut back to the close shot of Gyatso with Aang in the background.]

character_words: When you are ready, he will reveal himself to you.  Now, are you going to help me with these cakes,  or not?
scene_description: [In the background, Aang, annoyed by this vague answer, grunts softly and looks up to the sky before cupping his face in his hands again. Monk Gyatso continues on a bright, happy tone.]

character_words: When you are ready, he will reveal himself to you.  Now, are you going to help me with these cakes,  or not?
scene_description: [Close-up of Aang as he smiles lovingly at Gyatso.]

character_words: All right.
One.  Two. Three!
scene_description: [The camera switches to a side-view as the duo conjures a small air ball.]

character_words: Your aim has improved greatly,  my young pupil.
Your aim has improved greatly,  my young pupil.
You must miss him.
scene_description: [Understandingly places a hand on his shoulder.]

character_words: Yeah.
Yeah.
Where are you going?
The air temple sanctuary. There's someone I'm ready to meet.
scene_description: [Switch to a shot from Katara's point of view. Aang is walking up some stairs that lead to a corridor behind the statue. He looks back while answering.]

character_words: But Aang, no one could have survived in there for a hundred years.
It's not impossible.  I survived in the iceberg for that long.
scene_description: [Camera changes to show the trio looking up at the door. Hopeful.]

character_words: It's not impossible.  I survived in the iceberg for that long.
Good point.
Katara, whoever's in there might help figure out this Avatar thing!
scene_description: [Close shot of Aang with Katara visible over his shoulder. He glances hopeful at her over his shoulder. Excited.]

character_words: And whoever's in there might have  a medley of delicious  cured meats!
scene_description: [Appears in screen from behind Aang's back. Katara and Aang look surprised at him. Eagerly.]

character_words: And whoever's in there might have  a medley of delicious  cured meats!
scene_description: [Katara's look changes to one of annoyance. Close-up of Sokka's determined, anticipating face.]

character_words: And whoever's in there might have  a medley of delicious  cured meats!
scene_description: [He rubs his hands together and practically starts to drool over the thought.]

character_words: I don't suppose you have a key?
The key, Sokka, is airbending.
Hello?  Anyone home?
scene_description: [Cut to a front view of Aang, as he brings his hand besides his mouth.]

character_words: Hello?  Anyone home?
scene_description: [Switch back to a shot from behind Sokka and Katara as Aang enters the sanctuary.]

character_words: So a twelve-year-old boy bested you and your firebenders.  You're more pathetic than I thought.
scene_description: [Wider shot of the tent as Zhao stops pacing. Iroh can be seen sitting in a corner.]

character_words: I underestimated him once, but it will not happen again!
No, it will not. Because you won't have a second chance.
scene_description: [Frontal view with Zuko in the background. Aggressively.]

character_words: Commander Zhao,  I've been hunting the Avatar for two years and I -
Commander Zhao,  I've been hunting the Avatar for two years and I -
And you failed!  Capturing the Avatar is too important to leave in a teenager's hands. He's mine now.
scene_description: [Cut to a shot from over Zuko's shoulder as Zhao angrily turns around, spreading flames in an arc.]

character_words: And you failed!  Capturing the Avatar is too important to leave in a teenager's hands. He's mine now.
Keep them here.
More tea, please.
scene_description: [Calmly with a hint of amusement in his voice.]

character_words: Statues? That's it? Where's the meat?
Who are all these people?
I'm not sure.  But it feels like I know them somehow. Look!  That one's an airbender.
I'm not sure.  But it feels like I know them somehow. Look!  That one's an airbender.
I'm not sure.  But it feels like I know them somehow. Look!  That one's an airbender.
scene_description: [Camera shifts to a point behind Aang and Katara. Aang points at the statue of a man with airbending mastery tattoos in front of him.]

character_words: And this one's a waterbender.  They're lined up in a pattern:  air, water, earth and fire.
scene_description: [Camera pans to the right. Katara points at the statue of a male dressed in Water Tribe clothes next to the airbender.]

character_words: And this one's a waterbender.  They're lined up in a pattern:  air, water, earth and fire.
scene_description: [Looks to the right and back to the left.]

character_words: And this one's a waterbender.  They're lined up in a pattern:  air, water, earth and fire.
That's the Avatar Cycle.
Of course. They're Avatars. All these people are your past lives, Aang.
Wow! There are so many!
Past lives?  Katara, you really believe in that stuff?
Past lives?  Katara, you really believe in that stuff?
scene_description: [Aang stops before a statue while Sokka and Katara are still visible in the background.]

character_words: It's true.  When the Avatar dies, he's reincarnated into the next nation in the cycle.
scene_description: [The picture pans up the reveal Aang staring at the statue of an elderly man with a beard. In the background hundreds of statues can be seen spiraling up.]

character_words: Aang! Snap out of it!
Huh?
Who is that?
scene_description: [She curiously follows his gaze and looks at the statue as well.]

character_words: That's Avatar Roku. The Avatar before me.
You were a firebender? No wonder I didn't trust you when we first met.
There's no writing. How do you know his name?
scene_description: [Looks at the base of the statue.]

character_words: I'm not sure. I just know it somehow.
You just couldn't get any weirder.
Firebender. Nobody make a sound.
You're making a sound!
Shhhh!
That firebender won't know what hit him.
Lemur!
Dinner!
Don't listen to him. You're going to be my new pet.
Not if I get him first!
scene_description: [Aang glares angrily at Sokka, before the scene switches to a close-up of his drooling face. Challenging.]

character_words: Wait! Come back!
I want to eat you!
Hey! No fair!
My search party is ready. Once I'm out to sea,  my guards will escort you back to your ship and  you'll be free to go.
scene_description: [Cut to a shot from over Zhao's head to reveal Iroh and Zuko sitting in two chairs in front of him in the middle of the tent.]

character_words: My search party is ready. Once I'm out to sea,  my guards will escort you back to your ship and  you'll be free to go.
scene_description: [Close-up of Zuko, who angrily looks down.]

character_words: Why? Are you worried I'm going to try and stop you?
You? Stop me? Impossible.
Don't underestimate me, Zhao! I will capture the Avatar before you!
Prince Zuko, that's enough.
You can't compete with me. I have hundreds of war ships under my command and you? You're just a banished prince. No home, no allies. Your own father doesn't even want you.
You're wrong! Once I deliver the Avatar to my father, he will welcome me home with honor, and restore my rightful place on the throne!
If your father really wanted you home, he would have let you return by now, Avatar or no Avatar. But in his eyes you are a failure and a disgrace to the Fire Nation.
scene_description: [Close-up of Zhao, as the camera pans to the right to slowly reveal his whole face.]

character_words: That's not true.
You have the scar to prove it.
Maybe you'd like one to match!
Is that a challenge?
An Agni Kai. At sunset.
Very well.  It's a shame your father won't be here to watch me humiliate you.  I guess your uncle will do.
Very well.  It's a shame your father won't be here to watch me humiliate you.  I guess your uncle will do.
Prince Zuko, have you forgotten what happened last time you dueled a master?
scene_description: [Camera pans slowly to the right to a full close-up of Zuko. Worried.]

character_words: I will never forget.
Hey! Come back!  Come on out, little lemur! That hungry guy won't bother you anymore.
Hey! Come back!  Come on out, little lemur! That hungry guy won't bother you anymore.
scene_description: [Cut to a shot from inside the tent, as Aang pushes the decaying curtain of drapes out of the way. Happily looks around.]

character_words: Firebenders? They were here?
Gyatso.
Hey, Aang! You find my dinner yet?  Aang, I wasn't really going to eat the lemur, okay?  Oh, man.  Come on, Aang. Everything will be all right. Let's get out of here.
Hey, Aang! You find my dinner yet?  Aang, I wasn't really going to eat the lemur, okay?  Oh, man.  Come on, Aang. Everything will be all right. Let's get out of here.
scene_description: [Cut to a side-view of Aang sitting on his knees, his head cupped in his hands. Sokka walks toward him. Reassuring.]

character_words: Hey, Aang! You find my dinner yet?  Aang, I wasn't really going to eat the lemur, okay?  Oh, man.  Come on, Aang. Everything will be all right. Let's get out of here.
scene_description: [He approaches Aang with a smile on his face, but shakes his head and does a double take.]

character_words: Hey, Aang! You find my dinner yet?  Aang, I wasn't really going to eat the lemur, okay?  Oh, man.  Come on, Aang. Everything will be all right. Let's get out of here.
scene_description: [Switch to a shot of the skeleton of the monk, which slowly moves back to reveal that Sokka places a hand on Aang's shoulder.]

character_words: Aang!
Send word to the Fire Lord immediately! The Avatar has returned!
Aang! Come on! Snap out of it!
Aaaaahh!
What happened?
scene_description: [Shouting above the raging winds. Close-up of the two siblings. Katara looks worried at her brother.]

character_words: He found out firebenders killed Gyatso!
Oh no! It's his Avatar Spirit!  He must have triggered it! I'm going to try and calm him down!
scene_description: [Raises her hand to protect herself against the winds and the flying debris.]

character_words: Oh no! It's his Avatar Spirit!  He must have triggered it! I'm going to try and calm him down!
scene_description: [Closes an eye against the wind and starts to make her way toward Aang.]

character_words: Well, do it! Before he blows us off the mountain!
scene_description: [Holds on to the rock in an attempt to keep from being blown away. Alarmed.]

character_words: Remember your firebending basics,  Prince Zuko. They are your greatest weapons.
I refuse to let him win.
This will be over quickly.
Basics, Zuko!  Break his root!
Do it!
That's it? Your father raised a coward.
Next time you get in my way, I promise, I won't hold back.

No, Prince Zuko. Do not taint your victory.  So this is how the great Commander Zhao acts in defeat?  Disgraceful.  Even in exile, my nephew is more honorable than you.  Thanks again for the tea. It was delicious.

No, Prince Zuko. Do not taint your victory.  So this is how the great Commander Zhao acts in defeat?  Disgraceful.  Even in exile, my nephew is more honorable than you.  Thanks again for the tea. It was delicious.
scene_description: [Close-up of Zhao lying on the floor.]

character_words: No, Prince Zuko. Do not taint your victory.  So this is how the great Commander Zhao acts in defeat?  Disgraceful.  Even in exile, my nephew is more honorable than you.  Thanks again for the tea. It was delicious.
scene_description: [Cut back to a closer shot of Zuko and Iroh.]

character_words: No, Prince Zuko. Do not taint your victory.  So this is how the great Commander Zhao acts in defeat?  Disgraceful.  Even in exile, my nephew is more honorable than you.  Thanks again for the tea. It was delicious.
scene_description: [Zuko looks at Iroh upon hearing those last words. Switch to a shot from over Zhao's shoulders.]

character_words: Did you really mean that, Uncle?
Of course. I told you ginseng tea is my favorite.
scene_description: [Smiling slyly, while glancing at his nephew.]

character_words: Aang! I know you're upset and I know how hard it is to lose the people you love. I went through the same thing when I lost my mom.  Monk Gyatso and the other airbenders may be gone,  but you still have a family. Sokka and I!  We're your family now!
scene_description: [In the background, Sokka is hunched over his rock, clenching his teeth together. Katara shouts calmly with a sad expression on her face. The camera slowly moves in on her.]

character_words: Aang! I know you're upset and I know how hard it is to lose the people you love. I went through the same thing when I lost my mom.  Monk Gyatso and the other airbenders may be gone,  but you still have a family. Sokka and I!  We're your family now!
scene_description: [Diverts her eyes. Shot switches to a frontal view of Aang, his tattoos glowing and wind swirling around him; his clothes flutter in the storm. Sokka runs over to his sister in the background.]

character_words: Aang! I know you're upset and I know how hard it is to lose the people you love. I went through the same thing when I lost my mom.  Monk Gyatso and the other airbenders may be gone,  but you still have a family. Sokka and I!  We're your family now!
scene_description: [Close-up of her as she looks up at him.]

character_words: Aang! I know you're upset and I know how hard it is to lose the people you love. I went through the same thing when I lost my mom.  Monk Gyatso and the other airbenders may be gone,  but you still have a family. Sokka and I!  We're your family now!
scene_description: [Sokka opens his eyes and glances at his sister.]

character_words: Katara and I aren't going to let anything happen to you. Promise.
I'm sorry.
It's okay. It wasn't your fault.
But you were right. And if the firebenders found this temple, that means they found the other ones, too.  I really am the last airbender.
But you were right. And if the firebenders found this temple, that means they found the other ones, too.  I really am the last airbender.
scene_description: [Close-up of his sad face, as he closes his eyes.]

character_words: Everything's packed. You ready to go?
How is Roku supposed to help me if I can't talk to him?
scene_description: [Closer shot of Aang and Katara's faces. Softly.]

character_words: Maybe you'll find a way.
Looks like you made a new friend Sokka!
Can't talk! Must eat!
scene_description: [Pushing the food in his mouth with his two hands. Looks up with an exhilarated look upon his face. With a full mouth.]

character_words: Can't talk! Must eat!
Hey, little guy!
scene_description: [Looking at the lemur from the corners of his eye.]

character_words: You, me and Appa;  we're all that's left of this place.  We have to stick together. Katara, Sokka,  say hello to the newest member of our family.
You, me and Appa;  we're all that's left of this place.  We have to stick together. Katara, Sokka,  say hello to the newest member of our family.
scene_description: [Frontal view as the camera closes in on them.]

character_words: You, me and Appa;  we're all that's left of this place.  We have to stick together. Katara, Sokka,  say hello to the newest member of our family.
You, me and Appa;  we're all that's left of this place.  We have to stick together. Katara, Sokka,  say hello to the newest member of our family.
scene_description: [Switches to a shot of the duo fiddling with their luggage. They turn back to look at Aang as he calls them. Sokka is still eating a peach.]

character_words: What are you going to name him?
Momo.
The only reason you should be interrupting me, is if you have news about the Avatar.
Well, there is news, Prince Zuko, but you might not like it. Don't get too upset.
scene_description: [Pushes open the door completely and enters the room, holding a rolled up scroll in his hands.]

character_words: Uncle, you taught me that keeping a level head is a sign of a great leader. Now, whatever you have to say, I'm sure I can take it.
scene_description: [Cut to shot of the prince sitting motionless, still assuming his meditative stance, his back to the camera. Calmly.]

character_words: Okay then.  We have no idea where he is.
scene_description: [Frontal view of Zuko, Iroh tugging his small beard in the background.]

character_words: Okay then.  We have no idea where he is.
What!?
You really should open a window in here.
Give me the map!
scene_description: [He snatches the scroll from Iroh's hand.]

character_words: Give me the map!
scene_description: [He unrolls it, scanning over the parchment.]

character_words: Well, there have been multiple sightings of the Avatar, but he is impossible to track down.
How am I going to find him, Uncle?  He is clearly a master of evasive maneuvering.
How am I going to find him, Uncle?  He is clearly a master of evasive maneuvering.
scene_description: [Cut to a shot of the map in Zuko's hand, several locations marked down with zigzagged lines connecting each point; Voice-over.]

character_words: You have no idea where you're going, do you?
Well ...  I know it's near water.
I guess we're getting close then.
Momo, marbles please.  Hey Katara, check out this airbending trick!
scene_description: [Close-up of Momo who dives into his shirt and emerges, handing Aang two small, gray marbles.]

character_words: That's great, Aang.
scene_description: [Nonchalantly, still focusing on her task at hand.]

character_words: You didn't even look.
That's great!
scene_description: [Looks over Aang and attempts to show enthusiasm.]

character_words: But I'm not doing it now.
Stop bugging her, airhead. You need to give girls space when they do their sewing.
scene_description: [Cut to shot of Katara and Sokka seated on Appa's saddle. Sokka waves his arm breezily at Aang as if he is trying to shoo him away.]

character_words: What does me being a girl have to do with sewing?
scene_description: [Close side-view shot of Katara as she casts her brother an annoyed glare; irritably.]

character_words: Simple. Girls are better at fixing pants than guys and guys are better at hunting and fighting and stuff like that.  It's just the natural order of things.
scene_description: [Cut to a shot of Sokka lazily resting with his arms behind his head.]

character_words: Simple. Girls are better at fixing pants than guys and guys are better at hunting and fighting and stuff like that.  It's just the natural order of things.
All done with your pants!  And look what a great job I did!
All done with your pants!  And look what a great job I did!
scene_description: [Shows that the pants are still ripped.]

character_words: Wait! I was just kidding.  I can't wear these! Katara, please!
Wait! I was just kidding.  I can't wear these! Katara, please!
scene_description: [Sticks one arm through the large hole in his pants.]

character_words: Relax, Sokka. Where we're going, you won't need any pants.
scene_description: [Cut to a frontal view of Aang with the duo in the background. Enthusiastically.]

character_words: We just made a pit stop yesterday. Shouldn't we get a little more flying done before we camp out?
He's right. At this rate, we won't get to the North Pole until spring.
scene_description: [Cut to close frontal view of Aang who is looking at something, his hand held against his brow. The siblings stand in the background.]

character_words: But Appa's tired, aren't you boy?
scene_description: [Camera moves back to reveal Appa as well. Innocently.]

character_words: I said, aren't you boy?
scene_description: [Nudges Appa against his front leg with his elbow.]

character_words: Yeah, that was real convincing. Still, hard to argue with a ten-ton magical monster.
scene_description: [Aang smiles over his shoulder at the duo. Sarcastically.]

character_words: Yeah, that was real convincing. Still, hard to argue with a ten-ton magical monster.
Look!
scene_description: [Runs toward the shore, takes a sharp breath and points. Excitedly.]

character_words: That's why we're here.  Elephant koi, and I'm gonna ride it. Katara, you've got to watch me!
That's why we're here.  Elephant koi, and I'm gonna ride it. Katara, you've got to watch me!
scene_description: [Starts to disrobe while more koi fish jump out of the water in the background.]

character_words: Cold!
Hahaha, hahaha!
scene_description: [Switch to a close-up of Aang atop the fish's back, waving at his friends.]

character_words: Whooh!
scene_description: [Cut to Katara who enthusiastically waves back.]

character_words: He looks pretty good out there.
Are you kidding?  The fish is doing all the work.
Are you kidding?  The fish is doing all the work.
scene_description: [Lazily gestures at Aang in the water.]

character_words: No, Appa. Don't eat that!
scene_description: [Notices something behind Sokka and runs off screen.]

character_words: No, Appa. Don't eat that!
Oh man ...
scene_description: [Disappointed, the smile having faded off his face.]

character_words: There's something in the water!
What's wrong?
Aang's in trouble. Aang!
Get out of there!
Get back here, Aang!
Whaaaahh! Aaaah!
Whaaaahh!
What was that thing?
I don't know.
Well, let's not stick around to find out. Time to hit the road.
scene_description: [Stands up and wipes his hands together.]

character_words: Or, we could stay a while.
You three have some explaining to do.
And if you don't answer all our questions, we're throwing you back in the water with Unagi.
Show yourselves, cowards!
Who are you? Where are the men who ambushed us?
There were no men. We ambushed you. Now tell us, who are you and what are you doing here?
scene_description: [Stepping forward, gesturing heavily with her clenched fist. Indignantly.]

character_words: Wait a second,  there's no way that a bunch of girls took us down.
scene_description: [Closer side-view shot of Sokka who stares at them in disbelief.]

character_words: Wait a second,  there's no way that a bunch of girls took us down.
scene_description: [He amusingly glance to his right to where Aang stands as if he is looking for confirmation. Mockingly.]

character_words: A bunch of girls, huh? Unagi is gonna eat well tonight.
No, don't hurt him! He didn't mean it. My brother is just an idiot sometimes.
scene_description: [Leans forward in her bonds. Pleading and apologetically.]

character_words: No, don't hurt him! He didn't mean it. My brother is just an idiot sometimes.
scene_description: [Suki released Sokka, but still stares at him in dismay.]

character_words: It's my fault.  I'm sorry we came here. I wanted to ride the elephant koi.
scene_description: [The three teenagers looks surprised at Aang's words. The camera pans the left to reveal a sorrowfully looking Aang.]
