character_words: There's an airbender in our presence, and not just any airbender.  The Avatar!
There's an airbender in our presence, and not just any airbender.  The Avatar!
Now, what do you have to say for yourself,  Mr. Pippinpaddleopsicopolis?
Now, what do you have to say for yourself,  Mr. Pippinpaddleopsicopolis?

Okay, you caught me.  I'm the Avatar. Doing my Avatar thing, keeping the world safe. Everything checks out.  No firebenders here. So, good work, everybody!  Love each other,  respect all life,  and don't run with your spears. We'll see you next time!
scene_description: [Standing up, throwing his hands in the air.]

character_words: Okay, you caught me.  I'm the Avatar. Doing my Avatar thing, keeping the world safe. Everything checks out.  No firebenders here. So, good work, everybody!  Love each other,  respect all life,  and don't run with your spears. We'll see you next time!

Okay, you caught me.  I'm the Avatar. Doing my Avatar thing, keeping the world safe. Everything checks out.  No firebenders here. So, good work, everybody!  Love each other,  respect all life,  and don't run with your spears. We'll see you next time!

Okay, you caught me.  I'm the Avatar. Doing my Avatar thing, keeping the world safe. Everything checks out.  No firebenders here. So, good work, everybody!  Love each other,  respect all life,  and don't run with your spears. We'll see you next time!
scene_description: [Pulling Katara and Sokka into a hug.]

character_words: Okay, you caught me.  I'm the Avatar. Doing my Avatar thing, keeping the world safe. Everything checks out.  No firebenders here. So, good work, everybody!  Love each other,  respect all life,  and don't run with your spears. We'll see you next time!

Okay, you caught me.  I'm the Avatar. Doing my Avatar thing, keeping the world safe. Everything checks out.  No firebenders here. So, good work, everybody!  Love each other,  respect all life,  and don't run with your spears. We'll see you next time!
scene_description: [Cut to a shot of the threesome walking backward toward the exit.]

character_words: You can't keep us here! Let us leave!
Lettuce leaf?
We're in serious trouble. This guy is nuts.
scene_description: [Cut to the threesome. Sokka holds his hand for his mouth; whispering.]

character_words: Tomorrow, the Avatar will  face three deadly challenges.  But for now, the guards will show you to your chamber.
Tomorrow, the Avatar will  face three deadly challenges.  But for now, the guards will show you to your chamber.
Tomorrow, the Avatar will  face three deadly challenges.  But for now, the guards will show you to your chamber.
My liege, do you mean the good chamber or the bad chamber?
The newly refurbished chamber.
Wait, which one are we talking about?

The one that used to be the bad chamber, until the recent refurbishing, that is. Of course, we've been calling it the new chamber, but we really should number them.  Uh, take them to the refurbished chamber that was once bad!
scene_description: [Switch to a frontal shot of the three children as they are being led out of the room, flanked by two guards. Commanding.]

character_words: This is a prison cell? But it's so nice.
He did say it was newly refurbished.
scene_description: [Momo jumps off Aang's shoulders and onto a bed.]

character_words: Nice or not, we're prisoners!
I wonder what these challenges are gonna to be.
We're not sticking around to find out. There's got to be some way out of here.
The air vents!
scene_description: [Excitedly pointing at something at the other side of the room.]

character_words: If you think we're going to fit through there, you're crazier than that king.
We can't, but Momo can!
Momo, I need you to find Appa and bust us outta here!
Go on, boy, get Appa!
Eh, how was Appa supposed to save us anyway?
Appa's a ten-ton flying bison; I think he could figure something out.
Well, no point arguing about it now. Get some rest, Aang.  Looks like you'll need it for tomorrow.
Well, no point arguing about it now. Get some rest, Aang.  Looks like you'll need it for tomorrow.
Sokka?  Katara?  Where are my friends?
Sokka?  Katara?  Where are my friends?
scene_description: [Switch to Aang's point of view; the other beds are empty.]

character_words: Sokka?  Katara?  Where are my friends?
scene_description: [Frontal shot as Aang turns toward the guard.]

character_words: The king will free them if you complete your challenges.
And if I fail?
He didn't say.  Your staff, please?
He didn't say.  Your staff, please?
scene_description: [Extending his arm; switch back to a shot of the guard.]

character_words: First, Avatar,  what do you think of my new outfit? I want your honest opinion.  I'm waiting.
First, Avatar,  what do you think of my new outfit? I want your honest opinion.  I'm waiting.
scene_description: [Frontal shot as Bumi spread his arms, showing off his purple outfit; lighthearted.]

character_words: First, Avatar,  what do you think of my new outfit? I want your honest opinion.  I'm waiting.
scene_description: [Frontal shot of Aang who blankly stares at the king. Someone coughs during the ensuing silence. Switch back to a frontal shot of Bumi.]

character_words: I ... guess it's fine.
Excellent! You passed the first test.
Really?
Well, not one of the deadly tests.  The real challenges are much more, uh, challenging.
Well, not one of the deadly tests.  The real challenges are much more, uh, challenging.
scene_description: [Waving his finger from side to side, emphasizing his words.]

character_words: I don't have time for your crazy games!  Give me my friends back! We're leaving!
I don't have time for your crazy games!  Give me my friends back! We're leaving!
Oh, I thought you might refuse,  so I will give your friends some special souvenirs.
scene_description: [Side shot of the two. A wall opens, revealing Katara and Sokka struggling in the grasp of a guard. Aang turns to them.]

character_words: Those delightful rings are made of pure jennamite, also known as creeping crystal. It's a crystal that grows remarkably fast.  By nightfall your friends will be completely covered in it.  Terrible thing, really.  I can stop it, but only if you cooperate.

Those delightful rings are made of pure jennamite, also known as creeping crystal. It's a crystal that grows remarkably fast.  By nightfall your friends will be completely covered in it.  Terrible thing, really.  I can stop it, but only if you cooperate.

Those delightful rings are made of pure jennamite, also known as creeping crystal. It's a crystal that grows remarkably fast.  By nightfall your friends will be completely covered in it.  Terrible thing, really.  I can stop it, but only if you cooperate.

Those delightful rings are made of pure jennamite, also known as creeping crystal. It's a crystal that grows remarkably fast.  By nightfall your friends will be completely covered in it.  Terrible thing, really.  I can stop it, but only if you cooperate.
Ah! It's already creeping!
I'll do what you want.
scene_description: [Cut back to a side shot of Aang and Bumi; serious.]

character_words: It seems I've lost my lunch box key and I'm hungry. Ooh, there it is!  Would you mind fetching it for me?
Ooh, climbing the ladder. No one's ever done that before.
That's right. Keep diving head in. I'm sure it'll work eventually.
There! Enjoy your lunch! I want my friends back now!
Ah, not yet. I need help with another matter. It seems I've lost my pet, Flopsie.
Okay! Found him!
Bring him to me. Daddy wants a kiss from Flopsie!
Come here, Flopsie.  Huh?
scene_description: [Flopsie jumps down behind Aang, startling both him and the bunny.]

character_words: Flopsie, wait! Flopsie!  Flopsie!
scene_description: [Cut to Bumi laughing. Back to Aang chasing the bunny.]

character_words: Wait a minute.  Flopsie?
scene_description: [Close-up of Flopsie snarling. Cut to behind Aang.]

character_words: Flopsie!
Oh, that's a good boy. Yes, who has a soft belly?
Guys, are you okay?
scene_description: [Aang jumps up to where Katara and Sokka. Both are encased in crystal to their shoulders.]

character_words: Other than the crystals slowly encasing my entire body, doing great!
Oh, yes.
Come on! I'm ready for the next challenge.
Your final test is a duel. And as a special treat, you may choose your opponent.
Point and choose.
So ... you're saying whoever I point to, that's the person I get to fight?
Choose wisely!
I ... choose ... you.
Wrong choice!
You thought I was a frail old man, but I'm the most powerful earthbender you'll ever see.
Can I fight the guy with the axe instead?
There are no take-backsies in my kingdom. You might need this.
scene_description: [Points to the guard standing near Katara and Sokka.]

character_words: Typical airbender tactic: avoid and evade. I hoped the Avatar would be less predictable.
Don't you have any surprises for me? Sooner or later you'll have to strike back!
You'll have to be a little more creative than that!
Did someone leave the windows open? It feels a little drafty in here. Are you hoping I'll catch a cold?
How are you going to get me from way over there?
Well done, Avatar. You fight with much fire in your heart.  You've passed all my tests. Now, you must answer one question.
scene_description: [He tosses the boulder aside and bends up to the balcony where the two siblings are almost completely encased. Aang joins him.]

character_words: That's not fair! You said you would release my friends if I finished your tests.
Oh, but what's the point of tests if you don't learn anything?
Oh, come on!
Answer this one question and I will set your friends free. What ... is my name? From the looks of your friends I'd say you only have a few minutes.
How am I supposed to know his name?
Think about the challenges. Maybe it's some kind of riddle.
I got it!
Yeah?
He's an earthbender, right? Rocky. You know, because of all the rocks.
We're going to keep trying, but that is a good back-up.
Okay. So back to the challenges. I got a key from the waterfall, I saved his pet, and I had a duel.
And what did you learn?
Well, everything was different than I expected.
And?
scene_description: [The jennamite grows as she talks with anxiety.]

character_words: Well, they weren't straight forward. To solve each test, I had to think differently than I usually would. I know his name.
I solved the question the same way I solved the challenges. As you said a long time ago, I had to open my brain to the possibilities.  Bumi, you're a mad genius.
scene_description: [The king laughs with the same odd snort Bumi did a hundred years ago.]

character_words: Oh Aang, it's good to see you. You haven't changed a bit. Literally.
Uh, over here!
Little help?
Jennamite is made of rock candy.  Delicious!
scene_description: [He takes a bite into the crystal.]

character_words: So this crazy king is your old friend Bumi?
Who are you calling old? Okay, I'm old.
Why did you do all of this instead of just telling Aang who you were?

First of all, it's pretty fun messing with people.  But I do have a reason. Aang, you have a difficult task ahead. The world has changed in the hundred years that you've been gone. It's the duty of the Avatar to restore balance to the world by defeating Fire Lord Ozai. You have much to learn. You must master the four elements and confront the Fire Lord. And when you do, I hope you will think like a mad genius. And it looks like you're in good hands. You'll need your friends to help defeat the Fire Nation.  And you'll need Momo, too.

First of all, it's pretty fun messing with people.  But I do have a reason. Aang, you have a difficult task ahead. The world has changed in the hundred years that you've been gone. It's the duty of the Avatar to restore balance to the world by defeating Fire Lord Ozai. You have much to learn. You must master the four elements and confront the Fire Lord. And when you do, I hope you will think like a mad genius. And it looks like you're in good hands. You'll need your friends to help defeat the Fire Nation.  And you'll need Momo, too.
Thank you for your wisdom, but before we leave, I have a challenge for you.
My cabbages!
Great, you're back!
What's for dinner?
We've got a few options. First; round nuts. And some kind of oval shaped nuts? And some rock-shaped nuts, that might just be rocks.  Dig in!
We've got a few options. First; round nuts. And some kind of oval shaped nuts? And some rock-shaped nuts, that might just be rocks.  Dig in!
We've got a few options. First; round nuts. And some kind of oval shaped nuts? And some rock-shaped nuts, that might just be rocks.  Dig in!
scene_description: [Aang and Katara look at each other then back at Sokka.]

character_words: Seriously ... what else you got?
What was that?
It's coming from over there!
Shouldn't we run away from huge booms? Not toward them?
An earthbender!
Let's go meet him!
He looks dangerous, so we better approach cautiously.
Hello there! I'm Katara! What's your name?
scene_description: [Suddenly Katara is a few feet in front of them, excitedly addressing the earthbender.]

character_words: Nice to meet you!
I just wanted to say hi.
Hey! That guy's gotta be running somewhere. Maybe we're near a village? And I bet that village has a market!
Which means no nuts for dinner!
Hey! I worked hard to get those nuts!  Yeah, I hate 'em too.
Hey! I worked hard to get those nuts!  Yeah, I hate 'em too.
scene_description: [Momo flies overhead, chasing Katara and Aang.]

character_words: Hey! I worked hard to get those nuts!  Yeah, I hate 'em too.
Great hat!  I'll trade you some nuts for it.
Hey ...
scene_description: [Notices the boy enter a shop. Speaks to herself in surprise.]

character_words: Hi, Mom.
Where have you been, Haru? You're late! Get started on your chores.
Hey. You're that kid. Why did you run away before?
scene_description: [Enters the shop's front door, startling Haru.]

character_words: Uh, you must have me confused with some other kid.
No, she doesn't. We saw you earthbending.
They saw you doing what?!
They're crazy, Mom! I mean, look at how they're dressed.
You know how dangerous that is! You know what would happen if they caught you earthbending!
Open up!
Fire Nation! Act natural!
What do you want? I've already paid you this week!
scene_description: [The tax collector stares sourly toward the four children; aggressively.]

character_words: The tax just doubled.  And we wouldn't want an accident now would we?  Fire is sometimes so hard to control.
The tax just doubled.  And we wouldn't want an accident now would we?  Fire is sometimes so hard to control.
scene_description: [Creates a ball of fire between his hands, making everyone slightly back away.]

character_words: You can keep the copper ones.
scene_description: [Walks away, dropping four copper pieces to the floor, exits.]

character_words: Nice guy. How long has the Fire Nation been here?
Five years. Fire Lord Ozai uses our town's coal mines to fuel his ships.
They're thugs. They steal from us. And everyone here's too much of a coward to do anything about it.
Quiet, Haru! Don't talk like that.
But, Haru's an earthbender? He can help!
Earthbending is forbidden. It's caused nothing but misery for this village!  He must never use his abilities.
scene_description: [Casts a meaningful glance toward her son.]

character_words: How can you say that? Haru has a gift! Asking him not to earthbend is like asking me not to waterbend. It's a part of who we are.
You don't understand.
I understand that Haru can help you fight back. What can the Fire Nation do to you that they haven't done already?
They could take Haru away! Like they took his father.
My mom said you can sleep here tonight. But you should leave in the morning.
Thanks. I'll make sure Appa doesn't eat all your hay.
I'm sorry about what I said earlier. I didn't know about your father.
That's okay. It's funny, the way you were talking back in the store? It reminded me of him.
Thanks.
My father was very courageous. When the Fire Nation invaded, he and the other earthbenders were outnumbered ten to one. But they fought back anyway.
He sounds like a great man.
After the attack, they rounded up my father and every other earthbender, and took them away.  We haven't seen them since.
After the attack, they rounded up my father and every other earthbender, and took them away.  We haven't seen them since.
So that's why you hide your earthbending.
Yeah. Problem is ...  the only way I can feel close to my father now  is when I practice my bending. He taught me everything I know.
scene_description: [Close-up, earthbends two stones in a circle above his hand.]

character_words: Yeah. Problem is ...  the only way I can feel close to my father now  is when I practice my bending. He taught me everything I know.
scene_description: [Crushes the stones to sand with his hands. The sand blows away.]

character_words: See this necklace? My mother gave it to me.
scene_description: [Sits beside Haru, sets her fingertips on her necklace.]

character_words: It's beautiful.
I lost my mother in a Fire Nation raid.  This necklace is all I have left of her.
It's not enough, is it?
No.
Help, help!
The mine!
Help me!
Ugh! It's not working! We have to get help!
scene_description: [Haru braces his back against the mine entrance. Katara pulls the old man.]

character_words: There's no time, pull harder!
Haru. There's a way you can help him.
I can't.
Please, there's no one around to see you. It's the only way!
Haru! You did it!
Haru! You did it!
scene_description: [The two take place beside the old man and aid him walking away from the mine.]

character_words: It was so brave of Haru to use his earthbending to help that old man.
You must have really inspired him.
I guess so.
Everyone should get some sleep, we're leaving at dawn.
Dawn?! Can't we sleep in for once?
Absolutely not! This village is crawling with Fire Nation troops. If they discover you're here, Aang, we'll be eating fireballs for breakfast. Goodnight.
I'd rather eat fireballs than nuts.
Goodnight!
That's him! That's the earthbender!
They took him! They took Haru away!
scene_description: [Enters barn to see Aang and Sokka folding blankets; emotionally.]

character_words: What?
The old man turned him in to the Fire Nation - it's all my fault - I forced him into earthbending!
Slow down, Katara. When did this happen?
scene_description: [Steps beside her, taking her hand in his and laying his other hand supportively behind her shoulder.]

character_words: Haru's mother said they came for him at midnight.
Then it's too late to track him, he's long gone.
We don't need to track him. The Fire Nation is going to take me right to Haru.
scene_description: [Turns defiantly to the open door, clenches fists.]

character_words: And ... why would they do that?
Because they're going to arrest me for earthbending.
Because they're going to arrest me for earthbending.
scene_description: [Aang and Sokka share a horrified look.]

character_words: I thought you were crazy at first, Katara, but this might work. There are ventilation shafts throughout these mines. All Aang has to do is send an air current from that vent to this one right here. The boulder levitates and ta-da! Fake earthbending.
Aang? Did you get all that?
scene_description: [Props hands off hips, turns to Aang.]

character_words: Sure, sure. I got it.
scene_description: [Snapping small puffs of air at a sooty copper fritillary butterfly; dismissively.]

character_words: Do you remember your cue?
Yeah, yeah. Just relax. You're taking all the fun out of this.
scene_description: [Continues snapping puffs of air; still dismissive.]

character_words: By this, do you mean intentionally being captured by a group of ruthless firebenders?
Exactly! That's fun stuff!
Here they come! Get in your places!
Get out of my way, pipsqueak!
Get out of my way, pipsqueak!
scene_description: [The soldiers watch in confusion. One of them even raises an eyebrow.]

character_words: How dare you call me pipsqueak, you giant-eared cretin!
What did you call me?
A giant-eared cretin! Look at those things! Do herds of animals use them for shade?!
scene_description: [Far too dramatically as her hair loopies move with her motion.]

character_words: A giant-eared cretin! Look at those things! Do herds of animals use them for shade?!
You better back off!  Seriously, back off.
You better back off!  Seriously, back off.
scene_description: [Slips his hand by his mouth and mutters.]

character_words: I will not back off! I bet elephants get together and make fun of how large your ears are!
scene_description: [More determined, heightens above her now-cowering brother.]

character_words: That's it! You're going down!
I'll show you who's boss!  Earthbending style!  I said, earthbending style!
I'll show you who's boss!  Earthbending style!  I said, earthbending style!
scene_description: [Over-dramatically leaps toward the boulder, clenching her fist upward to which there is no reaction. Angrily.]

character_words: That lemur! He's earthbending!
scene_description: [Points a finger to the lemur; surprised.]

character_words: No, you idiot, it's the girl!
scene_description: [Katara and Momo each remain in their positions. Katara eyes the man in surprise. Sokka, angrily, waves his arms toward her.]

character_words: Oh.  Of course.
I'll hold her.  You've got twelve hours to find Haru. We'll be right behind you.
Momo, you have some big ears!
scene_description: [Eyeballs Momo perched off of Aang's shoulder. Points accusingly.]

character_words: Momo, you have some big ears!
scene_description: [Momo folds his ears back, hunches down, and coos in protest.]

character_words: She'll be fine, Aang. Katara knows what she's doing.
scene_description: [Aang stares nervously at the barge carrying Katara to the prison.]

character_words: Earthbenders. It is my pleasure to welcome you aboard my modest shipyard. I am your warden. I prefer to think of you not as prisoners,  but as honored guests. And I hope you come to think of me as your humble and caring host.  You will succeed here, if you simply abide-

Earthbenders. It is my pleasure to welcome you aboard my modest shipyard. I am your warden. I prefer to think of you not as prisoners,  but as honored guests. And I hope you come to think of me as your humble and caring host.  You will succeed here, if you simply abide-

Earthbenders. It is my pleasure to welcome you aboard my modest shipyard. I am your warden. I prefer to think of you not as prisoners,  but as honored guests. And I hope you come to think of me as your humble and caring host.  You will succeed here, if you simply abide-
What kind of guest dishonors his host by interrupting him?! Take him below!  One week in solitary will improve his manners.  Simply treat me with the courtesy that I give you-
What kind of guest dishonors his host by interrupting him?! Take him below!  One week in solitary will improve his manners.  Simply treat me with the courtesy that I give you-
scene_description: [Swings his arms. Some guards escort the man away. Mutters.]

character_words: What kind of guest dishonors his host by interrupting him?! Take him below!  One week in solitary will improve his manners.  Simply treat me with the courtesy that I give you-
And we'll get along famously.

You will notice, earthbenders, that this rig is made entirely of metal. You are miles away from any rock or earth.  So, if you have any illusions about employing that brutish savagery that passes for bending among you people ...  forget them. It is impossible. Good day.
scene_description: [Katara pauses, glancing over the expansive ocean to the land far away.]

character_words: You will notice, earthbenders, that this rig is made entirely of metal. You are miles away from any rock or earth.  So, if you have any illusions about employing that brutish savagery that passes for bending among you people ...  forget them. It is impossible. Good day.
Katara?
Haru!
What are you doing here?
It's my fault you were captured. I came to rescue you.
So, you got yourself arrested?
It was the only way to find you.
You've got guts, Katara. I'll give you that.  Come on. There's someone I want you to meet.
Katara. This is my father, Tyro.  Dad. This is Katara.
It's an honor to meet you.
Have some dinner, Katara.  It's not as bad as it looks.  It's still pretty bad though.
Have some dinner, Katara.  It's not as bad as it looks.  It's still pretty bad though.
Have some dinner, Katara.  It's not as bad as it looks.  It's still pretty bad though.
scene_description: [Katara tries a spoonful, but becomes further disgusted. He finds humor in this with a small chuckle.]

character_words: Tyro. The prisoners are complaining there aren't enough blankets to go around.
scene_description: [Walks up and lays a hand on Tyro's shoulder.]

character_words: I'll talk to the guards. In the meantime, make sure the elderly are taken care of. The rest of us will simply have to hope for warmer weather.
If you don't mind me asking, what's your escape plan?
Excuse me?
You know, the plan to get everyone off the rig? What is it? Mutiny, sabotage?
The plan? The plan is to survive. Wait out this war. Hope that one day some of us can get back home and forget this ever happened.
How can you say that? You sound like you've already given up!
Katara, I admire your courage. And I envy your youth. But people's lives are at stake here. The warden is a ruthless man, and he won't stand for any rebellion. I'm sorry, but we're powerless.
We'll see about that.

Earthbenders! You don't know me, but I know of you. Every child in my Water Tribe village was rocked to sleep with stories of the brave Earth Kingdom, and the courageous earthbenders who guard its borders.  Some of you may think that the Fire Nation has made you powerless. Yes, they have taken away your ability to bend. But they can't take away your courage. And it is your courage they should truly fear! Because it runs deeper than any mine you've been forced to dig, any ocean that keeps you far from home! It is the strength of your hearts that make you who you are. Hearts that will remain unbroken when all rock and stone has eroded away. The time to fight back is now! I can tell you the Avatar has returned! So remember your courage earthbenders,  let us fight for our freedom!
scene_description: [The watchman walks up to talk the warden, but the warden stops him and listens.]

character_words: Earthbenders! You don't know me, but I know of you. Every child in my Water Tribe village was rocked to sleep with stories of the brave Earth Kingdom, and the courageous earthbenders who guard its borders.  Some of you may think that the Fire Nation has made you powerless. Yes, they have taken away your ability to bend. But they can't take away your courage. And it is your courage they should truly fear! Because it runs deeper than any mine you've been forced to dig, any ocean that keeps you far from home! It is the strength of your hearts that make you who you are. Hearts that will remain unbroken when all rock and stone has eroded away. The time to fight back is now! I can tell you the Avatar has returned! So remember your courage earthbenders,  let us fight for our freedom!
Your twelve hours are up; where's Haru? We've gotta get outta here!
I can't.
We don't have much time. There are guards everywhere. Get on!
Katara, what's wrong?
I'm not leaving.  I'm not giving up on these people.
scene_description: [Aang and Sokka share a questionable look.]

character_words: What do you mean you're not leaving?
We can't abandon these people! There has to be a way to help them.
Maybe she's right. What do you say, Sokka?
I say you're both crazy!  Last chance! We need to leave, now!
No!
I hate when you get like this. Come on, we better hide.
Go hide.
scene_description: [Katara and Sokka flee. Aang whispers to Appa before joining them.]

character_words: Look!
scene_description: [Appa soars overhead to fly away and hide.]

character_words: Tell me exactly what you saw.
Well, sir, it looked like a flying bison.
What?
It was a giant flying buffalo, sir. With an empty saddle.
Which was it? A buffalo or a bison?
Uh, I'm not sure what the difference is, but that's not really the point, is it, sir?
I'll decide what the point is, fool!
You! Wake up the captain. Search the entire rig!
scene_description: [To the second guard as he straightens up.]

character_words: You! Wake up the captain. Search the entire rig!
Uh, sir.
What?
That was ... the captain you just threw overboard, so ...
Then wake up someone I haven't thrown overboard and search the rig! There's something going on here and I don't like it.
We don't have much time. What are we gonna do?
I wish I knew how to make a hurricane!
The warden would run away and we'd steal his keys!
Wouldn't he just take his keys with him?
I'm just tossing ideas around.
I tried talking the earthbenders into fighting back but, it didn't work! If there was just a way to help them help themselves.
For that they'd need some kind of earth, or some rock. Something they can bend.
But this entire place is made of metal!
No, it's not.  Look at the smoke! I bet they're burning coal. In other words, earth.
It's almost dawn. We're running out of time! You sure this is gonna work?

It should. These vents reminded me of our little trick back at the village. We're gonna do the same thing, but on a much bigger scale.  There's a huge deposit of coal at the base of the silo. And the whole system is ventilated. Aang closed off all the vents except one. When he does his airbending the coal only has one place to go, right back here.
scene_description: [The camera zooms through a visual walkthrough of Sokka's explanation.]

character_words: There's the intruder!
Stay back! I'm warning you!
scene_description: [Pulls out his boomerang, turning back-to-back with his sister.]

character_words: Katara, stop! You can't win this fight!
Listen to him well, child. You're one mistake away from dying where you stand.
Here's your chance, earthbenders! Take it! Your fate is in your own hands!

Foolish girl. You thought a few inspirational words and some coal would change these people? Look at these blank, hopeless faces. Their spirits were broken a long time ago.  Oh, but you still believe in them. How sweet. They're a waste of your energy little girl. You failed.

Foolish girl. You thought a few inspirational words and some coal would change these people? Look at these blank, hopeless faces. Their spirits were broken a long time ago.  Oh, but you still believe in them. How sweet. They're a waste of your energy little girl. You failed.
scene_description: [Katara's expression dims as she does as instructed, staring at the forlorn prisoners.]

character_words: Show no mercy!
scene_description: [Guards line up and prepare for battle.]

character_words: Show no mercy!
scene_description: [The guards send a blast of fire as one toward the rebelling prisoners.]

character_words: For the Earth Kingdom, attack!
scene_description: [The earthbenders work together to haul a sizable mass of coal to block the fire.]

character_words: Get to the ships! We'll hold them off!
Do not let them escape!
Guys! Throw me some coal!
scene_description: [Generates an air funnel and holds it between his hands; to Katara and Sokka.]

character_words: No, please! I can't swim!
Don't worry. I hear cowards float.
I want to thank you for saving me. For saving us.
All it took was a little coal.
It wasn't the coal, Katara. It was you.
Thank you for helping me find my courage, Katara of the Water Tribe. My family and everyone here owes you much.
So, I guess you're going home now.
Yes. To take back my village.  To take back all of our villages! The Fire Nation will regret the day they set foot on our land!
scene_description: [Raises his voice to the crowd on the lower deck.]

character_words: Yes. To take back my village.  To take back all of our villages! The Fire Nation will regret the day they set foot on our land!
Come with us.
I can't. Your mission is to take back your home. Ours is to get Aang to the North Pole.
scene_description: [Gazes over the rail to see Momo join Aang atop Appa's head, floating in the ocean.]

character_words: That's him, isn't it? The Avatar.  Katara, thank you for bringing my father back to me. I never thought I'd see him again. I only wish there was some way ...
scene_description: [Aang airbends an encased piece of coal. Momo jumps into his lap.]

character_words: I know.  My mother's necklace! It's gone!
scene_description: [Reaches for her necklace wistfully, but realizes it is not around her neck and panics.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Those clouds look so soft,  don't they? Like you could just jump down and you'd land in a big, soft, cottony heap?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Those clouds look so soft,  don't they? Like you could just jump down and you'd land in a big, soft, cottony heap?
scene_description: [Cut to Aang sitting lazily atop Appa's head, a twig in his mouth; the view pans to the left, showing Sokka carving something with an uninterested look on his face, Katara lying on her stomach, popped up on her elbows, staring dreamingly over the rim of Appa's saddle, and Momo sleeping on the luggage.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Maybe you should give it a try.
scene_description: [Turns to Katara; mockingly with a smile.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: You're hilarious.
scene_description: [Looks at Sokka with annoyance; sarcastically as she looks away from him.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I'll try it!  Yeah!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I'll try it!  Yeah!
scene_description: [Carrying his staff, he jumps off Appa with a big smile on his face. As he begins to fall, he turns once around his axis, winking at the camera as he passes. He falls down spreadeagled, laughing joyously.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Turns out, clouds are made of water.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Hey, what is that?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: It's like a scar ...

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Listen.  It's so quiet. There's no life anywhere.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Listen.  It's so quiet. There's no life anywhere.
scene_description: [Cut to a frontal shot of a sad-looking Aang, his friends behind him.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Aang? Are you okay?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Fire Nation! Those evil savages make me sick! They have no respect for -

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Shhh!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: What? I'm not allowed to be angry?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Why would anyone do this? How could I let this happen?
scene_description: [Kneels down and sighs. He picks up some ash as it slowly seeps through his hand and drops to the ground; sadly.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Aang, you didn't let this happen. It has nothing to do with you.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Yes, it does. It's the Avatar's job to protect nature. But I don't know how to do my job.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: That's why we're going to the North Pole.  To find you a teacher.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Yeah. A waterbending teacher. But there's no one who can teach me how to be the Avatar. Monk Gyatso said that Avatar Roku would help me.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: The Avatar before you? He died over a hundred years ago; how are you supposed to talk to him?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I don't know.
scene_description: [Momo comes up to Aang and settles in his lap.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Uncle! It's time to leave! Where are you? Uncle Iroh!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Over here!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Uncle? We need to move on. We're closing in on the Avatar's trail and I don't want to lose him.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: You look tired, Prince Zuko. Why don't you join me in these hot springs and soak away your troubles?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: My troubles cannot be soaked away. It's time to go!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: You should take your teacher's advice and relax a little. The temperature's just right. I heated it myself.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Enough! We need to leave now. Get out of the water!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Very well!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: On second thought, why don't you take another few minutes? But be back at the ship in a half-hour or I'm leaving without you!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Hey, Aang! You ready to be cheered up?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: No.  Ow! Hey, how is that cheering me up?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: No.  Ow! Hey, how is that cheering me up?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Cheered me up.  Ow. Yeah, I probably deserved that.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Cheered me up.  Ow. Yeah, I probably deserved that.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: These acorns are everywhere, Aang. That means the forest will grow back! Every one of these will be a tall oak tree someday, and all the birds and animals that lived here will come back.
scene_description: [She places the acorn in his hand and closes it.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Thanks, Katara.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Hey, who are you?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: When I saw the flying bison, I thought it was impossible!  But, those markings ... are you the Avatar, child?  My village desperately needs your help!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: When I saw the flying bison, I thought it was impossible!  But, those markings ... are you the Avatar, child?  My village desperately needs your help!
scene_description: [Aang look to Katara, who nods. He nods himself.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: This young person is the Avatar!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: So, the rumors of your return are true! It is the greatest honor of a lifetime to be in your presence.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Nice to meet you too! So ... is there something I can help you with?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I'm not sure ...

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Our village is in crisis, he's our only hope!  For the last few days at sunset, a spirit monster comes and attacks our village. He is Hei Bai, the black and white spirit.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Why is it attacking you?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: We do not know, but each of the last three nights, he has abducted one of our own. We are especially fearful because the winter solstice draws near.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: What happens then?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: As the solstice approaches, the natural world and the Spirit World grow closer and closer until the line between them is blurred completely.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Hei Bai is already causing devastation and destruction. Once the solstice is here, there's no telling what will happen.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: So, what do you want me to do, exactly?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Who better to resolve a crisis between our world and the Spirit World than the Avatar himself? You are the great bridge between man and spirits.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Right ... that's me.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Hey great bridge guy, could I talk to you over here for a second?  Aang, you seem a little unsure about all of this.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Yeah, that might be because I don't know anything at all about the Spirit World. It's not like there's someone to teach me this stuff!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: So ... can you help these people?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I have to try, don't I? Maybe whatever I have to do will just ... come to me.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I think you can do it, Aang.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Yeah.  We're all going to get eaten by a spirit monster.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Yeah.  We're all going to get eaten by a spirit monster.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Who's there?  A meadow vole! I should have known.  You startled me, little one.  It seems I dozed off and missed my nephew's deadline, but it was a very sweet nap.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Who's there?  A meadow vole! I should have known.  You startled me, little one.  It seems I dozed off and missed my nephew's deadline, but it was a very sweet nap.
scene_description: [He takes the creature into the palm of his hand.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Who's there?  A meadow vole! I should have known.  You startled me, little one.  It seems I dozed off and missed my nephew's deadline, but it was a very sweet nap.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: He's a Fire Nation soldier.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: He's no ordinary soldier. This is the Fire Lord's brother, the Dragon of the West. The once-great General Iroh, but now, he's our prisoner.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Hello, Spirit? Can you hear me? This is the Avatar speaking. I'm here to try to help stuff.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: This isn't right. We can't sit here and cower while Aang waits for some monster to show up.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: If anyone can save us, he can.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: He still shouldn't have to face this alone.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: The sun has set. Where are you, Hei Bai? Well ... spirit ... uhhh ... I hereby ask you to please leave this village in peace.  Okay ... well ... I guess that's settled, then.
scene_description: [He spins his staff and sticks it down, in apparent authority.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: You must be the Hei Bai spirit. My name is–

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: My name's Aang! I'm the Avatar and I would like to help. Hey, wait up!  Uhhh.
scene_description: [Hei Bai wreaks havoc, smashing buildings and destroying a tower with energy.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: The Avatar's methods are ... unusual.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: It doesn't seem too interested in what he's saying. Maybe we should go help him.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: No. Only the Avatar stands a chance against the Hei Bai.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Aang will figure out the right thing to do, Sokka.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Please, would you stop destroying things and listen? I'm trying to do my job as spirit bridge! Excuse me, would please turn around? I command you to turn around now!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: That's it. He needs help.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Sokka, wait!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: It's not safe!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Hei Bai, over here!
scene_description: [He throws his boomerang at him, but it barely affects the monster. He runs toward it.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Sokka, go back!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: We'll fight him together, Aang.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I don't want to fight him unless I–
scene_description: [Sokka is taken by the Hei Bai, and the spirit flees. Aang chases it.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Sokka!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Sokka!
scene_description: [The villagers go the entrance as well. Katara is left standing fearful.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Uncle! Uncle, where are you?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Sir, maybe he thought you left without him.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Something's not right here. That pile of rocks.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: It looks like there's been a landslide, sir.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Land doesn't slide uphill. Those rocks didn't move naturally.  My Uncle's been captured by earthbenders!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Aang! Over here! Help!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Hang on, Sokka!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Sokka!  I failed.
scene_description: [He realizes Sokka is nowhere to be seen.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Where are you taking me?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: We're taking you to face justice.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Right, but where, specifically?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: A place you're quite familiar with, actually. You once laid siege to it for 600 days, but it would not yield to you.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Ah, the great city of Ba Sing Se.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: It was greater than you were, apparently.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I acknowledge my defeat at Ba Sing Se. After 600 days away from home, my men were tired, and I was tired.  And I'm still tired.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I acknowledge my defeat at Ba Sing Se. After 600 days away from home, my men were tired, and I was tired.  And I'm still tired.
scene_description: [He falls off one of the horses. He is quickly picked back up. However, he leaves one of his sandals behind and smiles cleverly.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I'm sure they'll be back.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I know.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: You should get some rest.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Everything's going to be okay ...

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Your brother is in good hands. I would be shocked if the Avatar returned without him.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Katara? Katara, I lost him.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: The sun is rising. Perhaps he will return soon.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: What? No, I'm right here!  I'm in the Spirit World!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: What? No, I'm right here!  I'm in the Spirit World!
scene_description: [He waves his hand in the Wanderer's face, only to notice his own appearance.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Yeah, that's Uncle Iroh.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Yeah, that's Uncle Iroh.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I'll figure this out, Katara. I promise. Like they said, I'm the bridge between the worlds, right? All I have to do is ... figure out what I have to do. But once I do that, no problem.  Appa! Hey buddy, I'm right here!  But, I guess you can't see me either.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I'll figure this out, Katara. I promise. Like they said, I'm the bridge between the worlds, right? All I have to do is ... figure out what I have to do. But once I do that, no problem.  Appa! Hey buddy, I'm right here!  But, I guess you can't see me either.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: It's okay, Appa, don't worry. I'm sure they're on their way back. I bet they even found you a bunch of moon peaches for a treat.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: What am I supposed to do? Avatar Roku, how can I talk to you?  Sokka?  That's definitely not Sokka.  What? I can't airbend in the Spirit World.  You don't know where Sokka is, do you?  You're Avatar Roku's animal guide! Like Appa is to me! I need to save my friend and I don't know how! Is there some way for me to talk to Roku?  I'll be back, Katara.  Take me to Roku!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: What's the problem?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Nothing.  Actually, there is a bit of a problem. My old joints are sore and aching, and these shackles are too loose.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Too loose?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: That's right. The cuffs move and jangle around and bump my wrists. It would help me if you tighten them so they wouldn't shake around so much.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Very well. Corporal, tighten the prisoner's handcuffs.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Hey, what are you doing?  I don't understand, this is just a statue of Roku.  Is that what Roku wants to talk to me about? A comet? When can I talk to him?  It's a calendar, and the light will reach Roku on the solstice! So, that's when I'll be able to speak to Roku?  But I can't wait that long! I need to save Sokka now!
scene_description: [He screams, but they fly right through the roof and into a mysterious room. Within is a celestial calendar and a statue of Roku.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Hey, what are you doing?  I don't understand, this is just a statue of Roku.  Is that what Roku wants to talk to me about? A comet? When can I talk to him? scene_description: [Fang presses one of his feelers to Aang's forehead. A vision of a comet appears to him.]
