character_words: Hey, what are you doing?  I don't understand, this is just a statue of Roku.  Is that what Roku wants to talk to me about? A comet? When can I talk to him?  It's a calendar, and the light will reach Roku on the solstice! So, that's when I'll be able to speak to Roku?  But I can't wait that long! I need to save Sokka now!
scene_description: [The dragon takes Aang from the temple.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: He's too dangerous, Captain! We just can't just carry him to the Capital! We have to do something now!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I agree. He must be dealt with immediately and severely.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: It's no use, Appa. I don't seem them anywhere. Our best hope is to go back to the village and wait.
scene_description: [She re-directs Appa to the village's direction.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: The Avatar!
scene_description: [He turns slightly, but looks back at the footprints.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: You're back!  Where's Sokka?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I'm not sure ...

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: These dangerous hands must be crushed.
scene_description: [He brings up and prepares to drop it. However, Zuko jumps in and kicks the rock away before breaking Iroh's chain with his boot.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Excellent form, Prince Zuko.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: You taught me well.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Surrender yourselves. It's five against two. You're clearly outnumbered.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Yeah, that's true, but you are clearly outmatched.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Now would you please put on some clothes?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Aang, what are you doing?! Run!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: You're the spirit of this forest! Now I understand. You're upset and angry because your home was burned down. When I saw the forest had burned, I was sad and upset, but my friend gave me hope that the forest would grow back.
scene_description: [He shows it the acorn and leaves it at his feet. The spirit picks it up and reverts to the panda form. It walks away peacefully. As it exits, a series of branches grow, and three villagers and Sokka emerge from it.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Sokka!
scene_description: [She runs to him and embraces him, while other villagers embrace their loved ones.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: What happened?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: You were trapped in the Spirit World for 24 hours! How are you feeling?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Like I seriously need to use the bathroom.
scene_description: [Katara gives Sokka a somewhat disgusted look.]

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Thank you, Avatar. If only there were a way to repay you for what you've done.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: You could give us some supplies, and some money.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Sokka!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: What? We need stuff.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: It would be an honor to help you prepare for your journey.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I'm so proud of you, Aang. You figured out what to do, all on your own.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Actually, I did have a little help and there's something else.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: What is it?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: I need to talk to Roku and I think I found a way to contact his spirit.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: That's great!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Creepy, but great.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: There's a temple on a crescent-shaped island and if I go there on the solstice, I'll be able to speak with him.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: But the solstice is tomorrow!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
character_words: Yeah, and there's one more problem. The island is in the Fire Nation.

Let's go, Appa! Come on, boy!  Look I'm sorry, but Katara and Sokka aren't coming to the Fire Nation with us.  If they got hurt, I'd never forgive myself.  So get your big butt off the ground and let's go!

Let's go, Appa! Come on, boy!  Look I'm sorry, but Katara and Sokka aren't coming to the Fire Nation with us.  If they got hurt, I'd never forgive myself.  So get your big butt off the ground and let's go!
scene_description: [Appa roars in protest and sits down. Cut to a close side-view; Aang sadly addresses his pet.]

character_words: Let's go, Appa! Come on, boy!  Look I'm sorry, but Katara and Sokka aren't coming to the Fire Nation with us.  If they got hurt, I'd never forgive myself.  So get your big butt off the ground and let's go!
scene_description: [Frontal shot; looks down and away, sadly.]

character_words: Let's go, Appa! Come on, boy!  Look I'm sorry, but Katara and Sokka aren't coming to the Fire Nation with us.  If they got hurt, I'd never forgive myself.  So get your big butt off the ground and let's go!
scene_description: [Cut back to the side-shot; sternly, emphasizing his command by straightening himself.]

character_words: I think his big butt is trying to tell ya something.
scene_description: [Voice-over; Aang gasps in surprise and looks over his right shoulder and over his left, turning around in search for the origins of the voice.]

character_words: Please don't go Aang. The world can't afford to lose you to the Fire Nation.  Neither can I.
Please don't go Aang. The world can't afford to lose you to the Fire Nation.  Neither can I.
But I have to talk to Avatar Roku to find out what my vision means!  I need to get to the Fire Temple before the sun sets on the solstice. That's today!
scene_description: [Looks away sadly and recalls an image of Sozin's Comet.]

character_words: But I have to talk to Avatar Roku to find out what my vision means!  I need to get to the Fire Temple before the sun sets on the solstice. That's today!
We're not letting you go into the Fire Nation, Aang.
At least, not without your friends. We got your back.  Ew!
At least, not without your friends. We got your back.  Ew!
scene_description: [Momo soars up and perches atop Aang's shoulder, and Appa licks Sokka, who angrily looks at the bison.]

character_words: It's a long journey to the Crescent Island.  You'll have to fly fast to have any chance of making it before sundown. Good luck.
Thank you for your-
Go!
scene_description: [Interrupts sharply, yelling. Points toward the ocean.]

character_words: Having trouble sleeping?  Seen the Avatar lately?
Having trouble sleeping?  Seen the Avatar lately?
scene_description: [Pushes the man back through the door, knocking him down. Frontal shot as he approaches him.]

character_words: Come on boy, we've got a long way to go. Faster!
Sailing into Fire Nation waters ... Of all the foolish things you've done in your sixteen years, Prince Zuko, this is the most foolish!
I have no choice, Uncle.
Have you completely forgotten that the Fire Lord banished you?  What if you're caught?
Have you completely forgotten that the Fire Lord banished you?  What if you're caught?
I'm chasing the Avatar! My father will understand why I am returning home!
scene_description: [Breaks away from telescope to talk to his uncle.]

character_words: You give him too much credit. My brother is not the understanding type!
There they are. Helmsman! Full steam ahead!
scene_description: [Looks back into his telescope. Dark scope view reveals Appa mid-flight.]

character_words: Aang. We've got trouble!
Yeah! And it's gaining, fast!
Uh, really Prince Zuko, couldn't you shoot them down with something more fragrant?
On my mark! Fire!
scene_description: [Lights the stinking ball with a fire punch.]

character_words: Fireball!
I'm on it!
We have to get out of Zuko's range, before he shoots another hot stinker at us!
scene_description: [Aang, Katara, and Sokka all make faces and grasp their noses.]

character_words: Can't you make Appa go any faster?
Yeah. But there's just one little problem.
A blockade.
Technically you are still in Earth Kingdom waters. Turn back now and they cannot arrest you.
If we fly north, we can go around the Fire Nation ships and avoid the blockade! It's the only way.
There's no time!
This is exactly why I didn't want you to come! It's too dangerous!
And that's exactly why we're here.
Let's run this blockade!
Let's run this blockade!
Appa, yip-yip!
scene_description: [Appa roars readily, sailing forward even quicker.]

character_words: He's not turning around!
Please Prince Zuko! If the Fire Nation captures you, there is nothing I can do! Do not follow the Avatar.
I'm sorry, Uncle.  Run the blockade!
scene_description: [Lowers his head, closes his eyes, and clenches his hands into fists. Sorrowfully.]

character_words: I'm sorry, Uncle.  Run the blockade!
scene_description: [Raises his head, opens his eyes, and thrusts his right hand forward commandingly.]

character_words: The Avatar.  And the banished prince.  This must be my lucky day.
The Avatar.  And the banished prince.  This must be my lucky day.
scene_description: [Lowers telescope lens to spot Zuko's ship.]

character_words: The Avatar.  And the banished prince.  This must be my lucky day.
Commander Zhao. What are your orders?
Shoot the bison down, captain.
But there's a Fire Navy ship out there, sir! One of our own! What if it's hit?
So be it.  It belongs to a traitor.  Ignite. Launch!
scene_description: [Captain backs up in shock. Zhao continues coolly.]

character_words: So be it.  It belongs to a traitor.  Ignite. Launch!
Appa, are you okay?
scene_description: [Appa roars a reply. They soar higher into the clouds.]

character_words: Prince Zuko! The engines are damaged! We need to stop and make repairs!
Do not stop this ship.
scene_description: [Spins away from the man, facing the blockade.]

character_words: Launch!
Sokka!
Sokka!
scene_description: [Whips the reins down and begins a speedy descent in chase of Sokka.]

character_words: Ready ...
Fire!
We made it!
We got into the Fire Nation.  Great.
scene_description: [Katara and Sokka each grimacing in terror.]

character_words: We got into the Fire Nation.  Great.
Where do you think the Avatar is headed, sir?
I'm not sure.  But I bet a certain banished prince will know.
scene_description: [Turns aside, gazes at Zuko's smoking ship.]

character_words: We're on a collision course!
We can make it!
The boarding party is ready to apprehend Prince Zuko, sir.
scene_description: [Captain stands ahead of a squad of nine firebenders.]

character_words: Wait! Cut the engines, and let them pass.
Sir?
There it is!  The island where Roku's dragon took me.
scene_description: [Close-up. Momo is shown bouncing about in eager surprise.]

character_words: There it is!  The island where Roku's dragon took me.
scene_description: [Sokka and Katara pop up in the saddle.]

character_words: There it is!  The island where Roku's dragon took me.
scene_description: [Full view of Crescent Island and its smoking volcano as Appa descends.]

character_words: You did it buddy. Nice flying.
You did it buddy. Nice flying.
scene_description: [Appa bellows in satisfaction, rolling to his side to wave his three legs into the air lazily. Appa's tongue lolls out.]

character_words: Aww, you must be tired.
scene_description: [Smiles sweetly and approaches Appa. Rubs his belly.]

character_words: No! I'm good. Refreshed and ready to fight some firebenders!
No! I'm good. Refreshed and ready to fight some firebenders!
scene_description: [Continues to work out and flex his body.]

character_words: I was talking to Appa.
Well ... I was talking to Momo.
Well ... I was talking to Momo.
scene_description: [Points to the lemur clinging to a dead tree's branch.]

character_words: I don't see any guards.
scene_description: [Close-up, top-to-bottom view of the Fire Temple.]

character_words: The Fire Nation must have abandoned the temple when Avatar Roku died.
scene_description: [Camera drops to show the group taking cover behind a lower wall below steps.]

character_words: It's almost sundown. We better hurry!
scene_description: [The group leaps over the wall and charges for the front door.]

character_words: Wait. I think I heard something.
scene_description: [The group tip-toes through an enormous chamber with fire-decor columns.]

character_words: We are the Fire Sages. Guardians of the temple of the Avatar.
scene_description: [Turning around, they see five men standing in the hallway dressed in red with tall hats.]

character_words: Great! I am the Avatar!
We know.
scene_description: [Inhales briskly before punching a blast of fire their direction.]

character_words: I'll hold them off. Run!
scene_description: [Deflects three balls of fire with his airbending. Close-up. Shouts over his shoulder.]

character_words: If the Avatar contacts Roku, there's no telling how powerful the boy will become! Split up and find him.
Follow me!
scene_description: [Hallway view; Aang skids in front of Katara and Sokka and continues running.]

character_words: Do you know where you're going?
Nope!  Wrong way!
scene_description: [Rounds a corner and disappears from sight.]

character_words: Nope!  Wrong way!
scene_description: [A moment passes, Katara and Sokka stop when Aang skids into view again. Fearfully.]

character_words: Nope!  Wrong way!
Come back!
scene_description: [Rounds the corner, frightening Sokka and Katara to chase after Aang.]

character_words: I don't want to fight you! I am a friend.
Firebenders aren't our friends!
scene_description: [Aang steps ahead of his friends, assuming an airbending posture.]

character_words: I know why you're here, Avatar.
scene_description: [Steps toward the Avatar, before dropping to his knees and pressing his palms to the floor in submission. This startles Aang, Katara, and Sokka.]

character_words: You do?
Yes.  You wish to speak to Avatar Roku. I can take you to him.
scene_description: [Rises from the floor to stand again.]

character_words: How?
This way.
scene_description: [Slides back a lamplight on the wall. Places palm on wall, focuses firebending into this location to open a secret passage.]

character_words: Find him.
Time is running out! Quickly!
What's he up to, Uncle? Why didn't Commander Zhao arrest me?
scene_description: [Close-up. Tightens knuckles on ship's railing. Smoke billows behind his ship.]

character_words: Because he wants to follow you. He knows you'll lead him to the prize you're both after: the Avatar.
If Zhao wants to follow a trail of smoke, then that's exactly what I'll let him do.
Avatar Roku once called this temple his home. He formed these secret passages out of the magma.
scene_description: [Brief scene cut to show the sun nearly setting. Far overhead view of Shyu leading the group through caverns.]

character_words: Did you know Avatar Roku?
No. But my grandfather knew him. Many generations of Fire Sages guarded this Fire Temple long before me. We all have a strong spiritual connection to this place.
Is that how you knew I was coming?
A few weeks ago, an amazing thing occurred. The statue of Avatar Roku; its eyes began to glow!
That's when we were at the Air Temple. Avatar Roku's eyes were glowing there, too!
At that moment, we knew you had returned to the world.
If this is the Avatar's temple, why did the sages attack me?
Things have changed. In the past, the sages were loyal only to the Avatar. When Roku died, the sages eagerly awaited for the next Avatar to return. But he never came.
They were waiting for me.
Hey don't feel bad. You're only a hundred years late!
Hey don't feel bad. You're only a hundred years late!

They lost hope the Avatar would ever return. When Fire Lord Sozin began the War, my grandfather and the other sages were forced to follow him.  I never wanted to serve the Fire Lord. When I learned you were coming, I knew I would have to betray the other sages.
Thank you for helping me.
We'll follow these stairs to the sanctuary.  Once you're inside, wait for the light to hit Avatar Roku's statue. Only then will you be able to speak with him.
scene_description: [Continues leading the group up a spiraling flight of stairs.]

character_words: We'll follow these stairs to the sanctuary.  Once you're inside, wait for the light to hit Avatar Roku's statue. Only then will you be able to speak with him.
scene_description: [Time skip, Shyu continues talking as they near the top of the stairs.]

character_words: No!
Shyu, what's wrong?
The sanctuary doors, they're closed!
Can't you just open them with firebending? Like you opened that other door?
No. Only a fully realized Avatar is powerful enough to open this door alone. Otherwise, the sages must open this door together,  with five simultaneous fire blasts.
Five fire blasts, huh?  I think I can help you out.
Five fire blasts, huh?  I think I can help you out.
scene_description: [Zoom out to show a lamplight above him.]

character_words: Uncle, keep heading north. Zhao will follow the smoke trail, while I use it as a cover.
This is a little trick I picked up from my father. I seal the lamp oil inside an animal skin casing, Shyu lights the oil soaked twine and,  ta-da! Fake firebending!
This is a little trick I picked up from my father. I seal the lamp oil inside an animal skin casing, Shyu lights the oil soaked twine and,  ta-da! Fake firebending!
scene_description: [Picks up bag, holds it proudly before him.]

character_words: You've really outdone yourself this time, Sokka.
This might actually work.
The sages will hear the explosion, so as soon as they go off, you rush in!
scene_description: [Time skip. Sokka places his last bag into the dragon's mouth.]

character_words: It's almost sunset. Are you ready?
scene_description: [Hides behind a column with her brother. Holds Momo. Glances to the next column where Aang hides.]

character_words: Definitely.
They're still locked!
It didn't work.
scene_description: [Sadly sighs. Sokka rises from hiding behind his sister.]

character_words: It didn't work.
Why, won't, it, open?!
scene_description: [Time skip. Everyone stands in front of the door. Aang beats upon it furiously with consecutive airbending slices.]

character_words: Aang! Stop!  There's nothing else we can do ...
Aang! Stop!  There's nothing else we can do ...
I'm sorry I put you through all of this for nothing.
I don't get it. That firebending looked as strong as any firebending I've seen.
scene_description: [Examining the explosion. Runs his finger across the black soot.]

character_words: Sokka, you're a genius!
Wait. How is Sokka a genius? His plan didn't even work.
Come on Aang. Let her dream.
You're right. Sokka's plan didn't work. But it looks like it did.
Did the definition of genius change over the last hundred years?
Did the definition of genius change over the last hundred years?
scene_description: [Katara grasps her chin, slyly grinning toward Aang.]

character_words: Come quickly! The Avatar has entered the sanctuary!
scene_description: [Time skip. Fire Sages run toward Shyu in front of the door.]

character_words: How did he get in?
I don't know. But look at the scorch marks! And down there!
scene_description: [Points to a shadow visible at the bottom of the door.]

character_words: He's inside! Open the doors, immediately! Before he contacts Avatar Roku!
It's the Avatar's lemur. He must have crawled through the pipes! We've been tricked!
Now, Aang!
scene_description: [Grabs the last free sage and hauls him into his grip, pinning him.]

character_words: Aang! Now's your chance!
The Avatar's coming with me!  Close the doors! Quickly!
scene_description: [Steps out from behind column. Grips Aang from behind, pinning Aang's arms behind him.]

character_words: The Avatar's coming with me!  Close the doors! Quickly!
scene_description: [The captured sages use their captors' surprise to reclaim the upper hand, pinning their captors down. Momo flies off with the Great Fire Sage's hat.]

character_words: Go!
scene_description: [Chained. Sees him coming toward her. Turns head toward the closing door.]

character_words: He made it!
The light hits the statue and I talk to Roku. So why isn't anything happening?
Why isn't it working, it's sealed shut?
scene_description: [He and four sages launch fire blasts into the door's locks. Nothing happens. Frustrated.]

character_words: It must have been the light. Avatar Roku doesn't want us inside.
Why isn't anything happening? I don't know what I'm doing! All I know is airbending! Please Avatar Roku, talk to me!
scene_description: [Exasperated. Standing in the middle of the room, facing the statue.]

character_words: It's good to see you Aang. What took you so long?
scene_description: [Aang respectfully places a fist into his palm, bowing his head to the Avatar before him.]

character_words: Why did you help the Avatar?
scene_description: [Firmly to Shyu, who is kneeling before him with his hands behind his back.]

character_words: Because it was once the sages' duty. It is still our duty.
What a moving and heartfelt performance. I'm certain the Fire Lord will understand, when you explain why you betrayed him.
scene_description: [Claps. Interrupts interrogation. Approaches with six firebender guards.]

character_words: Commander Zhao.
And Prince Zuko. It was a noble effort, but your little smokescreen didn't work.  Two traitors in one day, the Fire Lord will be pleased.
scene_description: [Zuko scowls sharply. Firebenders step behind him, seizing his arms.]

character_words: You're too late, Zhao! The Avatar's inside and the doors are sealed.
scene_description: [Strains against his captor, snaps at Zhao.]

character_words: No matter.  Sooner or later, he has to come out.
No matter.  Sooner or later, he has to come out.
scene_description: [Katara and Sokka share a worried glance.]

character_words: I have something very important to tell you, Aang. That is why, when you were in the Spirit World, I sent my dragon to find you.
Is it about that vision? The one of the comet?
Yes.
What does it mean?
One hundred years ago,  Fire Lord Sozin used that comet to begin the War. He and his firebending army harnessed its incredible power, and dealt a deadly first strike against the other nations.
scene_description: [Viewers see a visual of a comet in the dark sky.]

character_words: So the comet made them stronger?
Yes. Stronger than you could even imagine.
But that happened a hundred years ago. What does the comet have to do with the War now?

Listen carefully.  Sozin's Comet will return by the end of the summer, and Fire Lord Ozai will use its power to finish the War, once and for all.  If he succeeds, even the Avatar won't be able to restore balance to the world. Aang. You must defeat the Fire Lord, before the comet arrives.
scene_description: [Viewers see silhouette of Fire Lord Ozai standing amid flames, fists taut.]

character_words: Listen carefully.  Sozin's Comet will return by the end of the summer, and Fire Lord Ozai will use its power to finish the War, once and for all.  If he succeeds, even the Avatar won't be able to restore balance to the world. Aang. You must defeat the Fire Lord, before the comet arrives.
scene_description: [Visual and audio of Ozai's silhouette roaring upward, fire streaming from his mouth.]

character_words: But I haven't even started learning waterbending! Not to mention earth and fire!
Mastering the elements takes years of discipline and practice. But if the world is to survive, you must do it by summer's end.
When those doors open,  unleash all your firepower!
How's Aang gonna make it out of this?
How are we gonna make it out of this?
What if I can't master all the elements in time? What if I fail?
I know you can do it Aang.  For you have done it before.  The solstice is ending. We must go our separate ways, for now.
I know you can do it Aang.  For you have done it before.  The solstice is ending. We must go our separate ways, for now.
scene_description: [Close-up of half of Aang's now-smiling face.]

character_words: But I won't be able to come back to the temple. What if I have questions? How will I talk to you?
I am a part of you. When you need to talk to me again, you will find a way.  A great danger awaits you at the temple.  I can help you face the threat. But only if you are ready.
scene_description: [Closes his eyes, providing Aang a vision of Fire Navy ships surrounding the island. Speaks to his mind without words.]

character_words: I am a part of you. When you need to talk to me again, you will find a way.  A great danger awaits you at the temple.  I can help you face the threat. But only if you are ready.
scene_description: [Provides a vision of the awaiting firebenders on the other side of the door.]

character_words: I'm ready.
Ready ...
scene_description: [Light fades, revealing a pair of glowing white eyes in the darkness.]

character_words: No! Aang!
scene_description: [Sokka struggles against his chains. Katara is terrified.]

character_words: Fire!
scene_description: [He and his guards cooperate in blasting fire onto the unseen target.]

character_words: Avatar Roku ...
Avatar Roku is going to destroy the temple! We have to get out of here!
Not without Aang!
We got your back.
scene_description: [Aang sighs weakly and drops to his knees. Sokka and Katara approach Aang's sides, supportively lifting him back to his feet.]

character_words: Thanks. Where's Shyu?
I don't know.
scene_description: [ Walking away with Sokka, helping Aang.]

character_words: No Prince, no Avatar! Apparently, the only thing I do have is five traitors!
But Commander! Only Shyu helped the Avatar.
Save your stories for the Fire Lord. As far as I'm concerned, you are all guilty!  Take them to the prison hold!
Save your stories for the Fire Lord. As far as I'm concerned, you are all guilty!  Take them to the prison hold!
Would you sit down?  If we hit a bump, you'll go flying off. What's bugging you anyway?
scene_description: [Aang is pacing around on Appa's saddle, breathing heavily.]

character_words: Would you sit down?  If we hit a bump, you'll go flying off. What's bugging you anyway?
scene_description: [Turns around from his perch on Appa's head.]

character_words: It's what Avatar Roku said. I'm supposed to master all four elements before that comet arrives.
Well, let's see. You pretty much mastered airbending and that only took you a hundred and twelve years. I'm sure you can master three more elements by next summer.
scene_description: [In a sarcastic, amused tone while facing Aang.]

character_words: I haven't even started waterbending and we're still weeks away from the North Pole. What am I gonna do?
Calm down, it's going to be okay.  If you want, I can try to teach you some of the stuff I know.
Calm down, it's going to be okay.  If you want, I can try to teach you some of the stuff I know.
scene_description: [Aang sits down in front of her.]

character_words: You'd do that?
We'll need to find a good source of water first.
scene_description: [Nods and looks over the side of Appa's saddle.]

character_words: Maybe we can find a puddle for you to splash in.
Nice puddle.
scene_description: [Frowning beside Aang and Katara's ecstatic faces.]

character_words: Yeah! Don't start without me, boy!
Yeah! Don't start without me, boy!
Remember the reason we're here.
Oh right. Time to practice waterbending.
Oh right. Time to practice waterbending.
Great. So what am I supposed to do?
You could ... clean the gunk out of Appa's toes.
scene_description: [Hands Sokka a branch with a bushel of leaves at the end.]

character_words: So, while you guys are playing in the water, I'm supposed to be hard at work picking mud out of a giant bison's feet?
Mud and bugs!
Okay.
scene_description: [Takes stick and walks over to Appa who is floating in the water.]

character_words: Someone's changing our course.
scene_description: [Close-up of his face; he glares at the tower.]

character_words: What is the meaning of this mutiny? No one told you to change course!
What is the meaning of this mutiny? No one told you to change course!
scene_description: [Shows Iroh and the rest of the crew playing Pai Sho behind them.]

character_words: Actually, someone did. I assure you, it is a matter of utmost importance, Prince Zuko.
Is it something to do with the Avatar?
Even more urgent. It seems, I-  -I have lost my lotus tile.
Even more urgent. It seems, I-  -I have lost my lotus tile.
scene_description: [Moves a piece of his across the Pai Sho board.]

character_words: Lotus tile?
For my Pai Sho game. Most people think the lotus tile insignificant, but it is essential for the unusual strategy that I employ.
You've changed our course for a stupid lotus tile?

See, you, like most people, underestimate it's value. Just give me ten minutes to check the merchants at this port of call.  Hopefully, they will have the lotus tile in stock and I can get on with my life.  I'm lucky to have such an understanding nephew.

See, you, like most people, underestimate it's value. Just give me ten minutes to check the merchants at this port of call.  Hopefully, they will have the lotus tile in stock and I can get on with my life.  I'm lucky to have such an understanding nephew.
scene_description: [Zuko breathes fire up at the ceiling in anger and Iroh smiles.]

character_words: Yeah, don't get too happy. You've got to do me next.

This is a pretty basic move, but is still took me months to perfect. So don't get frustrated if you don't get it right away.  Just push and pull the water like this. The key is getting the wrist movement right.
scene_description: [She moves her hands back and forth and makes small waves in the water, while Aang looks up, smiling.]

character_words: Like this?
Like this?
scene_description: [Does the hand movements Katara is doing, but nothing is happening yet.]

character_words: That's almost right. If you keep practicing I'm sure eventually—
Hey, I'm bending it already!
scene_description: [Shows Aang making much bigger waves than Katara's on his first try.]

character_words: Wow, I can't believe you got that so quickly. It took me two months to learn that move.
Well, you had to figure it all on your own. I'm lucky enough to have a great teacher.
Thanks.
So, what's next?
This is a more difficult move. I call it streaming the water.  It's harder than it looks, so don't be disappointed if-  Nice work.  Though the over-the-head flare was unnecessary.
scene_description: [She moves her hands and raises a stream of water from the river into the air and moves it around.]

character_words: This is a more difficult move. I call it streaming the water.  It's harder than it looks, so don't be disappointed if-  Nice work.  Though the over-the-head flare was unnecessary.
scene_description: [Shows Aang already controlling a stream of water, moving it around and above his body and neatly coiling it back into the river, much to Katara's dismay.]

character_words: This is a more difficult move. I call it streaming the water.  It's harder than it looks, so don't be disappointed if-  Nice work.  Though the over-the-head flare was unnecessary.
Sorry.  Well, don't stop now! Keep 'em coming!
Well I kind of know this one other move, but it's pretty hard. I haven't even totally figured it out yet. The idea is to create a big, powerful wave.
Well I kind of know this one other move, but it's pretty hard. I haven't even totally figured it out yet. The idea is to create a big, powerful wave.
scene_description: [She moves her hands up, shaking, and starts to get a big mass of water to rise out of the river, but it pops before forming into anything substantial.]

character_words: So, like this?
scene_description: [He raises his hands and creates a massive wave that towers over their heads.]

character_words: Aang?!
scene_description: [Still working on cleaning up Appa, he looks up and stares at Aang's wave crashing toward him in fear.]

character_words: Aang?!
scene_description: [The wave throws Sokka off into the water and his head slowly rises out, annoyed.]

character_words: Looks like I got the hang of that move! What else do you got?
That's enough practicing for today.
Yeah, I'll say!  You just "practiced" our supplies down the river.
scene_description: [Head still sticking out of the water.]

character_words: Yeah, I'll say!  You just "practiced" our supplies down the river.
Yeah, I'll say!  You just "practiced" our supplies down the river.
scene_description: [Shows a group of bags floating away.]

character_words: Uh, sorry.  I'm sure we can find somewhere to replace all this stuff.
Uh, sorry.  I'm sure we can find somewhere to replace all this stuff.
My life was hard enough when you were just an airbender.
We've got exactly three copper pieces left from the money that King Bumi gave us. Let's spend it wisely.
scene_description: [Walking back from alleyway with a bag over his shoulders.]

character_words: Uh, make that two copper pieces, Sokka. I couldn't say no to this whistle!
scene_description: [Pulls out a white whistle that looks like a bison, takes a huge breath and blows into it, but it barely makes a sound.]

character_words: It doesn't even work.  See? Even Momo thinks it's a piece of junk.
scene_description: [Pulls out fingers over his ears after expecting a loud noise.]

character_words: It doesn't even work.  See? Even Momo thinks it's a piece of junk.
scene_description: [Aang stops blowing when Momo squawks at him.]

character_words: No offense Aang, but I'll hold the money from now on.
scene_description: [Aang hands her the two copper coins.]

character_words: Earth Nation! Fire Nation! Water Nation! So long as bargains are your inclination, you're welcome here! Don't be shy, come on by!  Oh! You there, I can see from your clothing that you're world-traveling types. Perhaps I can interest you in some exotic curios?

Earth Nation! Fire Nation! Water Nation! So long as bargains are your inclination, you're welcome here! Don't be shy, come on by!  Oh! You there, I can see from your clothing that you're world-traveling types. Perhaps I can interest you in some exotic curios?
scene_description: [Sokka, Katara, and Aang walk by and he runs up to them.]

character_words: Sure! What are curios?
I'm not entirely sure. But we got 'em!
I'm not entirely sure. But we got 'em!
scene_description: [Puts his hand on Aang's shoulder and smiles, walking him into the ship.]

character_words: Huh?
scene_description: [Looks up close at an item on a shelf, confused.]

character_words: I've never seen such a fine specimen of lemur.  That beast would fetch me a hefty sum if you'd be interested in bartering.
scene_description: [Standing in a dark doorway as Aang passes by with Momo on his back.]

character_words: I've never seen such a fine specimen of lemur.  That beast would fetch me a hefty sum if you'd be interested in bartering.
scene_description: [Walks into the light, an iguana parrot on his shoulder.]

character_words: I've never seen such a fine specimen of lemur.  That beast would fetch me a hefty sum if you'd be interested in bartering.
Momo's not for sale.
Look at this, Aang. It's a waterbending scroll!  Check out these crazy moves.
Look at this, Aang. It's a waterbending scroll!  Check out these crazy moves.
Where did you get a waterbending scroll?
Let's just say I got it up North, at a most reasonable price, free.
scene_description: [Slams his hand onto the scroll and pulls it away.]

character_words: Let's just say I got it up North, at a most reasonable price, free.
scene_description: [Rolls the scroll back up and puts it away back in its shelf.]

character_words: Wait a minute ... Sea loving traders, with suspiciously acquired merchandise,  and pet reptile birds?  You guys are pirates!
scene_description: [Turns around and looks at the captain from the other side of the room.]

character_words: Wait a minute ... Sea loving traders, with suspiciously acquired merchandise,  and pet reptile birds?  You guys are pirates!
Wait a minute ... Sea loving traders, with suspiciously acquired merchandise,  and pet reptile birds?  You guys are pirates!
scene_description: [Turns around to Oh, almost spitting in his face.]

character_words: We prefer to think of ourselves as "high risk traders."
scene_description: [Puts his arm around a terrified Sokka's shoulders.]

character_words: So, how much for the, uh, traded scroll?
I've already got a buyer, a nobleman in the Earth Kingdom.  Unless of course, you kids have two hundred gold pieces on you right now.
I know how to deal with these guys, Katara. Pirates love to haggle.  Watch and learn.  Let's say to the price of, one copper piece!
I know how to deal with these guys, Katara. Pirates love to haggle.  Watch and learn.  Let's say to the price of, one copper piece!
scene_description: [Katara drops the final coins in his hand.]

character_words: I know how to deal with these guys, Katara. Pirates love to haggle.  Watch and learn.  Let's say to the price of, one copper piece!
scene_description: [Walks over to the counter, leans against it, and talks in a pirate voice.]

character_words: I know how to deal with these guys, Katara. Pirates love to haggle.  Watch and learn.  Let's say to the price of, one copper piece!
scene_description: [Smiles, and dramatically presents the single coin.]

character_words: The price is two hundred gold pieces. I don't haggle on items this rare.
Okay, two copper pieces!
scene_description: [Still smirking and talking like a pirate.]

character_words: It's not as amusing the second time, boy!
Aang, can we get out of here? I feel like we're getting weird looks.
Aye, we be casting off now!
What was that all about, Katara?
Yeah, I was just starting to browse through their boomerang collection.
I'll just feel a lot better once we get away from here.
Hey you! Get back here!
Well, well. Look who's come to their senses. Told you the haggling would pay off.
I don't think these pirates are here to trade with us.
I don't think these pirates are here to trade with us.
scene_description: [Turns around and runs, Aang and Sokka follow and the pirates chase behind them. Half of the group runs down one street while the other goes down the one next to it.]

character_words: This way. Let's cut 'em off!
Whoa!
scene_description: [Turning a corner with Aang and Katara.]

character_words: Whoa!
scene_description: [Katara freezes a puddle behind them that a pirate slips on.]

character_words: My cabbages! This place is worse than Omashu!
I hope that lemur of yours has nine lives!
Now, who gets to taste the steel of my blade first?
scene_description: [Him and the pirates corner them in the dead end of a street.]

character_words: No thanks.  Grab on tight!
scene_description: [Spins and hurls a blast of air at the pirates that send them backward, and runs toward them with his glider out.]

character_words: Aang! I thought we were running away from the pirates!
scene_description: [Jumps on to Aang's glider with Sokka and they lift off into the air.]

character_words: Just hang on!
scene_description: [Flies over the pirates' heads and into the distance.]

character_words: I used to kind of look up to pirates, but those guys are terrible.
I know. That's why I took this.
I know. That's why I took this.
scene_description: [Holds out the waterbending scroll they saw in the shop.]

character_words: No way!
Isn't it great?
No wonder they were trying to hack us up! You stole their waterbending scroll!
I prefer to think of it as high risk trading.
Good one, Katara.
Sokka, where do you think they got it? They stole it from a waterbender!
It doesn't matter. You put all of our lives in danger just so you could learn some stupid, fancy splashes.
These are real waterbending forms. You know how crucial it is for Aang to learn waterbending!
Whatever.
Well, what's done is done. We have it, we might as well learn from it.
I've checked all the shops on this pier. Not a lotus tile in the entire marketplace.
It's good to know this trip was a complete waste of time for everyone!
Quite the contrary. I always say, the only thing better than finding something you are looking for  is finding something you weren't looking for at a great bargain!
scene_description: [Crew members begin to walk past carrying Iroh's purchases.]

character_words: Quite the contrary. I always say, the only thing better than finding something you are looking for  is finding something you weren't looking for at a great bargain!
scene_description: [A crew member walks past the two playing a tsungi horn.]

character_words: You bought a tsungi horn?
For music night on the ship. Now, if we only had some woodwinds.  Oh, this place looks promising!  Oh, that is handsome! Wouldn't it look magnificent in the galley?
For music night on the ship. Now, if we only had some woodwinds.  Oh, this place looks promising!  Oh, that is handsome! Wouldn't it look magnificent in the galley?
We lost the Water Tribe girl and the little bald monk she was traveling with.
This monk, did he have an arrow on his head?
This monk, did he have an arrow on his head?
scene_description: [Iroh turns around, making a face similar to the monkey's.]

character_words: I just want to try this one move first and then it's all yours.  Here, hold it open for me. The single water whip. Looks doable.  Ow!
I just want to try this one move first and then it's all yours.  Here, hold it open for me. The single water whip. Looks doable.  Ow!
scene_description: [Attempts the move, but ends up hitting herself in the forehead.]

character_words: Ha, ha, ha!
What's so funny?
I'm sorry, but you deserved that.  You've been duped; she's only interested in teaching herself.
Aang will get his turn once I figure out the water whip.  Ugh, why can't I get this stupid move?
Aang will get his turn once I figure out the water whip.  Ugh, why can't I get this stupid move?
scene_description: [She tries again, but hits Momo instead, who screeches.]

character_words: You'll get it.  You just gotta shift your weight through the stances.  There, see, the key to bending is—
You'll get it.  You just gotta shift your weight through the stances.  There, see, the key to bending is—
scene_description: [He tries and does it perfectly on the first try.]

character_words: Will you please shut your air hole? Believe it or not your infinite wisdom gets a little old sometimes! Why don't we just throw the scroll away since you're so naturally gifted!  What?  Oh my gosh, Aang, I am so sorry, I don't know what came over me. But you know what, it won't happen again.  Here, this is yours. I don't want to have anything to do with it anymore.

Will you please shut your air hole? Believe it or not your infinite wisdom gets a little old sometimes! Why don't we just throw the scroll away since you're so naturally gifted!  What?  Oh my gosh, Aang, I am so sorry, I don't know what came over me. But you know what, it won't happen again.  Here, this is yours. I don't want to have anything to do with it anymore.

Oh my gosh, Aang, I am so sorry, I don't know what came over me. But you know what, it won't happen again.  Here, this is yours. I don't want to have anything to do with it anymore.
scene_description: [She looks back at Aang, who has tears in his eyes.]

character_words: Will you please shut your air hole? Believe it or not your infinite wisdom gets a little old sometimes! Why don't we just throw the scroll away since you're so naturally gifted!  What?  Oh my gosh, Aang, I am so sorry, I don't know what came over me. But you know what, it won't happen again.  Here, this is yours. I don't want to have anything to do with it anymore.
It's okay Katara.
What about Momo? He's the real victim here.
I'm sorry, Momo.
scene_description: [Bends down to pet Momo as he rubs his hind end.]

character_words: And what about me? There was that time you—
No more apologies!
Shouldn't we stop to search the woods?
We don't need to stop. They stole a waterbending scroll, right?
Mm-hm.
Then they'll be on the water.

Shhh, Momo! Go back to sleep. Shh!  Ugh, ugh, ugh! Shoot! Come on water, work with me here! Okay, what if I just, ow! Stupid scroll!  Okay Katara, shift your weight through the stances.  No! Let go of me!

Shhh, Momo! Go back to sleep. Shh!  Ugh, ugh, ugh! Shoot! Come on water, work with me here! Okay, what if I just, ow! Stupid scroll!  Okay Katara, shift your weight through the stances.  No! Let go of me!
scene_description: [The camera fades to show her standing by the river, attempting but failing to perfect the water whip, frustrated.]

character_words: Shhh, Momo! Go back to sleep. Shh!  Ugh, ugh, ugh! Shoot! Come on water, work with me here! Okay, what if I just, ow! Stupid scroll!  Okay Katara, shift your weight through the stances.  No! Let go of me!
scene_description: [The pirate captain and Zuko are shown hearing her.]

character_words: Shhh, Momo! Go back to sleep. Shh!  Ugh, ugh, ugh! Shoot! Come on water, work with me here! Okay, what if I just, ow! Stupid scroll!  Okay Katara, shift your weight through the stances.  No! Let go of me!
scene_description: [She drops the water again and hears the ship pulling up onto the river bank. She peaks through the bushes to see what the noise was, and gasps upon seeing the pirates. She turns to run, but it grabbed by a pirate.]

character_words: Shhh, Momo! Go back to sleep. Shh!  Ugh, ugh, ugh! Shoot! Come on water, work with me here! Okay, what if I just, ow! Stupid scroll!  Okay Katara, shift your weight through the stances.  No! Let go of me!
scene_description: [She bends water up into the pirate's face, and he releases her, she runs but is grabbed again on the wrists by Zuko.]

character_words: I'll save you from the pirates.
scene_description: [He glares at her as she looks frightfully at him.]

character_words: Tell me where he is and I won't hurt you or your brother.
Go jump in the river!
Try to understand. I need to capture him to restore something I've lost, my honor.  Perhaps in exchange I can restore something you've lost.
scene_description: [Katara jerks her head away from Zuko.]

character_words: Try to understand. I need to capture him to restore something I've lost, my honor.  Perhaps in exchange I can restore something you've lost.
scene_description: [He holds her mother's necklace up to her neck.]

character_words: My mother's necklace! How did you get that?
I didn't steal it, if that's what you're wondering. Tell me where he is.
No!
Enough of this necklace garbage! You promised a scroll!
I wonder how much this is worth ...  A lot, apparently. Now you help me find what I want, you'll get this back, and everyone goes home happy. Search the woods for the boy and meet back here!
scene_description: [The pirates gasp as he takes it out and holds it over a fire in his hand.]

character_words: Fine.
Huh? Where did she go?  I don't believe it.
Huh? Where did she go?  I don't believe it.
What's wrong?
She took the scroll! She's obsessed with that thing. It's just a matter of time before she gets us all in deep-
scene_description: [Yells as a pirate throws a rope around his arms and drags him forward. He rolls away and charges at the pirate while another pirate captures Aang in a net and drags him away.]

character_words: I got him, come on!
Oh, what? I'm not good enough to kidnap? Ah!
scene_description: [The pirate shoots another net at Sokka and drags him away too.]

character_words: Nice work.
Aang, this is all my fault.
No Katara, it isn't.
Yeah, it kind of is.
Give me the boy.
You give us the scroll.
You're really gonna hand over the Avatar for a stupid piece of parchment?
Don't listen to him, he's trying to turn us against each other!
Your friend is the Avatar?
Sure is, and I'll bet he'll fetch a lot more on the black market than that fancy scroll.
Shut your mouth, you Water Tribe peasant!
Yeah, Sokka, you really should shut your mouth.
I'm just sayin' it's bad business sense. Think how much the Fire Lord would pay for the Avatar. You guys would be set for life.
Keep the scroll; we can buy a hundred with the reward we'll get for the kid.
Keep the scroll; we can buy a hundred with the reward we'll get for the kid.
You'll regret breaking a deal with me.
scene_description: [He and two of his soldiers send a blast of fire at the pirates. The pirates jump back and Oh runs out, throwing smoke bombs and jumping into the cloud as the fight ensues. Some of the soldiers run out to Sokka and Aang, who are struggling with their ropes, but are stopped by several pirates. Momo runs down the tree and frees Katara.]

character_words: Thanks, Momo. I owe you a bushel of apples.
scene_description: [She runs to join the fight. Aang is shown lost in the smoke, a thrown knife narrowly misses him and cuts through his ropes. Zuko finds his way out of the smoke cloud and hides the scroll behind his back, but the pirate captain sees him and the two begin to fight. The scroll flies into the air and his caught by Momo, the iguana parrot sees him and hits Momo. The scroll flies back down to the ground. A knife narrowly misses Sokka's head, and he uses it to cuts the ropes on his hands.]

character_words: Aang, are you there?
I'm over here! Follow my voice!
Where? I can't find you!
I'm right here!  Never mind! I'll find you!  Run!  Katara, you're okay!
scene_description: [Airbends the dust away, revealing the pirates surrounding him, and immediately airbends it back around himself.]

character_words: I'm right here!  Never mind! I'll find you!  Run!  Katara, you're okay!
scene_description: [Sokka climbs out of the dust cloud on his hands and knees. Aang vaults over him in a full sprint.]

character_words: I'm right here!  Never mind! I'll find you!  Run!  Katara, you're okay!
scene_description: [They find Katara, who is trying to push the pirate boat back into the water.]

character_words: Help me get this boat back in the water so we can get outta here.
scene_description: [They join her in trying to push the boat, but can't.]

character_words: We'd need a team of rhinos to budge this ship.
A team of rhinos, or two waterbenders.
Everybody in!
Are you so busy fighting you cannot see your own ship has set sail?
We have no time for your proverbs, Uncle!
It's no proverb!
scene_description: [Points to Team Avatar who has hijacked the pirate ship.]

character_words: Bleeding hog monkeys!
scene_description: [Zuko laughs while pointing at him. His laughter dissipates as the pirates hijack his own boat. The pirates taunt him and the screen pans to a steaming Zuko.]

character_words: Hey! That's my boat!
Hey! That's my boat!
Maybe it should be a proverb ...
C'mon, Uncle!
C'mon, Uncle!
Sokka, can't you make it go any faster?
I don't know how. This thing wasn't made by the Water Tribe!
Hey, you did the water whip!
I couldn't have done it without your help.
Would you two quit congratulating each other and help me out?
That's good ...
scene_description: [Aang lands behind him and airbends him and the other pirate off the ship before jumping down to Sokka.]

character_words: Aang, look!
Aang, look!
scene_description: [The ship is shown headed toward a huge waterfall.]

character_words: Oh no ...
Have you lost your mind? This is no time for flute practice!
scene_description: [Katara and Aang stare in horror at the approaching waterfall.]

character_words: We can stop the boat! Aang, together, push and pull the water!  It's working, it's slowing down! We're doing it!
scene_description: [They create a small Whirlpool that stops the boat.]

character_words: But we have another problem.
scene_description: [Zuko's boat is shown sailing straight toward their ship. The boat rams into the ship and Sokka, Aang, and Katara are forced to jump as the boat goes over the falls.]

character_words: Jump!
scene_description: [Appa is shown flying toward them. They land on him and fly to safety.]

character_words: I knew a bison whistle would come in handy! Thanks Appa.
Yeah, we owe you one.
scene_description: [Appa roars and the scene cuts to show Zuko running to the cliff in horror at the fact that his boat has gone over the falls.]

character_words: My boat!
Prince Zuko, you're really going to get a kick out of this. That lotus tile was in my sleeve the whole time!
Prince Zuko, you're really going to get a kick out of this. That lotus tile was in my sleeve the whole time!
scene_description: [Has a big smile on his face.]

character_words: Aang, I still owe you an apology. You were just so good at waterbending without really trying. I got so competitive that I put us all in danger, I'm sorry.
That's okay Katara.
Besides, who needs that stupid scroll anyway?
Is that really how you feel?
The scroll!
First, what did you learn?
scene_description: [Puts his hand in front to keep Katara from grabbing it.]

character_words: Stealing is wrong.  Unless it's from pirates.
Good one, Katara.
Where's Momo?
scene_description: [Camera zooms in to close-up shot of Aang, Katara, and Sokka, the siblings sitting next to each other with bored faces, and Aang standing with his back to the camera. Momo screeches and the gang looks around.]

character_words: Hang on, Momo!  All right, you too.
scene_description: [Aang uses his airbending to fly to the top of the tree, jumping from trunk-to-trunk to get higher. He finds the traps' mechanisms, undoes them, and carefully lowers Momo to the ground where Katara and Sokka are waiting. They open the trap together and the lemur runs out with one of the lychee nuts in his mouth. Katara and Sokka look on as Momo gets on his hind legs and eats it as though nothing has happened. Sokka grunts in frustration and facepalms. When Aang lands, he looks up to see the other two animals seemingly crying out to him for help.]

character_words: Hang on, Momo!  All right, you too.
This is gonna take forever.
scene_description: [Throws his boomerang to simply cut the animals free.]

character_words: That works.
scene_description: [Inching his way upside-down to the traps on the tree branch. They fall before he can reach them.]

character_words: These are Fire Nation traps,  you can tell from the metalwork. We better pack up camp, and get moving.
scene_description: [Camera zooms to upward shot of the gang looking at the trap.]

character_words: Uh uh. No flying this time.
What? Why wouldn't we fly?
Think about it: Somehow Prince Zuko and the Fire Nation keep finding us. It's because they spot Appa, he's just too noticeable.
scene_description: [Takes the sleeping bag from Aang's hands.]

character_words: What? Appa's not too noticeable!
He's a gigantic fluffy monster with an arrow on his head! It's kinda hard to miss him!
He's a gigantic fluffy monster with an arrow on his head! It's kinda hard to miss him!
scene_description: [The bison yawns and the camera flashes to Aang sitting comfortably on the animal's head.]

character_words: Sokka's just jealous 'cause he doesn't have an arrow.
I know you all wanna fly, but my instincts tell me we should play it safe this time and walk.
scene_description: [Camera closes in on Sokka and Katara next to each other.]

character_words: Who made you the boss?
scene_description: [Leans forward at her brother and smiles.]

character_words: I'm not the boss, I'm the leader.
scene_description: [Points his finger at his chest; to Katara.]

character_words: You're the leader? But your voice still cracks!
I'm the oldest, and I'm a warrior, so  I'm the leader!
I'm the oldest, and I'm a warrior, so  I'm the leader!
If anyone's the leader, it's Aang. I mean he is the Avatar.
If anyone's the leader, it's Aang. I mean he is the Avatar.
Are you kidding, he's just a goofy kid!
He's right.
scene_description: [While hanging upside-down from Appa's right horn with feet sticking out in the air.]

character_words: Why do boys always think someone has to be the leader? I bet you wouldn't be so bossy if you kissed a girl.
I've kissed a girl, you just haven't met her.
Who? Gran-Gran? I've met Gran-Gran.
No! Besides Gran-Gran. Look, my instincts tell me we have a better chance of slipping through on foot, and a leader has to trust his instincts.
Okay, we'll try it your way, oh wise leader.
Who knows? Walking might be fun.  Walking stinks! How do people go anywhere without a flying bison?
scene_description: [Aang steps over, now wearing a backpack. Momo is sitting on the top.]

character_words: Who knows? Walking might be fun.  Walking stinks! How do people go anywhere without a flying bison?
scene_description: [Cut to the forest at a later time. Between trees the group trudges along, with Sokka in front, followed by Aang and Momo, Katara, and Appa.]

character_words: Well I don't know, Aang. Why don't you ask Sokka's instincts? They seem to know everything.
Ha, ha, very funny.
I'm tired of carrying this pack.
You know who you should ask to carry it for a while? Sokka's instincts.
scene_description: [Sokka's eyes turn to her in irritation.]

character_words: That's a great idea. Hey, Sokka's instincts, would you mind-
Okay, okay, I get it. Look guys, I'm tired too. But the important thing is that we're safe from the  Fire ... Nation.
scene_description: [Walks through a bush and sees something in front of him.]

character_words: Run!  We're cut off!
scene_description: [They turn to run but a firebender blocks them off by setting the plants behind them on fire.]

character_words: Sokka, your shirt!
scene_description: [Sokka yells; Katara clears a fire on Sokka's shirt with waterbending.]

character_words: If you let us pass, we promise not to hurt you.
What are you doing?
Bluffing?
You promise not to hurt us?
Nice work, Sokka! How'd you do that?
Uh, instinct?
Look!
Down you go.
scene_description: [Katara looks amazed, Aang shocked, and Sokka confused.]

character_words: They're in the trees!
Hey, he was mine!
Gotta be quicker next time.
Man!
Hey.
Hi.
You just took out a whole army almost single-handed.
Army? There were only like, twenty guys.
My name is Jet, and these are my Freedom Fighters, Sneers, Longshot, Smellerbee, The Duke, and Pipsqueak.
Ha, ha, Pipsqueak, that's a funny name.
Ha, ha, Pipsqueak, that's a funny name.
scene_description: [The Duke sniffs his nose, as the camera pans upward to Pipsqueak.]

character_words: You think my name is funny?
scene_description: [Looming over Aang in a threatening manner; in a low, growling tone of voice.]

character_words: It's hilarious!
scene_description: [Side-shot; Aang looks taken aback for a second before replying in an upbeat tone.]

character_words: Umm, thanks for saving us Jet. We're lucky you were there.
I should be thanking you. We were waiting to ambush those soldiers all morning, we just needed the right distraction, and then you guys stumbled in.
We were relying on instincts.
You'll get yourself killed doing that.
Hey Jet, these barrels are filled of blasting jelly.
That's a great score.
And these boxes are filled with jelly candy!
Also good, let's not get those mixed up.
We'll take this stuff back to the hideout.
You guys have a hideout?
You wanna see it?
Yes, we wanna see it!
We're here.
Where? There's nothing here.
Hold this.
Why? What's this do?
Why? What's this do?
scene_description: [Screams as he is pulled up into the branches.]

character_words: Aang?
I'll get up on my own.
scene_description: [Leaps up into the trees with airbending.]

character_words: Grab hold of me, Katara.
Nice place you got!
It's beautiful up here!
It's beautiful ... and more importantly the Fire Nation can't find us.
They would love to find you. Wouldn't they, Jet?
It's not gonna happen, Smellerbee.
Why does the Fire Nation want to find you?
I guess you could say I've been causing them a little trouble. See, they took over a nearby Earth Kingdom town a few years back.
We've been ambushin' their troops, cutting off their supply lines, and doing anything we can to mess with 'em.
scene_description: [Sokka is now seen comically hopping around trying to get past Pipsqueak.]

character_words: One day, we'll drive the Fire Nation out of here for good and free that town.
That's so brave.
Yeah, nothing's braver than a guy in a tree house.
Don't pay any attention to my brother.
No problem. He probably had a rough day.
So, you all live here?
scene_description: [Sokka who is being ignored comically sinks back behind them.]

character_words: That's right. Longshot over there?  His town got burned down by the Fire Nation. And we found The Duke trying to steal our food. I don't think he ever really had a home.
scene_description: [The screen cuts to Longshot and The Duke walking not making a sound.]

character_words: What about you?
The Fire Nation killed my parents. I was only eight years old. That day changed me forever.
scene_description: [Katara and Jet come to a halt as the rest pass.]

character_words: Sokka and I lost our mother to the Fire Nation.
I'm so sorry, Katara.

Today, we struck another blow against the Fire Nation swine.  I got a special joy from the look on one soldier's face, when The Duke dropped down on his helmet and rode him like a wild hog monkey.  Now, the Fire Nation thinks they don't have to worry about a couple of kids hiding in the trees.  Maybe they're right.  Or maybe ... they're dead wrong.
scene_description: [Everyone cheers. Katara and Aang smile while Sokka cops an attitude and a scowling face.]

character_words: Today, we struck another blow against the Fire Nation swine.  I got a special joy from the look on one soldier's face, when The Duke dropped down on his helmet and rode him like a wild hog monkey.  Now, the Fire Nation thinks they don't have to worry about a couple of kids hiding in the trees.  Maybe they're right.  Or maybe ... they're dead wrong.
scene_description: [The Duke, without his helmet, climbs up the table. He marches on the table with his arms in the air.]

character_words: Today, we struck another blow against the Fire Nation swine.  I got a special joy from the look on one soldier's face, when The Duke dropped down on his helmet and rode him like a wild hog monkey.  Now, the Fire Nation thinks they don't have to worry about a couple of kids hiding in the trees.  Maybe they're right.  Or maybe ... they're dead wrong.
scene_description: [He prepares to take a drink from his wooden cup.]

character_words: Today, we struck another blow against the Fire Nation swine.  I got a special joy from the look on one soldier's face, when The Duke dropped down on his helmet and rode him like a wild hog monkey.  Now, the Fire Nation thinks they don't have to worry about a couple of kids hiding in the trees.  Maybe they're right.  Or maybe ... they're dead wrong.
scene_description: [A very loud and long boo is heard; with an angry face.]

character_words: Today, we struck another blow against the Fire Nation swine.  I got a special joy from the look on one soldier's face, when The Duke dropped down on his helmet and rode him like a wild hog monkey.  Now, the Fire Nation thinks they don't have to worry about a couple of kids hiding in the trees.  Maybe they're right.  Or maybe ... they're dead wrong.
scene_description: [A loud and long cheer is heard.]

character_words: Hey Jet, nice speech.
Thanks. By the way, I was really impressed with you and Aang. That was some great bending I saw out there today.
Well, he's great. He's the Avatar.  I could use some more training.
Avatar huh? Very nice.
Thanks Jet.
So I might know a way that you and Aang can help in our struggle.
Unfortunately, we have to leave tonight.
Sokka, you're kidding me! I needed you on an important mission tomorrow.
What mission?
What are you doing?
Shh ... It amplifies vibrations.
Good trick.
Nothing yet.  Wait! Yes, someone's approaching.
scene_description: [Sokka puts his ear to the handle of his knife.]

character_words: Nothing yet.  Wait! Yes, someone's approaching.
How many?
I think there's just one.
Good work, Sokka. Ready your weapon.
Good work, Sokka. Ready your weapon.
scene_description: [Sokka takes his knife out of the tree. His eyes spot an old man.]

character_words: Wait, false alarm ... He's just an old man.
What are you doing in our woods, you leech?
Please sir, I'm just a traveler.
Do you like destroying towns? Do you like destroying families? Do you?
Oh ... Please let me go ... have mercy ...
Does the Fire Nation let people go? Does the Fire Nation have mercy?
Jet, he's just an old man!
He's Fire Nation! Search him!
scene_description: [Pipsqueak holds the prisoner and Smellerbee steps up to search the poor man.]

character_words: But he's not hurting anyone!
Have you forgotten that the Fire Nation killed your mother? Remember why you fight!
We've got his stuff, Jet.
scene_description: [She holds up the old man's bag. The old man is thrown back on the ground.]

character_words: This doesn't feel right.
It's what has to be done, now let's get outta here.
Come on, Sokka!
Sokka! Look what the Duke gave me!  Ow! Quit it!
scene_description: [Aang is wearing a bag and pulls a small pellet from it. With a sly grin, he tosses it next to Momo, where it explodes with a pop. Momo puffs up like a startled cat. He hisses and lunges for the bag. Momo sits on Aang's shoulder and tosses several pellets at his feet. Aang dances about wildly.]

character_words: Hey, Sokka. Is Jet back?
Yeah he's back. But we're leaving.
What?
But I made him this hat.
scene_description: [She shows a cap made out of stitched leaves with a flower on top.]

character_words: Your boyfriend Jet's a thug.
What? No, he's not.
He's messed up Katara.
He's not messed up, he's just got a different way of life, a really fun way of life.
He beat and robbed a harmless old man!
I wanna hear Jet's side of the story.
scene_description: [The scene changes to Jet in a room.]

character_words: Sokka, you told them what happened, but you didn't mention that the guy was Fire Nation?
No, he conveniently left that part out.
Fine! But even if he was Fire Nation, he was a harmless civilian!
He was an assassin, Sokka.
See? There's a compartment for poison in the knife. . He was sent to eliminate me; you helped save my life, Sokka.
scene_description: [He pulls on the ring and removes a small glass tube filled with red liquid.]

character_words: I knew there was an explanation.
I didn't see any knife!
That's because he was concealing it.
See, Sokka? I'm sure you just didn't notice the knife.
There was no knife! I'm going back to the hut and packing my things.
Tell me you guys aren't leaving yet. I really need your help.
What can we do?
The Fire Nation is planning on burning down our forest. If you both use waterbending to fill the reservoir, we could fight the fires. But if you leave now, they'll destroy the whole valley.
We can't leave now with the Fire Nation about to burn down a forest!
I'm sorry Katara. Jet's very smooth, but we can't trust him.
You know what I think? You're jealous that he's a better warrior and a better leader!
Katara, I'm not jealous of Jet. It's just that my instinct—
Well my instincts tell me we need to stay here a little longer and help Jet. Come on Aang.
Sorry, Sokka.
Let's go.
Now listen, you are not to blow the dam until I give the signal. If the reservoir isn't full, the Fire Nation troops could survive.
But what about the people in the town, won't they get wiped out too?
scene_description: [Jet places a hand on The Duke's shoulder.]

character_words: Look Duke, that's the price of ridding this area of the Fire Nation.  Now don't blow the dam until I give the signal—got it?
Look Duke, that's the price of ridding this area of the Fire Nation.  Now don't blow the dam until I give the signal—got it?
Where do you think you're going, ponytail?
Sokka, I'm glad you decided to join us.
scene_description: [Pipsqueak and Smellerbee send Sokka to his knees. He rubs his shoulder.]

character_words: I heard your plan to destroy the Earth Kingdom town.
Our plan is to rid the valley of the Fire Nation.
There are people living there, Jet; mothers and fathers and children.
We can't win without making some sacrifices.
scene_description: [Sokka points an accusing finger at Jet.]

character_words: You lied to Aang and Katara about the forest fire!
Because they don't understand the demands of war. Not like you and I do.
I do understand. I understand that there's nothing you won't do to get what you want.
I was hoping you'd have an open mind, but I can see you've made your choice.
I can't let you warn Katara and Aang.  Take him for a walk, a long walk.
scene_description: [Jet releases Sokka's hand; it is immediately forced behind his back.]

character_words: You can't do this!
Cheer up, Sokka. We're gonna win a great victory against the Fire Nation today.
Jet, I'm sorry about how Sokka's been acting.
No worries, he already apologized.
Really?  Sokka apologized?
scene_description: [Aang and Katara stop and look at one another.]

character_words: Yeah, I was surprised too. I got the sense that maybe you talked to him or something.
Yeah, I did.
I guess something you said got through to him. Anyhow, he went out on a scouting mission with Pipsqueak and Smellerbee.
I'm glad he cooled off. He's so stubborn sometimes.
All right, we're here. Underground water's trying to escape through these vents. I need you guys to help it along.
I've never used bending on water I can't see. I don't know ...
scene_description: [Jet stands behind her and places his hands on her shoulders.]

character_words: Katara. You can do this.
What about me?
I know the Avatar can do this.
Yes! Good job! This river empties into the reservoir--a few more geysers and it'll be full.
Look, there's another steam vent.
scene_description: [Aang and Katara walk off in its direction.]

character_words: Okay. You two keep it up, I'll go check on things at the reservoir.
When we're done we'll meet you over there.
Actually ... probably better if you meet me back at the hideout when you're done.
scene_description: [Jet resumes walking away Aang and Katara bend the next geyser into another fountain.]

character_words: I bet that's enough, and I'm not just saying that to be lazy.
I bet that's enough, and I'm not just saying that to be lazy.
scene_description: [Around them, over a dozen geysers flow into the river.]

character_words: Let's catch up with Jet at the reservoir.
I thought we agreed to meet Jet back at the hideout.
Well, we finished early. I'm sure he'll be happy to see us.
Come on, move along!
How can you stand by and do nothing while Jet wipes out a whole town?
Hey listen Sokka, Jet's a great leader. We follow what he says, and things always turn out okay.
scene_description: [Sokka notices a couple of snare leaf-piles nearby identical to the one that enticed Momo, right down to the pile of nuts.]

character_words: If that's how Jet leads, then he's got a lot to learn.
scene_description: [Sokka sprints off in the direction of the snares. Smellerbee makes a grab for him, but misses.]

character_words: Hey!
scene_description: [They give chase. Sokka leaps over the leaf piles. Pipsqueak and Smellerbee don't, and end up snared and hanging many feet up in the air.]

character_words: While you two are up there, you might want to practice your knot work.
scene_description: [He holds up his now-worthless bindings, turns, and walks away.]

character_words: Hey Smellerbee, you gonna eat your lychee nuts?  Ooh.
scene_description: [Smellerbee hits him in the head with a lychee nut and it lands in the pile he's holding.]

character_words: Hey Smellerbee, you gonna eat your lychee nuts?  Ooh.
scene_description: [He picks one up and licks his lips.]

character_words: What are they doing?
Hey, those are the red barrels he got from the Fire Nation.
Why would they need blasting jelly?
Because Jet's gonna blow up the dam.
What? No, that would destroy the town. Jet wouldn't do that.
I've gotta stop him.
Jet wouldn't do that.
Yes I would.
Jet, why?
Katara, you would too if you just stopped to think. Think about what the Fire Nation did to your mother, we can't let them do that to anyone else, ever again.
This isn't the answer!
I want you to understand me Katara. I thought your brother would understand, but—
Where's Sokka?
scene_description: [Tears fall from her eyes. Jet reaches out and touches her face.]

character_words: Katara.
I need to get to the dam.
You're not going anywhere without your glider.
I'm not gonna fight you, Jet.
You'll have to if you want your glider back.
Why, Jet? I can't believe I trusted you. You lied to me, you're sick and I trusted you!  What are you doing?
scene_description: [A birdcall is heard. Katara and Aang are startled, and look to the valley beyond where it's coming from. Jet gives an answering birdcall.]

character_words: You're too late.
No!
Sokka's still out there, he's our only chance.
Come on, Sokka. I'm sorry I ever doubted you, please.
No ...
Sokka didn't make it in time.
All those people ...  Jet, you monster!
scene_description: [She turns in rage back to Jet.]

character_words: This was a victory, Katara. Remember that. The Fire Nation is gone and this valley will be safe.
It will be safe, without you.
scene_description: [In shock, Jet looks up to see Sokka, Appa, and Momo rise from below the level of the cliff.]

character_words: Sokka!
I warned the villagers of your plan, just in time.
What?!
At first they didn't believe me. The Fire Nation soldiers assumed I was a spy. But one man vouched for me, the old man you attacked. He urged them to trust me, and we got everyone out in time.
scene_description: [Cuts to an illustrated set of flashback stills each being panned through.]

character_words: At first they didn't believe me. The Fire Nation soldiers assumed I was a spy. But one man vouched for me, the old man you attacked. He urged them to trust me, and we got everyone out in time.
scene_description: [The flashback ends and the townsfolk are seen on high ground above the river, on the bank opposite the town. A little girl, who was seen in the flashback, runs down to the water's edge as the doll floats by. She retrieves it.]

character_words: Misses Pretty!
Misses Pretty!
Sokka, you fool! We could've freed this valley!
Who would be free? Everyone would be dead.
You traitor!
No, Jet. You became the traitor when you stopped protecting innocent people.
Katara. Please, help me.
Goodbye Jet.
Yip yip.
scene_description: [Jet is left behind, still frozen to the tree.]

character_words: We thought you were going to the dam. How come you went to the town instead?
Let me guess, your instincts told you.
Hey, sometimes they're right.
Um ... Sokka? You know we're going the wrong way, right?
And sometimes they're wrong.
scene_description: [With a grin, he pulls Appa's reigns. They fly off screen before reappearing, going in the opposite direction.]

character_words: Um, aren't you forgetting the tarp?
Right, got it ...
scene_description: [Tosses the wrapped up tarp inside the tent.]

character_words: Sokka, you're supposed to put the tarp on top of the tent. You know, so we don't get rained on?
scene_description: [Cut to an overhead shot of the two, Sokka gesturing widely as he replies to his sister.]

character_words: Ordinarily, you'd be right, but seeing how it's the dry season, you're not. Besides that tarp makes a pretty warm blanket.
But what if it does rain?
What if it doesn't? Then I would have put up the tarp for nothing.
You're infuriating!
Katara, why don't you worry about gathering firewood, because that kindling is looking pretty sorry.
Well, if you don't like my firewood-
Well, if you don't like my firewood-
scene_description: [Throws the sticks at Sokka who shields himself from the wood. He stands in anger after the hail of sticks subsides.]

character_words: Fine by me, if you're not gonna do your job-
Fine by me, if you're not gonna do your job-
scene_description: [He tears the tent down and the two stare at each other angrily as Aang approaches.]

character_words: Okay, I got the grub if you guys got the-  hey, where's the campfire? And what happened to the tent?
scene_description: [The siblings turn away from each other in anger with their arms folded.]

character_words: Why don't you ask Miss Know-It-All, Queen of the Twigs.
Oh yeah? Well, you're Mister Lazy Bum, King of the  Tents!
scene_description: [Picks up and throws a twig at Sokka's head.]

character_words: Oh yeah? Well, you're Mister Lazy Bum, King of the  Tents!
scene_description: [Sokka turns around, looking angrily at her.]

character_words: Okay, listen guys, harsh words won't solve problems, action will. Why don't you just switch jobs?
Sounds good.
Whatever.
You see that? Settling feuds and making peace, all in a day's work for the Avatar.  Come on, Momo, that's fair. Appa's got five stomachs.
You see that? Settling feuds and making peace, all in a day's work for the Avatar.  Come on, Momo, that's fair. Appa's got five stomachs.
scene_description: [Turns his head to see Momo and Appa fighting over a watermelon. Momo continuously tries to fly away with it, while Appa pins it down. Aang takes the melon and uses airbending to slice it. Momo seems to be complaining about how he got the much smaller half and Appa got the bigger half.]

character_words: You see that? Settling feuds and making peace, all in a day's work for the Avatar.  Come on, Momo, that's fair. Appa's got five stomachs.
scene_description: [Appa eats his half of the melon.]

character_words: There it is, guys, The Great Divide.
Wow, I could just stare at it forever.
Wow, I could just stare at it forever.
scene_description: [Zoom backward to show Sokka in the foreground.]

character_words: Okay, I've seen enough.
How can you not be fascinated Sokka? This is the largest canyon in the entire world.
Then I'm sure we'll be able to see it very clearly from the air while we fly away.
If you're looking for the canyon guide, I was here first!
Ooh, canyon guide? Sounds informative.
Believe me, he's more than a tour guide, he's an earthbender,  and the only way in and out of the canyon is with his help, and he's taking my tribe across next.
scene_description: [Oblivious to the fact that Sokka is behind him, mocking him.]

character_words: Calm down, we know you're next.
You wouldn't be so calm if the Fire Nation destroyed your home and forced you to flee! My whole tribe has to walk thousands of miles to the capital city of Ba Sing Se.
You're a refugee!
Huh, tell me something I don't know.
Is that your tribe?

It most certainly is not! That's the Zhang tribe, a bunch of low-life thieves. They've been the enemies of my tribe for a hundred years.  Hey, Zhangs! I'm saving a spot for my tribe so don't even think about stealing it!
Where are the rest of the Gan Jin? Still tidying up their camp site?
Yes, but they sent me ahead of them to hold a spot.
I didn't know the canyon guide took reservations.
Ha, of course you didn't! That's the ignorance I'd expect from a messy Zhang. So unorganized and ill-prepared for a journey.
