scene_description: [The Zhang tribe members yell out in protest behind them. Katara and Aang look at each other worriedly, but turn around to see a large pile of rocks being levitated up and thrown away. The canyon guide stands behind where the rocks used to be.]

character_words: Sorry about the wait, youngsters. Who's ready to cross this here canyon?
Uh, one of them, I think.
scene_description: [Camera pans left to reveal the Zhang and the scout.]

character_words: I was here first, my party's on their way.
I can't guide people who aren't here.
scene_description: [Cut to a wider shot showing the Zhang filing past the three kids and the fuming Gan Jin scout.]

character_words: Guess you guys will have to make the trip tomorrow.
Wait, here they come!
scene_description: [A group of clean, finely dressed people are shown coming toward them.]

character_words: You're not seriously gonna cave into these spoiled Gan Jins? I mean we're refugees too! And we've got sick people that need shelter.
I ... uh ... well ...
We've got old people who are weary from traveling.
Sick people get priority over old people.
Maybe you Zhangs wouldn't have so many sick people if you weren't such slobs.
If you Gan Jins weren't so clean, you wouldn't live to be so old.
Well Aang, ready to put your peace-making skills to the test?
I don't know, a fight over chores is one thing, but these people have been feuding for a hundred years.
Everybody listen up! This is the Avatar, and if you give him a chance, I'm sure he can come up with a compromise that will make everyone happy.
Uh, you could share the earthbender and travel together?
Absolutely not! We'd rather be taken by the Fire Nation than travel with those stinking thieves!
We wouldn't travel with those pompous fools anyway!
scene_description: [The two tribes begin to shout at each other again.]

character_words: All right here's the deal, you're all going down together and Appa here will fly your sick and elderly across! Does that seem fair?
All right here's the deal, you're all going down together and Appa here will fly your sick and elderly across! Does that seem fair?
scene_description: [Both leaders nod in agreement, and the scene fades to show the sick and elderly boarding Appa.]

character_words: Sorry, Appa, you'll have to do this on your own.
Aang, this feuding tribe stuff is serious business. Are you sure it's a good idea getting involved in this?
To tell you the truth, I'm not sure. But when have I ever been?
He's the Avatar, Sokka, making peace between people is his job.
His job's gonna make us cross this whole canyon on foot isn't it?
His job's gonna make us cross this whole canyon on foot isn't it?
scene_description: [Cut to an overhead wide shot of the two tribes and the others.]

character_words: Okay, now comes the bad news.  No food allowed in the canyon, it attracts  dangerous predators.
scene_description: [Cut to a frontal shot of the guide.]

character_words: Okay, now comes the bad news.  No food allowed in the canyon, it attracts  dangerous predators.
scene_description: [He makes motions with his hands to illustrate the skittery monsters that might lurk in the canyon.]

character_words: Okay, now comes the bad news.  No food allowed in the canyon, it attracts  dangerous predators.
No food?! This is ridiculous.
Oh, you babies can go a day without food? Would you rather be hungry, or dead?  Now, we're heading down in ten minutes. All food better be in your gut or in the garbage!
scene_description: [He raises an earth pillar to tower over the rest. He continues, cupping his hands to his mouth to amplify his voice.]

character_words: Appa's going to take good care of you 'till we get there.  See you on the other side, buddy! Yip yip!
Appa's going to take good care of you 'till we get there.  See you on the other side, buddy! Yip yip!
Appa's going to take good care of you 'till we get there.  See you on the other side, buddy! Yip yip!
scene_description: [Appa roars and takes off. The camera fades to show both groups of people climbing down into the canyon. The tour guide earthbends to form a bridge in a gap in the path.]

character_words: Nice bending!

The job's much more than bending, kid. Folks want information.  Many of you are probably wondering how canyons are formed. Experts tell us this canyon was most likely carved into the ground by earth spirits who were angry at local farmers for not offering them a proper sacrifice.
He he he, guess the spirits are still angry! Hope you all brought sacrifices.
Okay, everyone stand clear of the wall.
scene_description: [He throws the boulder and destroys the bridge he had made earlier.]

character_words: Why'd you do that?
These people are fleeing the Fire Nation, aren't they? Gotta make sure we can't be followed. We'll be safe now.
scene_description: [Yells out, as he is picked up by a huge animal. Aang blows away the dust to reveal a canyon crawler.]

character_words: We gotta help him!  Okay, now we gotta help me!
scene_description: [He throws his boomerang at the crawler, which drops the canyon guide and comes after Sokka instead.]

character_words: We gotta help him!  Okay, now we gotta help me!
scene_description: [Katara comes to his aid and does a water whip on the crawler, but she is quickly thrown aside. Aang jumps down and sends a multiple blasts of air at the crawler and drives it away.]

character_words: What was that?
Canyon crawler.  And there's sure to be more!
Canyon crawler.  And there's sure to be more!
Your arms, they're broken!
Without my arms, I got no bending. In other words-
We're trapped in this canyon.
I thought the whole point of ditching our food was so we wouldn't have to deal with things like canyon crawlers.
It's the Zhangs! They took food down here even after the canyon guide told them not to.
What? If there's anyone who can't go without food for a day, it's you pampered Gan Jins!
I hope you're happy. We're stuck in this canyon with no way out.
Why don't you thank yourself, food hider?
Look, sticking together is the only way to-
I'm not walking another step with the likes of them!
Now there's something we can agree on.
Any ideas?
No bendng ... we need to get out of this canyon ... I won't die down here! I won't become part of the food chain!
See! We're going to become part of the food chain because of you!
Sure, unjustly blame the Zhangs like you always do!
Gladly.

Enough! I thought I could help you guys get along, but I guess that's not gonna happen.  We should split up, Gan Jins on this side and Zhangs on that side. We'll travel in two separate lines.  Sokka, you go with the Zhangs and Katara, you go with the Gan Jins. See if you can find out why they hate each other so much.

Enough! I thought I could help you guys get along, but I guess that's not gonna happen.  We should split up, Gan Jins on this side and Zhangs on that side. We'll travel in two separate lines.  Sokka, you go with the Zhangs and Katara, you go with the Gan Jins. See if you can find out why they hate each other so much.

Enough! I thought I could help you guys get along, but I guess that's not gonna happen.  We should split up, Gan Jins on this side and Zhangs on that side. We'll travel in two separate lines.  Sokka, you go with the Zhangs and Katara, you go with the Gan Jins. See if you can find out why they hate each other so much.
scene_description: [The two leaders nod at each other and start walking. Aang jumps down to Sokka and Katara.]

character_words: So, you guys aren't going to put up your tarps?
What for? Its the dry season.
Exactly!
Besides, we like to use the tarp as a blanket.
Finally, someone gets it!
You really think it'll rain?
No, but you can never be too careful, right?
Would you care for some bread, Katara?
So it was you guys who had food!
Oh come now, you really think that tribe of thieves isn't smuggling food? Why should my people go hungry when the sneaky Zhangs are stuffing their faces?
Well, I guess it's okay if everyone's doing it.  So, why does your tribe hate the Zhangs so much?
Well, I guess it's okay if everyone's doing it.  So, why does your tribe hate the Zhangs so much?

You seem like a smart girl Katara, I bet you would enjoy hearing some history.  The patriarch of our tribe, Jin Wei, was an earthbender warrior who was assigned an important duty, transporting our sacred orb from the great eastern gate, to the great western gate. Taking the orb from the east to the west represents the sun's rising and setting. It was our tribe's ancient redemption ritual. But as he approached the gate, Jin Wei was attacked by one of the Zhang, a vermin named Wei Jin, who looked at the orb with envy. That coward Wei Jin knocked Jin Wei to the ground, and stole our sacred orb.  Our people have never forgotten. You can never trust a Zhang.
scene_description: [Fades to show a large gate with a finely dressed man running toward it. Voice-over.]

character_words: You seem like a smart girl Katara, I bet you would enjoy hearing some history.  The patriarch of our tribe, Jin Wei, was an earthbender warrior who was assigned an important duty, transporting our sacred orb from the great eastern gate, to the great western gate. Taking the orb from the east to the west represents the sun's rising and setting. It was our tribe's ancient redemption ritual. But as he approached the gate, Jin Wei was attacked by one of the Zhang, a vermin named Wei Jin, who looked at the orb with envy. That coward Wei Jin knocked Jin Wei to the ground, and stole our sacred orb.  Our people have never forgotten. You can never trust a Zhang.
scene_description: [Camera goes back to the Gan Jin leader's face.]

character_words: Care for some meat?
Would I!
scene_description: [Takes the meat and bites down hungrily.]

character_words: I know what you must be thinking, we're horrible for endangering everybody by bringing food down here.
Hm-hmm.
The Gan Jin think so badly of us, they probably assumed we brought food in and decided to bring food in themselves. That's why we brought food in.
Hmm.

Our conflict with the Gan Jin goes back over a hundred years.  Our forefather Wei Jin was leaving the western gate of our village, when he saw a figure in the distance. It was a man of the Gan Jin tribe, Jin Wei, collapsed on the ground. Noble Wei Jin stopped to help him. Jin Wei was transporting a sacred orb, a very powerful relic used in his tribe's redemption ritual. Wei Jin tried to tend to the man's wounds but Jin Wei insisted the orb was more important, and asked him to take it back to his tribe. Kind Wei Jin promised to send help for the man as soon as he could, but as Wei Jin crossed the border to return the orb into Gan Jin territory, he was arrested. Instead of thanking him for his kind and selfless deed, they sentenced him to twenty long years in prison.  We Zhangs will never forget that injustice.
scene_description: [Fades to show a poorly-dressed man running through a large gate. Voice-over.]

character_words: Our conflict with the Gan Jin goes back over a hundred years.  Our forefather Wei Jin was leaving the western gate of our village, when he saw a figure in the distance. It was a man of the Gan Jin tribe, Jin Wei, collapsed on the ground. Noble Wei Jin stopped to help him. Jin Wei was transporting a sacred orb, a very powerful relic used in his tribe's redemption ritual. Wei Jin tried to tend to the man's wounds but Jin Wei insisted the orb was more important, and asked him to take it back to his tribe. Kind Wei Jin promised to send help for the man as soon as he could, but as Wei Jin crossed the border to return the orb into Gan Jin territory, he was arrested. Instead of thanking him for his kind and selfless deed, they sentenced him to twenty long years in prison.  We Zhangs will never forget that injustice.
That's just terrible.  You gonna finish that?

Sure would be nice to be sitting around one of those campfires, telling stories and laughing. Its okay Momo, we'll be out of here soon enough, and then we can eat our weight in leechi nuts!  Nah, I'll wait for the leechi nuts.
scene_description: [Momo jumps up and snatches a bug out of the air, he eats part of it before offering the rest to Aang.]

character_words: Lonely isn't it, being impartial?
I wish I could help these people get along, but it just seems impossible. Anyhow, I guess our biggest problem is getting out of here.
I'm not so sure the two problems are unrelated.
All clear, we're almost to the other side.
Katara, Sokka, will these people cooperate long enough to get out of the canyon?
I don't think so, Aang, the Zhangs really wronged the Gan Jins. They ambushed Jin Wei and stole the sacred orb.
What are you talking about?
Yeah Katara, what are you talking about? Wei Jin didn't steal the orb, he was returning it to their village gate and was wrongfully punished by the Gan Jin.
Not punished enough if you ask me.

Okay, okay I get it! Now I need your help, I need everyone together at the base of the canyon wall.  Please everyone, as soon as we get out of here we can eat and then go our separate ways, but I need you all to put your heads together and figure out a way up this cliff.

Okay, okay I get it! Now I need your help, I need everyone together at the base of the canyon wall.  Please everyone, as soon as we get out of here we can eat and then go our separate ways, but I need you all to put your heads together and figure out a way up this cliff.
scene_description: [He takes off on his glider and the scene fades to show him landing between the two tribes.]

character_words: Maybe the Zhang can climb the wall with their long disgusting fingernails.
Oh sorry, I forgot that to the Gan Jin unclipped fingernails is a crime punishable by twenty years in jail!
Why, you dirty thief!
You pompous fool!
Guys, focus! How many times do I have to say it? Harsh words won't solve problems, action will!
Perhaps the Avatar is right.
Yes, perhaps he is.
Harsh words will never solve our problems.
Action will!
To the death! And let this be the end of this rivalry!
You know, I take it back. Harsh words aren't so bad!

Is that ... food? Everyone smuggled food down here? Unbelievable! You guys put our lives in danger because you couldn't go without a snack for a day? You're all awful!  So hungry. Is that an egg custard in that tart?

Is that ... food? Everyone smuggled food down here? Unbelievable! You guys put our lives in danger because you couldn't go without a snack for a day? You're all awful!  So hungry. Is that an egg custard in that tart?
scene_description: [He looks in wonder at a custard tart, and his stomach growls.]

character_words: Is that ... food? Everyone smuggled food down here? Unbelievable! You guys put our lives in danger because you couldn't go without a snack for a day? You're all awful!  So hungry. Is that an egg custard in that tart?
scene_description: [He turns to see dozens of canyon crawlers approaching, and they all try to flee.]

character_words: Oh no, that's a lot of canyon crawlers.
We barely survived one!
They're coming back for me! They've had a taste and they're coming back for me!
Sokka, wait.  I don't care about this stupid feud, I just want us to get out of here alive.
Me too. I only took their side 'cause they fed me.
Everybody, watch me and do what I do!  Now follow me! We're riding out of this hole!  Everyone, get off!
Everybody, watch me and do what I do!  Now follow me! We're riding out of this hole!  Everyone, get off!
scene_description: [He distracts a crawler with a piece of food, leaps on its back, and throws a bag over its snout. The two tribes mimic him, working together.]

character_words: Everybody, watch me and do what I do!  Now follow me! We're riding out of this hole!  Everyone, get off!
scene_description: [Aang ties a huge bag of food onto a stick and uses it to guide the crawlers up the canyon wall.]

character_words: We made it!
I never thought a Gan Jin could get his hands dirty like that.
And I never knew you Zhangs were so reliable in a pinch.
Perhaps we're not so different after all.
scene_description: [They both smile at each other and Aang sighs in relief.]

character_words: Too bad we can't rewrite history. You thieves stole our sacred orb from Jin Wei!
You tyrants unjustly imprisoned Wei Jin for twenty long years!
Wait a second ... Jin Wei? Wei Jin? I know those guys!
Yes, yes, we're all aware of the story.

No, I mean I really knew them. I might not look it, but I'm a hundred and twelve years old. I was there one hundred years ago on the day you're talking about.  There seems to be a lot of confusion about what happened. First of all, Jin Wei and Wei Jin weren't enemies. They were brothers, twins in fact, and they were eight; and most importantly, they were just playing a game! The sacred orb from the legend, that was the ball! And the eastern and western gates were the goal posts. Jin Wei had the ball and was running toward the goal when he fell and fumbled it. Wei Jin didn't steal the ball, he picked it up and started running it toward the other goal, but he stepped out of bounds, so the official put him in the penalty box. Not for twenty long years but for two short minutes.  There was no stealing and no putting anyone in imprison, it was just a game.
scene_description: [Scene fades to show the two men facing each other. Voice-over.]

character_words: No, I mean I really knew them. I might not look it, but I'm a hundred and twelve years old. I was there one hundred years ago on the day you're talking about.  There seems to be a lot of confusion about what happened. First of all, Jin Wei and Wei Jin weren't enemies. They were brothers, twins in fact, and they were eight; and most importantly, they were just playing a game! The sacred orb from the legend, that was the ball! And the eastern and western gates were the goal posts. Jin Wei had the ball and was running toward the goal when he fell and fumbled it. Wei Jin didn't steal the ball, he picked it up and started running it toward the other goal, but he stepped out of bounds, so the official put him in the penalty box. Not for twenty long years but for two short minutes.  There was no stealing and no putting anyone in imprison, it was just a game.
You're saying the sacred orb was actually a sacred ball?
Nope, just a regular ball.
What about our tribe's redemption ritual?

That's what the game was called, redemption. As soon as you got the ball from one end to the other, everyone would yell "redemption"!  Don't get me wrong, Wei Jin was kind of a slob and Jin Wei was a little stuffy, that much is true. But they respected each other's differences enough to share the same playing field.
scene_description: [The tribe leaders look at each other skeptically.]

character_words: I suppose it's time we forget the past.
And look to the future.
Good to see you, boy. Did you miss me?
scene_description: [Appa licks Aang as the Gan Jin leader approaches.]

character_words: I cannot thank you enough, Avatar.
Well, you know I try.
Ugh!
Let us travel to the Earth Kingdom capital as one tribe.
scene_description: [Both tribes cheer as they start walking.]

character_words: I'm going too! I'm sick of this place!
That's some luck you knew Jin Wei and Wei Jin.
You could call it luck. Or you could call it lying.
What?
I made the whole thing up.
You did not!  That is so wrong.
You did not!  That is so wrong.
Now where is that custard tart? I'm starving!
We need you, Aang.
I need you, too.
scene_description: [Close-up as he is looking toward Katara; contentedly.]

character_words: Be careful, guys!  Guys?
Be careful, guys!  Guys?
scene_description: [He looks to his left and right, uneasy.]

character_words: Gyatso?
Why did you disappear?
I didn't mean to.
scene_description: [Frontal shot; his voice soft and sad.]

character_words: We need you, Aang.
We need you, Aang.  We need you. We need you, Aang. We need you.
We need you, Aang.  We need you. We need you, Aang. We need you.
scene_description: [Cut to a downward view of an unconscious Aang sinking.]

character_words: What's going on?  Did we get captured again?
What's going on?  Did we get captured again?
It's nothing. I just had a bad dream.  Go back to sleep.
scene_description: [Shot looking down, sliding right; Aang turns to his friends.]

character_words: It's nothing. I just had a bad dream.  Go back to sleep.
scene_description: [He curls up, facing away from them.]

character_words: Don't have to tell me twice.
Are you all right, Aang?
scene_description: [Frontal shot of Aang with Katara behind him, looking at him in concern.]

character_words: I'm okay.
You seem to be having a lot of nightmares lately. You want to tell me about it?
I think I just need some rest.
You guys want to hear about my dream?  That's okay. I didn't want to talk about it anyway.
You guys want to hear about my dream?  That's okay. I didn't want to talk about it anyway.
scene_description: [Katara glares at him, an expression Sokka returns.]

character_words: Look at those clear skies, buddy!  Should be some smooth flying.
scene_description: [Pets Appa's head. Cut to a close shot as he looks up at a flock of birds arranged in a "V" flying overhead, their goose-like honking audible.]

character_words: Well, we better smoothly fly  ourselves to a market, 'cause we're out of food.
scene_description: [Looking from the contents of the bag up to Aang.]

character_words: Well, we better smoothly fly  ourselves to a market, 'cause we're out of food.
scene_description: [She steps onto Appa's tail and walks to the saddle.]

character_words: Guys, wait. This was in my dream.  We shouldn't go to the market.
scene_description: [Side-shot as he suddenly straightens up, his tone serious.]

character_words: Guys, wait. This was in my dream.  We shouldn't go to the market.
scene_description: [Momo lands on the pack behind him.]

character_words: What happened in your dream?
scene_description: [Shot cuts beside Sokka, facing out toward Katara and Aang, who turn to look at him; curious.]

character_words: Food eats people!  Also, Momo could talk.  You said some very unkind things.
scene_description: [Frontal shot; his eyes are bugged out in terror and the camera zooms in on him, rolling slightly as the shot takes on a greenish tint and alien music dubs the scene.]

character_words: Food eats people!  Also, Momo could talk.  You said some very unkind things.
scene_description: [The colors return to normal as the shot cuts to Katara's face as she shakes her head. Behind her, Aang goes back to adjusting the reins. Cut to Sokka again as he points at Momo.]

character_words: Food eats people!  Also, Momo could talk.  You said some very unkind things.
scene_description: [He glares at Momo while crossing his arms.]

character_words: There is a storm coming. A big one.
You're out of your mind, Uncle.  The weather's perfect. There's not a cloud in sight.
A storm is approaching from the north.  I suggest we alter our course and head southwest.
We know the Avatar is traveling northward, so we will do the same.
scene_description: [Taking a few steps in Iroh's direction, pointing briefly northward.]

character_words: Prince Zuko, consider the safety of the crew.
The safety of the crew doesn't matter!
scene_description: [Cut to his face as he advances on his uncle angrily.]

character_words: Finding the Avatar is far more important than any individual's safety.
He doesn't mean that. He's just all worked up.
scene_description: [Reassuringly, a twinge of uncertainty in his voice, almost as if he does not fully believe what he is saying.]

character_words: Ahhh, it's good. It's perfect, I'm telling you!
I don't know if I like the sound of that swishing.
scene_description: [Shaking the watermelon, which emits an audible sloshing sound.]

character_words: Swishing means it's ripe! It's the ripe juices swishing around, eh?
scene_description: [As the shot zooms out, the merchant moves around the stand where Katara stands. Sokka and Aang, staff in hand, stand beside them; the former is filling a basket with fruit.]

character_words: I think it's true, Katara. Swishing means it's ripe.
I just realized we're out of money anyway.
scene_description: [As the shot cuts to a frontal view of her, she puts the melon back on the stand.]

character_words: Awww!
scene_description: [Annoyed, grabbing a basket full of fruits from Sokka.]

character_words: Out of food and out of money. Now what are we supposed to do?
You could get a job, smart guy.
We shouldn't go out there! Please, the fish can wait. There's going to be a terrible storm.
scene_description: [Camera cuts to show Aang, who appears alarmed by the prediction.]

character_words: You're crazy. It's a nice day:  No clouds, no winds, no nothing. So quit your nagging, woman.
scene_description: [Gesturing to the sky with both arms.]

character_words: Maybe we should find some shelter?
Are you kidding? Shelter from what?
My joints say there's going to be a storm! A bad one.
Well, it's your joints against my brain.
Then I hope your brain can find someone else to haul that fish, 'cause I ain't comin'.
Then I'll find a new fish hauler and pay him double what you get!  How do you like that?
scene_description: [Cut to a side shot of the couple, showing Sokka running up to them.]

character_words: I'll go.
You're hired!
scene_description: [Shoots a triumphant look at his wife, who scowls back.]

character_words: What? You said get a job ... and he's paying double.
scene_description: [After a short pause, to Katara and Aang.]

character_words: Double? Who told you that nonsense?
Looks like your uncle was right about the storm after all.
Lucky guess.
Lieutenant! You'd better learn some respect  – or I will teach it to you.
scene_description: [Whirling around and walking toward Jee; angry.]

character_words: Lieutenant! You'd better learn some respect  – or I will teach it to you.
Lieutenant! You'd better learn some respect  – or I will teach it to you.
scene_description: [Begins to walk away from Jee, who follows Zuko with his eyes, continuing his taunting after a short pause.]

character_words: What do you know about respect?  The way you talk to everyone around here, from your hard-working crew to your esteemed uncle, shows you know nothing about respect!  You don't care about anyone but yourself! Then again, what should I expect from a spoiled prince?
scene_description: [Behind Jee, Iroh's expression turns to panic and he makes a cutting motion at his throat with his hand, trying to signal Lieutenant Jee to stop. Cut to Zuko's back as he stops walking before switching to his face as he listens to Jee's words.]

character_words: What do you know about respect?  The way you talk to everyone around here, from your hard-working crew to your esteemed uncle, shows you know nothing about respect!  You don't care about anyone but yourself! Then again, what should I expect from a spoiled prince?
scene_description: [Cut to a close-up of Iroh's face as he gasps slightly, reaching out a hand in desperation before moving it to his forehead in resignation, believing Jee has gone too far. Cut back to Zuko's face, contorted with rage.]

character_words: Easy now.  Enough! We're all a bit tired from being at sea so long. I'm sure after a bowl of noodles, everyone will feel much better.
scene_description: [Both Zuko and Jee wrist-block the other's arm; smoke rises from a furious Zuko's hand. Interrupting the staredown, Iroh extends an arm and pulls theirs apart; the smoke fades.]

character_words: I don't need your help keeping order on my ship.
Sokka, maybe this isn't such a good idea. Look at the sky.
I said I was going to do this job. I can't back out just because of some bad weather.
The boy with the tattoos has some sense. You should listen to him!
Boy with tattoos?  Airbender tattoos. Well, I'll be a hog monkey's uncle. You're the Avatar, ain't ya?
scene_description: [The fisherman turns around to look at Aang.]

character_words: That's right.
Well, don't be so smiley about it.  The Avatar disappeared for a hundred years! You turned your back on the world!
Don't yell at him! Aang would never turn his back on anyone.
Oh, he wouldn't, huh? Then I guess I just have imagined the last hundred years of war and suffering.
Aang is the bravest person I know. He's done nothing but help people and save lives since I met him.  It's not his fault he disappeared, right Aang?  Aang, what's wrong?
scene_description: [Behind Katara's back, Aang slowly begins to backpedal away from her.]

character_words: Aang is the bravest person I know. He's done nothing but help people and save lives since I met him.  It's not his fault he disappeared, right Aang?  Aang, what's wrong?
scene_description: [Katara turns around to see Aang backing away.]

character_words: That's right! Keep flying!
You're a horrible old man!  Appa, yip yip!
scene_description: [She gets on Appa, who is floating beside the dock.]

character_words: Hey! They left without saying good-bye!
Your friends ain't too polite, are they?
I know! This one time, I was ...
Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah. Get below deck!
scene_description: [Hands Sokka a crate, interrupting him impolitely.]

character_words: I'm sorry for running away.
It's okay. That fisherman was way out of line.
Actually, he wasn't.
What do you mean?
I don't want to talk about it.
It has to do with your dream, doesn't it?  Talk to me.
Well, it's kind of a long story.
I'm going to try to get a little fire going.
I'll never forget the day the monks told me I was the Avatar. I was playing with some other kids just outside the South Wall. I was trying to teach them how to do the air scooter.
First you got to form the ball, then you got to get on quick.
Okay, here goes.
You kind of have to balance on it like it's a top.
Man, that's hard.
Where'd you learn that trick, Aang?
I made it up.
Wow!
Aang, come with us. We need to speak with you.
How do you know it's me?
We have known you were the Avatar for some time. Do you remember these?
Those were some of my favorite toys when I was little!
You chose them from among thousands of toys, Aang. The toys you picked were the four Avatar relics. These items belonged to Avatars past. Your own past lives.
I just chose them because they seemed fun.
You chose them because they were familiar.
Normally we would have told you of your identity when you turned sixteen, but there are troubling signs. Storm clouds are gathering.
I fear that war may be upon us, young Avatar.
We need you, Aang.
I'm sick of taking his orders! I'm tired of chasing his Avatar! I mean, who does Zuko think he is?
Do you really want to know?
General Iroh. We were just-
It's okay. May I join you?
Of course, sir.
Try to understand. My nephew is a complicated young man. He has been through much.
Let me in!
Prince Zuko, what's wrong?
I want to go into the war chamber  but the guard won't let me pass!
You're not missing anything, trust me. These meetings are dreadfully boring.
scene_description: [Leads Zuko away with his left hand still on his shoulder.]

character_words: If I'm going to rule this nation one day, don't you think I need to start learning as much as I can?
Very well. But you must promise not to speak.  These old folks are a bit sensitive, you know?
scene_description: [Another elder soldier walks by them into the war chamber.]

character_words: Thank you, Uncle.
The Earth Kingdom defenses are concentrated here.  A dangerous battalion of their strongest earthbenders and fiercest warriors. So I am recommending the forty-first division.
scene_description: [Bujing shows the place on the map.]

character_words: But the forty-first is entirely new recruits. How do you expect them to defeat a powerful Earth Kingdom battalion?
I don't. They'll be used as a distraction while we mount an attack from the rear. What better to use as bait than fresh meat?
You can't sacrifice an entire division like that! Those soldiers love and defend our nation! How can you betray them?
Zuko was right, you see,  but it was not his place to speak out. And there were dire consequences.
Zuko was right, you see,  but it was not his place to speak out. And there were dire consequences.
So you were upset that you were the Avatar? Why wouldn't you be excited about it?
Well, I didn't know how to feel about it. All I knew was that after I found out, everything began changing.
Hey, not bad! You guys have been practicing!
Not only that! We made up a game you can play with the air scooters!
Great!  What's going on?
scene_description: [Aang is shown making his own. But everyone else makes theirs vanish.]

character_words: Now that you're the Avatar, it's kind of an unfair advantage for whichever team you're on.
But I'm still the same! Nothing's changed! So, what? I can't play?
That's the only fair way.
Oh, okay.
Sorry, Aang.
Okay. Now, who wants Jinju on their team?
Very interesting move, young one.
What do you mean?
Hey!
You're playing games with him? The Avatar should be training!
Aang has already trained enough for today.
Time is short.  Come with me. I must test you on some high level techniques.
No. As long as I'm his guardian, I will decide when he trains ... and when he gets his butt kicked at Pai Sho.
Hmph.

After Zuko's outburst in the meeting, the Fire Lord became very angry with him.  He said the challenge against the general was an act of complete disrespect! And there was only one way to resolve this.
Agni Kai. A fire duel.

That's right. Zuko looked upon the old general he had insulted and declared that he was not afraid. But Zuko misunderstood.  When he turned to face his opponent, he was surprised to see it was not the general.  Zuko had spoken out against the general's plan, but by doing so in the Fire Lord's war room, it was the Fire Lord whom he had disrespected.  Zuko would have to duel his own father.
scene_description: [Flashback shows an overview of the chamber; the camera cuts to show Zuko preparing for the Agni Kai.]

character_words: That's right. Zuko looked upon the old general he had insulted and declared that he was not afraid. But Zuko misunderstood.  When he turned to face his opponent, he was surprised to see it was not the general.  Zuko had spoken out against the general's plan, but by doing so in the Fire Lord's war room, it was the Fire Lord whom he had disrespected.  Zuko would have to duel his own father.
scene_description: [Flashback shows the tippet that was on Zuko's shoulders fall down to the ground.]

character_words: That's right. Zuko looked upon the old general he had insulted and declared that he was not afraid. But Zuko misunderstood.  When he turned to face his opponent, he was surprised to see it was not the general.  Zuko had spoken out against the general's plan, but by doing so in the Fire Lord's war room, it was the Fire Lord whom he had disrespected.  Zuko would have to duel his own father.
scene_description: [Frontal shot of a surprised Zuko; as the camera zooms in on him, his expression changes to one of fear.]

character_words: Then, just when I was feeling better, something worse happened.
Aang needs to have freedom and fun. He needs to grow up as a normal boy.
You cannot keep protecting him from his destiny.
Gyatso, I know you mean well, but you are letting your affection for the boy cloud your judgment.
All I want is what is best for him.
But what we need is what's best for the world. You and Aang must be separated! The Avatar will be sent away to the Eastern Air Temple to complete his training.
That's awful, Aang. I don't know what to say.
How could they do that to me? They wanted to take away everything I knew and everyone I loved!
How could they do that to me? They wanted to take away everything I knew and everyone I loved!
Whoa! Hot cinders!
I'm sorry I got so mad.
You have the right to be angry after the monks sent you away like that.
Well, that's not exactly what happened.  I was afraid and confused. I didn't know what to do.
scene_description: [Flashback starts again, showing Aang looking out the window of his bedroom.]

character_words: Aang, I'm not going to let them take you away from me. Aang?
scene_description: [Gyatso is shown opening the door more, spotting the scroll, and opening it up. He gasps, and sees a storm coming outside the window.]

character_words: I never saw Gyatso again.  Next thing I knew, I was waking up in your arms after you found me in the iceberg.
scene_description: [Still in present, but flashback playing still.]

character_words: I never saw Gyatso again.  Next thing I knew, I was waking up in your arms after you found me in the iceberg.
scene_description: [Flashback shows Aang and Appa through the storm, and how Aang got into the iceberg.]

character_words: You ran away.
And then the Fire Nation attacked our temple. My people needed me and I wasn't there to help.
You don't know what would have-.
The world needed me and I wasn't there to help.
Aang ...
The fisherman was right! I did turn my back on the world!
You're being too hard on yourself, even if you did run away. I think it was meant to be. If you had stayed, you would have been killed along with all the other airbenders.
You don't know that.
I know it was meant to be this way. The world needs you now. You give people hope.
When Prince Zuko saw that it was his father who had come to duel him, he begged for mercy.
Please, Father. I only had the Fire Nation's best interest at heart. I'm sorry I spoke out of turn!
Please, Father. I only had the Fire Nation's best interest at heart. I'm sorry I spoke out of turn!
You will fight for your honor.
I meant you no disrespect.  I am your loyal son.
scene_description: [Frontal shot; kneels on his knees and forearms, while looking at the floor.]

character_words: I meant you no disrespect.  I am your loyal son.
scene_description: [Gazes up at his father, tears shimmering in his eyes as his voice starts to waiver.]

character_words: Rise and fight, Prince Zuko!
scene_description: [Far off frontal shot of Zuko as Ozai's shadow and eventually his head come into view.]

character_words: I won't fight you.
You will learn respect,  and suffering will be your  teacher.
scene_description: [Zuko pushes himself up on his knees and hands. Cut to a frontal shot of Zuko as he starts to shake.]

character_words: You will learn respect,  and suffering will be your  teacher.
scene_description: [Zuko looks up at Ozai, tears streaming down his face.]

character_words: I looked away.
scene_description: [Voice-over; Iroh closes his eyes and averts his head to the left.]

character_words: I always thought that Prince Zuko was in a training accident.

It was no accident. After the duel, the Fire Lord said that by refusing to fight, Zuko had shown shameful weakness. As punishment, he was banished and sent to capture the Avatar. Only then could he return with his honor.
So that's why he's so obsessed. Capturing the Avatar is the only chance he has of things returning to normal.
Things will never return to normal. But the important thing is the Avatar gives Zuko hope.
Help! Oh, please help!
It's okay. You're safe.
scene_description: [Grabs lady and brings her near the fire.]

character_words: But my husband isn't.
What do you mean? Where's Sokka?
They haven't returned! They should have been back by now! And this storm is becoming a typhoon! They're caught out at sea!
I'm going to find him!
I'm going with you!
I'm staying here.
We'll be back soon. I promise.
Where were we hit?
I don't know!
Look!
The helmsman!
Where are they?
Come on, Appa! The boat! There!
The Avatar!
What do you want to do, sir?
Let him go. We need to get this ship to safety.
Then we must head directly into the eye of the storm.
I'm too young to die!
I'm not, but I still don't wanna!
Hang onto the rope.
Uncle, I'm sorry.
Your apology is accepted.
Oh, you're alive! You owe this boy an apology!
He doesn't have to apologize.
What if, instead of an apology, I give him a free fish and we call it even?
Actually, I don't eat meat.
Fish ain't meat!
Seriously, you're still going to pay me, right?
Katara, I think you were right before. I'm done dwelling on the past.
Really?
I can't make guesses about what would have turned out if I hadn't run away. I'm here now and I'm going to make the most out of it.
I don't think you're gonna have those nightmares anymore.
And if you weren't here now, well, I guess I wouldn't be either. Thank you for saving my life, Avatar.
Do you hear that? It stopped raining.
Appa!
Absolutely not! The Yuyan Archers stay here. Your request is denied, Commander Zhao.

Colonel Shinu, please reconsider ... Their precision is legendary. The Yuyan can pin a fly to a tree from one hundred yards away ... without killing it.  You're wasting their talents using them as mere security guards.
I can do whatever I want with their talents, they're my archers, and what I say goes.
But my search for the Avatar is-
Is nothing but a vanity project! We're fighting a real war here, and I need every man I've got, commander.
scene_description: [Cutting Zhao off mid-sentence while getting close to him and scoffing angrily.]

character_words: But-!
That's final! I don't wanna hear another word about it!
News from Fire Lord Ozai?
It appears I've been promoted to Admiral. My request ... is now an order.
This should bring your fever down.
scene_description: [Pressing a wet rag onto Sokka's forehead.]

character_words: You know what I love about Appa the most? His sense of humor.
That's nice. I'll tell him.
Classic Appa.
How's Sokka doing?
Not so good, being out in that storm really did a number on him.
I couldn't find any ginger root for the tea. But I found a map. There's an herbalist institute on top of that mountain. We could probably find a cure for Sokka there.
Aang, he's in no condition for travel. Sokka just needs more rest. I'm sure he'll be better by tomorrow.
Not you too!
Relax, it was just a little cough. I'm fi-
scene_description: [She coughs again, this time with greater force, and lightly groans after.]

character_words: That's how Sokka started yesterday. Now look at him! He thinks he's an earthbender!
Take that, you rock!
Take that, you rock!
scene_description: [He flails his arms as if he is hitting something.]

character_words: A few more hours and you'll be talking nonsense, too. I'm going to go find some medicine!  Uh, maybe it's safer if I go on foot.  Keep an eye on them guys.
scene_description: [He grabs his glider and begins to head out just as a flash of lightning strikes.]

character_words: A few more hours and you'll be talking nonsense, too. I'm going to go find some medicine!  Uh, maybe it's safer if I go on foot.  Keep an eye on them guys.
A few more hours and you'll be talking nonsense, too. I'm going to go find some medicine!  Uh, maybe it's safer if I go on foot.  Keep an eye on them guys.
Ha, ha! You guys are killing me!
We haven't been able to pick up the Avatar's trail since the storm, but if we continue heading northeast ...
scene_description: [A larger Fire Nation ship pulls up next to theirs.]

character_words: What do they want?
Perhaps, a sporting game of Pai Sho!
The hunt for the Avatar has been given prime importance. All information regarding the Avatar must be reported directly to Admiral Zhao.
Zhao has been promoted? Well, good for him!
scene_description: [As Iroh makes a move in his Pai Sho game, another player slaps his hand against his own forehead as if he lost.]

character_words: I've got nothing to report to Admiral Zhao. Now get off my ship and let us pass.
Admiral Zhao is not allowing ships in or out of this area.
Off my ship!
Excellent! I take the pot!  But you're all improving! I'm certain you will win if we play again.
Excellent! I take the pot!  But you're all improving! I'm certain you will win if we play again.
Says here that the Avatar can create tornadoes and run faster than the wind. Pretty amazing!
Ah, that's just a bunch of Fire Lord propaganda! There's no way that's true!
Katara, please, water.
Listen carefully, Momo.  I need you to take this to the river, and fill it with water.  Got it?
Listen carefully, Momo.  I need you to take this to the river, and fill it with water.  Got it?
Listen carefully, Momo.  I need you to take this to the river, and fill it with water.  Got it?
scene_description: [She is shown through Momo's eyes, speaking gibberish.]

character_words: Listen carefully, Momo.  I need you to take this to the river, and fill it with water.  Got it?
scene_description: [Momo takes the skin and flies off.]

character_words: Hello, I'm sorry to barge in like this, but I need some medicine for my friends, they have fevers and they were coughing-
Hello, I'm sorry to barge in like this, but I need some medicine for my friends, they have fevers and they were coughing-
Settle down, young man. Your friends are going to be fine. I've been up here for over forty years you know, used to be others, but they all left years ago.  Now it's just me and Miyuki.
scene_description: [She pets Miyuki who begins to purr.]

character_words: That's nice.
Wounded Earth Kingdom troops still come by now and again, brave boys, and thanks to my remedies they always leave in better shape they when they arrive.
That's nice. Are you almost done?
Hold on, I just need to add one last ingredient.  Oh, sandalwood ... oh, er, uh, that won't do, banana leaf? Ah, nope, uh, ginger root, uh uh, oh where is that pesky little plant?
scene_description: [Walking among the shrubbery, looking around and muttering to herself.]

character_words: Is everything okay? It's been almost an hour and you haven't given the men an order.
I don't care what they do.
Don't give up hope yet. You can still find the Avatar before Zhao.
How, Uncle? With Zhao's resources, it's just a matter of time before he captures the Avatar.  My honor, my throne, my country, I'm about to lose them all.
scene_description: [Turning back, desperation and fear on his face.]

character_words: How, Uncle? With Zhao's resources, it's just a matter of time before he captures the Avatar.  My honor, my throne, my country, I'm about to lose them all.
scene_description: [Turns back out to sea and whispers.]

character_words: Ah! Plum blossom!
scene_description: [She plucks a flower from the tree.]

character_words: Finally!  Thanks for all your help!
scene_description: [He lifts up his head off the table.]

character_words: Finally!  Thanks for all your help!
scene_description: [Close-up of the mixing bowl as the herbalist drops the flower into the mixture, and Aang grabs for the bowl.]

character_words: Hands off!
Ow!
What do you think you're doing?
scene_description: [Close-up, holding her spoon at the ready for a new attack.]

character_words: Taking the cure to my friends.
This isn't a cure! It's Miyuki's dinner. Plum blossom is her favorite.
What about my friends?
Well, all they need are some frozen wood frogs. There's plenty down in the valley swamp.
What am I supposed to do with frozen frogs?
Why, suck on them of course!
Suck on them?
The frog skin excretes a substance that will cure your friends. Be sure to get plenty because once those little critters thaw out, they're useless!
You're insane, aren't you?
That's right! Well, don't stand there all day! Go!
Uh ... I think you dropped this ...  A frog!
scene_description: [Screams as he sees the Yuyan Archers taking aim at him. Panicking, he frees himself from the arrow that had pinned his foot to the ground and runs. He falls off a cliff into a swamp and finds the frozen frogs.]

character_words: So this is the great Avatar. Master of all the elements. I don't know how you've managed to elude the Fire Nation for a hundred years, but your little game of hide and seek is over.
I've never hidden from you! Untie me and I'll fight you right now!

Uhh, no. Tell me, how does it feel to be the only airbender left? Do you miss your people?  Don't worry, you won't be killed like they were.  See, if you die you will just be reborn and the Fire Nation would have to start searching all over again. So I'll keep you alive, but just barely.  Blow all the wind you want, but your situation is futile. There is no escaping this fortress, and no one is coming to rescue you.

Uhh, no. Tell me, how does it feel to be the only airbender left? Do you miss your people?  Don't worry, you won't be killed like they were.  See, if you die you will just be reborn and the Fire Nation would have to start searching all over again. So I'll keep you alive, but just barely.  Blow all the wind you want, but your situation is futile. There is no escaping this fortress, and no one is coming to rescue you.

Uhh, no. Tell me, how does it feel to be the only airbender left? Do you miss your people?  Don't worry, you won't be killed like they were.  See, if you die you will just be reborn and the Fire Nation would have to start searching all over again. So I'll keep you alive, but just barely.  Blow all the wind you want, but your situation is futile. There is no escaping this fortress, and no one is coming to rescue you.
scene_description: [Aang takes a deep breath and blows at gale force at Zhao, who falls over.]

character_words: Water ...
Momo should be back any minute.
Ugh! No, Momo, water. Wa-ter!  Aang, what in the world is taking you so long?
Ugh! No, Momo, water. Wa-ter!  Aang, what in the world is taking you so long?
scene_description: [Momo's ear go straight up. He jumps off her and scampers.]

character_words: All clear.
All clear. Go on in.

We are the sons and daughters of fire, the superior element! Until today only one thing stood our path to victory, the Avatar. I am here to tell you that he is now my prisoner!  This is the year Sozin's Comet returns to grant us its power!  This is the year the Fire Nation breaks through the walls of Ba Sing Se and burns the city to the ground!
What? No! Don't leave, frogs! My friends are sick and they need you! Please go back to being frozen!
Who are you? What's going on? Are you here to rescue me?  I'll take that as a "yes."
scene_description: [The Blue Spirit opens the door and motions for him to follow.]

character_words: My frogs! Come back! And stop thawing out!  Wait! My friends need to suck on those frogs!
scene_description: [The Blue Spirit comes back, picks him up by the collar and carries him out.]

character_words: How many times do I have to tell you, Momo? We need water, wa-ter. Oh forget it. Aang, please, hurry.
Who's this "Aang" kid you keep talking about, Your Highness?
Who's this "Aang" kid you keep talking about, Your Highness?
scene_description: [Katara gets an annoyed look on her face.]

character_words: I want a full transcription of my speech sent to the Fire Lord, along with glowing testimonials from all of the ranking officers present, and –
Sir, should I hold off sending that speech to the Fire Lord?
There, on the wall!
The Avatar has escaped! Close all the gates immediately!
The Avatar has escaped! Close all the gates immediately!
scene_description: [Cut to the escapees running, Aang passes the Blue Spirit.]

character_words: Stay close to me!
Take this. Jump on my back!
Give me the next one!
Hold your fire! The Avatar must be captured alive!
Open the gate.
Admiral, what are you doing?
Let them out, now!
How could you let them go?
A situation like this requires ... precision.
Do you have a clear shot?
Knock out the thief. I'll deliver him to the Fire Lord along with the Avatar.
Quick! Recover the Avatar!

You know what the worst part of being born over a hundred years ago is? I miss all the friends I used to hang out with. Before the war started, I used to always visit my friend Kuzon. The two of us, we'd get in and out of so much trouble together. He was one of the best friends I ever had, and he was from the Fire Nation, just like you. If we knew each other back then, do you think we could have been friends, too?
Where have you been, Prince Zuko? You missed music night! Lieutenant Jee sang a stirring love song.
I'm going to bed. No disturbances.
Suck on these. They'll make you feel better.
Aang, how was your trip? Did you make any new friends?
scene_description: [With his mouth full; still spouting out nonsense.]

character_words: No, I don't think I did.
Mmmm! This is tasty! Mmm!
Look!
He is taunting us!  You are so going to be dinner!
scene_description: [Camera zooms out to the lake and the group's camp site.]

character_words: Hey, where's the fishing line?
Oh, I didn't think you would need it, Sokka.
Oh, I didn't think you would need it, Sokka.
scene_description: [He holds up an intricately woven necklace decorated with a red flower.]

character_words: Aw, it's all tangled!
Not tangled. Woven! I made you a necklace, Katara. I thought since you lost your other one ...
Thanks, Aang.  I love it.
Thanks, Aang.  I love it.
Great, Aang. Maybe instead of saving the world, you can go into the jewelry-making business.
I don't see why I can't do both.
Stop taunting me!
So, how do I look?
You mean, all of you or just your neck?  I mean, because both look great!
You mean, all of you or just your neck?  I mean, because both look great!
scene_description: [Puts his right hand behind his head in embarrassment.]

character_words: Smoochie, smoochie, someone's in love!
scene_description: [Emerges from the water, holding the se tu.]

character_words: Smoochie, smoochie, someone's in love!
scene_description: [Makes kissing noises before the se tu breaks free from his grasp, slapping Sokka in the face with its tail and disappearing under the water.]

character_words: I ... well, uh ...
Stop teasing him, Sokka. Aang's just a good friend.  A sweet, little guy! Just like Momo.
Stop teasing him, Sokka. Aang's just a good friend.  A sweet, little guy! Just like Momo.
Stop teasing him, Sokka. Aang's just a good friend.  A sweet, little guy! Just like Momo.
scene_description: [Pets Momo, who lands on Aang's shoulder.]

character_words: Thanks.
Someone's being attacked by a platypus bear!
Well, hello there!  Nice day, isn't it?
scene_description: [Dodges another swift swing of the bear's claws.]

character_words: Make noise! He'll run off!
No, play dead! He'll lose interest!
Whoa, close one!
Whoa, close one!
Run downhill, then climb a tree!
scene_description: [Cups a hand to her mouth and makes gestures with her other hand.]

character_words: No, punch him in the bill!
And then run in zig-zags!
No need, it's going to be fine!
Whoa there!
scene_description: [Holding his hands out in front of him and assuming a fighting stance.]

character_words: Mmm, lunch!  Lucky for you, we came along.
Mmm, lunch!  Lucky for you, we came along.
Thanks, but everything was already under control. Not to worry. Aunt Wu predicted I'd have a safe journey.
Aunt who?
No, Aunt Wu. She's the fortuneteller from my village. Awful nice knowing your future.
Wow, it must be.  That explains why you were so calm!
scene_description: [Looks off to the side as she ponders this.]

character_words: Wow, it must be.  That explains why you were so calm!
scene_description: [Faces the man with a bright expression on her face.]

character_words: But the fortuneteller was wrong! You didn't have a safe journey; you were almost killed!
But I wasn't! All right, have a good one!  Oh, and Aunt Wu said if I met any travelers to give them this.
But I wasn't! All right, have a good one!  Oh, and Aunt Wu said if I met any travelers to give them this.
scene_description: [He bids them a farewell and begins to walk away only to turn back again.]

character_words: Maybe we should go see Aunt Wu and learn our fortunes. It could be fun.
Oh, come on. Fortune telling is nonsense!
What do you know? An umbrella!
That proves it!
No, it doesn't! You can't really tell the future!
scene_description: [Holding egg above his head to shield himself from the rain.]

character_words: I guess you're not really getting wet then.
Of course she predicted it was going to rain. The sky's been gray all day!
Just admit you might be wrong, and you can come under the umbrella.
Look, I'm going to predict the future now.  It's going to keep drizzling.  See?
scene_description: [Stops walking and hops from foot to foot in an exaggerated way.]

character_words: Look, I'm going to predict the future now.  It's going to keep drizzling.  See?
Not everyone has the gift, Sokka.
Agh!
Aunt Wu is expecting you.
Really?
My name is Meng and I'm Aunt Wu's assistant.
Well, hello there.
Hello.
Can I get you some tea or some of Aunt Wu's special bean curd puffs?
scene_description: [Aang and Katara seat themselves on the pillows.]

character_words: I'll try a curd puff.
Just a second.  So what's your name?
Just a second.  So what's your name?
Aang.
That rhymes with Meng! And you've got some pretty big ears, don't you?
I guess.
Don't be modest!  They're huge!
Don't be modest!  They're huge!
Well, Aang, it was very nice to meet you.  Very nice.
Well, Aang, it was very nice to meet you.  Very nice.
Well, Aang, it was very nice to meet you.  Very nice.
Likewise.
I can't believe we're here in the house of nonsense.
Try to keep an open mind, Sokka. There are things in this world that just can't be explained. Wouldn't it be nice to have some insight into your future?
It would be nice to have some bean curd puffs.
Oh, Meng! Aunt Wu says I'm going to meet my true love. He's going to give me a rare panda lily.
That's so romantic!  I wonder if my true love will give me a rare flower.
scene_description: [Dreamily, while casting Aang a flirtatious look.]

character_words: Good luck with that!
Is that the big-eared guy who Aunt Wu predicted you'd marry?
Enjoy your snack!
Enjoy your snack!
Welcome, young travelers. Now, who's next? Don't be shy.
I guess that's me.
Mm, not bad, not bad!  Mhm?
Mm, not bad, not bad!  Mhm?
I'm good on puffs.  So, what do you think they're talking about back there?
I'm good on puffs.  So, what do you think they're talking about back there?
scene_description: [Sokka shrugs and continues eating the puffs; trying to act casual.]

character_words: Boring stuff I'm sure. Love, who she's going to marry, how many babies she's going to have.
Yeah, dumb stuff like that ...  Well, I've got to find a bathroom.
Yeah, dumb stuff like that ...  Well, I've got to find a bathroom.
scene_description: [Tenses a bit and bites his fingers nervously.]

character_words: Your palms are so smooth. Do you use moisturizer?
Actually, I have this special seaweed lotion. I can get you some if you want.  So, do you see anything interesting in my love line?
scene_description: [Aang sticks out his tongue; slight pause.]

character_words: Actually, I have this special seaweed lotion. I can get you some if you want.  So, do you see anything interesting in my love line?
scene_description: [Aang immediately perks up upon hearing this.]

character_words: I feel a great romance for you. The man you are going to marry.
Tell me more!
I can see that he's a very powerful bender.
Looks like someone had a pretty good bathroom break.
Yeah ... when I was in there ...
I don't even want to know!
scene_description: [Disgusted, looking away and holding up a hand to signal Aang to stop.]

character_words: Who's next?
Okay, let's get this over with.
Your future is full of struggle and anguish. Most of it, self-inflicted.
But you didn't read my palms or anything!
I don't need to. It's written all over your face.  You there, come with me.
scene_description: [Sokka resumes picking his teeth in disgust; to Aang.]

character_words: This is the most reliable method of telling your fortune. The bones never lie.  Go on, pick one.  Now throw it on the fire.  The heat makes cracks in the bone and I read the bone cracks to tell your destiny.

This is the most reliable method of telling your fortune. The bones never lie.  Go on, pick one.  Now throw it on the fire.  The heat makes cracks in the bone and I read the bone cracks to tell your destiny.
scene_description: [Aang takes one bone and they sit down.]

character_words: This is the most reliable method of telling your fortune. The bones never lie.  Go on, pick one.  Now throw it on the fire.  The heat makes cracks in the bone and I read the bone cracks to tell your destiny.
scene_description: [Aang tosses the bone into the fire.]

character_words: Wow, that's a big crack.
I've never seen this before!

Oh my!  Your destiny! This is incredible. You will be involved in a great battle, an awesome conflict between the forces of good and evil. A battle whose outcome will determine the fate of the whole world!
scene_description: [Her and Aang shielding their faces in surprise.]

character_words: Oh my!  Your destiny! This is incredible. You will be involved in a great battle, an awesome conflict between the forces of good and evil. A battle whose outcome will determine the fate of the whole world!
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the bone lying in the fire and back to Aunt Wu who is fascinated.]

character_words: Yeah, yeah, I knew that already. But did it say anything about a girl?
A girl? You want to know about love?
Yes!
I'm sorry, but I didn't see anything.
Well, look!  I must've missed something.  Right here.  It says "trust your heart and you will be with the one you love."
Well, look!  I must've missed something.  Right here.  It says "trust your heart and you will be with the one you love."
scene_description: [Holding her hand against her face in mock forgetfulness.]

character_words: Well, look!  I must've missed something.  Right here.  It says "trust your heart and you will be with the one you love."
scene_description: [Cuts to a bone piece lying on the floor; Wu picks it up.]

character_words: Well, look!  I must've missed something.  Right here.  It says "trust your heart and you will be with the one you love."
Really?  Thank you, Aunt Wu!
Well, now you got to see for yourselves how fortune telling is just a big, stupid hoax.
You're just saying that because you're going to make yourself unhappy your whole life.
That woman is crazy! My life will calm and happy and joyful!
That doesn't prove anything!
Well, I liked my predictions.  Certain things are going to turn out very well.
Well, I liked my predictions.  Certain things are going to turn out very well.
They sure are ...
scene_description: [Slyly, crossing his arms and leaning in toward her.]

character_words: Why? What did she tell you?
Some stuff. You'll find out.
What's with the sky?
We are waiting for Aunt Wu to come and read the clouds to predict the fate of the whole village.
That cloud kind of looks like a fluffy bunny.
You better hope that's not a bunny! The fluffy bunny cloud forecasts doom and destruction.
Do you even hear yourself?
The cloud reading will tell us if Mt. Makapu will remain dormant for another year or if it will erupt.
scene_description: [Gesturing to the mountain in the background.]

character_words: We used to have a tradition once a year of going up the mountain to check the volcano ourselves.  But every since Aunt Wu moved to the village twenty years ago, we have a tradition of not doing that.
I can't believe you would trust your lives to that crazy, old woman's superstition!
Shhh! She's coming!
Hey, Aang.  Don't you think that cloud looks like a flower?
Hey, Aang.  Don't you think that cloud looks like a flower?
Huh? Sure, I guess.  Hey, Katara, don't you think that cloud look like a flower?
Huh? Sure, I guess.  Hey, Katara, don't you think that cloud look like a flower?
scene_description: [He pushes Meng away as the camera pans to the right; to Katara.]

character_words: Shhh!
Bending arrow cloud ... good crops this year. Nice big harvest.
Darn good news!
Wavy, moon-shaped cloud ... let's see.  Gonna be a great year for twins!
Yes!
And a cumulus cloud with a twisted nob coming off the end of it ...  The village will not be destroyed by the volcano this year!
And a cumulus cloud with a twisted nob coming off the end of it ...  The village will not be destroyed by the volcano this year!
Since I got you here, uh, there's something I want to tell you. I like you, but more than normal.
Never mind.
Hi, Aunt Wu! Sorry to bother you.
Any time.
About this man I'm supposed to marry ...  Is he going to be handsome?  Oh, I hope he's tall!
About this man I'm supposed to marry ...  Is he going to be handsome?  Oh, I hope he's tall!
Ah ... You want another reading?
Yes, please!
I can't believe all these saps!  Someone really needs to scream some sense into them.
scene_description: [Cuts to side-view of Sokka walking forward, Aang following close behind.]

character_words: They seem happy, Sokka.
Not for long. I'm going to prove Aunt Wu's predictions are nonsense.  Hey you, I bet Aunt Wu told you to wear those red shoes, didn't she?
Not for long. I'm going to prove Aunt Wu's predictions are nonsense.  Hey you, I bet Aunt Wu told you to wear those red shoes, didn't she?
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the man's red shoes.]

character_words: Yeah. She said I'd be wearing red shoes when I met my true love.
Uh huh ... And how many times have you worn those shoes since you got that fortune?
Everyday.
Then of course it's gonna come true!
scene_description: [Background becomes a spiral of swirling orange and yellow flames; angry.]

character_words: Really? You think so?  I'm so excited!
Really? You think so?  I'm so excited!
And then you will have your third great-grandchild before quietly passing away in your sleep.  Is that enough information for you?
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of Aunt Wu, who does not seem particularly happy.]

character_words: Wow, thanks, Aunt Wu.  Oh wait, one more thing. How warmly should I dress tomorrow?
Wow, thanks, Aunt Wu.  Oh wait, one more thing. How warmly should I dress tomorrow?
scene_description: [She rises and prepares to leave, but suddenly turns back.]

character_words: You want me to do a reading for that?
I don't care what Aunt Wu told you! You have to take a bath sometime!
So, Sokka, you know some stuff about ladies, right?
Some stuff?  You've come to the right place. What can I do you for?
Some stuff?  You've come to the right place. What can I do you for?
Well, there's this girl.
I think I know who you mean.
You do? And you're okay with it?
Of course I am. And to tell you the truth, I've been picking up a subtle vibe that she likes you, too.
She does?
scene_description: [Growing anxious; Meng tries to catch Aang's attention in the background.]

character_words: Oh yeah, she's crazy about you. All you have to do now is not mess it up.
Well, how do I do that?
The number once mistake nice guys like you make: being too nice.
You can be too nice?
Yep. If you want to keep her interested, you have to act aloof, like you don't really care one way or the other.
Well, okay ...
Hey, Aang, I was wondering ...
See you later ...
scene_description: [Walks away casually and waves hand breezily.]

character_words: Wow, that kid is good.
And you'll be fine as long as you've got a scarf. Bye-bye now.
Okay, okay, but one more thing.
All right, what is it?
scene_description: [Stares horrified at Katara before sighing and leaning forward slightly in surrender.]

character_words: Should I eat a mango or a papaya for breakfast tomorrow?
scene_description: [Puts a hand to her chin thoughtfully.]

character_words: Papaya!
Papaya!
Aww, I hate papaya.
scene_description: [Kicks the ground, sending up a small cloud of dust.]

character_words: Oh, hey, Katara. I didn't see you there.
Hey, Aang.
Hey, Aang.
That's okay. I'm busy with my own stuff.
Ugh, papaya please.
So ... papaya.
Uh huh. Would you like some?
You know me. I don't really care what I eat.
scene_description: [Causally, picking an apple from the stand.]

character_words: Okay then. See you later.
Maybe aloof isn't my style.
Oh, a panda lily!
Did you see that?
Excuse me.  Where can a guy find one of those things?
I can't believe you're dragging me all the way up here for a stupid flower.
Not just any flower, a panda lily. I've seen it in action and boy, does it work.
Flowers are fine once you're married, but at this early stage, it's critical that you maintain maximum aloofness.
But my heart is telling me to get this flower,  and Aunt Wu said if I trusted in my heart, I will be with the one I love.
scene_description: [Looks up toward the rim of the mountain.]

character_words: What? Don't tell me you believe in that stuff, too.
Well, Aunt Wu hasn't been wrong yet. Why should she be wrong about love?  There! On the rim!
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of Aang perched on one boulder, Sokka appearing on-screen.]

character_words: Well, Aunt Wu hasn't been wrong yet. Why should she be wrong about love?  There! On the rim!
scene_description: [Leaps upward and points in delight at the rim.]

character_words: Oh no.  Aunt Wu was wrong.
Oh no.  Aunt Wu was wrong.
scene_description: [Cuts to overhead shot of the volcano.]

character_words: Those people all think they're safe! We've got to warn them!
There's no time to walk!  Grab on!
There's no time to walk!  Grab on!
scene_description: [He pulls Sokka forward, who shouts in surprise and the two take off.]

character_words: Hi, Katara.
Can you believe she won't let me in? And after all the business I've given her?
But she doesn't even charge.
I know, but still ...
Well, we have other things to worry about. Aunt Wu was wrong about the volcano.
Sokka, you tried to convince me she was wrong before. It's going to take an awful lot to change my mind -
Oh no.
Everyone, that volcano is gonna blow any second! Aunt Wu was wrong!
Yeah, yeah, we know you don't believe in Aunt Wu, Mr. science and reason lover.
If you won't listen to him, maybe you'll listen to me. I want to believe Aunt Wu and her predictions as much as you do, but my brother and Aang saw the lava with their own eyes.
Well, I heard Aunt Wu's prediction with my own ears.
Please listen to us! You are all in danger! And we have to get out of here! You can't rely on Aunt Wu's prediction,  you have to take fate into your own hands!
scene_description: [Leaps onto the awning of a nearby building; urgently.]

character_words: Please listen to us! You are all in danger! And we have to get out of here! You can't rely on Aunt Wu's prediction,  you have to take fate into your own hands!
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of villagers who gaze up at him, seemingly listening.]

character_words: Look!  Can your fortune telling explain that?
Can your science explain why it rains?
Yes! Yes, it can!
They just won't listen to reason.
They just won't listen to reason.
But they will listen to Aunt Wu!
I know that's the problem.
Well, it's about to become the solution. We're taking fate in our own hands. First, I need to borrow Aunt Wu's cloud reading book.
Shhh! We don't want anyone to hear us.
Oh, I didn't see you there.
You don't like me, do you?
You don't like me, do you?
Of course I like you.
But not the way I like you.
Oh, I guess not.
It's okay. It's just really hard when you like someone, but they don't think of you that way.
I know what you mean.
She's beautiful, by the way.
Huh?
That Water Tribe girl. I can see why you like her so much.  She's sweet, she's a bender  and her hair seems so manageable.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the two standing in the room.]

character_words: That Water Tribe girl. I can see why you like her so much.  She's sweet, she's a bender  and her hair seems so manageable.
scene_description: [Clasps hands together, counts on her fingers.]

character_words: That Water Tribe girl. I can see why you like her so much.  She's sweet, she's a bender  and her hair seems so manageable.
That Water Tribe girl. I can see why you like her so much.  She's sweet, she's a bender  and her hair seems so manageable.
scene_description: [While saying this last part, she tries to smooth down her braids only for them to immediately stick up again.]

character_words: Don't worry. You're going to meet a great guy who's going to completely fall for you. I know it.
scene_description: [Places a hand on her shoulder comfortingly; turns to leave.]

character_words: Thanks.  Wait! Don't you want this?
Thanks.  Wait! Don't you want this?
scene_description: [Aang looks surprised; Meng hands him the cloud reading book, revealing she had had it in her possession the whole time.]

character_words: How did you know?
I've kind of been stalking you.  Heh ...
I've kind of been stalking you.  Heh ...
Oh, thanks ... I guess.
Clouds are made of water and air, so between the two of us, we ought to be able to bend them into any shape we want.
I found it. The symbol for volcanic doom.
Aunt Wu, look! Something is happening in the clouds.
That's very strange. It shouldn't ...  Oh my!
That's very strange. It shouldn't ...  Oh my!
scene_description: [A shadow falls over her face as the sky darkens; suddenly terrified.]

character_words: We still can save the village if we act fast.  Sokka has a plan.
scene_description: [Gesturing toward Sokka, who stands on the pagoda.]

character_words: Lava is gonna flow downhill to this spot. If we can dig a deep enough trench we can channel all the lava away from the village to the river.
If any of you are earthbenders, come with me.
I'm an earthbender!
I'm not!
Everybody else grab a shovel  Come on! We've gotta hurry!
scene_description: [As another explosion resonates over the village, everyone stumbles before regaining balance.]

character_words: Dig faster! Dig faster!
Everyone needs to evacuate! We'll come for you when it's safe!
It's too much! It's gonna overflow!
Man, sometimes I forget what a powerful bender that kid is.
scene_description: [Katara's expression changes at this, remembering Aunt Wu's words about her future marriage.]

character_words: Wait, what did you just say?
Nothing, just that Aang is one powerful bender.
I suppose he is.
scene_description: [Slowly widens her eyes in realization; as if having an epiphany.]

character_words: By the way, we kind of borrowed your book.
So you messed with the clouds, did you?
Very clever!
No offense, but I hope this taught everyone a lesson about not relying too much on fortune telling.
But Aunt Wu predicted the village wouldn't be destroyed and it wasn't. She was right, after all.
I hate you.
scene_description: [Gets near the Calm man's face, through gritted teeth.]

character_words: It's okay, Sokka. Everything's going to be all right.
scene_description: [Holding Sokka by the shoulders and leading him away.]

character_words: Can I ask you something?
Of course, honey.
You didn't really see love in my fortune, did you? You just told me what I wanted to hear.
I'll tell you a little secret, young airbender.  Just as you reshaped those clouds,  you have the power to shape your own destiny.
I'll tell you a little secret, young airbender.  Just as you reshaped those clouds,  you have the power to shape your own destiny.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of Aang, who smiles; off-camera.]

character_words: Goodbye everyone! It was so nice to meet you!  Take care, Meng.
Goodbye everyone! It was so nice to meet you!  Take care, Meng.
Take care!  Floozy.
Take care!  Floozy.
scene_description: [Appa turns away. Cuts to Meng's face, whose smile disappears and is replaced by a frown.]

character_words: Hey, look!  A sword made out of a whale's tooth.
Let me see that.
This is a Water Tribe weapon.  See if you can find anything else.
Did someone lose something?
No, we found something!
It's burned.  There was a battle! Water Tribe warriors ambushed a group of firebenders.  The firebenders fought back, but the warriors drove them down this hill.
scene_description: [Cut to shot of a tree trunk, scorch marks and sharp cuts running across its bark. Cut to shot of Sokka and the others.]

character_words: It's burned.  There was a battle! Water Tribe warriors ambushed a group of firebenders.  The firebenders fought back, but the warriors drove them down this hill.
scene_description: [He turns away from the tree and looking down the slope of the hill seeing a black spot on the ground.]

character_words: So, then what happened?
I don't know. The trail ends here.
Wait, look!
Wait, look!
scene_description: [Cut to shot of a Water Tribe ship, half obscured behind large rocks, sitting idly on the shore.]

character_words: It's one of our boats!
Is this dad's boat?
scene_description: [She and Sokka run toward it. Cut to shot of entire ship as they approach.]

character_words: No, but it's from his fleet.  Dad was here.
scene_description: [Strokes the boat off, while Aang appears behind them.]

character_words: No, but it's from his fleet.  Dad was here.
Aahh!  See Prince Zuko, a moment of quiet is good for your mental well-being.
Aahh!  See Prince Zuko, a moment of quiet is good for your mental well-being.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of entire room where he and Zuko are seated at a low-lying table.]

character_words: Aahh!  See Prince Zuko, a moment of quiet is good for your mental well-being.
Look out! Argh!
Get back! We're after a stowaway!
Get back! We're after a stowaway!
scene_description: [Cut to overhead shot of the ship's deck.]

character_words: There are no stowaways on my ship.
He's paralyzed.
Only temporarily.  The toxins will wear off in about an hour. But by then, he'll be in jail and I'll have my money.
scene_description: [Lifts the man and slings him over her shoulder.]

character_words: Only temporarily.  The toxins will wear off in about an hour. But by then, he'll be in jail and I'll have my money.
But how did you find him on my ship?
My shirshu can smell a rat a continent away.
scene_description: [Prepares to mount Nyla, the stowaway already slung onto his back.]

character_words: My shirshu can smell a rat a continent away.
Well, I'm impressed.  Very impressed.
scene_description: [June cracks her whip. Cuts to shot of the shirshu bolting off the ship and racing down the dock.]

character_words: Well, I'm impressed.  Very impressed.
scene_description: [Leaning over the ledge of the ship with Zuko, stroking his beard thoughtfully; Zuko look at him, disgusted.]

character_words: Sokka.
I'm coming with you.
You're not old enough to go to war, Sokka, you know that.
I'm strong, I'm brave, I can fight! Please, Dad!
Being a man is knowing where you're needed the most. And for you right now, that's here, protecting your sister.
scene_description: [Lays a hand on his son's shoulder; grimly and sadly.]

character_words: I don't understand.
Someday you will.  I'm gonna miss you so much.
scene_description: [Sokka throws aside his bag and throws himself into his father's arms. Cut to close-up of him as he sobs and buries his face in his father's parka.]

character_words: Who's there?
Who's there?
Sokka?
Bato?
Bato?
Who the what now?
Bato!
Sokka! Katara! It is so good to see you two.  You've grown so much!
scene_description: [Cuts to side-shot of Bato, Sokka running over to him, followed closely by Katara.]

character_words: Sokka! Katara! It is so good to see you two.  You've grown so much!
Sokka! Katara! It is so good to see you two.  You've grown so much!
scene_description: [Aang follows them, but remains standing a few feet away.]

character_words: Hi, I'm Aang.
Where's Dad?
Is he here?
No, he and the other warriors should be in the Eastern Earth Kingdom by now.  This is no place for a reunion. Let's get inside.
scene_description: [Both siblings look crestfallen at this news. A gust of wind blows, causing them to shiver. Cut to a shot of Bato who shivers as well.]

character_words: After I was wounded, your father carried me to this abbey. The sisters have cared for me ever since. Superior,  these are Hakoda's children. They've been traveling with the Avatar. I found them by my boat.
Young Avatar, it gives me great joy to be in your presence. Welcome to our abbey.
Thank you, it's truly an honor to be here. If there's anything-
What smells so good, Bato?
The sisters craft ointments and perfumes.
Perfume?  Maybe we can dump some on Appa, because he stinks so much.  Am I right?
