Perfume?  Maybe we can dump some on Appa, because he stinks so much.  Am I right?
scene_description: [Waves his hand in front of his face.]

character_words: Perfume?  Maybe we can dump some on Appa, because he stinks so much.  Am I right?
scene_description: [Everyone is silent, a single person coughs.]

character_words: You have your father's wit.
Bato, it looks like home!
scene_description: [Bato, Katara, Sokka, and Aang file inside.]

character_words: Everything's here, even the pelts!
Yeah, nothing's cozier than dead animal skins.
No way! Stewed sea prunes!
Help yourself!
Dad could eat a whole barrel of these things!
Bato, is it true that you and dad lassoed an arctic hippo?
It was your father's idea, he just dragged me along. Well, the hippo did the dragging!
scene_description: [Momo, sitting by Aang, starts to eat the stewed sea prunes that Aang set aside, but ends up spitting it out.]

character_words: Hey, I ride animals, too! There was this one time when I rode a giant eel and I-
scene_description: [Sokka and Katara are slurping their stewed sea prunes as Aang speaks.]

character_words: So, who was it that came up with the Great Blubber Fiasco?
You knew about that?
Everyone does!
What's that story?
It's a long one Aang, some other time.
You and Dad had so many hilarious adventures.
Not all of which were hilarious at the time, but everything's funny in hindsight.  Hey, Aang! Please put that down,  it's ceremonial and very fragile.
Not all of which were hilarious at the time, but everything's funny in hindsight.  Hey, Aang! Please put that down,  it's ceremonial and very fragile.
scene_description: [Aang is shown wearing a fur pelt on his head.]

character_words: Not all of which were hilarious at the time, but everything's funny in hindsight.  Hey, Aang! Please put that down,  it's ceremonial and very fragile.
scene_description: [Aang puts the pelt back on the wall, and sits in the back of the room.]

character_words: Was it you or Dad that put an octopus on your head and convinced Gran-Gran you were a water spirit?
Your dad wore the octopus,  but I did the spooky voice.
Out of my way!  Step aside, filth!
Out of my way!  Step aside, filth!
scene_description: [Pushing a man out of the way.]

character_words: He means no offense! I'm certain you bathe regularly!
I need to talk to you!
Well, if it isn't my new friends: Angry Boy and Uncle Lazy.
Your beast trashed my ship. You have to pay me back!
Well, I'd love to help you out, but I'm a little short on money.  Drinks on me!
Well, I'd love to help you out, but I'm a little short on money.  Drinks on me!
Well, I'd love to help you out, but I'm a little short on money.  Drinks on me!
Money isn't what I had in mind.
I need you to find someone.
What happened, your girlfriend run off on you?
It's not the girl I'm after, it's the bald monk she's traveling with.
Whatever you say.
If you find them, I'll consider the damage to my ship paid for.
Heh, forget it.
Heh, forget it.
Plus, we'll pay your weight in gold.
Make it your  weight, and we gotta deal.
scene_description: [Stops and widens her eyes in surprise. She smiles. Cut to a side-shot of June walking over to Iroh.]

character_words: Make it your  weight, and we gotta deal.
You got it!
scene_description: [Laughs with his hand on his stomach.]

character_words: Get on!
There's something I should tell you kids. I'm expecting a message from your father.
scene_description: [Aang is shown with his eyes closed, excluded from the group.]

character_words: Really?
When?
Any day now. Your father said he'd send a message when they found the rendezvous point. If you wait until the message arrives, you can come with me, and see your father again.
It's been over two years since we've seen Dad. That would be so incredible! Katara!
I do really miss him, it would be great to see Dad.
scene_description: [Aang gets up to leave, but no one notices him.]

character_words: It's been far too long, hasn't it?  I'm not sure when word will arrive, but when it does-
It would be great, but we can't. We have to take Aang to the North Pole first.
Even if we do have time to wait for the message, who knows how far we'd have to travel. We don't have time for a long detour.
I'm sure your father would understand, and be proud that his children are helping the Avatar.
I can't believe they would leave me.
I'm looking for Bato of the Water Tribe.
Uhhh, I know Bato!
Make sure he gets this!
scene_description: [Hands Aang the scroll and rides away.]

character_words: It's the map to Sokka and Katara's dad!
Hey everyone! Sorry I was gone so long.
Hey, Aang, I didn't notice you left.
Yup, but now I'm back.  Sure could go for some delicious sea prunes!
Out for a bit of fresh air, are we?
We're looking for someone.
I hope it's not Miyuki  Miyuki, did you get in trouble with the Fire Nation, again?
I hope it's not Miyuki  Miyuki, did you get in trouble with the Fire Nation, again?
The Avatar's been through here. Let's keep moving.
Aha! I caught you.  You should be ashamed of yourself ... Littering in the courtyard.
scene_description: [Picks up the crumpled paper as Aang looks at her nervously.]

character_words: I'm sorry, I'll take care of this.
I'm sorry, I'll take care of this.
scene_description: [Bows. As Mother Superior walks away, Aang stuffs the map back up his sleeve.]

character_words: This ship is sentimental to me. It was built by my father.
Is this the boat he took you ice dodging in?
Yep! It's got the scar to prove it. Ha. How 'bout you Sokka? You must have some good stories from your first time ice dodging.
He never got to go. Dad left before he was old enough.
Oh, I forgot you were too young.
What's ice dodging?
It's a rite of passage for young Water Tribe members. When you turn fourteen, your dad takes you-  You know what, you're about to find out!
scene_description: [Bato smile and puts his hand on Sokka's shoulder with a new thought.]

character_words: Why are we stopping?
Because the girl must have spent a lot of time here.
We have no time for this!
Hey! Watch it!
Oh look, he likes you!
Care to hear your fortune, handsome?
At my age, there's really only one big surprise left, and I'd just as soon leave it a mystery.
Ice dodging is a ceremonial test of wisdom, bravery, and trust.  In our village, ice dodging was done by weaving a boat through a field of icebergs.
How are we supposed to ice dodge without ice?

You'll be dodging those.  Sokka, you steer and call the shots, lead wisely. Katara, you secure the main sail.  The winds can be brutal, so be brave. Aang, you control the jib. Without your steady hand, we all go down. Your position is about trust.
scene_description: [Points to a group of tall, sharp, jagged rocks near the shore. Katara and Sokka appear nervous.]

character_words: You'll be dodging those.  Sokka, you steer and call the shots, lead wisely. Katara, you secure the main sail.  The winds can be brutal, so be brave. Aang, you control the jib. Without your steady hand, we all go down. Your position is about trust.
I know that. Why wouldn't I know that?  I'm the Avatar; I know about trust.
I know that. Why wouldn't I know that?  I'm the Avatar; I know about trust.
I know that. Why wouldn't I know that?  I'm the Avatar; I know about trust.
scene_description: [He crosses his arms and looks away, but gives Bato a second glance.]

character_words: For this is to be done right, I cannot help.  You pass or fail on your own.
scene_description: [Sits cross-legged at the front of the boat.]

character_words: Aang, ease up on the jib. Katara, steady.  Aang, less sail. Katara, give him room.  Aang, helm to lee. Helm to lee!
Aang, ease up on the jib. Katara, steady.  Aang, less sail. Katara, give him room.  Aang, helm to lee. Helm to lee!
scene_description: [Katara looks at the shore with concern.]

character_words: Aang, ease up on the jib. Katara, steady.  Aang, less sail. Katara, give him room.  Aang, helm to lee. Helm to lee!
scene_description: [The ship moves to the side and sails between some rocks.]

character_words: What does that even mean?
Great job!
There's no way through!
We can make it.
Sokka, you've already proven yourself. Maybe we should-
scene_description: [Stands up and grabs the side of the boat.]

character_words: Aang, I'm gonna need air in that sail.  Katara, I want you to bend as much water as you can between us and those rocks. Now!

The spirits of water bear witness to these marks. For Sokka, the Mark of the Wise.  The same mark your father earned. For Katara,  the Mark of the Brave. Your courage inspires us.  And for Aang, the Mark of the Trusted. You are now an honorary member of the Water Tribe.

The spirits of water bear witness to these marks. For Sokka, the Mark of the Wise.  The same mark your father earned. For Katara,  the Mark of the Brave. Your courage inspires us.  And for Aang, the Mark of the Trusted. You are now an honorary member of the Water Tribe.

character_words: The spirits of water bear witness to these marks. For Sokka, the Mark of the Wise.  The same mark your father earned. For Katara,  the Mark of the Brave. Your courage inspires us.  And for Aang, the Mark of the Trusted. You are now an honorary member of the Water Tribe.

character_words: The spirits of water bear witness to these marks. For Sokka, the Mark of the Wise.  The same mark your father earned. For Katara,  the Mark of the Brave. Your courage inspires us.  And for Aang, the Mark of the Trusted. You are now an honorary member of the Water Tribe.
scene_description: [Using his thumb to put an arc on Aang's forehead.]

character_words: I can't.
Of course you can!
No, you can't trust me.
scene_description: [Rubbing off his mark and backing away.]

character_words: Aang, what are you talking about?
A messenger gave this to me for Bato.  You have to understand. I was afraid you would-
scene_description: [Takes the crumpled map out of his sleeve.]

character_words: A messenger gave this to me for Bato.  You have to understand. I was afraid you would-
This is the map to our father! You had it the whole time? How could you?  Well, you can go to the North Pole on your own. I'm going to find Dad.
This is the map to our father! You had it the whole time? How could you?  Well, you can go to the North Pole on your own. I'm going to find Dad.
This is the map to our father! You had it the whole time? How could you?  Well, you can go to the North Pole on your own. I'm going to find Dad.
Well, Sokka. I think you should-
Katara, are you with me?
I'm with you Sokka.
scene_description: [Turns to look at Aang and closes her eyes.]

character_words: Good luck.
Okay. You too.
Guess I should be moving on.
That would be best.
I'm an idiot, Momo.
We're getting close.
scene_description: [Whips Nyla, who runs out of the abbey and into the woods.]

character_words: That wolf sounds so sad.
It's probably wounded.

No, it's been separated from the pack. I understand that pain. It's how I felt when the Water Tribe warriors had to leave me behind. They were my family,  and being apart from them was more painful than my wounds.

No, it's been separated from the pack. I understand that pain. It's how I felt when the Water Tribe warriors had to leave me behind. They were my family,  and being apart from them was more painful than my wounds.
scene_description: [Shot of Sokka, who looks sadly at the camera.]

character_words: Sokka?
We need to go back. I wanna see Dad, but, helping Aang is where we're needed the most.
You're right.
Your father will understand, and I know he's proud of you.
scene_description: [Walks up to Katara and Sokka and puts his arms on their shoulders.]

character_words: Thanks, Bato.
I know where to go from here.  Take this in case you want to find us. I'll leave a message at the rendezvous point.
scene_description: [Takes the map from out of his Water Tribe outfit.]

character_words: Looks like we're going alone, guys.
Avatar, you must leave!
Okay, I get it. Everybody wants me gone.
A group of people came to the abbey looking for you.
Who?
A fierce looking woman with a horrible monster, and a young man with a scar.
Zuko.
The beast was using the scent of a necklace to follow you.
A necklace?  Katara!
So this is your girlfriend.  No wonder she left, she's way too pretty for you.
So this is your girlfriend.  No wonder she left, she's way too pretty for you.
Where is he? Where is the Avatar?
We split up. He's long gone.
How stupid do you think I am?
Pretty stupid.  Run!
What are we supposed to do now?
It's seeking a different scent. Perhaps something that the Avatar held.
scene_description: [Nyla walks closer to Sokka and Katara.]

character_words: What's it doing? It's just going in a circle.
Aang!
Up!
scene_description: [June cracks her whip. Nyla stands up and June mounts him.]

character_words: Come on! Get up!
I'm ... starting to get some feeling back!  Ow.
scene_description: [Rubble from the roof falls on him.]

character_words: You've got something I want.
That thing sees with its nose. Let's give him something to look at.
The perfume?
June! No!
scene_description: [Nyla paralyzes Zuko as Iroh looks at Nyla in concern.]

character_words: June! No!
scene_description: [Nyla tongue lashes out and hits June, who falls back into Iroh's arms.]

character_words: Uncle? I didn't see you get hit with the tongue.
Shhh.
So ... where do we go?
We're getting you to the North Pole.
Yeah, we've lost too much time as it is.
Don't you want to see your father?
Of course we do, Aang. But, you're our family, too. And right now, you need us more.
And we need you.
I wish I could give you a little piece of home, Katara. Something to remind you ...
I'll be okay.
Still, just a little trinket. Maybe something like ...  this?
Still, just a little trinket. Maybe something like ...  this?
Aang, how'd you get that?
Zuko asked me to be sure I got it to you.
Aw, that's so sweet of Zuko. Could you give him a kiss for me when you see him?
Sure.
So, how long do you think it's been since someone was here?
Long enough for moss to grow on the hull.  About three months.
Oh.  So dad's probably long gone.
Oh.  So dad's probably long gone.
I wonder why they left this boat? There's nothing wrong with it.
scene_description: [Cut to a shot from behind Aang.]

character_words: When was the last time you saw your dad?
I don't want to talk about it.
Sorry.  I didn't mean to bring that up.
scene_description: [The camera cuts to a frontal of Aang.]

character_words: Sorry.  I didn't mean to bring that up.
It's okay Aang. Our dad left about two years ago, with all the other Water Tribe men.
scene_description: [Shot of Katara and Aang around the campfire.]

character_words: Maybe we should all get some sleep.
scene_description: [Sokka enters the shot and proceeds to lay down in front of the campfire; interrupting Katara.]

character_words: This should give us a good idea of what's around here.
scene_description: [Walking toward a poster on the kiosk, present in the middle of a crossroad.]

character_words: See if you can find a menu, I'm starving!
scene_description: [Flips a small pouch to find it empty aside from a few crumbs.]

character_words: See if you can find a menu, I'm starving!
I bet we'll find something to eat here,  the Fire Day's Festival.  Fire Nation cultural exhibits, jugglers, benders, magicians ...  This would be a great place for me to study some real firebenders.
I bet we'll find something to eat here,  the Fire Day's Festival.  Fire Nation cultural exhibits, jugglers, benders, magicians ...  This would be a great place for me to study some real firebenders.
scene_description: [Momo jumps down. Aang begins reading-out the poster.]

character_words: I bet we'll find something to eat here,  the Fire Day's Festival.  Fire Nation cultural exhibits, jugglers, benders, magicians ...  This would be a great place for me to study some real firebenders.
You might wanna rethink that. Look at this.
scene_description: [Looking at another poster on the other side of the kiosk; seriously.]

character_words: Hey, a poster of me!
A wanted poster! This is bad.
scene_description: [Aang removes the poster from the wall and starts reading it.]

character_words: I think we better keep moving.
I have to learn firebending at some point and this could be my only chance to watch a master's up close.
I guess we could go check it out.
scene_description: [Swayed by Aang; while her head is bowed.]

character_words: I guess we could go check it out.
What? You wanna walk into a Fire Nation town where they're all fired-up with their ... you know, fire?
scene_description: [Moves in front of Katara; in an opposing tone.]

character_words: What? You wanna walk into a Fire Nation town where they're all fired-up with their ... you know, fire?
We'll wear disguises and if it looks like trouble, we'll leave.
scene_description: [Starts walking toward Appa and is followed by Aang.]

character_words: Yeah! Because we always leave before we get into trouble.
You guys stay out of sight here while we go to the festival.  Ready disguises!
You guys stay out of sight here while we go to the festival.  Ready disguises!
It's like you're a whole different person ...
It's like you're a whole different person ...
Let's go.
I think we need some new disguises.
Where are we gonna get masks like that?
Get your genuine Fire Festival masks here!
That was surprisingly easy.
Hey, there's some food.
Finally!  What do you have?
Flaming fire flakes! Best in town.
I'll take'em!
Aaahhh! Hot! Hot!
"Flaming fire flakes", hot? What do you know?
Hey, look at this.
Don't worry loyal citizens! No one can surprise the Fire Lord!
Oh no! Look out!
scene_description: [As an Earth Kingdom general puppet pops up behind the Fire Lord's puppet, with a rock ready to attack.]

character_words: Oh no! Look out!
scene_description: [The puppet breaths fire, burning the other puppet.]

character_words: Aang, hold on! Where are we going?
I don't know, but there's a big crowd so it must be good.
Knowing the Fire Nation, it's probably an execution.
I gotta learn that trick!
Thank you! For my next trick I need a volunteer from the audience!
Oh! Oh! Me! Me!
scene_description: [Waving his hand up in the air all around childishly.]

character_words: What do you think you're doing?
scene_description: [In a stern tone while pulling his arm down.]

character_words: I want to get a closer look.
It's better that we don't attract any attention to ourselves.
How about you, little lady?
Uh.
Awww, she's shy. Leeet's give her some encouragement, folks!
Awww! That could've been me.
scene_description: [In a jealous tone while folding his arms.]

character_words: This next trick is called "Taming the Dragon."  You will be my captured princess! Don't worry, young maiden! I will tame this fiery beast! It's too strong, I can't hold it!
scene_description: [While sitting her down in a chair and tying her to it.]

character_words: We gotta help her!
No, we don't want to make a scene!
The rope, it's breaking!  Hey, you tryin' to upstage me, kid?
scene_description: [Aang saves Katara with his airbending, dispersing the flames is a ray of colors while he loses his mask in the process.]

character_words: Hey! That kid's the Avatar!
I think it's time to go.
Follow me! I can get you outta here!
There they are!
Over there!
I'm calling Appa.
I hope he can really hear that bison whistle!
This way!  Okay! Not this way!
scene_description: [Making a sharp turn down one of the several alleys.]

character_words: This way!  Okay! Not this way!
Appa! Down here!
Nice touch setting off the fireworks.
You really know your explosives ...
I'm familiar.
You're a Fire Nation Soldier!
Was. My name's Chey.
I serve a man. More than a man really, he's a myth, but he's real, a living legend, Jeong Jeong the Deserter. He was a Fire Nation general, or wait, was he an admiral?
He was very highly ranked, we get it.

Yeah! Way up there! But he couldn't take the madness any more. He's the first person ever to leave the army - and live. I'm the second, but you don't get to be a legend for that. That's okay though. Jeong Jeong's a firebending genius. Some say he's mad - but he's not! He's enlightened.
You mean there's a firebender out here who's not with the Fire Lord?  We've gotta go see him! He can train me!
We're not gonna go find some crazy firebender!
He's not crazy! He's a genius! And he's the perfect person to train the Avatar! That's why I followed you into the festival.
Look, thanks for the help, but we're leaving for the North Pole in the morning.
Sokka, this could be my only chance to meet a firebending master who would actually be willing to teach me.
It can't hurt just to talk to him.
That's what you said about going to the festival! Why doesn't anyone ever listen to me?
Don't move!
Jeong Jeong told you not to look for Avatar!
Hold on, you know these guys?
Oh yeh! Lin Yee's an old buddy! Right, Lin Yee?
Shut up! Keep moving.
Go on. He sees you only.
Oh that's okay, we can chat later.
Is that where Jeong Jeong is? I need to talk to him right away.
No! You wait there.  Go now!
Don't worry! Everything'll be fine. He's a great man, great man!
So, the Avatar was here and you let him slip away?
Yes, sir, but other than that the festival went off without a hitch!  No fights. Theft was way down.
Yes, sir, but other than that the festival went off without a hitch!  No fights. Theft was way down.
scene_description: [A huge piece of burning planks of wood falls in the background with a massive crash making the guards twitch.]

character_words: I don't care about your local crime rates! Which way did they go?
They headed into the forest, up the river I suspect.
Ready the river boats. We're going after the Avatar.
What happened? Can I see Jeong Jeong now?
He won't see you. He's very angry that I brought you here. He wants you to leave immediately.
Finally! Let's hit the road.
Why won't he see me?
He says you're not ready. Says you haven't mastered waterbending and earthbending yet.
Wait, how does he know that?
He saw the way you walked into camp. He could tell.
I'm going in, anyway!
Get out.
Master, I need to learn firebending.
Only a fool seeks his own destruction.
I'm the Avatar, it's my destiny to—
I'm the Avatar, it's my destiny to—

Destiny? What would a boy know of destiny? If a fish lives its whole life in this river, does he know the river's destiny? No! Only that it runs on and on out of his control! He may follow where it flows, but he cannot see the end. He cannot imagine the ocean.
Okay, but it's the Avatar's duty to master all of the bending disciplines.
To master the bending disciplines, you must first master discipline itself. But you have no interest in this, so I have no interest in you! Now, get out.
Please, I have to learn. This could be my only chance.

Are you deaf? How can I teach you if you refuse to listen? Before learning firebending you must learn water and earth. Water is cool and soothing, earth is steady and stable, but fire, fire is alive! It breathes, it grows. Without the bender, a rock will not throw itself! But fire will spread and destroy everything in its path if one does not have the will to control it! That is its destiny! You are not ready! You are too weak!
You think I am weak?
Avatar Roku! No, No! I did not mean that.
I have mastered the elements a thousand times in a thousand lifetimes. Now, I must do it once again. You will teach the Avatar  firebending.
scene_description: [He raises his hand and ignites the tree behind Jeong Jeong.]

character_words: Yes, yes, I will teach you.
Really? That's great!
scene_description: [Raises his hands happily; Jeong Jeong groans in dismay fearing this may not end well.]

character_words: Widen your stance. Wider! Bend your knees. Now, concentrate.  Good, good!
Wait! What do I do now?
Silence! Talking is not concentrating! Look at your friend, is she talking?  Even that oaf knows to concentrate on what he's doing!
Silence! Talking is not concentrating! Look at your friend, is she talking?  Even that oaf knows to concentrate on what he's doing!
Hey!
But what am I concentrating on?
Feel the heat of the sun. It is the greatest source of fire. Yet, it is in complete balance with nature!
So when do I get to make some fire?
Concentrate!
Are we coming up here so I don't burn anything with my fire blasts?
No fire yet.
What?
Power in firebending comes from the breath. That is why you must master proper breath control.
You brought me up here to breathe?
Assume your stance.
Wider.
You're not even look—
Wider! Now, inhale through the nose and exhale through the mouth - without talking. Good. Keep going.
What are you doing here? I did not tell you to stop!
I've been breathing for hours!
You want to stop breathing?
I want you to stop wasting my time! I already know how to squat and breathe and feel the sun!  I wanna know how to shoot fire out of my fingertips!
scene_description: [Wiggles fingers to the ceiling to gesture this.]

character_words: I had a pupil once who had no interest in learning discipline. He was only concerned with the power of fire - how he could use it to destroy his opponents and wipe out the obstacles in his path, but fire is a horrible burden to bear. Its nature is to consume and without control it destroys everything around it.

I had a pupil once who had no interest in learning discipline. He was only concerned with the power of fire - how he could use it to destroy his opponents and wipe out the obstacles in his path, but fire is a horrible burden to bear. Its nature is to consume and without control it destroys everything around it.
scene_description: [While he was speaking, the camera cuts to Zhao on his boat; several men attack him, but he fends them off easily, leaving a fire in his wake. Cuts back to Jeong Jeong.]

character_words: Learn restraint, or risk destroying yourself and everything you love.
I thought about what you said, I promise I'll be more patient.
We're going to work with fire now.
Oh yeah!  I mean, let us begin.
scene_description: [Aang gets excited and airbends himself into the air. He quickly gets serious again.]

character_words: Concentrate on the fire. I want you to keep the flame from reaching the edges of the leaf for as long as you can.
Master! There is trouble.
What's going on?
Concentrate on your leaf!
This is the worst firebending instruction ever! All he does is leave me for hours to concentrate or breathe!
I'm sure there's a good reason.
But I'm ready to do so much more.
I did it! I made fire!
Aang, that's great, but you should take it slow.
Now that's some firebending!
Aang, you'll hurt yourself!
I wonder how that juggler did it.
Katara! I'm so sorry!
Katara, what's wrong?  What did you do!?
Katara, what's wrong?  What did you do!?
I'm sorry! It was an accident!
I told you we shouldn't mess around with this! Look what you did! You burned my sister!  You burned my sister!  This is all your fault!
I told you we shouldn't mess around with this! Look what you did! You burned my sister!  You burned my sister!  This is all your fault!
I know! Now pack your things. You must leave immediately.
I'm sorry, I didn't ...  I'm sorry!
I'm sorry, I didn't ...  I'm sorry!
You have healing abilities. The great benders of the Water Tribe sometimes have this ability. I've always wished I were blessed like you - free from this burning curse.
But you're a great master. You have powers that I will never know.

Water brings healing and life. But fire brings only destruction and pain. It forces those of us burdened with its care to walk a razor's edge between humanity and savagery. Eventually, we are torn apart.
Go get your friends and flee! Do not come back here or you will all be destroyed. Hurry!
Don't worry, men. My old teacher gave up fighting a long time ago.  Haven't you, Master Jeong Jeong?
scene_description: [The screen pans to Jeong Jeong. Suddenly, Zhao parts through the wall.]

character_words: NA
scene_description: [The screen goes for a close of Jeong Jeong's face, and a wide shot as he drops the wall of fire. Cut to Katara running up to where Sokka is preparing Appa to leave.]

character_words: Katara! Are you all right?
I'm fine, we've got to get out of here. Where's Aang?
Jeong Jeong tried to tell me that I wasn't ready. I wouldn't listen. I'm never going to firebend again.
You'll have to eventually.
No, never again.
It's okay, Aang. I'm healed.
What? How?
I'll explain later. But right now, we have to get out here. Zhao and his soldiers are attacking!
Where?
By the river. They captured Jeong Jeong.
I have to help him!
NA
scene_description: [The screen switches to an overhead shot of the beach. Zhao and his men stand against Jeong Jeong, before cutting to a closer shot.]

character_words: Look at you. You were once so great. I can't believe my former master has become nothing more than a simple savage.
It is you who have embraced savagery, Zhao.
It's Admiral Zhao, now.
That title will not help you against the Avatar. Do not try to fight him! You are no match!
I think I can handle a child.
I have never seen such raw power ...
Jeong Jeong!
We'll see. Men! Take the deserter!
It's a trick! He's run off into the woods. Find him!  Let's find out what my old master has taught you.
It's a trick! He's run off into the woods. Find him!  Let's find out what my old master has taught you.
You were Jeong Jeong's student?!
Until I got bored.
I see he taught you how to duck and run like a coward. But I doubt he showed you what a firebender is truly capable of!
Whoa! Wild shot!
I'll show you wild!
No self-control ...
Stand and fight, Avatar!
Oh, were we fighting? I thought you were just getting warmed up!
I was ...
I was ...
Is that all you got? Man, they'll make anyone an admiral these days!   Ahoy!  I'm Admiral Zhao!  I don't know why, but I thought you'd be better than Zuko.  Sloppy. Very sloppy.
Is that all you got? Man, they'll make anyone an admiral these days!   Ahoy!  I'm Admiral Zhao!  I don't know why, but I thought you'd be better than Zuko.  Sloppy. Very sloppy.
scene_description: [Aang cups his hands over his to sound louder.]

character_words: Is that all you got? Man, they'll make anyone an admiral these days!   Ahoy!  I'm Admiral Zhao!  I don't know why, but I thought you'd be better than Zuko.  Sloppy. Very sloppy.
Is that all you got? Man, they'll make anyone an admiral these days!   Ahoy!  I'm Admiral Zhao!  I don't know why, but I thought you'd be better than Zuko.  Sloppy. Very sloppy.
scene_description: [Zhao gets even angrier and Aang nearly gets blasted again.]

character_words: Is that all you got? Man, they'll make anyone an admiral these days!   Ahoy!  I'm Admiral Zhao!  I don't know why, but I thought you'd be better than Zuko.  Sloppy. Very sloppy.
scene_description: [Aang looks disappointed when he says this. His eyes go wide and he lies down on the deck fast enough to avoid being burnt. Mocking Zhao's firebending.]

character_words: Nowhere to run now, you little smart mouth!
You've lost this battle.
scene_description: [Having dodged a series of blasts from Zhao on several ships.]

character_words: Are you crazy? You haven't thrown a single blow!
No, but you have.  Jeong Jeong said you had no restraint.  Have a nice walk home!
scene_description: [He gestures around, all the boats are on fire and sinking.]

character_words: No, but you have.  Jeong Jeong said you had no restraint.  Have a nice walk home!
Aang, come on! Let's go!
Wait! Where's Jeong Jeong?
He disappeared. They all did.
Hey, where did everybody go?  Very funny guys
scene_description: [Walks into the now abandoned village; not amused.]

character_words: Hey, where did everybody go?  Very funny guys
Aang, you're burned! Let me help you.
scene_description: [Katara heals the burn on Aang's arm.]

character_words: Wow, that's good water.
When did you learn that?
I guess I always knew.
Oh ... Well then thanks for all the first aid over the years. Like when I fell into the greaseberry bramble.  Or that time I had two fishhooks in my thumb!
Oh ... Well then thanks for all the first aid over the years. Like when I fell into the greaseberry bramble.  Or that time I had two fishhooks in my thumb!
Two?
He tried to get the first fishhook out with another fishhook.
Oh, and the time that mink snake bit me! Thanks for healing that up. That was great. Really helpful.

So, travelers. The next time you think you hear a strange, large bird talking, take a closer look. It might not be a giant parrot, but a flying man. A member of a secret group of air walkers, who laugh at gravity, and laugh at those bound to the earth by it!
Aren't airbender stories the greatest?
scene_description: [Cuts to a wide shot, showing the gang and the other travelers surrounding a small campfire. The Storyteller, having finished his story, is going around collecting coins from the other travelers.]

character_words: Aren't airbender stories the greatest?
scene_description: [Talking to Katara and Sokka, who are sitting next to him.]

character_words: Was it realistic? Is that how it was back then?
I laugh at gravity all the time.  Gravity.
Jingle, jingle!
scene_description: [Arrives in front of the gang, having already collected money from the rest of the audience.]

character_words: Jingle, jingle!
scene_description: [Jingles the hat in front of Sokka, asking for money.]

character_words: Sorry ...
Aww, cheapskates!
Aww, cheapskates!
scene_description: [Walks away as Sokka puts the bugs back in his pocket.]

character_words: Hey! Thanks for the story.
Tell it to the cap, boy.
Aww, much obliged, little bat-thing.
It means a lot to hear airbender stories. It must have been a hundred years ago your great grandpa met them.
scene_description: [Having given up trying to find a coin.]

character_words: What are you prattling about, child? Great Grandpappy saw the air walkers last week.
What are you prattling about, child? Great Grandpappy saw the air walkers last week.
scene_description: [He indicates to the old man he was kneeling in front of before. The old man makes a sound in his throat akin to a laugh, and waves a greeting to Aang. The shot cuts to Aang, who has a shocked and disbelieving expression.]

character_words: Hey, we're almost at the Northern Air Temple. This is where they had the championships for Sky Bison polo.
scene_description: [Sitting on Appa's neck, steering. He is talking to Katara and Sokka, who are riding in Appa's saddle.]

character_words: Do you think we'll really find airbenders?
scene_description: [Moving to sit at the back of the saddle with her brother.]

character_words: You want me to be like you, or totally honest?
scene_description: [He is whittling a piece of wood. The design is indecipherable.]

character_words: Are you saying I'm a liar?
scene_description: [Crossing her arms, obviously angry with him.]

character_words: I'm saying you're an optimist. Same thing, basically.
Hey, guys, look at this!
They really are airbenders!
No, they're not.
scene_description: [His face falls as he sees the 'airbenders', and after Katara's excited outburst, he leans back and scowls while crossing his arms.]

character_words: What do you mean "they're not"? Those guys are flying!
Gliding maybe, but not flying. You can tell by the way they move, they're not airbending. Those people have no spirit.
scene_description: [Bitterly. He is glaring at the direction of the people flying around the temple.]

character_words: I don't know, Aang. That kid seemed pretty spirited.
I don't know, Aang. That kid seemed pretty spirited.
scene_description: [Katara indicates to the boy, who is flying dangerously close, but still laughing.]

character_words: We better find some solid ground, before it finds us.
scene_description: [The siblings land Appa on the temple courtyard, out of the hazardous sky. Aang is still flying with the boy, and seems to be having fun at the surprise competition.]

character_words: Go Teo! Show that bald kid how it's done!
scene_description: [Several children are on the ground, cheering on their friend.]

character_words: Hey there, you're pretty good!
scene_description: [The boy doesn't seem upset at Aang, and seems happy that he isn't angry for nearly flying into him.]

character_words: Yeah, I know. But I can do more than fancy gliding.
Wow, I don't think I can do that. But here's a good one.
scene_description: [He is looking amazed, before thinking of his own plan.]

character_words: What do you think?
It's great.
scene_description: [Annoyed; his face mimics the one Teo has just drawn.]

character_words: Hey, you're a real airbender. You must be the Avatar! That's amazing! I-I've heard stories about you!
Thanks.
Wow! This glider chair is incredible!
scene_description: [Sokka ignores all formalities, instead going over to Teo's chair and examining the strange shape and design.]

character_words: You think this is good, wait until you see the other stuff my dad designed.
Wow!
Yeah, my dad is the mastermind behind this whole place. Everything's powered by hot air.  It even pumps hot air currents outside to give us a lift while we're gliding.
scene_description: [Shows women using an elevator like contraption.]

character_words: This place is unbelievable.
Yeah, it's great, isn't it?
No, just unbelievable.
Aang used to come here a long time ago. I think he's a little shocked it's so ... different.
scene_description: [Katara approaches Teo, who seems disappointed at Aang's reaction.]

character_words: So better!
This is supposed to be the history of my people.
Ugh!
I'm sure some parts of the temple are still the same.
scene_description: [Walks up and puts her hand on his shoulder.]

character_words: It's nice to see that at least one part of the temple that isn't ruined.
Look out!
What the doodle? Don't you know enough to stay away from construction sites? We have to make room for the bathhouse!
scene_description: [He has approached Aang and the group, looking more surprised than upset.]

character_words: Do you know what you did!? You just destroyed something sacred! For a stupid bathhouse!
scene_description: [He turns to the mechanist and yells angrily at him.]

character_words: Well, people around here are starting to stink.
scene_description: [Waves his hand in front of his face, as though trying to dissipate a bad smell.]

character_words: This whole place stinks!
This whole place stinks!
scene_description: [Using his airbending, Aang flips the crane contraption off of the edge of the building.]

character_words: This is a sacred temple! You can't treat it this way!  I've seen it when the monks were here! I know what it's supposed to be like!
The monks? But,  you're twelve.
Dad, he's the Avatar. He used to come here a hundred years ago.
What are you doing? Who said you could be here?

Hmm, doing here ... A long time ago,  but not a hundred years, my people became refugees  after a terrible flood. My infant son,  Teo, was badly hurt and lost his mother.  I needed somewhere to rebuild and I stumbled across this place. Couldn't believe it! Everywhere! Pictures of flying people! But empty,  nobody home. Then,  I came across these fan-like contraptions!

Hmm, doing here ... A long time ago,  but not a hundred years, my people became refugees  after a terrible flood. My infant son,  Teo, was badly hurt and lost his mother.  I needed somewhere to rebuild and I stumbled across this place. Couldn't believe it! Everywhere! Pictures of flying people! But empty,  nobody home. Then,  I came across these fan-like contraptions!

Hmm, doing here ... A long time ago,  but not a hundred years, my people became refugees  after a terrible flood. My infant son,  Teo, was badly hurt and lost his mother.  I needed somewhere to rebuild and I stumbled across this place. Couldn't believe it! Everywhere! Pictures of flying people! But empty,  nobody home. Then,  I came across these fan-like contraptions!

I needed somewhere to rebuild and I stumbled across this place. Couldn't believe it! Everywhere! Pictures of flying people! But empty,  nobody home. Then,  I came across these fan-like contraptions!

Hmm, doing here ... A long time ago,  but not a hundred years, my people became refugees  after a terrible flood. My infant son,  Teo, was badly hurt and lost his mother.  I needed somewhere to rebuild and I stumbled across this place. Couldn't believe it! Everywhere! Pictures of flying people! But empty,  nobody home. Then,  I came across these fan-like contraptions!

Hmm, doing here ... A long time ago,  but not a hundred years, my people became refugees  after a terrible flood. My infant son,  Teo, was badly hurt and lost his mother.  I needed somewhere to rebuild and I stumbled across this place. Couldn't believe it! Everywhere! Pictures of flying people! But empty,  nobody home. Then,  I came across these fan-like contraptions!
scene_description: [Does a airplane like gesture, like he's flying up to Aang.]

character_words: Our gliders.

Yes! Little, light flying machines!  They gave me an idea. Build a new life for my son, in the air! Then everyone will be on equal ground! So to speak. We're just in the process of improving upon what's already here.  And, after all, isn't that what nature does?

Yes! Little, light flying machines!  They gave me an idea. Build a new life for my son, in the air! Then everyone will be on equal ground! So to speak. We're just in the process of improving upon what's already here.  And, after all, isn't that what nature does?
scene_description: [Katara wipes her tears on Aang's shirt, and Sokka looks like he's holding back tears.]

character_words: Nature knows where to stop.
I suppose that's true. Unfortunately, progress has a way of getting away from us. Look at the time!  Come!  The pulley system must be oiled before dark.
I suppose that's true. Unfortunately, progress has a way of getting away from us. Look at the time!  Come!  The pulley system must be oiled before dark.
Wait, how can you tell the time from that thing? The notches all look the same.
The candle will tell us. Watch.
You put spark powder in the candle!
Four flashes. So it's exactly four hours past mid-day. Or, as I call it: four o'candle.  If you like that, wait till you see my finger-safe knife sharpener.  Only took me three tries to get it right.
scene_description: [Sokka laughs. Cut to a frontal shot of the mechanist, pleased that Sokka is interested.]

character_words: Four flashes. So it's exactly four hours past mid-day. Or, as I call it: four o'candle.  If you like that, wait till you see my finger-safe knife sharpener.  Only took me three tries to get it right.
scene_description: [He holds up his left hand, revealing that three of the fingers are made of wood.]

character_words: Four flashes. So it's exactly four hours past mid-day. Or, as I call it: four o'candle.  If you like that, wait till you see my finger-safe knife sharpener.  Only took me three tries to get it right.
scene_description: [He pulls off the three wooden fingers, and throws them into Sokka's hand.]

character_words: Aaah!
Follow me!
scene_description: [Pokes Sokka in the back with his one remaining finger and gestures for him to come.]

character_words: Follow me!
Hey, Aang. I want to show you something.
I just can't get over it. There's not a single thing that's the same.
I don't know about that. The temple might be different  but the creatures that live here  are probably direct descendants of the ones who lived here a long time ago.
scene_description: [Picks up hermit crab from the ground.]

character_words: I don't know about that. The temple might be different  but the creatures that live here  are probably direct descendants of the ones who lived here a long time ago.
You're right. They're kind of keepers of the temple's origins.
You're right. They're kind of keepers of the temple's origins.
scene_description: [Katara hands it to Aang. It moves around in his hand and he smiles.]

character_words: Besides, there's one part of the temple that hasn't changed at all.
Hey, it's just like the one in the other temple!
Only an airbender can open it, so inside it's completely untouched. Just the way the monks left it. I've always wondered what it's like in there ...
Aang?
scene_description: [She looks at him, as though slightly scared of his reaction. Her tone is gentle and questioning.]

character_words: I'm sorry. This is the last part of the temple that's the same as it was. I want it to stay that way.
scene_description: [He turns away from the door and his friends.]

character_words: I completely understand. I just wanted you to know that it's here.
scene_description: [Somewhat disappointed, although he tries not to let it show.]

character_words: Thanks.
These lanterns are terrible. I can't see!  Why would you want to use fireflies for light?
scene_description: [Opens the top of his lantern only to find them filled with fireflies.]

character_words: These lanterns are terrible. I can't see!  Why would you want to use fireflies for light?
Hey! Close that up! They'll get loose!  Fireflies are a non-flammable light source.
Hey! Close that up! They'll get loose!  Fireflies are a non-flammable light source.
Cover your nose  and hold your breath.
Cover your nose  and hold your breath.
scene_description: [The mechanist opens an eye slot in the door, both look inside a pitch-black room.]

character_words: Okay ... so you brought me all the way down here to see an empty room.
scene_description: [Nasally, due to his nose being blocked.]

character_words: Wrong. It's filled to the brim with natural gas. Came across it my first time here. Unfortunately, I was carrying a torch at the time. Nearly blew my self and the whole place even more sky high! Thought my eyebrows would never grow back.  Anyway, there's a vital problem that needs solving. From time to time, we have gas leaks. And they're nearly impossible to find.

Wrong. It's filled to the brim with natural gas. Came across it my first time here. Unfortunately, I was carrying a torch at the time. Nearly blew my self and the whole place even more sky high! Thought my eyebrows would never grow back.  Anyway, there's a vital problem that needs solving. From time to time, we have gas leaks. And they're nearly impossible to find.
So, this place is an explosion waiting to happen.
Yes, until I figure out how to locate something I can't see, hear, smell, or touch.
The wind will carry you. It supports something inside you. Something even lighter than air.  And that something takes over when you fly.
scene_description: [Shows Katara holding a glider and standing at the edge of a building.]

character_words: The wind will carry you. It supports something inside you. Something even lighter than air.  And that something takes over when you fly.
scene_description: [Katara puts down her glider and looks up at the other people flying.]

character_words: I've changed my mind. I think I was born without that something.
Impossible! Everybody has it!
Spirit.
What?
Spirit. That's the something you're talking about.
Yeah, I suppose it is.
Are you ready?
No!  Aaaaah!  I can't believe I'm flying!
No!  Aaaaah!  I can't believe I'm flying!
scene_description: [Starts to fall down wards, but eventually starts to fly straight. Her scream peters off as she begins laughing.]

character_words: Just make sure you keep your mouth closed so you don't swallow a bug!
scene_description: [Shows Momo flying by and eating a bug.]

character_words: Teo was right about the air. All I had to do was trust it, let it carry me.
Even though Teo's not an airbender, he really does have the spirit of one!  I've been thinking. If you want to see what's in that room, I'd be happy to open the door for you.
scene_description: [Aang lands beside him on the building.]

character_words: Great!
Wait!  How do I land this thing? What if I land over a-ack-ack-bleck! Bug! Bug! Ack, that was a bug!
I said don't touch anything!  Oh, don't worry. That experiment's old,  and that egg was just part of last week's lunch.
scene_description: [Comes over to help Sokka pick things up.]

character_words: I said don't touch anything!  Oh, don't worry. That experiment's old,  and that egg was just part of last week's lunch.
Ugh! Week old egg smell!
Quick, find that egg!
scene_description: [Both crawl around the floor looking for it.]

character_words: I can't believe I'm finally going to see what's inside!
How can something so small that you can't even see it make such a big stink!?
That's the solution to our problem!
Yeah ...  if we put a whole mess of rotten eggs in the cellar where the gas seeps up ...
... The gas will mix with the smell of rotten eggs!
Then, if there's a leak ...
... You smell rotten eggs! Then, you just follow your nose to the place where the smell is coming from ...
And plug up the hole where the gas is escaping!
You're a genius!
scene_description: [Bell rings on one of his desks.]

character_words: Something's wrong.  I've go to go!
Something's wrong.  I've go to go!
scene_description: [Runs out the door and Sokka follows.]

character_words: This is a nightmare.
You don't understand!
You're making weapons for the Fire Nation!
You make weapons for the Fire Nation?!
Explain all this! Now!

It was about a year after we moved here. Fire Nation soldiers found our settlement. You were too young to remember this, Teo. They were going to destroy everything! Burn it to the ground! I pleaded with them, I begged them to spare us! They asked what I had to offer. I offered ... my services. You must understand. I did this for you!
scene_description: [He is hesitant, but resigned as he begins to explain.]

character_words: When are they coming?
Soon.  Very soon.
You can't give them more weapons.
If I don't give them what they want, they will destroy this place!
scene_description: [The model of the hot air balloon catches fire and crashes. The mechanist puts the fire out with a cloth.]

character_words: How can I be proud of you when your inventions are being used for murder?
I need some time to think.  You need to leave! Go!
We're not leaving!
Then hide! Quickly!
scene_description: [They hide behind some of his inventions. the mechanist pulls a rope that opens a trapdoor, and a war minister from the Fire Nation is lifted into the room.]

character_words: You know better than to keep me waiting. Give me what you owe us so we can be on our way.  Well? Is there a problem?
No, right this way.
No, right this way.
The deal's off.
The Avatar ...
Aang, don't get involved!
If I don't get what I came here for, the Fire Nation will burn this place to rubble!
Get out of here!  You're leaving empty-handed!
scene_description: [Slaps him in the face with an air swipe; continues off screen.]

character_words: Then the destruction of this temple  will be on your head!
Then the destruction of this temple  will be on your head!
scene_description: [He leaves through the trap door and Aang airbends it shut.]

character_words: This is bad.
Very bad!
Aang, what are we going to do? How can we possibly keep them all away?
I'll tell you how. We have something they don't.  Air power. We control the sky. That's something the Fire Nation can't do. We can win!
I want to help.
Good. We'll need it.
We finally got the war balloon working, thanks to Sokka. This boy's a genius!
Thank you. You're a genius!
Thank you!

See, the problem with the old war balloon was you could get it air-borne,  but once it did, it just kept going.  You could put a hole in the top, but then all the hot air would escape. So the question became, how do you keep a lid on hot air?

See, the problem with the old war balloon was you could get it air-borne,  but once it did, it just kept going.  You could put a hole in the top, but then all the hot air would escape. So the question became, how do you keep a lid on hot air?
scene_description: [He pulls a string connected to the model, putting it on the table.]

character_words: Ugh, if only we knew.
A lid is actually the answer. If you control the hot air, you control the war balloon.
Huh, that's actually pretty smart.
Okay, we've got four kinds of bombs:  smoke, slime, fire, and ...
scene_description: [He begins listing them off on his fingers.]

character_words: Stink! Never underestimate the power of stink!
They're coming!
Are we ready?
Yes. But where's Sokka with the war balloon?
We'll have to start without it.
Take them out of the sky. Now!
We've got them on the run! We need more slime!
Those things are unstoppable!
I think I know how they work. I remember my dad tinkering with the counterbalancing system. Something to do with water. Works great, huh?
scene_description: [Thoughtfully, trying to remember what he knew.]

character_words: Water? Can you get me close to one?
No problem!
We're out of bombs!
Come on Sokka.  Where's that war balloon?
Hey, why aren't they shooting at us?
The insignia!  They think we're on their side.
Then I guess they won't see this coming.
Then I guess they won't see this coming.
scene_description: [Slices rope attached to a large bomb.]

character_words: Bombs away!
scene_description: [Cut to view of both balloon and advancing army.]

character_words: Oh no, that was the last one.
scene_description: [Cut to tanks beginning to scale the cliffs.]

character_words: Wait a second. You smell that?
scene_description: [Cut back to Sokka and the mechanist.]

character_words: Rotten eggs!  There! That's were the gas is escaping.
scene_description: [Cut to a view of the balloon and a large crevice in the ground below.]

character_words: What are you doing? That's our fuel source.
It's the only bomb we've got.
Look! They're retreating!
We're going down!
No, Sokka! Hold on!
scene_description: [Cut to Aang and Katara on balcony.]

character_words: No, Sokka! Hold on!
scene_description: [Aang jumps on his glider and flies toward them.]

character_words: Get ready!
scene_description: [Cut to close-up of Sokka swinging his boomerang around with a rope attached, the mechanist behind him.]

character_words: You know what?  I'm really glad you guys all live here now.  I realized, it's like the hermit crab.  Maybe you weren't born here, but you found this empty shell and made it your home. And now you protect each other.
scene_description: [Cut to close-up panning shot of Sokka, Katara, Aang, Teo, and the mechanist.]

character_words: You know what?  I'm really glad you guys all live here now.  I realized, it's like the hermit crab.  Maybe you weren't born here, but you found this empty shell and made it your home. And now you protect each other.
scene_description: [Cut to shot above Aang picking up a hermit crab.]

character_words: You know what?  I'm really glad you guys all live here now.  I realized, it's like the hermit crab.  Maybe you weren't born here, but you found this empty shell and made it your home. And now you protect each other.
scene_description: [Cut to close-up of Aang's hands surrounding the hermit crab.]

character_words: That means a lot, coming from you.
Aang you were right about air power. As long as we've got the skies, we'll have the Fire Nation on the run.
Aang you were right about air power. As long as we've got the skies, we'll have the Fire Nation on the run.
scene_description: [Cut to wide-view of temple grounds, crowd cheering.]

character_words: This defeat is the gateway to many victories.
scene_description: [Cut to Qin, surrounded by two other ministers.]

character_words: I'm not one to complain,  but can't Appa fly any higher?
scene_description: [Hanging lazily over the back of Appa's saddle; grumpily.]

character_words: I'm not one to complain,  but can't Appa fly any higher?
scene_description: [Side-view shows Appa flying just above the water.]

character_words: I have an idea! Why don't we all get on your  back and you could fly us to the North Pole?!
I have an idea! Why don't we all get on your  back and you could fly us to the North Pole?!
scene_description: [Points angrily at Sokka; Katara briefly looks at Aang, but resumes her stare in front of her.]

character_words: I'd love to.  Climb on everyone,  Sokka's ready for take off.
scene_description: [Back-view of Sokka looking over his shoulder; sarcastically.]

character_words: I'd love to.  Climb on everyone,  Sokka's ready for take off.
I'd love to.  Climb on everyone,  Sokka's ready for take off.
Look, we're all just a little tired and cranky because we've been flying for two days straight.
scene_description: [Waving her hands up and down while shifting looks between Aang and Sokka.]

character_words: And for what? We can't even find the Northern Water Tribe.  There's nothing up here.
scene_description: [Frontal shot, Momo is now on his lap; annoyed.]

character_words: And for what? We can't even find the Northern Water Tribe.  There's nothing up here.
scene_description: [Cut to a wide side-shot, revealing Appa floating along a vast ocean of only water and ice.]

character_words: They're waterbenders!  We found the Water Tribe!
He's heading north. The Northern Water Tribe. The Avatar needs to master waterbending. He's looking for a teacher.
Then what are we waiting for? Let's go get him!

Patience, Captain Li. This isn't some little earth village we can just march into. The Water Tribe is a great nation. There's a reason they've survived a hundred years of war. The frozen tundra is treacherous, the landscape itself is an icy fortress. We'll need a massive invasion force.
There it is!
The Northern Water Tribe.
We're finally here.
I can't believe how many waterbenders live up here!
We'll find a master to teach us, no problem.
This place is beautiful.
Yeah ... she is ...
Winter, spring ... Summer, and fall ... Winter, spring ... Summer, and fall ... Four seasons ... four loves ... Four seasons ... for love.

Tonight, we celebrate the arrival of our brother and sister from the Southern Tribe. And they have brought with them, someone very special, someone whom many of us believed disappeared from the world until now ... the Avatar!  We also celebrate my daughter's sixteenth birthday. Princess Yue is now of marrying age!
Thank you, Father. May the great Ocean and Moon Spirits watch over us during these troubled times!
Now, Master Pakku and his students will perform!
Hi there. Sokka, Southern Water Tribe.
Very nice to meet you.
Very nice to meet you.
scene_description: [They nervously share an awkward silence for a moment.]

character_words: So ... uhhh ... you're a princess, huh?  You know, back in my tribe, I'm kind of like a prince, myself.
So ... uhhh ... you're a princess, huh?  You know, back in my tribe, I'm kind of like a prince, myself.
So ... uhhh ... you're a princess, huh?  You know, back in my tribe, I'm kind of like a prince, myself.
Ha, prince of what?
A lot of things! Do you mind? I'm trying to have a conversation here.
My apologies, Prince Sokka.
So, it looks like I'm going to be in town for a while. I'm thinking ... maybe we could ... do an activity, together?
Do an activity?
Very smooth ...
Master Pakku, meet your newest student, the Avatar.
Just because you're destined to save the world, don't expect any special treatment.
My friend and I can't wait to start training with you! After we relax for a couple of days.
If you want to relax, then I suggest visiting a tropical island. If not, I'll see you both at sunrise. Good night.
For the last time, I'm not playing the tsungi horn!
No, it's about our plans. There's a bit of a problem.
I'm taking your crew.
What?!
What?!
I've recruited them for a little expedition to the North Pole.
Uncle, is that true?
I'm afraid so. He's taking everyone ...  even the cook.
scene_description: [Putting his arm over his face in woe.]

character_words: Sorry you won't be there to watch me capture the Avatar. But I can't have you getting in my way again.
No!
scene_description: [Cuts to a furious Zuko. Zuko charges at Zhao in anger, but Iroh cuts him off.]

character_words: I didn't know you were skilled with broadswords, Prince Zuko.
I'm not. They're antiques. Just decorative.
Have you heard of the Blue Spirit, General Iroh?
Just rumors. I don't think he is real.

He's real, all right.  He's a criminal, and an enemy of the Fire Nation. But I have a feeling justice will catch up with him soon.  General Iroh, the offer to join my mission still stands ... if you change your mind.
scene_description: [He hands the broad sword to Iroh.]

character_words: He's real, all right.  He's a criminal, and an enemy of the Fire Nation. But I have a feeling justice will catch up with him soon.  General Iroh, the offer to join my mission still stands ... if you change your mind.
I've waited for this day my whole life. I finally get to learn from a real waterbending master!
Good morning, Master Pakku!
No, please, march right in. I'm not concentrating or anything.
scene_description: [Drops the water, and speaks in an annoyed tone.]

character_words: Uhhh ... This is my friend, Katara. The one I told you about?
I'm sorry, I think there's been a misunderstanding. You didn't tell me your friend was a girl. In our tribe, it is forbidden for women to learn waterbending.
What do you mean you won't teach me? I didn't travel across the entire world so you could tell me no!
No.
But there must be other female waterbenders in your tribe!
Here, the women learn from Yugoda to use their waterbending to heal. I'm sure she would be happy to take you as her student, despite your bad attitude.
I don't want to heal, I want to fight!
I can see that. But our tribe has customs, rules.
Well, your rules stink!
Yeah, they're not fair! If you won't teach Katara, then ...
Then what?
Then I won't learn from you!
Well, have fun teaching yourself! I'm sure you'll do a great job.
Wait! Aang didn't mean that!  You can't risk your training for me. You have to learn from Master Pakku, even if he is a big jerk.
Why don't we get started, then?
scene_description: [Aang gets hit with a water blast from him.]

character_words: Princess Yue, good morning! How about that picnic last night? Boy, your dad sure does know how to throw a party.
I'm happy you enjoyed yourself.
Well, it wasn't as much fun after you left.  So, I'm still hoping we can see more of each other.
Do an activity, you mean?
Yes ... at a place ... for some time.
I'd love to. I'll meet you on that bridge tonight.
I'd love to. I'll meet you on that bridge tonight.
Great! I'll see you– Ah!
Sorry.
That's okay, it was worth it. See you tonight.
I'm very impressed. You all seem highly qualified for the mission I have in mind.
That's some tasty gold.
What do you need us to do?
I believe you're acquainted with Prince Zuko.
Uhhh ... Hi. Are you Yugoda?
Are you here for the healing lesson?
I guess I am.
scene_description: [Looks at all the young girls, and speaks in a disappointed tone.]

character_words: Welcome ... welcome!
You're moving the water around, but you're not feeling the push and pull.
I'm trying ...
Maybe that move is too advanced for you. Why don't you try an easier one?
Thanks for the lesson.
So, who's the lucky boy?
Huh?
Your betrothal necklace. You're getting married, right?
Ah ... No. I don't think I'm ready for that yet. My grandmother gave my mother this necklace and my mother passed it down to me.
I recognize this carving! I don't know why I didn't realize sooner; you're the spitting image of Kanna!
Wait, how do you know my Gran-Gran's name?
When I was about your age, I was friends with Kanna. She was born here in the Northern Tribe.
She never told me.
Your grandmother had an arranged marriage with a young waterbender. He carved that necklace for her.
If Gran-Gran was engaged, why did she leave?
I don't know. That's always been a mystery to me. She left without saying goodbye.
Good luck!
The crew wanted me to wish you safe travels.
scene_description: [Cut to a shot of Prince Zuko lying in bed in the foreground of his cabin. The door opens and Iroh sticks his head in. Entering.]

character_words: Good riddance to those traitors.
It's a lovely night for a walk. Why don't you join me? It would clear your head.  Or just stay in your room and sit in the dark. Whatever makes you happy.
Careful with the blasting jelly!
Uncle? Uncle, is that you?
Uncle? Uncle, is that you?
Zuko!  Zuko ...
scene_description: [Runs back to see the ship destroyed.]

character_words: Hi, Princess Yue. I made you something. I carved it myself.
It's a bear.
Actually, it's supposed to be a fish.  See, it has a fin.
Oh. I'm sorry, I made a mistake. I shouldn't have asked you to come here.
How's warrior training going?
That bad?
No, it's Princess Yue. I don't get it, one minute she wants to go out with me, and the next, she's telling me to get lost.  So, how's waterbending training?
Master Poophead won't teach her because she's a girl.
Why don't you just teach her, Aang?
Why didn't I think of that? At night, you can teach me whatever moves you learn from Master Pakku! That way, you have someone to practice with, and I get to learn waterbending! Everyone's happy!
I'm not happy.
But you're never happy. Come on, Aang.
Master Pakku said this move is all about sinking and floating.
Master Pakku said this move is all about sinking and floating.
I got it!
That was amazing!
That wasn't me.
I was just showing Katara a few moves.
You have disrespected me, my teachings, and my entire culture.
I'm sorry, I ...
You are no longer welcome as my student.
What do you want me to do? Force Master Pakku to take Aang back as his student?
Yes ... please!
I suspect he might change his mind, if you swallow your pride and apologize to him.
Fine.
I'm waiting, little girl.
No.  No way am I apologizing to a sour old man like you!
No.  No way am I apologizing to a sour old man like you!
Uhhh ... Katara?
I'll be outside if you're man enough to fight me.
I'm sure she didn't mean that.
Yeah, I think she did.
I'm devastated to hear about Prince Zuko. Just ... devastated.
The Fire Lord will not be pleased when he learns who was responsible.
You know who was behind the attack?
Yes ... pirates. We had a run-in with them a while back. They wanted revenge.
So, have you reconsidered my offer?
Yes, I accept. It will be an honor to serve as your general. To the Fire Nation!
To victory!
Are you crazy, Katara? You're not going to win this fight!
I know! I don't care!
You don't have to do this for me. I can find another teacher.
I'm not doing it for you! Someone needs to slap some sense into that guy!  So, you decided to show up?  Aren't you going to fight?
I'm not doing it for you! Someone needs to slap some sense into that guy!  So, you decided to show up?  Aren't you going to fight?
Go back to the healing huts with the other women where you belong.  Fine. You want to learn to fight so bad? Study closely!  Don't worry, I'm not going to hurt you!
scene_description: [Katara tightens her fist and sends water whips at him. Pakku halts.]

character_words: Go back to the healing huts with the other women where you belong.  Fine. You want to learn to fight so bad? Study closely!  Don't worry, I'm not going to hurt you!
scene_description: [He bends two streams of water from nearby pools and sends them both at a charging Katara, who falls back. He joins the two streams together, encircling both Katara and himself in a forceful ring of water.]

character_words: You can't knock me down!
Go, Katara!
Well, I'm impressed. You are an excellent waterbender.
But you still won't teach me, will you?
No.
This fight is over.
Come back here. I'm not finished yet!
Yes, you are.  This is my necklace ...
No, it's not. It's mine! Give it back!
I made this sixty years ago for the love of my life ... for Kanna.
My Gran-Gran was supposed to marry you?
Our plan is working perfectly. Zhao doesn't suspect a thing.
You didn't have to do this.
No nephew of mine is going to stow away on a ship without some backup.
Thank you, Uncle.
Someone's coming. Stay hidden until we get to the North Pole and the Avatar will be yours. Good luck.
I carved this necklace for your grandmother when we got engaged. I thought we would have a long, happy life together. I loved her.
But she didn't love you, did she? It was an arranged marriage. Gran-Gran wouldn't let your tribe's stupid customs run her life. That's why she left. It must have taken a lot of courage.
Go get her.
What do you want from me?
Nothing. I just want you to know, I think you're beautiful, and, I never thought a girl like you would even notice a guy like me.
You don't understand.
No, no. See, that's the thing. I think I do understand now. You're a Princess, and I'm ... I'm just a Southern peasant.
No, Sokka ...
It's okay. You don't have to say anything. I'll see you around, okay?  Okay, now I'm really confused. Happy, but confused.
I do like you, a lot. But we can't be together, and not for the reason you think. It's because ... I'm engaged.  I'm sorry.
scene_description: [She pulls down the collar of her coat and shows him her betrothal necklace.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Come back!

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Hello, Aang.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Roku!

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Shelter.
scene_description: [Drags Aang into the cave and ties him up.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Roku, the Water Tribe's under attack. I need to find the Ocean and the Moon Spirits.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: The Ocean and the Moon are ancient spirits. They crossed over the Spirit World to the mortal world very near the beginning. There is only one spirit I know of who is old enough to remember.
scene_description: [Pops out of the reflection in front of Aang.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Who?

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: The spirit's name is Koh, but he is very dangerous. They call him the Face Stealer.  When you speak with him, you must be very careful to show no emotion at all. Not the slightest expression, or he will steal your face.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: The spirit's name is Koh, but he is very dangerous. They call him the Face Stealer.  When you speak with him, you must be very careful to show no emotion at all. Not the slightest expression, or he will steal your face.
scene_description: [Aang looks even more horrified but calmly nods, understanding the situation.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: I finally have you, but I can't get you home because of this blizzard.  There's always something. Not that you would understand. You're like my sister. Everything always came easy to her. She's a firebending prodigy, and everyone adores her. My father says she was born lucky. He says I was lucky to be born. I don't need luck, though. I don't want it. I've always had to struggle and fight and that's made me strong. It's made me who I am.
scene_description: [Stands up and looks outside the cave.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: I don't need to remind you we have a time limit. If we don't defeat the Water Tribe before the full moon rises, they will be undefeatable.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: I assure you I have everything under control. I intend to remove the moon as a factor.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Remove the moon? How?

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Admiral Choi! Prepare to meet your fate!

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: As I was saying, years ago I stumble upon a great and powerful secret: the identity of the Moon Spirit's mortal form.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: What?

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: I was a young lieutenant serving under General Shu in the Earth Kingdom.  I discovered a hidden library. Underground, in fact. I tore through scroll after scroll. One of them contained a detailed illustration, and the words "moon" and "ocean". I knew then that these spirits could be found and killed.  And that it was my destiny to do so.
scene_description: [Fade to a flashback of a young Zhao tearing through scrolls in a library.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: I was a young lieutenant serving under General Shu in the Earth Kingdom.  I discovered a hidden library. Underground, in fact. I tore through scroll after scroll. One of them contained a detailed illustration, and the words "moon" and "ocean". I knew then that these spirits could be found and killed.  And that it was my destiny to do so.
scene_description: [The memory ends with a close up of Zhao's eyes, fade to the present.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Zhao, the spirits are not to be trifled with!

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Yes, yes ... I know you fear the spirits, Iroh. I've heard rumors about your journey into the Spirit World. But the Ocean and Moon gave up their immortality to become a part of our world. And now they will face the consequences.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: You're just a curly tailed blue nose.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Aaahhh!  Show no fear. Show no emotion at all.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Aaahhh!  Show no fear. Show no emotion at all.
scene_description: [Aang takes a deep breath and speaks with his and Avatar Roku's voices combined.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Hello? I-I'm looking for a spirit named 'Koh'.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Welcome!

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Thank you.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Thank you.
scene_description: [Koh wheels around Aang to look at him from behind. His voice is low and melodic, almost purring.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: My old friend, the Avatar. It's been a long time.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: You know me?

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: How could I forget  you? One of your previous incarnations tried to slay me! Nearly eight or nine hundred years ago.
scene_description: [Now facing the camera, away from Aang.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: How could I forget  you? One of your previous incarnations tried to slay me! Nearly eight or nine hundred years ago.
scene_description: [He switches with a "winking" effect, as if some sort of nictitating membrane closes briefly over the old face to reveal a new one, to a mad face of a middle-aged, mustached man with thick eyebrows, long mustache, and beard; angrily.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: I didn't know that. Why did he, or I, try to kill you?

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Oh, it was something about stealing the face of someone you loved.  Of course, that's all behind us. Why should I hold a grudge against you for something in a past life? After all, you're a different person now.  You've come to me ... with a new face.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Oh, it was something about stealing the face of someone you loved.  Of course, that's all behind us. Why should I hold a grudge against you for something in a past life? After all, you're a different person now.  You've come to me ... with a new face.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Oh, it was something about stealing the face of someone you loved.  Of course, that's all behind us. Why should I hold a grudge against you for something in a past life? After all, you're a different person now.  You've come to me ... with a new face.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Guess we'll be here awhile.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Don't worry, Prince Zuko can't be getting too far in this weather.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: I'm not worried they'll get away in the blizzard. I'm worried that they won't.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: They're not going to die in this blizzard. If we know anything, it's that Zuko never gives up. They'll survive, and we'll find them.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: It's been a long time since I've added a child's face to my collection.  So ... how may I help you?

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: It's been a long time since I've added a child's face to my collection.  So ... how may I help you?
scene_description: [His face is now that of an owl.]

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: I need to find the moon and the ocean.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Their spirit names are Tui and La, push and pull. And that has been the nature of their relationship for all time.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Please. Help me find them. An entire culture could be destroyed if I don't get their help.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Please. Help me find them. An entire culture could be destroyed if I don't get their help.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Oh, you think you need their help.  Actually it's quite the other way round.  Someone's going to kill them!

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Oh, you think you need their help.  Actually it's quite the other way round.  Someone's going to kill them!

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Oh, you think you need their help.  Actually it's quite the other way round.  Someone's going to kill them!

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: What do you mean? How can I find them and protect them?

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: You've already met them, actually.  Tui and La, your moon and ocean, have always circled each other in an eternal dance. They balance each other, push and pull, life and death,  good and evil, yin and yang.

character_words: The spirits are in trouble, I need to get back to the physical world.

character_words: A friend is here, to guide you back.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Hei Bai!

character_words: We'll be following this map to a very special location. And when we get there, we're going fishing.

character_words: This is where I came in, but how do I get back?

character_words: Good riddance.

character_words: Look, that's gotta be Aang! Yip-yip!

character_words: Welcome back.

character_words: It's good to be back.

character_words: That won't be enough to escape.

character_words: Appa!

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Trust me Zuko, it's not going to be much of a match.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: Hey, this is some quality rope!

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: We need to get to the oasis; the spirits are in trouble!

character_words: Wait, we can't just leave him here.

character_words: Sure we can. Let's go.

character_words: No, if we leave him he'll die.

character_words: I feel faint.
