chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: I owe the Moon Spirit my life.

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: What do you mean?

chapter: The Siege of the North, Part 2
character_words: When I was born I was very sick and very weak.  Most babies cry when they're born, but I was born as if I was asleep, my eyes closed.  Our healers did everything they could.  They told my mother and father I was going to die.  My father pleaded with the spirits to save me.  That night, beneath the full moon, he brought me to the oasis and placed me in the pond.  My dark hair turned white.  I opened my eyes and began to cry, and they knew I would live.  That's why my mother named me Yue.  For the moon.

character_words: I have to do this.

character_words: You must be proud.

Fly straight to the Earth Kingdom base to the east of here. General Fong will provide you with an escort to Omashu. There, you will be safe to begin your earthbending training with King Bumi.
scene_description: [Aang looks up at Katara, who is sitting on Appa and looks back.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Say hi to Gran-Gran for me!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: This is what I've been missing. Who knew floating on a piece of driftwood for three weeks with no food or water, and sea vultures waiting to pluck out your liver could make one so tense?  I see. It's the anniversary, isn't it?
scene_description: [Looks at the clearly unhappy Zuko, walks over to him, and sits down on the ground.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Three years ago today, I was banished. I lost it all.  I want it back. I want the Avatar, I want my honor, my throne. I want my father not to think I'm worthless.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Three years ago today, I was banished. I lost it all.  I want it back. I want the Avatar, I want my honor, my throne. I want my father not to think I'm worthless.

character_words: Three years ago today, I was banished. I lost it all.  I want it back. I want the Avatar, I want my honor, my throne. I want my father not to think I'm worthless.

character_words: I'm sure he doesn't. Why would he banish you if he didn't care?  Uh, that came out wrong, didn't it?
scene_description: [Zuko gets up and walks away; he grimaces soon after; to the massagers.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I'm sure he doesn't. Why would he banish you if he didn't care?  Uh, that came out wrong, didn't it?
scene_description: [They look at each other in confusion.]

character_words: My brother and my uncle have disgraced the Fire Lord, and have brought shame on all of us. You might have mixed feelings about attacking members of the Royal Family. I understand. But I assure you, if you hesitate, I will not hesitate to bring you down. Dismissed.
scene_description: [Stepping out of the carriage and walking down the line of soldiers.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Princess, I'm afraid the tides will not allow us to bring the ship into port before nightfall.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I'm sorry, captain, but I do not know much about the tides. Could you explain something to me?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Of course, Your Highness.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Do the tides command this ship?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I'm afraid I don't understand.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: You said the tides would not allow us to bring the ship in.  Do the tides command this ship?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: No, princess.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: And if I were to have you thrown overboard, would the tides think twice about smashing you against the rocky shore?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: No, princess.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Well then, maybe you should worry less about the tides who have already made up their mind about killing you, and worry more about me, who's still mulling it over.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Well then, maybe you should worry less about the tides who have already made up their mind about killing you, and worry more about me, who's still mulling it over.

character_words: I'll pull us in.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: There it is!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Welcome, Avatar Aang!  I am General Fong, and welcome, to all of you great heroes! Appa, Momo, brave Sokka, the mighty Katara ...
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the team stretching after riding on Appa.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Mighty Katara? I like that.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Not bad, not bad.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Avatar Aang, we were all amazed at the stories of how you singlehandedly wiped out an entire Fire Navy fleet at the North Pole.  I can't imagine what it feels like to wield such devastating power. It's an awesome responsibility.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Avatar Aang, we were all amazed at the stories of how you singlehandedly wiped out an entire Fire Navy fleet at the North Pole.  I can't imagine what it feels like to wield such devastating power. It's an awesome responsibility.
scene_description: [Closes up to Fong, stroking his beard.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I try not to think about it too much.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Avatar, you're ready to face the Fire Lord now.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: What? No I'm not!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Aang still needs to master all four elements.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Why? With the kind of power he possesses, power enough to destroy hundreds of battle ships in a matter of minutes, he could defeat the Fire Lord now!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: But sir, the thing is, Aang can only do those things when he's in the Avatar State.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: See, it's this special state where-
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I'm well aware! Your eyes and tattoos glow and you're able to summon unbelievable power. Without you, we'd be slaughtered before we even reach their shores.  But with you leading the way, as the ultimate weapon, we could cut a swath right through to the heart of the Fire Nation.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I'm well aware! Your eyes and tattoos glow and you're able to summon unbelievable power. Without you, we'd be slaughtered before we even reach their shores.  But with you leading the way, as the ultimate weapon, we could cut a swath right through to the heart of the Fire Nation.
scene_description: [Looks at map and guides finger from the location of the base to the location of the Fire Nation Capital.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Right, but, I don't know how to get in or out of the Avatar State, much less what to do once I'm there.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: So, it's decided then. I'll help you figure out how to get into the Avatar State and then you'll face your destiny.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: No, nothing's decided. We already have a plan. Aang's pursuing his destiny his way.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Well, while you take your time learning the elements, the War goes on. May I show you something?  That's the infirmary, and those soldiers are the lucky ones.  They came back. Every day, the Fire Nation takes lives. People are dying, Aang! You could end it, now. Think about it.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Well, while you take your time learning the elements, the War goes on. May I show you something?  That's the infirmary, and those soldiers are the lucky ones.  They came back. Every day, the Fire Nation takes lives. People are dying, Aang! You could end it, now. Think about it.

character_words: Almost perfect.

character_words: One hair out of place.

character_words: Almost isn't good enough!

character_words: General Fong?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Come in, Aang. Have you thought about our discussion?

writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Aang, no! This is not the right way!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Why not? Remember when he took out the Fire Navy?  He was incredible!
scene_description: [Resting on his bed with his arms behind his head.]

character_words: Why not? Remember when he took out the Fire Navy?  He was incredible!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Or just glow it up and stop that Fire Lord!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: If you two meat heads want to throw away everything we've worked for, fine, go ahead and glow it up!
scene_description: [Rises and throws her hands up in surrender.]

character_words: If you two meat heads want to throw away everything we've worked for, fine, go ahead and glow it up!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Katara, I'm just being realistic! I don't have time to do this the right way!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: This rare chi-enhancing tea is a natural stimulant. In an ordinary warrior, it improves strength and energy ten-fold. In you, it may induce the Avatar State.
scene_description: [Drops white food item into the teapot.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Ten-fold energy, huh?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Is it working? Is it working? I can't tell! Somebody tell me if I'm in the Avatar State 'cause I don't have a good view of myself! Am I talking too loud?

character_words: I guess he could talk the Fire Lord to death.
scene_description: [Sitting on the floor, tired out by Aang's actions.]

character_words: Maybe I can shock you into the Avatar State.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I love surprises!

character_words: Still not glowing.

character_words: So ... do you feel anything?

character_words: We have to find a way.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Look at these magnificent shells!  I'll enjoy these keepsakes for years to come.

character_words: Look at these magnificent shells!  I'll enjoy these keepsakes for years to come.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: We don't need any more useless things! You forget, we have to carry everything ourselves now!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Hello, brother. Uncle.
scene_description: [From the corner, sitting at the table; calmly.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: What are you doing here?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: In my country, we exchange a pleasant hello before asking questions.  Have you become uncivilized so soon, Zuzu?
scene_description: [Holds up a shell in her hand.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: In my country, we exchange a pleasant hello before asking questions.  Have you become uncivilized so soon, Zuzu?
scene_description: [Rises and walks toward Zuko and Iroh.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Don't call me that!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: To what do we owe this honor?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Hmmm ... must be a family trait. Both of you so quick to get to the point.  I've come with a message from home. Father's changed his mind. Family is suddenly very important to him. He's heard rumors of plans to overthrow him; treacherous plots. Family are the only ones you can really trust.  Father regrets your banishment. He wants you home.  Did you hear me? You should be happy. Excited. Grateful. I just gave you great news.
scene_description: [Breaks the shell she was holding with her fingertips, leaving Iroh angry.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I'm sure your brother simply needs a moment.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Don't interrupt, Uncle!  I still haven't heard my thank you.  I'm not a messenger. I didn't have to come all this way.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Don't interrupt, Uncle!  I still haven't heard my thank you.  I'm not a messenger. I didn't have to come all this way.

writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Father regrets? He ... wants me back?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I can see you need time to take this in. I'll come to call on you tomorrow. Good evening.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Can we talk about something?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Sure.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Do you remember when we were at the air temple and you found Monk Gyatso's skeleton? It must have been so horrible and traumatic for you. I saw you get so upset that you weren't even you anymore.  I'm not saying the Avatar State doesn't have incredible and helpful power ... but you have to understand ... for the people who love you, watching you be in that much rage and pain is really scary.
scene_description: [Cuts to side-shot of Aang and Katara.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Do you remember when we were at the air temple and you found Monk Gyatso's skeleton? It must have been so horrible and traumatic for you. I saw you get so upset that you weren't even you anymore.  I'm not saying the Avatar State doesn't have incredible and helpful power ... but you have to understand ... for the people who love you, watching you be in that much rage and pain is really scary.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I'm really glad you told me that. But I still need to do this.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I don't understand.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: No, you don't. Every day, more and more people die. I'm already one hundred years late. Defeating the Fire Lord is the only way to stop this war. I have to try it!
scene_description: [Cuts to overall view of Aang and Katara.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I can't watch you do this to yourself. I'm not coming tomorrow.  Good night.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I can't watch you do this to yourself. I'm not coming tomorrow.  Good night.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Good night.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: We're going home! After three long years, it's unbelievable!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: It is unbelievable. I have never known my brother to regret anything.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Did you listen to Azula? Father's realized how important family is to him!  He cares about me!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I care about you! And if Ozai wants you back, well, I think it may not be for the reasons you imagine.
scene_description: [Turns to face Zuko and holds out arms in gesture.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: You don't know how my father feels about me. You don't know anything!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Zuko, I only meant that in our family, things are not always what they seem.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I think you are exactly what you seem! A lazy, mistrustful, shallow old man who's always been jealous of his brother!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Sokka! Sokka, wake up.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Huh?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I don't think we should be trying to bring on the Avatar State.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: You sure?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Yes.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Okay.

character_words: Do you think the general will be mad?

character_words: Wait! Don't leave without me!

character_words: Uncle! You've changed your mind!

character_words: Family sticks together, right?

character_words: You sure I can't change your mind?

character_words: What's going on?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: The general's gone crazy! He's trying to force Aang into the Avatar State!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Good ... bird ... horse thingy ...
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Maybe you can avoid me ... but she can't.
scene_description: [Looking back at Aang, who has managed to escape up a stairway.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I can't move!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Don't hurt her!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Katara! No!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Stop this! You have to let her go!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: You could save her if you were in the Avatar State!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I'm trying ... I'm trying!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Aang, I'm sinking!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Aang, I'm sinking!
scene_description: [Twists around again and is buried chest deep.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I don't see glowing!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I don't see glowing!
scene_description: [Lowers his right arm and begins closing his hand into a fist; Katara becomes buried neck deep.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Please!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: You don't need to do this!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Apparently, I do.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: It worked! It worked!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Zuko! Let's go!
scene_description: [Pushes several guards away; grabs one and wrestles him.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: You know, Father blames Uncle for the loss of the North Pole. And he considers you a miserable failure for not finding the Avatar!  Why would he want you back home, except to lock you up  where you can no longer embarrass him?
scene_description: [Cuts to Zuko, who is panting heavily.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: You know, Father blames Uncle for the loss of the North Pole. And he considers you a miserable failure for not finding the Avatar!  Why would he want you back home, except to lock you up  where you can no longer embarrass him?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Avatar Aang! Can you hear me? Your friend is safe!  It was just a trick to trigger the Avatar State ...  and it worked!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Avatar Aang! Can you hear me? Your friend is safe!  It was just a trick to trigger the Avatar State ...  and it worked!
scene_description: [Brings Katara back above ground; cuts to close-up of her as she looks up at Aang in misery.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Avatar Aang! Can you hear me? Your friend is safe!  It was just a trick to trigger the Avatar State ...  and it worked!
scene_description: [Cuts back to Fong, who smiles maniacally.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: It's time you learned.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: The Avatar State is a defense mechanism, designed to empower you with the skills and knowledge of all the past Avatars.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: The glow is the combination of all your past lives, focusing their energy through your body.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: In the Avatar State, you are at your most powerful,  but you are also at your most vulnerable.
scene_description: [Cuts to an unnamed fire Avatar, who summons lava spouts from four volcanoes; the lava washes over the screen and the scene cuts back to Roku and Aang.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: What do you mean?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: If you are killed in the Avatar State,  the reincarnation cycle will be broken  and the Avatar will cease to exist.
scene_description: [The figures of him and the Avatars in the background are blown away like dust.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: If you are killed in the Avatar State,  the reincarnation cycle will be broken  and the Avatar will cease to exist.
scene_description: [Shows the line of Avatars with Aang standing at the end; the Avatars begin to fade away in succession down the line.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I'm sorry, Katara. I hope you never have to see me like that again.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Ha! Are you joking? That was almost perfect!  We just have to find out a way to control you when you're like that.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Ha! Are you joking? That was almost perfect!  We just have to find out a way to control you when you're like that.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: You're out of your mind.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I guess we'll figure it out on the way to the Fire Nation.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Anybody got a problem with that?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Do you still want an escort to Omashu?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I think we're all set.
scene_description: [Casts the group a look of annoyance.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Anyone who harbors these traitors will face the wrath of the Fire Lord!  There will be no place left to hide!
scene_description: [Holds up wanted poster of her brother and uncle.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: Anyone who harbors these traitors will face the wrath of the Fire Lord!  There will be no place left to hide!
scene_description: [She lays a hand on the balcony, causing the two massagers to cower in fear; cuts to close-up of her.]
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: I think we're safe here.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

character_words: You guys are going to be done soon, right? We have a lot of ground to cover if we're going to make it to Omashu today.
What? Like you're ready to go right now, naked guy?
scene_description: [Rises from her hunched-over position; turns to face Sokka smugly.]

character_words: What? Like you're ready to go right now, naked guy?
I could be ready in two minutes. Seriously,  whenever.
scene_description: [Pulls back the hair covering his eyes.]

character_words: So you were showing me the octopus form?
Right, let me see your stance.
Your arms are too far apart.  See, if you move them closer together, you protect your center. You got it?
Your arms are too far apart.  See, if you move them closer together, you protect your center. You got it?
Oh, yea ... thanks.
Okay, let's see what you got.
scene_description: [Walks away and assumes a fighting stance.]

character_words: You make a fine octopus, Pupil Aang.
Da, da, da. Don't fall in love with the traveling girl. She'll leave you broke and brokenhearted.  Hey, river people!
Da, da, da. Don't fall in love with the traveling girl. She'll leave you broke and brokenhearted.  Hey, river people!
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the team standing in the lake. Sokka unexpectedly falls off his leaf into the water. Cuts to nomads. Chong stops singing and points at the group.]

character_words: We're not river people.
You're not? Well then what kind of people are you?
Just ... people.
Aren't we all, brother?
Who are you?
I'm Chong and this is my wife, Lily. We're nomads, happy to go wherever the wind takes us!
scene_description: [He suddenly strums his lute-like instrument in a crazy fashion much like a rock star strums crazily on their guitar.]

character_words: You guys are nomads? That's great! I'm a nomad!
scene_description: [Starts out with a somewhat puzzled tone, but changes it to an excited one.]

character_words: Hey, me too!
I know ... you just said that.
Oh.  Nice underwear ...
I didn't find anything to eat! I can't live like this! I wasn't meant to be a fugitive.  This is impossible!  Uncle, what are you doing?
scene_description: [Emerging from the bushes, now sporting short, black hair.]

character_words: I didn't find anything to eat! I can't live like this! I wasn't meant to be a fugitive.  This is impossible!  Uncle, what are you doing?
scene_description: [Raises fists in the air and yells at the sky.]

character_words: I didn't find anything to eat! I can't live like this! I wasn't meant to be a fugitive.  This is impossible!  Uncle, what are you doing?
You're looking at the rare white dragon bush. Its leaves make a tea so delicious, it's heartbreaking. That, or it's the white jade, which is poisonous.
scene_description: [Cuts to Iroh who dotes over the flower. Zuko appears behind him.]

character_words: We need food, not tea. I'm going fishing.
Hmm ... delectable tea?  Or deadly poison?
Hmm ... delectable tea?  Or deadly poison?
Hey, Sokka, you should hear some of these stories. These guys have been everywhere!
scene_description: [Wearing a wreath of pink flowers on his head.]

character_words: Well not everywhere, Little Arrowhead. But where we haven't been, we've heard about through stories and songs.
They said they'll take us to see a giant night crawler!
On the way, there's a waterfall that creates a never-ending rainbow!
scene_description: [Lying on the ground; in a dreamy voice.]

character_words: Look, I hate to be the wet blanket here, but since Katara is busy, I guess it's up to me.
We need to get to Omashu. No sidetracks, no worms and definitely no rainbows.
Wow, sounds like someone has a case of destination fever. You're worried too much about where you're going.
You got to focus less on the "where" and more on the "going".
scene_description: [She makes gestures with her hand, accidentally tugging on Katara's braid.]

character_words: O. Ma. Shu!
Sokka's right. We need to find King Bumi, so Aang can learn earthbending somewhere safe.
Sounds like you're headed to Omashu.
There's an old story about a secret pass right through the mountains.
Is this real or a legend?

Oh, it's a real legend. And it's as old as earthbending itself.  Two lovers, forbidden from one another, the war divides their people and the mountain divides them apart! Built a path to be together!  Yeah, I forget the next couple of lines, but then it goes ...  Secret tunnel! Secret tunnel! Through the mountains, secret, secret, secret, secret tunnel! Yeah!

Oh, it's a real legend. And it's as old as earthbending itself.  Two lovers, forbidden from one another, the war divides their people and the mountain divides them apart! Built a path to be together!  Yeah, I forget the next couple of lines, but then it goes ...  Secret tunnel! Secret tunnel! Through the mountains, secret, secret, secret, secret tunnel! Yeah!

Oh, it's a real legend. And it's as old as earthbending itself.  Two lovers, forbidden from one another, the war divides their people and the mountain divides them apart! Built a path to be together!  Yeah, I forget the next couple of lines, but then it goes ...  Secret tunnel! Secret tunnel! Through the mountains, secret, secret, secret, secret tunnel! Yeah!
I think we'll just stick with flying. We've dealt with the Fire Nation before. We'll be fine.
Yeah, thanks for the help, but Appa hates going underground.  And we need to do whatever makes Appa most comfortable ...
Launch!
Ahhhh!
Secret love cave, let's go.
Zuko,  remember that plant I thought might be tea?
scene_description: [Cut to a wide, overhead shot of Zuko standing behind Iroh.]

character_words: You didn't ...
I did ...  and it wasn't.
I did ...  and it wasn't.
scene_description: [Reveals himself to be swollen and covered in red marks.]

character_words: Ahh!
scene_description: [Cut back to Zuko who drops the branch out of shock.]

character_words: When the rash spreads to my throat, I will stop breathing.  But look what I found.  These are bacui berries, known to cure the poison of the white jade.  That, or maka'ole berries that cause blindness.

When the rash spreads to my throat, I will stop breathing.  But look what I found.  These are bacui berries, known to cure the poison of the white jade.  That, or maka'ole berries that cause blindness.

When the rash spreads to my throat, I will stop breathing.  But look what I found.  These are bacui berries, known to cure the poison of the white jade.  That, or maka'ole berries that cause blindness.
scene_description: [Iroh holds out his arm to reveal berries.]

character_words: When the rash spreads to my throat, I will stop breathing.  But look what I found.  These are bacui berries, known to cure the poison of the white jade.  That, or maka'ole berries that cause blindness.
We're not taking any more chances with these plants! We need to get help.
scene_description: [Grabbing branch of berries and hurling it into the bushes.]

character_words: But where are we going to go?  We're enemies of the Earth Kingdom and fugitives from the Fire Nation.
scene_description: [Kneeling down and scratching his rash vigorously.]

character_words: But where are we going to go?  We're enemies of the Earth Kingdom and fugitives from the Fire Nation.
scene_description: [Camera zooms in on his reddened leg.]

character_words: If the Earth Kingdom discovers us, they'll have us killed.
But if the Fire Nation discovers us, we'll be turned over to Azula.
Earth Kingdom it is.
How far are we from the tunnel?
Actually, it's not just one tunnel. The lovers didn't want anyone to find out about their love, so they built a whole labyrinth!
Labyrinth?
Oh, I'm sure we'll figure it out.
All you need to do is trust in love ... according to the curse.
Curse!
Hey-hey! We're here!
What exactly is this curse?
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of inscription on the side of the cave entrance.]

character_words: The curse says that only those who trust in love can make it through the caves. Otherwise, you'll be trapped in them forever.
And die.
Oh yeah, and die.  Hey, I just remembered the rest of that song!  And die!
Oh yeah, and die.  Hey, I just remembered the rest of that song!  And die!
scene_description: [Stands before the entrance and strums lute, while singing an ominous line in a low voice.]

character_words: That's it! There's no way we're going through some cursed hole!
Hey, someone's making a big campfire!
scene_description: [Turns head to observe gray smoke rising from the horizon, which he proceeds to point at.]

character_words: That's no campfire, Moku.
It's Fire Nation. They're tracking us.
So all you need to do is trust in love to get through these caves?
That is correct, Master Arrowhead.
We can make it.
Everyone into the hole!
Hold on! It's too dangerous. Haven't you heard the song? Just close them in. The mountain will take care of the rest.
It's okay, Appa. We'll be fine. I hope.
We will be fine. All we need is a plan. Chong, how long do those torches last?
Uh, about two hours each.
And we have five torches, so that's ten hours!
scene_description: [Lighting the rest of the torches in her hand.]

character_words: It doesn't work like that if they're all lit at the same time!
scene_description: [Grabbing torches and stomping out the fire.]

character_words: Oh, right.
I'm going to make a map to keep track of exactly where we've been. Then we should be able to solve it like a maze and get through.
You two must not be from around here. We know better than to touch the White Jade, much less make it into tea and drink it.
You two must not be from around here. We know better than to touch the White Jade, much less make it into tea and drink it.
scene_description: [Flicks Iroh's hand away when he scratches his rash.]

character_words: Whoops!
scene_description: [The girl moves away from the camera's eye, revealing Iroh to be in an even worse condition than before with the rash having spread to his face and his cheeks swollen.]

character_words: So where are you traveling from?
Yes, we're travelers.
scene_description: [Nervously; rises from his seat as she moves his hand down so she could wash it.]

character_words: Do you have names?
Names? Of course we have names.  I'm, uh ... Lee and this is my Uncle, uh ... Mushi?
scene_description: [Song turns to see Iroh scratching and glares at him, before slapping his hand away.]

character_words: Yes, my nephew was named after his father, so we just call him Junior.
scene_description: [Shoots him angry look. Cuts to shot of Song taking a lotion from a jar. She begins slathering it over the inflamed areas.]

character_words: Yes, my nephew was named after his father, so we just call him Junior.
scene_description: [Leans over to the side to give Zuko a pleased smile.]

character_words: Mushi and Junior, huh. My name is Song. You two look like you could use a good meal.  Why don't you stay for dinner?
scene_description: [Slaps Iroh's hand away when he goes to scratch his rash.]

character_words: Sorry, but we need to be moving on.
That's too bad.  My mom always makes too much roast duck.
scene_description: [Screwing the cap back on the lid.]

character_words: That's too bad.  My mom always makes too much roast duck.
Where do you live exactly?
Sokka, this is the tenth dead end you've led us to.
This doesn't make sense. We already came through this way.
We don't need a map.  We just need love. The little guy knows it.
Yeah, but I wouldn't mind a map also.
There's something strange here. There's only one explanation.  The tunnels are changing.
scene_description: [Cuts to an overhead shot of the group standing in the dark cave before switching to Sokka who looks up from the map.]

character_words: There's something strange here. There's only one explanation.  The tunnels are changing.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the rest of the group before switching to Sokka who turns to face the camera.]

character_words: My daughter tells me you're refugees. We were once refugees ourselves.
scene_description: [Setting down a platter of roast duck and taking a seat.]

character_words: When I was a little girl, the Fire Nation raided our farming village. All the men were taken away. That was the last time I saw my father.
I haven't seen my father in many years.
Oh, is he fighting in the War?
Yeah.
Yeah.
The tunnels, they're a-changin'. It must be the curse! I knew we shouldn't have come down here!
Right, if only we listened to you.
Everyone be quiet. Listen.
It's a giant flying thing with teeth!
No! It's a wolfbat!
Yeah, it's no use. We're separated. But at least you have us!
Nooooo!
Can I join you? I know what you've been through. We've all been through it.  The Fire Nation has hurt you.
It's okay. They've hurt me, too.
It's okay. They've hurt me, too.
scene_description: [Pulls up pants leg to reveal burn scars on her leg.]

character_words: Oh, don't let the cave-in get you down!  Don't let the falling rocks turn your smile into a frown!  When the tunnels are darkest, that's when you need a clown, hey!  Don't let the cave-in get you down, Sokka!
scene_description: [Singing as he and the nomads pass the angry warrior.]

character_words: Oh, don't let the cave-in get you down!  Don't let the falling rocks turn your smile into a frown!  When the tunnels are darkest, that's when you need a clown, hey!  Don't let the cave-in get you down, Sokka!

Oh, don't let the cave-in get you down!  Don't let the falling rocks turn your smile into a frown!  When the tunnels are darkest, that's when you need a clown, hey!  Don't let the cave-in get you down, Sokka!
scene_description: [He goes off-screen and Moku passes by, nudging Sokka.]

character_words: Oh, don't let the cave-in get you down!  Don't let the falling rocks turn your smile into a frown!  When the tunnels are darkest, that's when you need a clown, hey!  Don't let the cave-in get you down, Sokka!
Aang, look!
We found the exit!
scene_description: [Running up to a solid rock door.]

character_words: This isn't the exit.
No. It's a tomb.
It must be the two lovers from the legend; that's who's buried here.
These pictures tell their story.
They met on top of the mountain that divided their two villages ...
The villages were enemies, so they could not be together ...  but their love was strong and they found a way.
The villages were enemies, so they could not be together ...  but their love was strong and they found a way.
scene_description: [Character flashes red as the background turns grim and dark.]

character_words: The two lovers learned earthbending from the badgermoles; they became the first earthbenders.

They built elaborate tunnels, so they could meet secretly.  Anyone who tried to follow them would be forever in the labyrinth.  But, one day, the man didn't come  - he'd died in the war between the two villages.  Devastated, the woman unleashed a terrible display of her earthbending power - she could have destroyed them all ...  but, instead, she declared the war over.  Both villages helped her build a new city where they would live together in peace.  The woman's name was Oma and the man's name was Shu.  The great city was named Omashu as a monument to their love.

scene_description: [The characters for "Oma" appear followed by the character for "Shu". Flashback ends.]

character_words: Love is brightest  in the dark.
scene_description: [Reading the inscription on the relief in the wall.]

character_words: Love is brightest  in the dark.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of a carving of the couple kissing.]

character_words: Oh, great! Your plans have led us to another dead end!
At least I'm thinking of ideas and trying to get us out of here, Moku.
Whoa, whoa, wait a minute. We're thinking of ideas‌? Because I've had an idea for, like, an hour now.
Yes! We're all thinking of ideas!
Well, then listen to this: If love is the key out of here, then all we need to do is play a love song!
scene_description: [Begins playing song much to Sokka's dismay.]

character_words: How are we going to find our way out of these tunnels?
I have a crazy idea.
What?
Never mind. It's too crazy.
Katara, what is it?
I was thinking ... the curse says we'll be trapped in here forever unless we trust in love ...
Right ...
And here, it says, "Love is brightest in the dark," and has a picture of them kissing.
scene_description: [Turns to face him and gestures to the portrait.]

character_words: Where are you going with this?
Well, what if we ... kissed?
Us ... kissing‌?
See? It was a crazy idea.
Us ... kissing ...
Us kissing. What was I thinking? Can you imagine that‌?
Yeah.  I definitely wouldn't want to kiss you!
Yeah.  I definitely wouldn't want to kiss you!
Yeah.  I definitely wouldn't want to kiss you!
Oh, well! I didn't realize it was such a horrible option.  Sorry I suggested it!
Oh, well! I didn't realize it was such a horrible option.  Sorry I suggested it!
No, no, I mean ... if there was a choice between kissing you and dying ...
Ugh!
What? I'm saying is I would rather kiss you than die - that's a compliment.
Well, I'm not sure which I'd rather do!
Well, I'm not sure which I'd rather do!
scene_description: [Slams the torch into his hand and storms away.]

character_words: What is wrong with me ...
Even if you're lost, you can't lose the love because it's in your heart ...
Thank you for the duck. It was excellent.
You're welcome. It brings me pleasure to see someone eat my cooking with such ... gusto.
Much practice.
scene_description: [Pats his stomach in a contented manner.]

character_words: Junior, where are your manners? You need to thank these nice people.
Thank you.
I know you don't think there's any hope left in the world, but there is hope. The Avatar has returned.
I know.
What are you doing? These people just showed you great kindness.
They're about to show us a little more kindness. Well?
We're going to run out of light any second now, aren't we?
I think so ...
Then, what are we going to do?
What can we do?
Hey! You saved us, Sokka!
No, they were trying to get away from something!
From what?
Hey, those things are music lovers!
Badgermoles coming toward me. Come on guys, help me out!
The big, bad badgermoles who earthbend the tunnels, hate the wolfbats, but love the sounds!
They're made of some kind of crystal. They must only light up in the dark.
That's how the two lovers found each other.  They just put out their lights and followed the crystals.  That must be the way out!
scene_description: [Gestures with her hand along the ceiling.]

character_words: That's how the two lovers found each other.  They just put out their lights and followed the crystals.  That must be the way out!
That's how the two lovers found each other.  They just put out their lights and followed the crystals.  That must be the way out!
So, uh ...
Let's go!
What about Sokka?
Sokka!
How did you guys get out?
Just like the legend said, we let love lead the way.
Really? We let huge, ferocious beasts lead our way.
Why is your forehead all red?
Nobody react to what I'm about to tell you: I think that kid might be the Avatar!
So are you guys going to come to Omashu with us?
Nope.
Okay. Thanks for everything, Moku.
Sokka, I hope you learned a little something about not letting the plans get in the way of the journey.
Just play your songs.
Hey! Good plan!  Even if you're lost, you can't lose the love because it's in your heart. Da, da, da ...
scene_description: [Begins playing his lute and singing. Cuts to shot of Team Avatar.]

character_words: The journey was long and annoying, but now you get to see what it's really about: the destination.  I present to you the Earth Kingdom city of O-  Oh no ...
The journey was long and annoying, but now you get to see what it's really about: the destination.  I present to you the Earth Kingdom city of O-  Oh no ...
The journey was long and annoying, but now you get to see what it's really about: the destination.  I present to you the Earth Kingdom city of O-  Oh no ...
I can't believe it. I know the War has spread far,  but Omashu always seemed ... untouchable.
scene_description: [Viewing the city, his back to the camera; in a somewhat shocked tone.]

character_words: I can't believe it. I know the War has spread far,  but Omashu always seemed ... untouchable.
Up until now it was.  Now Ba Sing Se is the only great Earth Kingdom stronghold left.
This is horrible,  but we have to move on.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of entire group standing on the cliffside overlooking the city.]

character_words: This is horrible,  but we have to move on.
scene_description: [Approaches Aang; cuts to side-view of the two standing next to each other.]

character_words: No, I'm going in to find Bumi.
Aang, stop. We don't even know if Bumi's still ...
What? If he's still what?
A-around.
I know you had your heart set on Bumi, but there are other people who can teach you earthbending.
This isn't about finding a teacher. This is about finding my friend.
A secret passage? Why didn't we just use this last time?
Ugh!
That answer your question?
Eww!
That wasn't as bad as I thought.
Ahh! They won't let go! Help!
scene_description: [In a panicking tone while trying to yank the pentapox off.]

character_words: Shh! Stop making so much noise. It's just a purple pentapus.
scene_description: [Quickly tackles Sokka into a wall in order to slience him; in a somewhat cheerful tone.]

character_words: Hey! What are you kids doing out past curfew?
Sorry. We were just on our way home.
Wait, what's the matter with him?
scene_description: [Notices the spots where the pentapus was attached to Sokka.]

character_words: Uh, he has pentapox, sir.  Umm, it's highly contagious.
Oh, it's so awful. I'm dying.
And deadly.
Hey, I think I heard of pentapox! Didn't your cousin Chang die of it?
We'd better go wash our hands, and burn our clothes.
Thank you, sewer friends.
When tracking your brother and uncle, traveling with the royal procession may no longer be an option.
May no longer be wise.
If you hope to keep the element of surprise.
You're right. The Royal Procession is dead weight. If I want to catch my prey, I must be agile, nimble. I need a small, elite team. It's time to visit some old friends.
Let's find Bumi and get out of here.
Where would they be keeping him?
Somewhere he can't earthbend. Somewhere made of metal.
There really is no fathoming the depths of my hatred for this place.
Mai, your father was appointed governor. We're like royalty here. Be happy and enjoy it.
The targets are approaching.
Take them out.
I thought my life was boring in the Fire Nation, but this place is unbearably bleak. Nothing ever happens.
The resistance!
Ty Lee, could that possibly be you?
Azula!
It is so good to see you!
Please, don't let me interrupt your ...  whatever it is you were doing.
Tell me, what is the daughter of a nobleman doing here?  Certainly our parents didn't send us to the Royal Fire Academy for Girls to end up in ...  places like this.
Tell me, what is the daughter of a nobleman doing here?  Certainly our parents didn't send us to the Royal Fire Academy for Girls to end up in ...  places like this.
Tell me, what is the daughter of a nobleman doing here?  Certainly our parents didn't send us to the Royal Fire Academy for Girls to end up in ...  places like this.
I have a proposition for you.
I'm hunting a traitor.  You remember my old fuddy-duddy uncle, don't you?
Oh yeah. He was so funny.
scene_description: [Resting on her chest and elbows, but now with her both feet resting on her head.]

character_words: I would be honored if you would join me on my mission.
Oh ... I ... uh ... would love to.  But the truth is, I'm really happy here.  I mean, my aura has never been pinker!
scene_description: [She stands up in a fluid elegant movement.]

character_words: Oh ... I ... uh ... would love to.  But the truth is, I'm really happy here.  I mean, my aura has never been pinker!
I'll take your word for it. Well, I wouldn't want you to give up the life you love just to please me.
scene_description: [Raising up her hand in a "stop" motion to Ty Lee.]

character_words: Thank you, Azula.
Thank you, Azula.
Of course, before I leave, I'm going to catch your show.
Uh ... yeah ... sure ... uh ... of course ...
So, is King Bumi with you guys? Is he leading the resistance?

Of course not! The day of the invasion, we readied ourselves for battle. We were prepared to defend our city ... to fight for our lives and for our freedom. But before we even had a chance, King Bumi surrendered.
The day of the invasion, I asked King Bumi what he wanted to do.  He looked me in the eye and said ...
I'm going to do ... nothing!
scene_description: [He starts to laugh and snort like the mad lunatic he is.]

character_words: It doesn't matter now.  Fighting the Fire Nation is the only path to freedom.  And freedom is worth dying for.
scene_description: [Cut to Aang who sadly lowers his eyes as the resistance leader continues.]

character_words: It doesn't matter now.  Fighting the Fire Nation is the only path to freedom.  And freedom is worth dying for.
scene_description: [Switch to a close-up of Yung again.]

character_words: Actually there's another path to freedom. You could leave Omashu. You're directing all your energy to fight the Fire Nation.  But you're outnumbered. You can't win. Now's the time to retreat, so you can live to fight another day.
scene_description: [The camera pans to the right, showing several Earth Kingdom soldiers.]

character_words: You don't understand. They've taken our home, and we have to fight them at any cost!
scene_description: [He makes some powerful hand gestures to make his point more clear.]

character_words: I don't know, Yung, living to fight another day is startin' to sound pretty good to me.
Yeah, I'm with the kid!
scene_description: [He takes a step forward and points toward himself. He addresses Yung with a decisive tone.]

character_words: Fine. But there's thousands of citizens that need to leave. How're we going to get them all out?
Suckers!
You're all about to come down with a nasty case of pentapox.
The marks make ya look sick, but you gotta act sick too. Ya gotta sell it!
Now that's what I'm talkin' about.
scene_description: [Grabs the guy who is standing next to him and points at the old man.]

character_words: Years of practice.
Okay everyone! Into sick formation.
Aang, what are you doing? Aren't you coming with us?
No. I'm not leaving until I find Bumi.
Sorry Momo, I'll feed you later.
Plague! Plague!
What is going on down there?
I saw some kids yesterday who were sick with pentapox. It must have spread!
Pentapox!  Hmm, I'm pretty sure I've heard of that.
Oh, this is terrible.
What should we do?
Drive them out of the city  ... but don't touch them! We have to rid the city of this disease!
Fire flakes, Dad?
How awful!
Flopsie!
Come on, Flopsie.  You gotta help me find Bumi. Yip Yip!  Oh ... I guess that doesn't work with you. Let's go!
Come on, Flopsie.  You gotta help me find Bumi. Yip Yip!  Oh ... I guess that doesn't work with you. Let's go!
We're deeply honored to have the Fire Lord's daughter at our humble circus.
Uh ... tell us if there is anything we can do to make the show more enjoyable.
I will.
Incredible. Do you think she'll fall?
Of course not.
Then wouldn't it make it more interesting if you removed the net?
Uh ... the thing is ... the performers ...
You're right, you're right. That's been done.  I know. Set the net on fire.
scene_description: [After a short pause, she continues with a tone of dark pleasure.]

character_words: Of course, Princess.
Brilliant, just brilliant!  Ooh, what kind of dangerous animals do you have?
Brilliant, just brilliant!  Ooh, what kind of dangerous animals do you have?
scene_description: [She looks down at Shuzumu and asks happily.]

character_words: Well, our circus boasts the most exotic assortment-
Release them all!
We looked everywhere. No Bumi.
We've got a problem. We just did a head count.
Oh no. Did someone get left behind?
No, we have an extra.
So, the resistance has kidnapped my son. Everything so clever, so tricky. Just like their King Bumi.
What do you want to do, sir?
What an exquisite performance. I can't wait to see how you'll top yourself tomorrow.
I'm sorry Azula, but unfortunately there won't be a show tomorrow.
scene_description: [Smiling at Azula's reflection in the mirror.]

character_words: Really?
The universe has given me strong hints that it's time for a career change.  I want to join you on your mission.
The universe has given me strong hints that it's time for a career change.  I want to join you on your mission.
scene_description: [She gets up and turns around to face Azula.]

character_words: No! Bad Fire Nation baby!
Oh ... all right.
Oooh, you're so cute.  Mmmmm ...
Oooh, you're so cute.  Mmmmm ...
scene_description: [She kisses him on the cheek, while an annoyed Sokka looks the other side, resting his head on his hand.]

character_words: Sure he's cute now, but when he's older, he'll join the Fire Nation army.  You won't think he's so cute then. He'll be a killer.
scene_description: [Switch to Katara who is happily playing with the baby under the annoyed gaze of her brother.]

character_words: Does that look like the face of a killer to you?
A messenger hawk!
It's from the Fire Nation governor. He thinks we kidnapped his son.  So ... he wants to make a trade. His son  for King Bumi.
scene_description: [Switch to another view. Aang is shown standing at the other side of the campfire, reading the message.]

character_words: It's from the Fire Nation governor. He thinks we kidnapped his son.  So ... he wants to make a trade. His son  for King Bumi.
scene_description: [Zoom to Aang's surprised face while he continues dramatically, his eyes widening.]

character_words: You realize we're probably walking right into a trap.
I don't think so. I'm sure the governor wants his son back as much as we want Bumi.  It's a new day. I have a good feeling about this.
scene_description: [Smiling at the sleeping baby he holds against his chest.]

character_words: Please tell me you're here to kill me.
It's great to see you, Mai.
I thought you ran off and joined the circus. You said it was your calling.
Well, Azula called a little louder.
I have a mission and I need you both.
scene_description: [Azula places a hand on both her friends' shoulders.]

character_words: Count me in. Anything to get me out of this place.
I apologize.  You've come to Omashu at a difficult time. At noon we're making a trade with the resistance to get Tom-Tom back.
scene_description: [Switch to a closer shot of the governor who squatting down on a pillow.]

character_words: Yes, I'm so sorry to hear about your son, but really,  what did you expect by just letting all the citizens leave?  My father has trusted you with this city and you're making a mess of things!
scene_description: [She crosses her legs and clasps her hands.]

character_words: Yes, I'm so sorry to hear about your son, but really,  what did you expect by just letting all the citizens leave?  My father has trusted you with this city and you're making a mess of things!
scene_description: [She stands up, addressing the governor in a harsher tone.]

character_words: Yes, I'm so sorry to hear about your son, but really,  what did you expect by just letting all the citizens leave?  My father has trusted you with this city and you're making a mess of things!
scene_description: [She emphasizes her words with a hand gesture.]

character_words: Forgive me, Princess.
You stay here.  Mai will handle the hostage trade so you don't have a chance to mess it up.  And there is no more "Omashu". I'm renaming it in honor of my father, the city of New Ozai.
scene_description: [Mai and Ty Lee get up behind her.]

character_words: You stay here.  Mai will handle the hostage trade so you don't have a chance to mess it up.  And there is no more "Omashu". I'm renaming it in honor of my father, the city of New Ozai.
scene_description: [Cut to a shot of the still smoking city of Omashu, followed by some shots of Fire Nation construction sites.]

character_words: Hi, everybody!
You brought my brother?
He's here. We're ready to trade.
I'm sorry, but a thought just occurred to me. Do you mind?
Of course not, Princess Azula.
We're trading a two year old for a king.  A powerful, earthbending king?
Mmm hmmm!
It just doesn't seem like a fair trade, does it?
You're right.  The deal's off.
scene_description: [Azula smiles slyly while Mai walks forward.]

character_words: Whhhoa! See you all later!
Bumi!
The Avatar!
My lucky day.
Aang, is that you? Where did you come from?
Hang on! We're gonna get you out of here.
We've got to get the baby out of here!
Way ahead of ya!
scene_description: [Blows on the bison whistle before looking at his sister with a big smile.]

character_words: Way ahead of ya!
scene_description: [Tom-Tom reaches for the whistle and starts to play with it.]

character_words: Aang, stop your blowing for a minute.
Now hold on just a  duahhh!!!
scene_description: [The swing of Aang's staff breaks the frozen chain and they freefall down.]

character_words: It's just like old times, isn't it, Bumi?
Aang, I need to talk to you!
It's good to see you too!
How are you gonna fight without your bending?
I seem to manage!
There's Aang!
We can catch him!
Hang on, Bumi! Our ride's here!
You could earthbend? All along?
Well, they didn't cover my face.
I don't understand. Why didn't you free yourself? Why did you surrender when Omashu was invaded? What's the matter with you, Bumi?
Listen to me, Aang. There are options in fighting, called jing. It's a choice of how you direct your energy.
I know! There's positive jing when you're attacking, and negative jing when you're retreating.
scene_description: [Cut to a close-up of an annoyed Aang, counting along on his fingers as he sums up the different jings.]

character_words: ... and neutral jing when you do nothing!
There are three jings?
scene_description: [He looks shocked at his three raised fingers.]

character_words: Well, technically there are eighty-five, but let's just focus on the third. Neutral jing is the key to earthbending. It involves listening and waiting for the right moment to strike.
That's why you surrendered, isn't it?
Yes, and it's why I can't leave now.
I guess I need to find someone else to teach me earthbending.
Your teacher will be someone who has mastered neutral jing. You need to find someone who waits and listens before striking.
Hey, Momo!
Momo's mastered a few jings himself!
Goodbye, Aang. I'll see you when the time is right.
So, we're tracking down your brother and Uncle, huh?
It'll be interesting seeing Zuko again,  won't it, Mai?
It'll be interesting seeing Zuko again,  won't it, Mai?
It's not just Zuko and Iroh anymore.  We have a third target now.
scene_description: [Cut closer to Azula who continues on a serious tone.]

character_words: Tom-Tom!
Spare coins for weary travelers?
This is humiliating! We're royalty! These people should be giving us whatever we want.
They will if you ask nicely.  Spare change for a hungry old man?
scene_description: [A peasant woman strolls past; somewhat dramatically.]

character_words: Aw, here you go.
The coin is appreciated, but not as much as your smile!
How about some entertainment in exchange for ... a gold piece?
How about some entertainment in exchange for ... a gold piece?
scene_description: [He pulls the piece from his pocket with a flourish.]

character_words: We're not performers.
Not professional anyway.  It's a long, long way to Ba Sing Se, but the girls in the city, they look so pretty!
Not professional anyway.  It's a long, long way to Ba Sing Se, but the girls in the city, they look so pretty!
scene_description: [He puts the hat down and stands up, swaying lightly as he begins to sing.]

character_words: Come on, we're talking a gold piece here! Let's see some action!  Dance!
scene_description: [Annoyed with the quality of the entertainment.]

character_words: Come on, we're talking a gold piece here! Let's see some action!  Dance!
scene_description: [Zuko glances up sharply as the man withdraws his swords.]

character_words: They kiss so sweet that you really got to meet the girls from Ba Sing Se!
Ha, ha! Nothing like a fat man dancing for his dinner! Here ya go!
Ha, ha! Nothing like a fat man dancing for his dinner! Here ya go!
scene_description: [Tosses the gold coin onto the ground and walks away.]

character_words: Such a kind man.
Hey, you taking us down for a reason?  Aang,  why are we going down?
Hey, you taking us down for a reason?  Aang,  why are we going down?
scene_description: [Aang continues to stare at the swamp.]

character_words: Hey, you taking us down for a reason?  Aang,  why are we going down?
What? I didn't even notice.
Are you noticing now?
Is something wrong?
scene_description: [Moving to the front of the saddle.]

character_words: I know this is going to sound weird, but I think the swamp is calling to me.
scene_description: [He still seems somewhat dazed by the swamp.]

character_words: Is it telling you where we can get something to eat?
No, I ... I think it wants us to land there.
No offense to the swamp, but I don't see any land there to land on.
I don't know. Bumi said to learn earthbending I would have to wait and listen, and now I'm actually hearing the earth. Do you want me to ignore it?
Yes.
I don't know. There's something ominous about that place.
See, even Appa and Momo don't like it here.
Okay, since everyone feels so strongly about this,  bye swamp.  Yip, Yip!
Okay, since everyone feels so strongly about this,  bye swamp.  Yip, Yip!
Okay, since everyone feels so strongly about this,  bye swamp.  Yip, Yip!
You better throw in an extra "yip"! We gotta move!
Where's Appa and Momo?  Appa! Momo!
scene_description: [Looking around the swamp and at his friends.]

character_words: Where's Appa and Momo?  Appa! Momo!
scene_description: [Aang jumps up to the top of the trees, looking for his animal friends as he uses the height to search for them.]

character_words: Sokka, you've got an elbow leech.
Where? Where?
scene_description: [He spins around, panicking, trying to find it.]

character_words: Where do you think?
Why do things keep attaching to me?!
scene_description: [Ripping off the elbow leech and throwing it behind to Katara. He cries out angrily.]

character_words: You couldn't find them?
No, and the tornado ... it just disappeared.
We better speed things up.
Maybe we should be a little nicer to the swamp.
Aang, these are just plants. Do you want me to say "please" and "thank you" as I swing my machete back and forth?
Maybe you should listen to Aang. Something about this place feels ... alive.
I'm sure there are lots of things that are alive here and if we don't wanna wind up getting eaten by them, we need to find Appa as fast as we can.
Appa! Momo!
There's no way they can hear us and no way we can see them. We'll have to make camp for the night.
What was that?
Nothing, just swamp gas.  Look, there's nothing supernatural going on here.
I think we should build a fire.
Sokka, the longer we're here, the more I think you shouldn't be doing do that.
No, I asked the swamp. It said this was fine.  Right, swamp?  "No problem, Sokka!"
No, I asked the swamp. It said this was fine.  Right, swamp?  "No problem, Sokka!"
scene_description: [Shakes the root and fakes a reply.]

character_words: Does anyone else get the feeling that we're being watched?
Please, we're all alone out here.
Except for them.
Right, except for them.
Guys?
What'd you reckon make a track like that, Tho?
Don't know, Due.  Some'in with six legs. Pretty big'uns too.
Leaves a nice, wide trail to folla'.
You know what's at the end of that trail?
Dinner.
Aang! Sokka!
Hello? Hello? Can you help me?  Mom?  Mom!
Hello? Hello? Can you help me?  Mom?  Mom!
scene_description: [More loudly and running toward the figure.]

character_words: I can't believe ...
Aang!  Stupid swamp! Dumb, ugly vines! Katara!  You think you're so tough, huh?
Aang!  Stupid swamp! Dumb, ugly vines! Katara!  You think you're so tough, huh?
scene_description: [He becomes caught, and grunts with exertion before slicing himself free.]

character_words: Hello? Yue?  This is just a trick of the light ... swamp gas ... I ... hit my head running away last night. I'm going crazy.
scene_description: [He takes a hold of his head, before removing his hands and shrugging, turning away from the apparition.]

character_words: Hello? Yue?  This is just a trick of the light ... swamp gas ... I ... hit my head running away last night. I'm going crazy.
scene_description: [Almost fearfully, he turns around and walks closer.]

character_words: You didn't protect me.
Katara! Appa!
Hello? Who are you?
Hey, come back!
scene_description: [He holds his hand out as though to grab her.]

character_words: Look at that Tho. Is that a little hairy fella ridin' that thing?
No, that's what they call a "lemoo". Saw one at a traveling show once. Real smart they say.
Bet he tastes a lot like possum chicken.
You think everything tastes like possum chicken.
C'mon now, fellas.  Just a little closer. Nice and easy. Nothing to worry about. We just fixin' to eat ya.
scene_description: [He moves to the front of the boat.]

character_words: What'd you say that fer?
Well, we are!
scene_description: [Shrugging as he tries to appease his friend.]

character_words: But you don't have to tell 'em that.
Well how'd I know they'd understand me?
Come on!
Who are you?
What do you guys think you're doing!? I've been looking all over for you!
scene_description: [He stands up and puts his machete away.]

character_words: Well, I've been wandering around looking for you!
scene_description: [She has not moved, although her hand is on her head as she sits on the root they have fallen onto.]

character_words: I was chasing some girl.
scene_description: [He looks away before airbending himself to his feet. He appears embarrassed that he was not actively searching for his friends like they were him.]

character_words: What girl?
I don't know. I heard laughing and I saw some girl in a fancy dress.
scene_description: [He walks over to Katara and helps her up before rubbing his ear.]

character_words: Well, there must be a tea party here and we just didn't get our invitations!
I thought I saw Mom.
Look, we were all just scared and hungry and our minds were playing tricks on us. That's why we all saw things out here.
You saw something too?
I thought I saw Yue. But, that doesn't prove anything. Look, I think about her all the time, and you saw Mom, someone you miss a lot.
scene_description: [He looks away for a moment, before turning back and taking a step closer to his sister.]

character_words: What about me? I didn't know the girl I saw. And all our visions led us right here.
Okay ... so where's here? The middle of the swamp?
Yeah, the center ... it's the heart of the swamp. It's been calling us here. I knew it.
It's just a tree.  It can't call anyone. For the last time, there's nothing after us and there's nothing magical happening here.
scene_description: [He raises his arms above his head.]

character_words: Now, what would a lemoo need a shirt fer?
There's someone in there! He's bending the vines!
Why did you call me here if you just wanted to kill us!?
Wait!  I didn't call you here.
scene_description: [The vines drop to reveal a slightly larger man wearing nothing but a leaf loincloth.]

character_words: We were flying over and I heard something calling to me, telling me to land.
scene_description: [He shares a look of confusion with Sokka, who is also in an offensive stance.]

character_words: He's the Avatar. Stuff like that happens to us a lot.
The Avatar? Come with me.
So, who are you then?
I protect the swamp from folks that want to hurt it, like this fella with his big knife.
scene_description: [Bending a vine out of the way.]

character_words: See, completely reasonable.  Not a monster, just a regular guy defending his home. Nothing mystical about it.
Oh the swamp is a mystical place all right. It's sacred. I reached enlightenment right here under the banyan-grove tree.  I heard it calling me, just like you did.
scene_description: [He sits on the tree, looking at the group as he explains.]

character_words: Sure you did. It seems real chatty.
See this whole swamp is actually just one tree spread out over miles. Branches spread and sink, take root, and spread some more. One big, living organism. Just like the entire world.
scene_description: [The camera zooms out as he explains, slowly revealing more and more of the swamp. It shows how large the banyan-grove tree is compared to the others, but at the final magnification, it is impossible to distinguish it from the other trees.]

character_words: I get how the tree is one big thing, but the whole world?
scene_description: [Cuts back to Aang, looking at Huu. He is still openly skeptical.]

character_words: Sure. You think you're any different from me or your friends or this tree? If you listen hard enough, you can hear every living thing breathing together.  You can feel everything growing. We're all living together, even if most folks don't act like it. We all have the same roots and we are all branches of the same tree.
scene_description: [Another shot shows the swamp river. There are the sounds of several animals heard in the background.]

character_words: But what did our visions mean?
scene_description: [She and her friends are now sitting, listening to Huu.]

character_words: In the swamp, we see visions of people we've lost, people we loved, folks we think are gone.  But the swamp tells us they're not. We're still connected to them. Time is an illusion and so is death.
scene_description: [The shot cuts to show the people that Sokka and Katara saw in the swamp, before cutting back to Huu.]

character_words: But what about my vision? It was someone I had never met.
You're the Avatar. You tell me.
Time is an illusion. So, it's someone I will meet.
scene_description: [He looks down as he tries to understand.]

character_words: Sorry to interrupt the lesson, but we still need to find Appa and Momo.
I think I know how to find them.  Everything is connected.  Come on! We've got to hurry!
scene_description: [Aang kneels down and places his hand on the tree.]

character_words: I think I know how to find them.  Everything is connected.  Come on! We've got to hurry!
scene_description: [Energy travels from Aang's hand to Appa's location. Appa is seen being captured by the Foggy Swamp members. Back at the banyan-grove tree, Aang stands up.]

character_words: Set my lines by the river bed! Caught ten fish and I killed 'em dead! Cut 'em and gut 'em and I tossed the heads in the water to keep them catgators fed.
scene_description: [Singing and tapping the side of his canoe. Momo is seen struggling inside the sack he has been placed in.]

character_words: Appa!
We're under attack!
Hey, you guys are waterbenders!
You too! That means we're kin!  Hey Huu! How you been?
scene_description: [Due ceases waterbending, followed by a slightly disgusted Katara. He watches as Sokka and Huu run up to the branch Katara and Aang are standing on.]

character_words: You know, scared some folks, swung some vines, the usual.
Huu?
How you like that possum chicken?
Tastes just like arctic hen. So why were you guys so interested in eating Appa?  You've got plenty of those big things wandering around.
scene_description: [He indicates the catgator lying behind Tho.]

character_words: You want me to eat old Slim? He's like a member of the family!
Nice Slim!
Oh, he don't eat no bugs! That's people food.
Where'd you say you was from?
The South Pole.
scene_description: [Smiling. Sokka is shown chewing nonchalantly next to her.]

character_words: Didn't know there was waterbenders anywhere but here. They got a nice swamp there, do they?
No, it's all ice and snow.
Hmm. No wonder you left.
Well, I hope you realize now that nothing strange was going on here.  Just a bunch of greasy people living in a swamp.
Well, I hope you realize now that nothing strange was going on here.  Just a bunch of greasy people living in a swamp.
What about the visions?
I told you, we were hungry. I'm eating a giant bug!
But what about when the tree showed me where Appa and Momo were?
That's Avatar stuff, that doesn't count.  The only thing I can't figure out is how you made that tornado that sucked us down.
I can't do anything like that. I just bend the water in the plants.
Well, no accounting for weather. Still, there's absolutely nothing mysterious about the swamp.
Who's there?
What are you doing in my mouth?  Momo, you need to be a little more sensitive to my boundaries.
What are you doing in my mouth?  Momo, you need to be a little more sensitive to my boundaries.
scene_description: [Momo chitters happily while lying upside down on Sokka's belly, chewing on the fly he "rescued" from the spider's web.]

character_words: Give up! You're completely surrounded!
scene_description: [Shouting from up above as he looks over the campsite.]

character_words: Come on! Come on! Come on!
My scrolls!
My staff!
Yip yip!
Wait, my boomerang!
scene_description: [Stretching out his arm over the saddle as if he wants to grab it.]

character_words: There's no time!
Oh, I see,  so there's time to get your scrolls  and time to get your staff,  but no time for my boomerang?
Oh, I see,  so there's time to get your scrolls  and time to get your staff,  but no time for my boomerang?
Oh, I see,  so there's time to get your scrolls  and time to get your staff,  but no time for my boomerang?
Oh, I see,  so there's time to get your scrolls  and time to get your staff,  but no time for my boomerang?
scene_description: [Looking back at Katara with his hand on his chest.]

character_words: That's correct!
Oh.
scene_description: [Bowing his head in defeat by this totally honest answer.]

character_words: Sorry about your boomerang, Sokka.
I feel like I've lost part of my identity.  Imagine if you lost your arrow, or Katara lost her ...  hair loopies.
I feel like I've lost part of my identity.  Imagine if you lost your arrow, or Katara lost her ...  hair loopies.
scene_description: [He jumps up and moves Aang's hat slightly so that he can point at Aang's arrow.]

character_words: I feel like I've lost part of my identity.  Imagine if you lost your arrow, or Katara lost her ...  hair loopies.
scene_description: [Makes a hair loopies gesture with a somewhat bored look.]

character_words: Here's your produce, ponytail guy.
I used to be boomerang guy ...
scene_description: [He picks up the basket full of supplies, looking dejected at the nickname.]

character_words: Hey, Water Tribe money!
I hope that's okay.
So long as it's money.  Have a nice Avatar Day!
So long as it's money.  Have a nice Avatar Day!
scene_description: [The merchant closes his shop, while Katara walks over to Aang, who is trying to console a crying Sokka as the camera pans up to show just the merchant's head.]

character_words: Avatar Day?
You guys are going to the festival, right?
There's a holiday for the Avatar. Who knew?
Look! They made a giant Kyoshi float!
And here comes Avatar Roku!
Having a huge festival in your honor is great, but frankly, it's just nice to be appreciated.
And it's nice to appreciate their deep-fried festival food!
scene_description: [He takes a huge bite out of the food-item he is holding.]

character_words: Aang, look!
scene_description: [Pointing at a giant float of Aang coming down the street.]

character_words: That's the biggest me I've ever seen!
Now a torch, that's a nice prop. It's bright, dangerous ...  smells manly. But I'm not sure I could carry it off.
Hey, what's that guy doing?
Down with the Avatar!
scene_description: [Chanting as Kyoshi's effigy is consumed by the flames.]

character_words: Where did you get these?
What does it matter where they came from?
Mmmm ...  ... mmmm!
Mmmm ...  ... mmmm!
scene_description: [Takes a bite out of one of the cupcakes Zuko brought. The jam drips of his chin. In delight.]

character_words: That party pooper's ruining Avatar Day!
scene_description: [Angrily pointing an accusing finger at Katara.]

character_words: That party pooper's my friend!
That party pooper's my friend!
scene_description: [He takes off his hat and throws it away to reveal his arrow.]

character_words: It's the Avatar himself!
It's going to kill us with its awesome Avatar powers!
No, I'm not, I ...
I suggest you leave!  You're not welcome here, Avatar!
I suggest you leave!  You're not welcome here, Avatar!
scene_description: [He waves them away with a gesture of his hand.]

character_words: Why not? Aang helps people.
It's true! I'm on your side.
I find that hard to swallow,  considering what you did to us in your past life! It was Avatar Kyoshi; she murdered our glorious leader, Chin the Great.
