Zuko, it's time we talked.  Go help you other friends. We'll catch up with you.
scene_description: [They walk away, Katara looks back at Zuko before moving on.]

character_words: Why, Uncle?

You're not the man you used to be, Zuko. You are stronger and wiser and freer than you have ever been. And now you have come to the crossroads of your destiny. It's time for you to choose. It's time for you to choose good.
I expected this kind of treachery from Uncle.  But Zuko, Prince Zuko, you're a lot of things, but you're not a traitor, are you?
scene_description: [Cut to Iroh, still trapped in crystals. Cut to a side shot, where Zuko protects his uncle.]

character_words: Release him immediately.
It's not too late for you, Zuko. You can still redeem yourself.
The kind of redemption she offers is not for you.

Why don't you let him decide, Uncle?  I need you, Zuko. I've plotted every move of this day,  this glorious day in Fire Nation history, and the only way we win is together. At the end of this day, you will have your honor back. You will have Father's love. You will have everything you want.

Why don't you let him decide, Uncle?  I need you, Zuko. I've plotted every move of this day,  this glorious day in Fire Nation history, and the only way we win is together. At the end of this day, you will have your honor back. You will have Father's love. You will have everything you want.
Zuko, I am begging you. Look into your heart and see what it is that you truly want.
You are free to choose.
We've got to find Sokka and Toph.
See any Dai Li agents nearby?
Nope, all clear.
Let's go.
I'm not leaving without Bosco!
I thought you had changed.
I have changed.
Come on, it's easy. You just walk on your front paws instead of your rear ones.  Like this.
Come on, it's easy. You just walk on your front paws instead of your rear ones.  Like this.
That is a nice trick.
Just take the bear.
Bosco!
There's too many.
The only way is to let her go.
I'm sorry, Katara.
You've got to get out of here! I'll hold them off as long as I can!
scene_description: [Fires some blasts at Zuko and Azula.]

character_words: We've done it, Zuko. It's taken a hundred years, but the Fire Nation has conquered Ba Sing Se.
I betrayed Uncle.
No, he betrayed you.  Zuko, when you return home, Father will welcome you as a war hero.
But I don't have the Avatar. What if Father doesn't restore my honor?
He doesn't need to, Zuko.  Today, you restored your own honor.
scene_description: [She puts a hand on Zuko's shoulder.]

character_words: The Earth Kingdom ... has fallen.
What happened?  Oh no!
scene_description: [Sees the Fire Nation designs and flag and immediately assumes he has been captured.]

character_words: You hear something?  He's awake!  Stop! Wait!
scene_description: [Aang retreats behind the wall, where he dons a determined look and quickly steps out to send a weak air blast at them, which only ruffles their clothes, and moves past the hallway.]

character_words: You hear something?  He's awake!  Stop! Wait!
scene_description: [The two begin chasing Aang, who struggles to escape.]

character_words: Momo?
Twinkle Toes! That's got to be you!
Aang, you're awake!
Are you sure?  I feel like I'm dreaming.
You're not dreaming. You're finally awake.
Aang, good to see you back with the living, buddy!
scene_description: [Hugs Aang; is disguised as a Fire Nation guard.]

character_words: Sokka?
scene_description: [Breathes heavily, appears to be passing out.]

character_words: Uh-oh, somebody catch him, he's going to-
Aren't you cold?
I've got a lot on my mind. It's been so long, over three years since I was home. I wonder what's changed. I wonder how I've changed.
I just asked if you were cold, I didn't ask for your whole life story.  Stop worrying.
I just asked if you were cold, I didn't ask for your whole life story.  Stop worrying.
scene_description: [Giggles and holds his face in her hands.]

character_words: Why are we on a Fire Nation ship? Why is everyone dressed this way? And why am I the only one who's completely out of it?
You need to take it easy, okay? You got hurt pretty bad.  I like your hair.
I have hair?  How long was I out?
A few weeks.
Everything okay?
We're fine, Dad.
I'm Hakoda, Katara and Sokka's father.
I'm Hakoda, Katara and Sokka's father.
scene_description: [Aang moves to shake his outstretched hand.]

character_words: He knows who you are. I just called you "Dad", didn't I?
scene_description: [Placing her hands on Aang's shoulders stopping him.]

character_words: I guess you're right.
Nice to officially meet you, Chief Hakoda.
scene_description: [Removing Katara's hand he shakes Hakoda's hand.]

character_words: It's an honor to meet you.
Great, great, so now you guys have finally met. So would you mind giving us a little privacy?
Of course.
Are you mad at your dad or something?
scene_description: [Katara looks at Hakoda leave with an expression of annoyance on her face.]

character_words: What, not at all. Why would you say that?
Maybe we should go upstairs.  You need a healing session.
Tell me where the pain feels most intense.
Mmm, a little higher. Uhhh!
Wow, you're definitely in the right area there.
I can feel a lot of energy twisted up around there.  Let me just see if I can-
I went down! I didn't just get hurt, did I? It was worse than that. I was gone! But you brought me back.
I just used the spirit water from the North Pole. I don't know what I did exactly.
You saved me.
You need to rest.
scene_description: [Placing a hand on the side of his face.]

character_words: Your Princess Azula, clever and beautiful, disguised herself as the enemy and entered the Earth Kingdom's Capital. In Ba Sing Se, she found her brother Zuko, and together they faced the Avatar ...
And the Avatar fell! And the Earth Kingdom fell!
Azula's agents quickly overtook the entire city. They went to Ba Sing Se's great walls ...
And brought them down!
The armies of the Fire Nation surged through the walls and swarmed over Ba Sing Se, securing our victory.
Now the heroes have returned home!
Your princess, Azula ...
And after three long years, your prince has returned ...
Zuko!

After what happened at Ba Sing Se, we had to get you to safety. We flew back to Chameleon Bay where we found my father and the other Water Tribe men.  The Earth King decided he wanted to travel the world in disguise, so he set off alone.  Well, not completely alone.  Soon, the bay was overrun by Fire Nation ships. Rather than fight them all, we captured a single ship and made it our disguise. Since then we've been traveling west. We crossed through the Serpent's Pass a few days ago. We've seen a few Fire Nation ships, but none have bothered us.
scene_description: [Flashback preparing to leave by taking off his Earth King robes revealing traveling robes beneath.]

character_words: After what happened at Ba Sing Se, we had to get you to safety. We flew back to Chameleon Bay where we found my father and the other Water Tribe men.  The Earth King decided he wanted to travel the world in disguise, so he set off alone.  Well, not completely alone.  Soon, the bay was overrun by Fire Nation ships. Rather than fight them all, we captured a single ship and made it our disguise. Since then we've been traveling west. We crossed through the Serpent's Pass a few days ago. We've seen a few Fire Nation ships, but none have bothered us.
scene_description: [Bosco is shown taking off his own attire and hat before Kuei jumps on Bosco and they set off.]

character_words: After what happened at Ba Sing Se, we had to get you to safety. We flew back to Chameleon Bay where we found my father and the other Water Tribe men.  The Earth King decided he wanted to travel the world in disguise, so he set off alone.  Well, not completely alone.  Soon, the bay was overrun by Fire Nation ships. Rather than fight them all, we captured a single ship and made it our disguise. Since then we've been traveling west. We crossed through the Serpent's Pass a few days ago. We've seen a few Fire Nation ships, but none have bothered us.
scene_description: [Cut back to Sokka continuing the story.]

character_words: So what now?
We've been working on a modified version of the invasion plan.
It's Sokka's invasion plan.
Yes, Sokka's plan. We won't be able to mount a massive invasion without the Earth King's armies, but the solar eclipse will still leave the Fire Nation vulnerable.
So we're planning a smaller invasion. Just a ragtag team of our friends and allies from around the Earth Kingdom. We already ran into Pipsqueak and The Duke.
Good to see you again, Aang!
scene_description: [Eating noodles with The Duke on his shoulder.]

character_words: And the best part is, the eclipse isn't even our biggest advantage!  We have a secret ... you!
Me?
Yep, the whole world thinks you're dead! Isn't that great?
The world thinks I'm dead? How is that good news? That's terrible!
No, it's great! It means the Fire Nation won't be hunting us anymore! And even better, they won't be expecting you on the Day of Black Sun!
No, no, no, no, no. You have no idea. This is so messed up!
I'll handle this. The Avatar is back.
Aang, wait! Remember, they don't know we're not Fire Nation!
Everyone just stay calm.  Bato and I will take care of this.
scene_description: [He and Bato put their helmets on.]

character_words: I hate not being able to do anything.
Hopefully, you won't need to.
Commander, why are you off course? All Western Fleet ships are supposed to be moving toward Ba Sing Se to support the occupation!
Actually, we're from the Eastern Fleet. We have orders to deliver some cargo.
Ahhh ... Eastern Fleet. Well, nice of Admiral Chan to let us know he was sending one of his ships our way.
I'm sure Admiral Chan meant no disrespect, sir.
I mean, how hard is it to write a quick note and send a hawk our way?
Next time, we'll send  two hawks to make sure you get the message.
scene_description: [Bato and Hakoda glance at each other.]

character_words: Sir ... Admiral Chan has been on leave for two months at Ember Island.

What? Why doesn't anyone ever tell me anything? Something's not right; they should have known that. I think this is a captured ship.  Just stay quiet until we're safely across the ramp. Then we'll sink this ship.
They know!
You seem so downcast. Has Mai gotten to you already? Though actually, Mai has been in a strangely good mood lately.
I haven't seen Dad yet. I haven't seen him in three years, since I was banished.
So what?
So, I didn't capture the Avatar.
Who cares? The Avatar is dead ...  unless you think he somehow miraculously survived.
This is water from the spirit oasis at the north pole. It has special properties so I've been saving it for something important.
No. There's no way he could have survived.
Well, then I'm sure you have nothing to worry about.
Load the Toph!
I'm gonna give us some cover!
I just can't stand by and do nothing!
Aang, no!  You're still hurt, and you have to stay secret! Just let us handle this.
Aang, no!  You're still hurt, and you have to stay secret! Just let us handle this.
Fine.
How are we doing?
Things couldn't get much worse.  The universe just loves proving me wrong, doesn't it?
scene_description: [A serpent rises from the water near their ship.]

character_words: You make it too easy!
Thank you, the universe!
Hey, Aang! We're going into town to find some dinner.
Well, I am pretty hungry. Maybe dinner's a good idea.
Here,  tie this around your head. It will cover your arrow.
I'm not going out if I can't wear my arrow proudly!
Aang, come on. Be practical.
You guys go ahead without us. We'll catch up to you.  I think I understand why being a secret bothers you so much. You don't want people to think you failed.
You guys go ahead without us. We'll catch up to you.  I think I understand why being a secret bothers you so much. You don't want people to think you failed.
scene_description: [Toph and Sokka exit. Katara sits on Aang's bed, placing a hand on his shoulder.]

character_words: You're right, I don't. But the problem is, I did fail!
Aang, that's not true.
It is true. I was in Ba Sing Se. I was there! But I lost. And now the Earth Kingdom is fallen for good.
It's not for good.  Remember, there's still a plan. The invasion!

And I hate the invasion plan, too!  I don't want you or anyone else risking your lives to fix my mistakes! I've always known that I would have to face the Fire Lord. But now I know I need to do it alone.
scene_description: [Rips down the Fire Nation flag covering his staff.]

character_words: Aang ...
Katara, please! Just go ... please.
Is there anything you need?
I need to redeem myself. I need my honor back.
I brought you some food!  Oh no ...
I brought you some food!  Oh no ...
You've been away for a long time. I see the weight of your travels has changed you. You have redeemed yourself, my son.  Welcome home.
scene_description: [Approaches Zuko; the camera pans up to view Ozai's full face for the first time.]

character_words: I'll leave you two alone.
What's wrong, Katara?
He left.
What?
Aang. He just took his glider and disappeared. He has this ridiculous notion that he has to save the world alone, that it's all his responsibility.
Maybe that's his way of being brave.
It's not brave, it's selfish and stupid! We could be helping him and I know the world needs him, but doesn't he know how much we need him, too? How can he just leave us behind?
You're talking about me too, aren't you?
How could you leave us, Dad?  I mean, I know we had Gran-Gran, and she loved us, but we were just so lost without you.
scene_description: [She attempts to wipe away the tears.]

character_words: I'm so sorry, Katara.
I understand why you left. I really do, and I know that you had to go, so why do I still feel this way? I'm so sad and angry and hurt!

I love you more than anything. You and your brother are my entire world. I thought about you every day when I was gone and every night when I went to sleep, I would lie awake missing you so much it would ache.

I am proud of you, Prince Zuko. I am proud because you and your sister conquered Ba Sing Se. I am proud because when your loyalty was tested by your treacherous uncle, you did the right thing and captured the traitor. And I am proudest of all of your most legendary accomplishment: you slayed the Avatar.
What did you hear?
Azula told me everything. She said she was amazed and impressed at your power and ferocity at the moment of truth.
A blockade.
Why'd you do it?
You're going to have to be a little more specific.
Why did you tell Father that I was the one who killed the Avatar?
Can't this wait until the morning?
It. Can't.
Fine. You seemed so worried about how Father would treat you because you hadn't captured the Avatar. I figured if I gave you the credit, you'd have nothing to worry about.
But why?
Call it a generous gesture. I wanted to thank you for your help and I was happy to share the glory.
You're lying.
If you say so ...
You have another motive for doing this, I just haven't figured out what it is.

Please Zuko, what ulterior motive could I have? What could I possibly gain by letting you get all the glory for defeating the Avatar?  Unless, somehow, the Avatar was actually alive. All that glory would suddenly turn to shame and foolishness. But you said it yourself, that was impossible.  Sleep well, Zuzu.
scene_description: [Approaching close to Zuko she places a hand on his shoulder.]

character_words: Please Zuko, what ulterior motive could I have? What could I possibly gain by letting you get all the glory for defeating the Avatar?  Unless, somehow, the Avatar was actually alive. All that glory would suddenly turn to shame and foolishness. But you said it yourself, that was impossible.  Sleep well, Zuzu.
I'm not gonna make it. I failed.  Roku?
scene_description: [Within the lightning strikes, the spirit of Roku appears before Aang.]

character_words: You haven't failed, Aang.
But everyone thinks I'm dead again. They think I've abandoned them, and I'm losing this war. I'm letting the whole world down.

If anyone is to blame for the state of the world, it is me. I should have seen this war coming and prevented it. You inherited my problems and my mistakes. But I believe you are destined to redeem me and save the world.
I don't know.
You already saved the world. And you'll save the world again, but you can't give up.
You're right. I won't give up.
You're okay!
I have so much to do.
I know, but you'll have our help.
You didn't think you could get out of training just by coming to the Fire Nation, did you?
What about the invasion?
We'll join up with my dad and the invasion force the day of the eclipse.
Hey! What's ... oh, it's your glider.
scene_description: [Notices Aang's damaged staff has washed ashore.]

character_words: It's okay. If someone saw it, it would give away my identity. It's better for now that no one knows I'm alive.
Who's there?!
I think I see a cave below.
Sh! Keep quiet!
Great job with the cloud camo, but next time, let's disguise ourselves as the kind of cloud that knows how to keep its mouth shut.
Yeah, we wouldn't want a bird to hear us chatting up there and turn us in.
scene_description: [Cut to the Toph, Katara, and Aang standing in front of Sokka, who is reconnoitering. Sarcastically.]

character_words: Hey, we're in enemy territory.  Those are enemy birds.
Hey, we're in enemy territory.  Those are enemy birds.
scene_description: [He points above as camera zooms back to show four toucan puffins standing on a rock behind him.]

character_words: Well, this is it.  This is how we'll be living until the invasion begins.  Hiding in cave after cave after cave after cave ...
scene_description: [Cut to Sokka standing in front of the other three.]

character_words: Well, this is it.  This is how we'll be living until the invasion begins.  Hiding in cave after cave after cave after cave ...
scene_description: [His head drops each time he says the word, "cave".]

character_words: Sokka, we don't need to become cave people. What we need is some new clothes.
scene_description: [Cut to Katara, standing near Aang, from behind Sokka.]

character_words: Yeah, blending in is better than hiding out.  If we get Fire Nation disguises,  we would be just as safe as we would be hiding in a cave.
Yeah, blending in is better than hiding out.  If we get Fire Nation disguises,  we would be just as safe as we would be hiding in a cave.
Plus, they have real food out there. Does anyone want to sit in the dirt and eat cave hoppers?
scene_description: [Cut to Toph, who is sitting down with her legs slightly folded.]

character_words: Looks like we got outvoted, sport. Let's get some new clothes.
I don't know about this.  These clothes belong to somebody.
I don't know about this.  These clothes belong to somebody.
scene_description: [Cut to a view of Team Avatar from the clothes.]

character_words: I call the silk robe!
scene_description: [Jumps out from behind the rock wall and grabs two outfits.]

character_words: But if it's essential to our survival ... then I call the suit!
Ta-dah! Normal kid.
Hm ... I should probably wear shoes. But then I won't be able to see as well.  Sorry, shoes.  Finally, a stylish shoe for the blind earthbender.
Hm ... I should probably wear shoes. But then I won't be able to see as well.  Sorry, shoes.  Finally, a stylish shoe for the blind earthbender.
scene_description: [Pulls on the shoe, launching the sole at Sokka's face, leaving a red mark.]

character_words: How do I look?
How do I look?
scene_description: [The camera pans from Katara's dress to her whole outfit.]

character_words: Uh ... your mom's necklace.
Oh,  oh, yeah. I guess it's pretty obviously Water Tribe, isn't it?
Oh,  oh, yeah. I guess it's pretty obviously Water Tribe, isn't it?
scene_description: [Takes off the necklace and holds it in her hand.]

character_words: I used to visit my friend Kuzon here a hundred years ago. So, everyone just follow my lead and stay cool. Or, as they say in the Fire Nation, stay flamin'.  Greetings, my good hotman.
scene_description: [Walks around the building corner. To a man eating meat on a stick.]

character_words: Uh, hi.  I guess ...
Uh, hi.  I guess ...
scene_description: [Sokka shrugs at him as he passes.]

character_words: Oh, we're going to a meat place?
Come on, Aang, everyone here eats meat. Even the meat.
scene_description: [Points at a hippo cow eating a piece of meat swarming with flies.]

character_words: You guys go ahead. I'll just get some lettuce out of the garbage.  Hotman. Hotman. Hotman. Hotman. Hotman. Hotman.
scene_description: [Aang and Katara wave each at each other as the rest enter. Turns around to greet random people on the street.]

character_words: It's over. We caught you.
Who, me?
It couldn't be more obvious that you don't belong here.  Next time you play hooky, you might wanna take off your school uniform.
Oh. Is this a new mind ready for molding?
That's right.  Let the molding begin.
That's right.  Let the molding begin.
scene_description: [The two guards turn away to leave.]

character_words: Wait a minute.  You're not from the Fire Nation.  Clearly you're from the colonies.
Wait a minute.  You're not from the Fire Nation.  Clearly you're from the colonies.
Yeah, the colonies, of course. The Fire Nation colonies in the Earth Kingdom.
Your etiquette is terrible. In the homeland, we bow to our elders.  Like so.
Your etiquette is terrible. In the homeland, we bow to our elders.  Like so.
Sorry, ma'am.
And we don't wear head coverings indoors.
Um ... I have a scar. It's really embarrassing.
Very well. What is your name? Or should we just call you "Mannerless Colony Slob"?
Just "slob" is fine. Or, uh, Kuzon.
We made it through the day Momo, and it was pretty fun.
Don't let the headmaster catch you with that monkey.
Don't let the headmaster catch you with that monkey.
What monkey?
Don't worry, I'm not a tattletale. My name's On Ji. I like your headband, by the way.
On Ji, you don't have to baby-sit the new kid.
scene_description: [Walks past Aang, slightly bumping him away and puts a hand around On Ji's shoulders.]

character_words: Wow.  You must be one of those popular kids I've been hearing about.
That's right. Now listen, friend. I know you're from the colonies, so I'll say this slowly.  On Ji is my girlfriend.  Don't forget it.
That's right. Now listen, friend. I know you're from the colonies, so I'll say this slowly.  On Ji is my girlfriend.  Don't forget it.
It was nice meeting you.
scene_description: [Waving goodbye to On Ji and Hide.]

character_words: I don't believe it, he didn't beat you up. Not even a little.
I guess I'm just lucky.
We were on our way to play hide and explode. You wanna come?
I'd love to.
Where have you been? We've been worried sick.
I got invited to play with some kids after school.
After what?!
scene_description: [Springs up to his feet in shock.]

character_words: I enrolled in a Fire Nation school, and I'm going back tomorrow.
Enrolled in what?!
Enrolled in what?!
You again? Stop where you are!  Prince Zuko ...
scene_description: [Readies his spear, with it pointed directly at Zuko.]

character_words: You again? Stop where you are!  Prince Zuko ...
scene_description: [Zuko raises his head, looking at the guard.]

character_words: I'm going in for a visit. You're going to stand guard here, and no one is going to know about this.  Uncle, it's me.
scene_description: [Zuko releases the guard, enters Iroh's cell, and approaches him.]

character_words: I'm going in for a visit. You're going to stand guard here, and no one is going to know about this.  Uncle, it's me.
scene_description: [Iroh, sitting on the floor, turns away from Zuko with a scowl on his face.]

character_words: Aang, I'm trying to be mature and not immediately shoot down your idea, but it sounds ... really terrible.
Yeah, we got our outfits. What do you need to go to school for?
Every minute I'm in that classroom, I'm learning new things about the Fire Nation. I already have a picture of Fire Lord Ozai.  And here's one that I made out of noodles!
Every minute I'm in that classroom, I'm learning new things about the Fire Nation. I already have a picture of Fire Lord Ozai.  And here's one that I made out of noodles!
Impressive, I admit, but I still think it's too dangerous.
I guess we'll never find out about the secret river then. It goes right to the Fire Lord's palace. We were supposed to learn about it in class tomorrow.
Hmm, I am a fan of secret rivers ... fine, let's stay a few more days.
Flamey-o, hotman!
Flamey-o?

You brought this on yourself you know. We could have returned together. You could have been a hero!  You have no right to judge me, Uncle. I did what I had to do in Ba Sing Se, and you're a fool for not joining me.  You're not going to say anything?  You're a crazy old man! You're crazy! And if you weren't in jail, you'd be sleeping in a gutter!
scene_description: [Iroh shifts but does not look at him.]

character_words: You brought this on yourself you know. We could have returned together. You could have been a hero!  You have no right to judge me, Uncle. I did what I had to do in Ba Sing Se, and you're a fool for not joining me.  You're not going to say anything?  You're a crazy old man! You're crazy! And if you weren't in jail, you'd be sleeping in a gutter!

You brought this on yourself you know. We could have returned together. You could have been a hero!  You have no right to judge me, Uncle. I did what I had to do in Ba Sing Se, and you're a fool for not joining me.  You're not going to say anything?  You're a crazy old man! You're crazy! And if you weren't in jail, you'd be sleeping in a gutter!
scene_description: [Kicks up a small stool and destroys it with firebending.]

character_words: You brought this on yourself you know. We could have returned together. You could have been a hero!  You have no right to judge me, Uncle. I did what I had to do in Ba Sing Se, and you're a fool for not joining me.  You're not going to say anything?  You're a crazy old man! You're crazy! And if you weren't in jail, you'd be sleeping in a gutter!
scene_description: [Zuko leaves, slamming the door behind him as Iroh's head drops slightly and he closes his eyes.]

character_words: Good morning class. Recite the Fire Nation oath.
My life I give to my country, with my hands I fight for Fire Lord Ozai and our forefathers before him.
scene_description: [Turns to a large painting of Ozai at the back of the class.]

character_words: Fire Lord ... forefathers ...
scene_description: [Glances around the room as the class recites the oath.]

character_words: With my mind I seek ways to better my country, and with my feet may our March of Civilization continue.
Firebenders ... Fire Lord ... wah, bah, blah, blah.
scene_description: [The class snickers at him as they sit down as the teacher looks on with a stern expression.]

character_words: Since it's obviously hilarious to mock our national oath, we'll begin with a pop quiz on our great March of Civilization.  Question one: What year did Fire Lord Sozin battle the Air Nation army?  Kuzon?
scene_description: [The class groans and picks up their pens.]

character_words: Since it's obviously hilarious to mock our national oath, we'll begin with a pop quiz on our great March of Civilization.  Question one: What year did Fire Lord Sozin battle the Air Nation army?  Kuzon?
Is that a trick question? The Air Nomads didn't have a formal military. Sozin defeated them by ambush.
scene_description: [The entire class stares at him, dumbfounded.]

character_words: Well, I don't know how you could possibly know more than our national history book. Unless you were there a hundred years ago.
I'll just write down my best guess.
Kuzon?
I know, I'm a terrible tsungi hornist.
No, child. That hullabaloo going on with your feet. Is that a nervous disorder?
I was just dancing. You do dances here in the homeland, right?
Not really, no.
Dancing is not conducive to a proper learning environment. Young people must have rigid discipline and order.
But what about expressing yourself?
I know sometimes we're so ruled by our love for our nation that we can't control our own bodies.  If you must, you may march in place quietly next time the urge hits you.
scene_description: [He puts his hand to his face at what he is saying before continuing on.]

character_words: Uh, hi, Kuzon. I really liked that crazy dance you were doing.
Thanks On Ji. I could show it to you again if you like. Ah!
scene_description: [He jumps as a blast of fire hits the ground at his feet.]

character_words: What'd you say, colony trash? You're gonna show her something?
Just some dance movements.
Nobody shows my On Ji anything, especially movements!
Picking fights on your second day? We need to have a conference to discuss your punishment. Bring your parents to my office after school.
Parents? But-
Don't be late!
Thank you for coming, Mr. and Mrs ...
scene_description: [Shot changes to show Sokka and Katara in disguise with Aang sitting between them.]

character_words: Fire. Wang Fire.  This is my wife, Sapphire.
Sapphire Fire. Nice to meet you.
Mr. and Mrs ... Fire, your son has been enrolled here for two days and he's already causing problems. He's argued with his history teacher, disrupted music class, and roughed up my star pupil.
My goodness! That doesn't sound like our Kuzon.
That's what any mother would say, Ma'am. Nonetheless, you're forewarned; if he acts up one more time, I'll have him sent to reform school-  by which I mean the coal mines. Are we clear?
Don't you worry, Mr. Headmaster. I'll straighten this boy out somethin' fierce!  Young man, as soon as we get home you're gonna get the punishment of a lifetime!
Don't you worry, Mr. Headmaster. I'll straighten this boy out somethin' fierce!  Young man, as soon as we get home you're gonna get the punishment of a lifetime!
That's what I like to hear.
Orange is such an awful color.
You're so beautiful when you hate the world.
I don't hate you.
I don't hate you too.
scene_description: [They kiss, but are interrupted by Azula.]

character_words: Ahem.  Zuko, could I have a word with you?
scene_description: [They turn to look at her, clearly annoyed.]

character_words: Can't you see we're busy?
Oh Mai, Ty Lee need your help untangling her braid.
Sounds pretty serious.
Sounds pretty serious.
scene_description: [Leaves, but throws an angry glance at Azula behind her back.]

character_words: So, I've heard you've been to visit your uncle fatso in the prison tower.
That guard told you.
No. You did. Just now.
Okay, you caught me. What is it that you want Azula?
Actually, nothing. Believe it or not, I'm looking out for you. If people find out you've been to see Uncle, they'll think you're plotting with him. Just be careful, Dum-Dum.
That settles it! No more school for you, young man!
That settles it! No more school for you, young man!
I'm not ready to leave yet. I'm having fun for once, just being a normal kid. You don't know what it's like, Sokka. You get to be normal all the time.
Ha ha!
Listen guys, those kids at school are the future of the Fire Nation. If we want to change this place for the better, we need to show them a little taste of freedom.
What could you possibly do for a country of depraved little fire monsters?
I'm gonna throw them,  a secret dance party!
I'm gonna throw them,  a secret dance party!
Go to your room!
I can't believe we're having a dance party. It seems so ... silly.
Don't think of it as a dance party, but as a cultural event celebrating the art of fancy footwork!
They're coming! Everyone stop bending.
Sorry buddy, you should probably wait out back.  I know, you got fancier feet than anybody. And six of 'em!
Sorry buddy, you should probably wait out back.  I know, you got fancier feet than anybody. And six of 'em!
scene_description: [Appa grumbles as Aang herds him into the back.]

character_words: Ladies and gentlemen, the Flamey-O's! Yeah, this ought to get everybody moving.
Ladies and gentlemen, the Flamey-O's! Yeah, this ought to get everybody moving.
scene_description: [He looks around at the kids standing shyly at the edge of the cave.]

character_words: Now what do we do?
This is when you start dancing.
I don't think my parents want me dancing in a cave ...
Yeah! What if someone finds out?!
Yeah! What if someone finds out?!
Oh boy. Listen guys, dancing isn't something you think about. It's a form of self-expression that no one can ever take away from you.
Maybe it was different in the colonies, Kuzon, but we don't do that here.

Sure you do, you have for generations! It just so happens that I know several classic Fire Nation dances. A hundred years ago, this was known as the 'Phoenix Flight'.  And, this was the 'Camelephant Strut'.
scene_description: [The students ooh and aah as Aang runs low to the ground.]

character_words: Who knew Twinkle Toes could dance?

I brought you some komodo chicken. I know you don't care for it, but I figure it beats prison food. I admit it, I have everything I always wanted, but it's not as all how I thought it would be. The truth is, I need your advice.  I think the Avatar is still alive, I know he's out there, I'm losing my mind.  Please, Uncle, I'm so confused I need your help.  Forget it, I'll solve it myself! Waste away in here for all I care!
scene_description: [Sliding food into Iroh's cell as Iroh keeps his back to him.]

character_words: I brought you some komodo chicken. I know you don't care for it, but I figure it beats prison food. I admit it, I have everything I always wanted, but it's not as all how I thought it would be. The truth is, I need your advice.  I think the Avatar is still alive, I know he's out there, I'm losing my mind.  Please, Uncle, I'm so confused I need your help.  Forget it, I'll solve it myself! Waste away in here for all I care!

I brought you some komodo chicken. I know you don't care for it, but I figure it beats prison food. I admit it, I have everything I always wanted, but it's not as all how I thought it would be. The truth is, I need your advice.  I think the Avatar is still alive, I know he's out there, I'm losing my mind.  Please, Uncle, I'm so confused I need your help.  Forget it, I'll solve it myself! Waste away in here for all I care!

I brought you some komodo chicken. I know you don't care for it, but I figure it beats prison food. I admit it, I have everything I always wanted, but it's not as all how I thought it would be. The truth is, I need your advice.  I think the Avatar is still alive, I know he's out there, I'm losing my mind.  Please, Uncle, I'm so confused I need your help.  Forget it, I'll solve it myself! Waste away in here for all I care!

I brought you some komodo chicken. I know you don't care for it, but I figure it beats prison food. I admit it, I have everything I always wanted, but it's not as all how I thought it would be. The truth is, I need your advice.  I think the Avatar is still alive, I know he's out there, I'm losing my mind.  Please, Uncle, I'm so confused I need your help.  Forget it, I'll solve it myself! Waste away in here for all I care!
scene_description: [He glances back before leaving, and a tear slides down Iroh's face.]

character_words: And this is how they do it in the ballrooms of Ba Sing Se.
scene_description: [He starts tapping his feet from side to side and On Ji joins him.]

character_words: Wow, they look pretty good together.
scene_description: [Watching as Aang dances with On Ji.]

character_words: Eh, if that's what you like ...
scene_description: [Barely hiding her envy as she looks away.]

character_words: Eh, if that's what you like ...
Yeah, that's it! That's the sound of happy feet.  All right, go with that! Everybody freestyle!
scene_description: [The rest of the kids start dancing with them.]

character_words: I don't know, Aang. These shoes aren't really right for dancing, and I-I'm not sure that I know how to-
Take my hand.
Okay.
Aang, everyone's watching.
Don't worry about them. It's just you and me right now.
It is a dancing party.  You did the right thing by telling me, Hide.
Anytime, Headmaster sir.
This is incredible! It's like my inhibitions just disappear!  Okay, they're back again.
This is incredible! It's like my inhibitions just disappear!  Okay, they're back again.
scene_description: [He sees the Headmaster come into the cave, and immediately stops dancing and attempts to shrink into his robes.]

character_words: He's the one we want! The boy with the headband!
Uh-oh.
scene_description: [Aang starts running away through the crowd as the soldiers chase him. One soldier sees a boy with a headband, and grabs him.]

character_words: Gotcha!
scene_description: [The boy turns, but the guard is confused upon seeing a different boy there.]

character_words: Looking for me?
That's not the one. He's here somewhere. Don't let him leave the cave!
Yes?
Hi there.
How're we doing?
Looking for someone?
Who are you looking for?
Do you need something?
Over here.
Stop that!  Stop that!
scene_description: [To one of the soldiers, who starts dancing.]

character_words: Stop that!  Stop that!
scene_description: [To another soldier, who is tapping her foot.]

character_words: We're safe Sokka, you can take off the mustache now.
Oh, no I can't. It's permanently glued to my skin.
scene_description: [He is seen with his Wang Fire mustache on and begins stroking it.]

character_words: Way to go, dancy pants. I think you really did help those kids, you taught them to be free.
I don't know, it was just a dance party, that's all.
Well, that was some dance party Aang.
scene_description: [She kisses him on the cheek, and Aang blushes.]

character_words: Flamey-o sir, flamey-o.
You're sure you weren't followed? I've heard about you. They say you're good at what you do, and even better at keeping secrets. The Avatar is alive. I want you to find him, and end him.
Momo!  Oh Momo!  Hahahahaha! You found me, buddy!  Hey guys, I think this river's polluted.
Momo!  Oh Momo!  Hahahahaha! You found me, buddy!  Hey guys, I think this river's polluted.
scene_description: [Dives again and Momo flies to Aang.]

character_words: Momo!  Oh Momo!  Hahahahaha! You found me, buddy!  Hey guys, I think this river's polluted.
scene_description: [Looks down at the water in distaste and airbends up to Appa's saddle, where he stands dripping in sludge.]

character_words: Momo!  Oh Momo!  Hahahahaha! You found me, buddy!  Hey guys, I think this river's polluted.
scene_description: [Airbends mud off himself, splattering the rest of Team Avatar with mud, which causes them to cry out in disgust.]

character_words: Pah! Plegh!
scene_description: [Tastes mud on her mouth, and spits.]

character_words: Pah! Plegh!
scene_description: [Aang airbends again, blowing the rest of the mud back into the river and messing up their hair.]

character_words: Well that explains why I can't catch a fish around here, because normally my fishing skills are off the hook!  Get it? Like a fishing hook?
Well that explains why I can't catch a fish around here, because normally my fishing skills are off the hook!  Get it? Like a fishing hook?
Too bad your skills aren't on the hook.
It looks like we'll need to go somewhere else to get food,  assuming that'll fit into Sokka's master schedule.
scene_description: [Unrolls a long scroll in front of her.]

character_words: Hmmm ... It's doable. But that means only two potty breaks today.
Hey, maybe we can get food there!
scene_description: [Points at a village in the middle of the river.]

character_words: Now you look just like a little hill with horns! Bye, buddy!
I don't feel anything. Where is the village?
It's in the middle of the river!
Sure is! My name's Dock. Mind if I ask who you are?
We're um ... from the Earth Kingdom colonies.
Wow ... Colonials. Hop on, I give you ride in the town.
Why do you guys live on the river?

Because we're a fishing town. At least that's how it was before the factory moved in.  Army makes their metal there. Moved in a few years ago and started gunking up our river.  Now our little village is struggling to survive.
scene_description: [Turns his paddle to the right side, pointing at the Fire Nation factory.]

character_words: Because we're a fishing town. At least that's how it was before the factory moved in.  Army makes their metal there. Moved in a few years ago and started gunking up our river.  Now our little village is struggling to survive.
scene_description: [Closer shot of the Fire Nation factory and pans down.]

character_words: Because we're a fishing town. At least that's how it was before the factory moved in.  Army makes their metal there. Moved in a few years ago and started gunking up our river.  Now our little village is struggling to survive.
scene_description: [Shot changes back to the ferry. Aang and Katara glance sadly at each other.]

character_words: Thanks for the ride!
scene_description: [Waves his hand to Dock, who waves back.]

character_words: Look at this place.  It's so sad.  We have to do something to help.
scene_description: [Cut to three villagers sitting on a porch.]

character_words: Look at this place.  It's so sad.  We have to do something to help.
scene_description: [Cut to two other villagers, an old man and a young boy.]

character_words: Look at this place.  It's so sad.  We have to do something to help.
No, we can't waste our time here. We have a bigger mission that we need to stay focused on. These people are on their own.
These people are starving! But you'd turn your back on them?  How can you be so cold and heartless?
These people are starving! But you'd turn your back on them?  How can you be so cold and heartless?
I'm not turning my back, I'm just being realistic. We can't go around helping every rinky-dink town we wander into. We'll be helping them all by taking out the Fire Lord.
scene_description: [Shot changes to show their argument from the river as a barrel bobs up and down.]

character_words: I'm not turning my back, I'm just being realistic. We can't go around helping every rinky-dink town we wander into. We'll be helping them all by taking out the Fire Lord.
scene_description: [Aang guides Toph toward the arguing siblings.]

character_words: Hey, loud mouths! Maybe we should be a little quieter when we talk about "taking out the Fire Lord."
Come on, Katara, be reasonable about this. You know our mission has to come first.
I guess so.
I guess so.
Let's just get what we need and go.
Hey, Dock. You work here too?
I'm not Dock. I'm Xu! Dock's my brother.
But we just saw you. You're even wearing the same clothes.  The only difference is your hat.
Dock works on the docks. That's why we call him, "Dock", and I work in the shop, that's why they call me, "Xu"!
I don't get it.
Me neither.  What I can getcha?  Hey, I'll give you a special deal. If you buy three fish, I'll give you a clam for free.
scene_description: [Jumps down behind the counter and pulls out a crate filled with rancid gray seafood.]

character_words: Me neither.  What I can getcha?  Hey, I'll give you a special deal. If you buy three fish, I'll give you a clam for free.
Me neither.  What I can getcha?  Hey, I'll give you a special deal. If you buy three fish, I'll give you a clam for free.
scene_description: [Sokka pushes a clam, and mucus splashes out from it.]

character_words: We'll just take the fish.  Mind telling your brother we need a ride back to shore?
We'll just take the fish.  Mind telling your brother we need a ride back to shore?
We'll just take the fish.  Mind telling your brother we need a ride back to shore?
scene_description: [Xu jumps down behind the counter and jumps up wearing Dock's hat.]

character_words: Hey, colonials! My brother says you need a lift.
scene_description: [Jumps over the counter, and walks to the dock.]

character_words: Can you spare some food?
I wish I could help more.
I wish I could help more.
scene_description: [Gives the boy a fish, and the boy bows to her and leaves to give the fish to his sick mother.]

character_words: Our detour into town today has completely thrown off our schedule. It's gonna take some serious finagling to get us back on track.
Finagle away, oh schedule master.
Well, for starters, it looks like we'll need to wake up forty-three minutes earlier every day.
Forty-three minutes?

Look, we only have a few weeks to get to the Fire Lord in time for the invasion and the eclipse, which, by the way, only lasts for eight minutes. And we just lost a whole day. So if we want to make up the time and stay on schedule, we have to wake up early!
scene_description: [Pointing to various spots on his schedule.]

character_words: Well I'm not waking up early.
Or we could just cut out all of our eating breaks.
What?
No way!
Forget it!
I got it, how's this from now on, we'll take food breaks and potty breaks at the same time.
scene_description: [Gets a sly look on his face.]

character_words: Hey, it might be gross, but it's efficient. Either way, we have to leave here first thing tomorrow morning.
What's the matter Katara?
I think Appa's sick.
What? Appa's sick? That's awful!
Wow, Sokka, I didn't realize you cared so much.
Of course I care. I might as well just throw our schedule away now.  And I'm concerned because my big, furry friend doesn't feel well.
scene_description: [Pulls out his schedule. He stops and looks at the group. Cut to a shot of the rest of the gang giving him the evil eye, and he quickly changes his tone, rushing solicitously to Appa's side.]

character_words: He must have gotten sick from being in the polluted water.
He doesn't look sick. You okay, buddy?  His tongue is purple! That can't be good. Katara, can you heal him?
scene_description: [Appa groans and Aang pulls out Appa's purple tongue.]

character_words: It looks like he needs some medicine. Maybe we can find the right herbs in town.
Is it just me, or does this place seem different?
Yeah, are the people ... happier?
Hey, Xu, what's going on with everyone today?
Ah, something amazing happened last night. Food was delivered to our village by a mysterious and wonderful person ... the Painted Lady.
The Painted who now?
The Painted Lady.  She's part of our town's lore. They say she's a river spirit who watches over our town in times of need. I always thought she was just a legend. Until now.
scene_description: [He places a miniature statuette of the spirit down on the counter.]

character_words: See, we don't need to help these people, they already have someone to help them. All we need is medicine for our sick friend.
Medicine? Sorry, all the medicine we have goes to the factory. That's why there's so many sick people in our village.
Looks like we need to stay another night so Appa can rest.
I guess you're right. You got any more food to sell?
Would you like the one-headed fish, or the two-headed fish?
scene_description: [Goes under the counter and emerges holding a fish in each hand.]

character_words: Would you like the one-headed fish, or the two-headed fish?
scene_description: [He turns the fish on the left sideways to show the second head.]

character_words: Two-headed!  What? You get more for your money that way!
Two-headed!  What? You get more for your money that way!
scene_description: [The rest of the group lowers their heads and small sweat drops appear.]

character_words: Two-headed!  What? You get more for your money that way!
Thank you, Painted Lady.
Hi, Dock. Is Xu around?
Let me check ...  Hey there! Back again, are ya?
scene_description: [He runs around the shop and ducks beneath the counter to switch hats.]

character_words: We need more food.  Our friend is still sick and we can't leave until he's better.
We need more food.  Our friend is still sick and we can't leave until he's better.
Oh, well, that's too bad. Maybe if you guys are lucky, the Painted Lady will visit you in the night, and heal your friend.
And maybe she'll cook us a midnight snack, and we'll all have a sing-along.
Yeah, may be! You know, last night she visited us again. Healed most of our sick folks.
scene_description: [Not getting the sarcasm. Sokka looks annoyed now.]

character_words: Is that why this place seems so festive?
Yep, it's all because of the Painted Lady.
Can you believe how much an entire village can be affected by one lady I mean ... spirit?
Well, I hope she returns every night. Otherwise this place would go right back to the way it was.
Why would you say that? Look how much better off these people are.
Yeah, now, but without her they wouldn't be able to fend for themselves. If she really wanted to help, she would use her spirit magic to blow up that factory.
scene_description: [He makes mocking gestures to indicate explosive spirit magic. He crosses his arms with a smile. Katara gets even more annoyed. The screen pans to the right to show Aang who has his arms crossed not impressed.]

character_words: Spirit magic doesn't work that way, Sokka. It's more like ...
scene_description: [He waves his body with arms in the air making similar gestures to indicate spirit magic. Katara storms away from the two.]

character_words: Wooooooooo ...
scene_description: [Sokka wraps and arm over Aang's shoulder and the two combined their little imitation but far more ridiculous.]

character_words: Wooooooooo ...
What's the matter, buddy?  It's her!  Hello, Painted Lady Spirit!
What's the matter, buddy?  It's her!  Hello, Painted Lady Spirit!
scene_description: [Excited, waves his hand to Katara and puts on his headband.]

character_words: Excuse me, I don't mean to bother you, but my friend's sick and we're on kind of a tight schedule.  Wait! But I'm a great bridge between your world and mine!  I know Hei Bai! We're close personal friends!  Heeey!  My name's Aang. I'm the Avatar.

Excuse me, I don't mean to bother you, but my friend's sick and we're on kind of a tight schedule.  Wait! But I'm a great bridge between your world and mine!  I know Hei Bai! We're close personal friends!  Heeey!  My name's Aang. I'm the Avatar.
scene_description: [Continues to follow her down the hill as she crosses the river.]

character_words: Excuse me, I don't mean to bother you, but my friend's sick and we're on kind of a tight schedule.  Wait! But I'm a great bridge between your world and mine!  I know Hei Bai! We're close personal friends!  Heeey!  My name's Aang. I'm the Avatar.
scene_description: [Aang freezes some water to form stepping stones to cross the river.]

character_words: Excuse me, I don't mean to bother you, but my friend's sick and we're on kind of a tight schedule.  Wait! But I'm a great bridge between your world and mine!  I know Hei Bai! We're close personal friends!  Heeey!  My name's Aang. I'm the Avatar.
scene_description: [Katara moves faster, and Aang jumps on a wooden bridge. Katara runs out of the river onto the docks and notices Aang's reflection in the water. She looks up and sees Aang running across a roof.]

character_words: Excuse me, I don't mean to bother you, but my friend's sick and we're on kind of a tight schedule.  Wait! But I'm a great bridge between your world and mine!  I know Hei Bai! We're close personal friends!  Heeey!  My name's Aang. I'm the Avatar.
scene_description: [He suddenly hits a pole, Katara flinches and feels sorry for him but continues on across the river to the other side. She stops to look out at the village thinking she is safe but Aang drops in front of her.]

character_words: Excuse me, I don't mean to bother you, but my friend's sick and we're on kind of a tight schedule.  Wait! But I'm a great bridge between your world and mine!  I know Hei Bai! We're close personal friends!  Heeey!  My name's Aang. I'm the Avatar.
scene_description: [Lifts his headband and points at his arrow.]

character_words: Well, hello Avatar. I wish I could talk, but I am very busy.
Yeah, me too. I hate that.  You know, you're really pretty spirit. I don't meet too many spirits, but the ones I do meet, not very attractive.
scene_description: [Looks at Katara's face from behind the veil.]

character_words: Yeah, me too. I hate that.  You know, you're really pretty spirit. I don't meet too many spirits, but the ones I do meet, not very attractive.
scene_description: [Looks at Katara suspiciously. Tries to look under the hat.]

character_words: Thank you, but-
You seem familiar too.
A lot of people say that.
No, you really seem familiar.
Look, I really should get going.
scene_description: [Covers her face and runs, but Aang uses his airbending and blasts her hat up into the air, exposing her.]

character_words: Katara?
Hi, Aang.
You're the Painted Lady?  But how?
You're the Painted Lady?  But how?
I wasn't her at first, I was just trying to help the village.  But since everyone thought that's who I was anyway, I guess I just kinda became her.
I wasn't her at first, I was just trying to help the village.  But since everyone thought that's who I was anyway, I guess I just kinda became her.
So you've been sneaking out at night? Wait, is Appa even sick?
He might be sick of the purple berries I've been feeding him, but other than that he's fine!
I can't believe you lied to everyone, so you could help these people.
I'm sorry, I know I shouldn't have ...
No, I think it's great! You're like a secret hero!
Well, if you wanna help, there's one more thing I have to do.
You wanna destroy this factory?
Yes. Sokka was just kidding, but he was right. Getting rid of this factory is the only way to help these people permanently.
Shhh!  We don't wanna wake Sokka.  Hi, Sokka, we were just out on a morning walk!
Shhh!  We don't wanna wake Sokka.  Hi, Sokka, we were just out on a morning walk!
scene_description: [She turns and sees that Sokka and Toph are awake.]

character_words: Oh, really? A morning walk?  I know you're the Painted Lady, I know you've been sneaking out at night, and I know you've been lying about Appa and been feeding him  purpleising tongue berries!  Katara, what you did put our whole mission in jeopardy. We're leaving right now!

Oh, really? A morning walk?  I know you're the Painted Lady, I know you've been sneaking out at night, and I know you've been lying about Appa and been feeding him  purpleising tongue berries!  Katara, what you did put our whole mission in jeopardy. We're leaving right now!
scene_description: [Dumps the hay out of Katara's sleeping bag.]

character_words: Oh, really? A morning walk?  I know you're the Painted Lady, I know you've been sneaking out at night, and I know you've been lying about Appa and been feeding him  purpleising tongue berries!  Katara, what you did put our whole mission in jeopardy. We're leaving right now!

Oh, really? A morning walk?  I know you're the Painted Lady, I know you've been sneaking out at night, and I know you've been lying about Appa and been feeding him  purpleising tongue berries!  Katara, what you did put our whole mission in jeopardy. We're leaving right now!
scene_description: [Toph sticks out her tongue and shows that it is purple and holds up a bag of berries which Momo starts eating.]

character_words: And how long did you know about this?
Hey, I just found out this morning!
What's going on?
scene_description: [Approaching and kneeling down with the others.]

character_words: Fire Nation soldiers are heading toward the village!
What did you do?
I kind of destroyed their factory.
You what?
It was your idea!
I was joking! I also said to use spirit magic and made funny noises!  Did you even think this through? The army is gonna blame the villagers! They're headed there right now to get revenge!
Well, what was I supposed to do?
Leave! Do nothing!
No, I will never, ever turn my back on people who need me!  I'm going down to that village, and I am gonna do whatever I can.
No, I will never, ever turn my back on people who need me!  I'm going down to that village, and I am gonna do whatever I can.
Wait! I'm coming, too.
I thought you didn't want to help.
You need me, and I will never turn my back on you.
Sokka, you really do have a heart.
He really does have a heart, doesn't he?
I thought we could live as neighbors, in peace. But I guess I was wrong. You steal our food, our medicine ... and then you destroy our factory.
We didn't do any of that.  Yeah, the Painted Lady brought us food. She's the one that healed our sick, not your medicine.
scene_description: [Pops out of the crowd wearing Dock hat.]

character_words: We didn't do any of that.  Yeah, the Painted Lady brought us food. She's the one that healed our sick, not your medicine.
scene_description: [Pops out in a different place wearing his Xu hat.]

character_words: Oh, right, the mysterious Painted Lady did it. And I suppose she drew the army emblem on your containers, too.  This is a town of thieves and liars!  Where's your Painted Lady now? We're going to cure the world of this wretched village.

Oh, right, the mysterious Painted Lady did it. And I suppose she drew the army emblem on your containers, too.  This is a town of thieves and liars!  Where's your Painted Lady now? We're going to cure the world of this wretched village.
scene_description: [Throws the statuette at the container, smashing it. The crowd gasps.]

character_words: Oh, right, the mysterious Painted Lady did it. And I suppose she drew the army emblem on your containers, too.  This is a town of thieves and liars!  Where's your Painted Lady now? We're going to cure the world of this wretched village.
scene_description: [Firebends a blast at a house. Mockingly.]

character_words: Light it again!
Look at that! Where's it coming from?
I don't know. Something strange is going on.
It's the Painted Lady.  She's coming.
There is no Painted Lady!
What is that sound?
Maybe it is her.
Do something!  Stand your ground!  I'll take care of you myself.
scene_description: [Pushes his soldiers forward. As they timidly draw near, they are rattled by a blast of airbending. Aang is shown hiding beneath the dock. The two soldiers run off. To the remaining soldiers.]

character_words: Do something!  Stand your ground!  I'll take care of you myself.
scene_description: [Katara waterbends two jet skis into a nearby cliff. As she raises her hand to wreak further damage, the soldiers jump into the remaining jet skis and speed off, leaving Mung.]

character_words: Leave this village and never come back.
I knew you'd come.
Thank you!
Painted Lady, you're the best!
Me and my brothers really owe you a lot.  Hey, wait a minute! I know you! You're not the Painted Lady, you're that colonial girl!
scene_description: [Looking at her and her faded Painted Lady marks.]

character_words: Yeah, you're the lady that gave me a fish.
You've been tricking us. You're a waterbender!
She's a waterbender!
How dare you act like our Painted Lady!
Maybe she is a waterbender, but she was just trying to help you. Because of her, that factory won't be polluting your river, and the army is gone. You should be down on your knees thanking her!

Sokka, it's okay.  I shouldn't have acted like someone I wasn't, and I shouldn't have tricked you. But I felt like I had to do something. It doesn't matter if the Painted Lady is real or not. Because your problems are real, and this river is real. You can't wait around for someone to help you. You have to help yourself.
scene_description: [She steps forward and moves Sokka back. To the villagers.]

character_words: She's right, but what should we do?
Maybe we can clean the river!
scene_description: [Pops out from behind the little boy's mother and uses a lower voice.]

character_words: Yeah, we can clean the river!  Thank you. You know, you're not so bad for a waterbender.
You wouldn't mind keeping that a secret, by the way, would you?
No problem. Keeping my mouth shut is a personal specialty. My brother Xu, on the other hand, ohh, he's a blabbermouth.
So, Dock, are you gonna help us clean?
No, ma'am. I'm going to get my other brother, Bushi. He loves cleaning rivers.  All right, I'm Bushi! Let's get some river cleaning done!
scene_description: [Dock brazenly switches hats right in front of them.]

character_words: Aha, I knew it! I knew you were the same guy. You're the shop owner and the boat guy.
Oh, you must be talking about my brothers, Dock and Xu.
No, I just saw you! You switched hats and called yourself a different name!
Oh, you know who does that? My brother, Dock.  He's crazy.
Oh, you know who does that? My brother, Dock.  He's crazy.
Oh, you know who does that? My brother, Dock.  He's crazy.
Thank you.
Wow, this is amazing to watch.
Kind of makes you realize how insignificant we are.
Eh, you've seen nothing once, you've seen it a thousand times.
Oh man,  you've never not seen anything like this.
The fire is gonna destroy that town!
Not if we can stop it!
There's a creek over here. I'll bend the water onto the fire.
scene_description: [Jumps onto Appa's head, taking the reins.]

character_words: There's a creek over here. I'll bend the water onto the fire.
Toph, let's make a trench to stop the fire from coming any closer.
scene_description: [Frontal view of Toph, Sokka, and Aang.]

character_words: What should I do?
Keep an eye on Momo.
So what, I'm just a lemur sitter?  There, there, feel better?
Sokka, stand clear!
Right.  Staying clear, got it.
scene_description: [Side-view of the crash site with Sokka and Momo looking left.]

character_words: Right.  Staying clear, got it.
scene_description: [Picks up Momo and makes to move away.]

character_words: Good work, everybody.
Look at you,  you're just a fat disgusting old man.  You do nothing, you say nothing, you just eat and roll around in your own filth like a pig.  You're a disgrace.
Look at you,  you're just a fat disgusting old man.  You do nothing, you say nothing, you just eat and roll around in your own filth like a pig.  You're a disgrace.
Look at you,  you're just a fat disgusting old man.  You do nothing, you say nothing, you just eat and roll around in your own filth like a pig.  You're a disgrace.
scene_description: [Frontal view of Poon as Iroh continues to eat.]

character_words: Look at you,  you're just a fat disgusting old man.  You do nothing, you say nothing, you just eat and roll around in your own filth like a pig.  You're a disgrace.
scene_description: [Spits on the floor in front of him and leaves.]

character_words: These people have no idea  how close they were to getting toasted last night.
Yeah, the worst thing about being in disguise is that we don't get the hero worship anymore. I miss the love.
Boo-hoo,  poor heroes.
Boo-hoo,  poor heroes.
scene_description: [Shot of Sokka from behind looking back.]

character_words: Boo-hoo,  poor heroes.
What's your problem? You haven't even touched your smoked sea slug.
It's just, all you guys can do this awesome bending stuff like putting out forest fires, and flying around and  making other stuff fly around. I can't fly around, okay?  I can't do anything.
It's just, all you guys can do this awesome bending stuff like putting out forest fires, and flying around and  making other stuff fly around. I can't fly around, okay?  I can't do anything.
That's not true. No one can read a map like you.
I can't read at all!
Yeah, and who keeps us laughing with sarcastic comments all the time?  I mean, look at Katara's hair, right? What's up with that?
What? What's wrong with my hair?
Nothing. I was just trying to ...
Look, I appreciate the effort,  but the fact is each of you is so amazing and so special and I'm ... not.  I'm just the guy in the group who's regular.
Look, I appreciate the effort,  but the fact is each of you is so amazing and so special and I'm ... not.  I'm just the guy in the group who's regular.
I'm sorry you're feeling so down but I hope you know, none of us see you that way.  I know something that's going to make you feel better.
I'm sorry you're feeling so down but I hope you know, none of us see you that way.  I know something that's going to make you feel better.
scene_description: [Frontal view of the two. Looks down for a moment before putting her hand on his shoulder.]

character_words: You do?
Shopping!  Maybe a little something to reinvigorate my battling.  Hey, how about these?
scene_description: [Clapping excitedly. Runs toward the camera. Cut to side-view as he approaches to view some weapons.]

character_words: Shopping!  Maybe a little something to reinvigorate my battling.  Hey, how about these?
Shopping!  Maybe a little something to reinvigorate my battling.  Hey, how about these?
scene_description: [Frontal view of Sokka. Sokka tests the nunchaku, making attacking noises, but he hits himself on the head and falls into some of the other weapons.]

character_words: What do you think?  Pretty slick, huh?  All I need to complete the outfit is a wind sword.
What do you think?  Pretty slick, huh?  All I need to complete the outfit is a wind sword.
scene_description: [Cut to Aang as the camera pans up to see him wearing strange, scary armor.]

character_words: What do you think?  Pretty slick, huh?  All I need to complete the outfit is a wind sword.
scene_description: [Close-up of Katara with a scared and surprised expression. Side-view of Katara approaching Aang, holding a hand up to avoid the glare coming off Aang's helmet.]

character_words: What's a wind sword?
It's where I get a sword handle and then I just swing this around and bend air out like a blade.  Whoosh, whoosh, whoosh.
scene_description: [Raises a sword handle, swishing it around like a sword.]

character_words: Yeah ... nice.
I'll just stick to what I got.
Ooh!  That's what Sokka's talking about.
Ooh!  That's what Sokka's talking about.
scene_description: [Walks to the sword. Side-view of Sokka inspecting the sword.]

character_words: You have a good eye.  That's an original from Piandao,  the greatest swordsmaster and sword maker in Fire Nation history.  He lives in the big castle up the road from here.
scene_description: [Aerial view of Sokka as shopkeeper approaches.]

character_words: You have a good eye.  That's an original from Piandao,  the greatest swordsmaster and sword maker in Fire Nation history.  He lives in the big castle up the road from here.
You have a good eye.  That's an original from Piandao,  the greatest swordsmaster and sword maker in Fire Nation history.  He lives in the big castle up the road from here.
You have a good eye.  That's an original from Piandao,  the greatest swordsmaster and sword maker in Fire Nation history.  He lives in the big castle up the road from here.
That's it! That's what you needed all along, Sokka.
A sword?
Not the sword, a master.  We've all had masters to help us get better. You should see if you can study with Piandao.
scene_description: [Sokka takes the sword from the rack.]

character_words: That's a great idea. I could've never gotten to where I am without Master Pakku. Everyone needs a teacher.
scene_description: [Frontal view of Sokka with Katara behind.]

character_words: I learned from badgermoles. They don't talk, but they're still good teachers.
It would be nice to be a master sword fighter. All right, I'll talk to him.
scene_description: [Close-up. Pulling out the blade, inspecting it.]

character_words: Can I help you?
I've come to train with the master.
You should know The Master turns almost everyone away.  What did you bring him to prove your worth?
You should know The Master turns almost everyone away.  What did you bring him to prove your worth?
scene_description: [Holds hand out in front of Sokka.]

character_words: Well, uhh ...
Well, uhh ...
scene_description: [Feels around, patting his clothes for something to offer.]

character_words: Right ...  Let's get this over with.
Right ...  Let's get this over with.
Master, my name is Sokka, and I wish to be instructed in the way of the sword.
Sokka. That's an unusual name.
Oh, uh, really, uh where I come from, the Fire Nation colonies, it's a pretty normal name ... for Fire Nation colonials.
Let me guess. You've come hundreds of miles from your little village where you're the best swordsman in town. And you think you deserve to learn from the master.
scene_description: [Side-view. Writing calligraphy on a piece of parchment.]

character_words: Well, actually, I've been all over the world.
Yep, here we go.
scene_description: [Side-view of his arm and hand as he continues to write. Knowingly.]

character_words: And I know one thing for sure:  I have a lot to learn.
And I know one thing for sure:  I have a lot to learn.
scene_description: [Gets down on his knees and hangs his head.]

character_words: You're not doing a very good job of selling yourself.
I know. Your butler told me that when I met you, I would have to prove my worth.  But the truth is ... I don't know if I am worthy.
I know. Your butler told me that when I met you, I would have to prove my worth.  But the truth is ... I don't know if I am worthy.
Hm, I see.  Well, then,  let's find out together how worthy you are.
Hm, I see.  Well, then,  let's find out together how worthy you are.
scene_description: [Smiles and turns his head. Cut to his hand picking up his sword.]

character_words: Hm, I see.  Well, then,  let's find out together how worthy you are.
I will train you.
The first thing you must learn is that your weapon is an extension of yourself.  You must think of it as another part of your own body.
The first thing you must learn is that your weapon is an extension of yourself.  You must think of it as another part of your own body.
scene_description: [Cut further away as he unsheathes his sword and begins performing a sword form.]

character_words: Like a second head.

Well, more like an extra-long, really sharp arm.  The sword is a simple tool, but in the hands of a master it becomes  the most versatile of weapons,  and just as the imagination is limitless,  so too are the possibilities of the sword.

Well, more like an extra-long, really sharp arm.  The sword is a simple tool, but in the hands of a master it becomes  the most versatile of weapons,  and just as the imagination is limitless,  so too are the possibilities of the sword.

scene_description: [Frontal view from below. Sheathes his sword and assumes a stance.]

character_words: Well, more like an extra-long, really sharp arm.  The sword is a simple tool, but in the hands of a master it becomes  the most versatile of weapons,  and just as the imagination is limitless,  so too are the possibilities of the sword.
What should we do today‌?
I'm tapped out. I already picked my toes, twice.
Twice?
The first time was for cleaning, but the second time's just for the sweet picking sensation!
Sokka's been in charge of the schedule. I'm not sure what we should be doing.
Plus, it's so hot today.
scene_description: [Frontal view of Aang with Toph behind. Picking her nose.]

character_words: How hot is it?
I dunno. Real hot‌?
I-It's so hot, it's so hot ... Momo is shedding like Appa.  Huh, huh‌?
I-It's so hot, it's so hot ... Momo is shedding like Appa.  Huh, huh‌?
scene_description: [Pets Momo and flicks tufts of fur from her fingers.]

character_words: I guess the jokes don't run in the family.
Oh, everyone's a critic.
The warrior practices a variety of arts to keep his mind sharp and fluid.  The first you will learn is calligraphy.  Write your name.
scene_description: [Flattens out a piece of paper on the table.]

character_words: The warrior practices a variety of arts to keep his mind sharp and fluid.  The first you will learn is calligraphy.  Write your name.
scene_description: [Cut to his hands as Piandao delicately hands a brush to Sokka, who takes it, messing the bristles up with his thumb.]

character_words: Writing my name will make me a better swordsman‌?

When you write your name, you stamp the paper with your identity. You must learn to use your sword to stamp your identity on a battlefield.  Remember, you cannot take back a stroke of the brush, or a stroke of the sword.
scene_description: [Takes the brush and positions it correctly in Sokka's hand. Cut to a wide shot of both.]

character_words: When you write your name, you stamp the paper with your identity. You must learn to use your sword to stamp your identity on a battlefield.  Remember, you cannot take back a stroke of the brush, or a stroke of the sword.
scene_description: [Sokka holds his sleeve back. Cut to close-up of the ink as Sokka dips the brush in to it. Cut to frontal view of Sokka readying himself to paint as Piandao looks on.]

character_words: You are getting ink on your face.
I am?  I am! So this is about putting my identity on the page, right?
I am?  I am! So this is about putting my identity on the page, right?
Landscape painting teaches a warrior to hold the lay of the land in his mind.
In battle, you only have an instant to take everything in.
Now, paint it.
And no peeking.
I'm finished!
You added a rainbow.
Is that ok‌ay?
Sokka.
Concentrate on what you're doing.
Rock gardening teaches the warrior to manipulate his surroundings and use them to his advantage.
Hm, manipulate them to my advantage ... oh!
Hey, would you mind grabbing a cold drink for me‌?
I'll take a slice of lemon in mine, please.
What's going on in there‌?
Crazy old man.
So where are we going next‌?  We're starting from here ...
scene_description: [Cut to a shot of Aang and Katara sitting around a map of the Fire Nation. Pointing to the map.]

character_words: No, we're over on this island.
You noodle-brains don't know what you're doing. I miss Sokka.
Ooh, I got one, if you miss him so much, why don't you marry him‌?
You've had a good first day of training.
I have‌? But I thought I messed up every single thing we worked on!
You messed things up in a very special way. You are ready for a real sword.
scene_description: [Frontal view of feet. Camera pans up to his face.]

character_words: Are you giving me one of yours‌?
No.
Your sword must be an extension of yourself. So tomorrow, you will make your own sword.
scene_description: [Frontal view. Camera zooms in on his face.]

character_words: Choosing the correct material is the most important step in crafting a sword.  You must trust your steel with your life. Choose carefully.
scene_description: [Close-up and zooms out showing the steel in front of him.]

character_words: Master,  would it be possible for me to leave and bring back a special material for my sword‌?
I wouldn't have it any other way.
Sokka's coming!
Hey, guys. What are you doing‌?
Sokka!
You're back!
We missed you so much!
scene_description: [Close-up of Sokka and Katara with Aang in the foreground.]

character_words: Say something funny!
Funny how‌?
What's their deal‌?
scene_description: [Side-view of Sokka with Toph in the foreground. To Toph.]

character_words: I don't know. They missed you or something. I didn't care.
Thanks. That warms my heart. Anyway, I need some help.
Who's this‌?
Oh, these are my friends. Just other good Fire Nation folks.  Do you think we can make a sword out of a meteorite‌?
Oh, these are my friends. Just other good Fire Nation folks.  Do you think we can make a sword out of a meteorite‌?
scene_description: [They bow to Piandao. Cut to Piandao, who bows back. The camera zooms out to show the meteorite and Sokka.]

character_words: We'll make a sword unlike any other in the world.

Sokka, when you first arrived, you were so unsure. You even seemed down on yourself.  But I saw something in you right away.  I saw a heart as strong as a lion turtle, and twice as big.  And as we trained, it wasn't your skills that impressed me.  No, it certainly wasn't your skills.  You showed something beyond that.  Creativity, versatility,  intelligence ...  these are the traits that define a great swordsman.  And these are the traits that define you.  You told me you didn't know if you were worthy,  but I believe that you are more worthy than any man I have ever trained.
scene_description: [Frontal view of Piandao as the camera pans across to the right revealing Fat.]

I'm sorry, too.
No, this is my fight, alone.
You used to be the pride of the Fire Nation. Our top general, the Dragon of the West. Now, look at you.  Look what you've become.
scene_description: [Drops the food to the floor. Cut to aerial shot of the floor as the trays contents go everywhere. Iroh grabs a green fruit from behind the bars. Cut to close-up of Iroh on the ground as he moves the fruit to his mouth.]

character_words: Excellent!  Using your superior agility against an older opponent ... smart.
Good use of terrain ... fighting from the high ground.
Yes, use your surroundings.  Make them fight for you!
scene_description: [Piandao deflects the attacks as Sokka runs away. Sokka grabs two stalks and pulls them back before releasing them. They whip around at Piandao, who slices through them.]

character_words: Very resourceful.
Excellent work, Sokka.
I think I'm a little old to be fighting the Avatar.
How did you know‌?

Oh, I've been around a while. You pick things up.  Of course, I knew from the beginning that Sokka was Water Tribe.  You might want to think of a better Fire Nation cover name.  Try "Lee." There's a million "Lees". .
scene_description: [Wipes the dirt off his face with the cloth.]

character_words: Wait!  The Master wanted you to have this, as something to remember him by.
It's a Pai Sho tile.
The White Lotus. Huh.

character_words: Oh, Zuko, it's so strange how your mind works.  Fire Lord Sozin began the war, of course.  He spent his early years secretly preparing for it. He was as patient as he was clever.
