scene_description: [Turns away from Toph with her arms folded.]

character_words: Okay. I'm ready for some training.
Good job, Twinkle Toes. Visualize, then attack.
Maybe you should take your own advice, Toph!
What's the matter? Can't handle a little dirt, Madame Fussy-Britches?
Oh, sorry. Did I splash you, Mud-Slug?
Are we taking a break?
Sneak Attack!
Sokka, sneak attacks don't work if you yell it out loud.
scene_description: [While raising his blindfold and turning to face Sokka.]

character_words: Hungry for a mud pie?
I'll give you a mud pie!
Uh guys, I thought we were supposed to be training me.
Very well, pupil. I believe we've had enough training for today.
scene_description: [Takes a few steps forward, covered in mud; calmly.]

character_words: Very well, pupil. I believe we've had enough training for today.
While Katara cleans up,  let's go have some fun!
scene_description: [Earthbends the mud off of herself and runs toward Aang and Sokka.]

character_words: Yeah!
Yes!
Look at all those messenger hawks! You know, I've been thinking about getting one for myself. That way, I wouldn't have to talk to anyone. I could just send them messages.
I gotta say, I like the idea of not talking to you.
So, guys. What are we gonna get with our last silver piece?
We can get more money.  Right there.
We can get more money.  Right there.
We can get more money.  Right there.
scene_description: [Points to an area beneath them. Aang and Sokka move back to look where she is pointing.]

character_words: This is where you seeing people are at a disadvantage. Everyone guesses wrong because the dealer moves the rock at the last minute. But I can feel it with my earthbending.
scene_description: [As she says this, the scam artist continues to move the shells around as the gambler tries to focus on the shell with the rock, and right before stopping, the scam artist quickly and inconspicuously earthbends the rock from underneath one of the shells into his sleeve.]

character_words: You there. Wanna play a friendly game?
How can I possibly play?  I'm blind.
scene_description: [Waves her hand in front of her face.]

character_words: You don't have to see to be lucky.
Flamey-O, Toph.
Wow. Fancy guessing. You are amazing at this.  Would you like to make the game a little more interesting?
scene_description: [Plays with a few silver pieces in his hands.]

character_words: More interesting? How?
Well, let's say you toss in your friend's fine sword there,  then I'll put up twenty silver pieces against it, and that's more interesting.
Well, let's say you toss in your friend's fine sword there,  then I'll put up twenty silver pieces against it, and that's more interesting.
I'll do it for forty silver pieces.
I'll do it for forty silver pieces.
scene_description: [Sokka stares at them with his mouth wide open.]

character_words: Forty silver pieces it is.
scene_description: [Drops some more money into the bag and starts moving the shells, faster this time.]

character_words: Sorry, little lady, but-  Huh?
scene_description: [Moves his hand over to the shell, about to lift it.]

character_words: Sorry, little lady, but-  Huh?
scene_description: [Lifts up the shell and sees the rock, which shocks and confuses him.]

character_words: Sorry, little lady, but-  Huh?
I won!
scene_description: [She grabs the bag of money, and Sokka grabs his sword as they run off.]

character_words: Where did you guys get the money to buy all this stuff?
Toph got us money.  She scammed one of those guys in town who moves the shells around all sneaky-like.
scene_description: [Grabs an apple and takes a bite out of it as he sits down.]

character_words: Toph got us money.  She scammed one of those guys in town who moves the shells around all sneaky-like.
scene_description: [He mimics the scam artist moving the shells with his hand. Katara's expression shows disapproval.]

character_words: She used earthbending to win the game! Classic!
Ah, so she cheated.
Hey! I only cheated because he was cheating!  I cheated a cheater.  What's wrong with that?
scene_description: [Starts to bite her apple, but stops to defend herself.]

character_words: Hey! I only cheated because he was cheating!  I cheated a cheater.  What's wrong with that?
Hey! I only cheated because he was cheating!  I cheated a cheater.  What's wrong with that?
I'm just saying this isn't something we should make a habit of doing.
Why? Because it's fun? And you hate fun?
I don't hate fun!  See? Fun!
scene_description: [Places Momo on her head like a hat while grinning unconvincingly.]

character_words: I don't hate fun!  See? Fun!
scene_description: [Momo slips off her head, screeches at her, and runs away.]

character_words: Katara,  I'll personally make you an Avatar Promise that we won't make a habit of doing these scams.
Katara,  I'll personally make you an Avatar Promise that we won't make a habit of doing these scams.
scene_description: [Slightly lifts his headband to reveal his airbender tattoo and bows.]

character_words: Guys, I think these scams have gone far enough. If you keep doing them, something bad is gonna happen.
Could you for once stop being such a sourpuss and just lighten up?
Oh, I'm sorry! You think I should be more like you? Like some wild child?
Oh, I'm sorry! You think I should be more like you? Like some wild child?
Yeah! Maybe! Maybe then you'd see  how great we have it! I mean, look at us!  We're traveling around the world! Making easy money! Having fun! With no parents to tell us what to do!
scene_description: [Sokka grabs the money off the ground.]

character_words: Yeah! Maybe! Maybe then you'd see  how great we have it! I mean, look at us!  We're traveling around the world! Making easy money! Having fun! With no parents to tell us what to do!
scene_description: [Leans back on the rock behind her and crosses her arms behind her head.]

character_words: Ah. I see. You're acting like this because of your parents.
Whatever.
They were controlling over you, so you ran away, and now you act like your parents don't exist. You act like you hate them, but you don't. You just feel guilty.
I do hate them.
I don't think so. I think you miss them, but you just don't wanna deal with that, so instead you act like this crazy person.
Look, I ran away to help Aang!
You know what? It doesn't matter. These scams put us all at risk, and we don't need that.  We've already got some third-eyed freak after us.
Speaking of that "third-eyed freak", I think I've come up with a name for him. What do you think of "Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man"?  Just think about it.
We have enough money! You need to stop this!
I'll stop when I wanna stop and not when you tell me!
I'll stop when I wanna stop and not when you tell me!
scene_description: [Uses earthbending to launch the bag of money behind her into her hand and walks away angrily. Katara shakes her head angrily as Toph sits and creates an earth tent.]

character_words: Speaking of money, I'm off to spend some. See you guys later.
scene_description: [Grabs his bag of money and his sword and stands up.]

character_words: Speaking of money, I'm off to spend some. See you guys later.

Hawky, welcome to Team Avatar. My name's Sokka, and I'm your new owner, and as such I should warn you that there's already a lemur in our group, so I don't wanna see any fighting.  Good little messenger hawky. Who's got pretty feathers?  You're right, Hawky. This is bad.

Hawky, welcome to Team Avatar. My name's Sokka, and I'm your new owner, and as such I should warn you that there's already a lemur in our group, so I don't wanna see any fighting.  Good little messenger hawky. Who's got pretty feathers?  You're right, Hawky. This is bad.
scene_description: [While walking away, he notices a wanted poster he had just past with Toph's picture on it. He gasps in horror and rips it off the wall. Hawky screeches.]

character_words: Hawky, welcome to Team Avatar. My name's Sokka, and I'm your new owner, and as such I should warn you that there's already a lemur in our group, so I don't wanna see any fighting.  Good little messenger hawky. Who's got pretty feathers?  You're right, Hawky. This is bad.
scene_description: [Suddenly, the bird poops while standing on Sokka's arm.]

character_words: Toph, while I was in town, I found something that you're not gonna like.
scene_description: [Pulls out the wanted poster and shows it to her.]

character_words: Well it sounds like a sheet of paper, but I guess you're referring to what's on the sheet of paper.
It's a wanted poster. Of you. They've nicknamed you the Runaway.
A wanted poster! That's so great! "The Runaway." I love my new nickname. Is there a picture of me? Does it look good?
Well yeah, actually, it does look pretty good.  But, Toph, you're missing the point. Maybe Katara was right. These scams are drawing too much attention to us.
scene_description: [Looks a few times at both the wanted poster and Toph.]

character_words: Well yeah, actually, it does look pretty good.  But, Toph, you're missing the point. Maybe Katara was right. These scams are drawing too much attention to us.
Don't be such a worrywart like your sister.  Think of it this way: Now you've got plenty of money to help with the invasion plan.
scene_description: [Stands up and walks up to Sokka.]

character_words: Don't be such a worrywart like your sister.  Think of it this way: Now you've got plenty of money to help with the invasion plan.
scene_description: [Holds up a bag of money and jiggles it in front of him.]

character_words: Well, that is true. I had this idea of making armor for Appa.
Well, that is true. I had this idea of making armor for Appa.
scene_description: [Looks at Appa, who is napping, but opens one eye upon hearing this.]

character_words: Here's a little extra, so you can get yourself a nice map of the Fire Nation. You know what?  Make it an atlas.
scene_description: [Takes some money out of the bag and hands the money to him.]

character_words: Here's a little extra, so you can get yourself a nice map of the Fire Nation. You know what?  Make it an atlas.
I do like expensive atlases.
Of course you do.  And that's why this wanted poster is going to stay our little secret.
scene_description: [Grabs the wanted poster and tucks it into her outfit.]

character_words: Of course you do.  And that's why this wanted poster is going to stay our little secret.
Sokka,  tell me you didn't buy a bird.
scene_description: [Places her hand on her face; annoyed.]

character_words: Not just a bird, a messenger bird. Now we can send messages all over the world. Even to Gran Gran.
Wow, how does it work?
Hm. Uh, I never actually thought about that. Hawky,  Gran Gran, South Pole.  I think he gets it.
Hm. Uh, I never actually thought about that. Hawky,  Gran Gran, South Pole.  I think he gets it.
Hawky! Make nice! Bad Hawky!
Well. Look who decided to join us.  Where have you two been? Off scamming again?
Well. Look who decided to join us.  Where have you two been? Off scamming again?
Yes, we were.
And I suppose you don't think what you're doing is dangerous at all?
scene_description: [Slides to the right to behind Toph.]

character_words: No, I don't.
Really?
Yes. Really.
Well then. What's this?
Well then. What's this?
I don't know! I mean, seriously! What is with you people? I'm blind!
I don't know! I mean, seriously! What is with you people? I'm blind!
scene_description: [Points at her eyes and pulls down her bottom eyelids to emphasize her words.]

character_words: It's a wanted poster of you! "The Runaway!" Is that what you're called now? Are you proud of this?
Where did you get that!?
It doesn't matter where I got it. The fact is-
You went through my stuff! You had no right!
Your stuff was messy and I was just straightening up, and I happened to stumble across it!
That's a lie!  You're lying, Katara!
Fine! It's a lie! But you've been so out of control lately, I knew something was up! I knew you were hiding something and you were!  Don't you walk away from me while I'm talking to you!
scene_description: [Cut to a surprised Katara who glares at Toph. Pushes Toph's pointing hand out of her face.]

character_words: Fine! It's a lie! But you've been so out of control lately, I knew something was up! I knew you were hiding something and you were!  Don't you walk away from me while I'm talking to you!
scene_description: [Shows her the poster again, but Toph grabs it, tosses it and starts to walk past Katara.]

character_words: Oh really, Mom? Or what are you gonna do? Send me to my room?
I wish I could!
Well you can't! Because you're not my mom, and you're not their mom!
scene_description: [Extends her arm at Aang and Sokka, who are sitting on a ledge.]

character_words: I never said I was!

No, but you certainly act like it! You think it's your job to boss everyone around, but it's not! You're just a regular kid like the rest of us! So stop acting like you can tell me what to do! I can do whatever I want!
I don't act that way!  Sokka, do I act motherly?
scene_description: [Looks at Sokka, who jumps as she says his name.]

character_words: Hey. I'm staying out of this one.
What do you think, Aang? Do I act like a mom?
Well. I, uh-
Stop rubbing your eye and speak clearly when you talk!
Yes, ma'am.
I can't be around you right now!
Well, I can't be around you!
I know, Hawky. Why can't they just get along?
Hey, Aang. You wanna test out my messenger hawk with me? I've got an idea.
Sure.
I'm going to send a note to Katara and say it's from Toph, who wants to apologize. Then everyone will be friends again.
I gotta say, Sokka, you continue to impress me with your ideas.
It's a gift.  "Dear Katara, sorry for everything. Your friend, Toph."
scene_description: [Pulls out a pen and ink and a piece of paper and starts to write.]

character_words: I know this is from you, Sokka! Toph can't write!  Ugh! You're all driving me crazy!
I know this is from you, Sokka! Toph can't write!  Ugh! You're all driving me crazy!
I can't believe we forgot Toph can't write.
Yup. We're idiots.
I guess Plan B is we send a note to Toph pretending it's from Katara.
I think we're gonna run into a similar problem.  Sorry, Hawky. Looks like I'm gonna have to do this without your help.  Come on. We need to talk.
I think we're gonna run into a similar problem.  Sorry, Hawky. Looks like I'm gonna have to do this without your help.  Come on. We need to talk.
So lemme guess: You brought me out here to tell me that your sister's not as annoying as I make her out to be.
Nah, she's pretty much a pain.  She's always got to be right about everything and she gets all bossy and involved and in your business ...
scene_description: [Katara, looking up at their feet from below and behind, glares and looks away.]

character_words: Yeah. I don't know how you could deal with it.
Actually, in a way, I rely on it.
I don't understand.

When our mom died, that was the hardest time in my life. Our family was a mess, but Katara? She had so much strength. She stepped up and took on so much responsibility. She helped fill the void that was left by our mom.
I guess I never thought about that.

I'm gonna tell you something crazy. I never told anyone this before, but honestly? I'm not sure I can remember what my mother looked like. It really seems like my whole life, Katara's been the one looking out for me. She's always been the one that's there. And now, when I try to remember my mom, Katara's is the only face I can picture.
scene_description: [Katara, touched by what Sokka says, is reduced to tears.]

character_words: The truth is sometimes Katara does act motherly, but that's not always a bad thing. She's compassionate and kind, and she actually cares about me.  You know, the real me. That's more than my own mom.  Don't ever tell her I said any of this!
scene_description: [Wipes away tears from her left eye.]

character_words: The truth is sometimes Katara does act motherly, but that's not always a bad thing. She's compassionate and kind, and she actually cares about me.  You know, the real me. That's more than my own mom.  Don't ever tell her I said any of this!
scene_description: [Katara, deeply touched by Toph's words, sinks slightly into the water. Toph punches Sokka in the arm.]

character_words: Hey, my lips are sealed.
Hi, Toph. Um, I wanna-
Katara, stop. You don't need to apologize. I was the one being stupid. These scams are out of control, and I'm done with them.
scene_description: [Holds up her hand in a "stop" fashion.]

character_words: Actually I wasn't going to apologize. I was gonna say ... I wanna pull a scam with you.
Actually I wasn't going to apologize. I was gonna say ... I wanna pull a scam with you.
scene_description: [Aang and Sokka stare at her from behind, extremely shocked.]

character_words: What? You wanna pull a scam?
Not just any scam. The ultimate scam.  Whaddaya say, Toph? Just me and you. One last go. You in?
scene_description: [Sokka and Aang, still staring at her with shock, look at each other and faint, foaming from the mouth slightly. Katara puts her arm around Toph's shoulder, who gives a sly smile.]

character_words: You know I'm in! Now what's this idea of yours?
You know I'm in! Now what's this idea of yours?
scene_description: [They walk away and leave Aang and Sokka behind, who are now unconscious and foaming at the mouth.]

character_words: The plan is simple: This wanted poster says you're worth a lot of money; Ten times more than you've made in all of your scams. So I'm gonna turn you in and collect the reward. Then you metalbend yourself out of jail, and we're on our way.
scene_description: [As she speaks, the screen fades to the beginning of the episode, where Toph is seen running from the authorities and is caught in a net.]

character_words: How could you do this to me? You betrayed me!
You brought this on yourself. I had no choice.
You brought this on yourself. I had no choice.
You did the right thing by turning in the Runaway.
The right thing is its own reward.
Well, I'm happy to hear you say that.
But, I still want the actual reward.
Of course. Right this way.
Hey! What kind of cell is this?
A wooden one.
scene_description: [She walks away as Toph becomes visibly worried.]

character_words: That's her! That's the girl you were looking for!
Do you think this scam of theirs should be taking this long?
I was just wondering the same thing. We'd better check it out.  You two behave.  Appa's in charge.
I was just wondering the same thing. We'd better check it out.  You two behave.  Appa's in charge.
I was just wondering the same thing. We'd better check it out.  You two behave.  Appa's in charge.
scene_description: [Appa lifts his head as the two animals start screeching at each other as soon as Sokka and Aang leave, but stop as soon as Appa roars at them.]

character_words: Wait! It's a trap!
Really? No kidding! Is that why we're sitting in a wooden cage right now? Gee, how'd you figure out it was a trap?
Not for us, Katara! We're the bait! He wants Aang!
I can't believe I'm so stupid! See? This is exactly why I'm against these scams! I knew this would happen!
But, this was your idea.
I know. I wanted to show that I'm not so motherly. I wanted to show you that I can have fun too.
Katara, you are fun. If nothing else, you're at least fun to argue with.
I know your relationship with your parents is complicated. And I shouldn't have said what I said.
It's okay. I was really mad when you said that because ... well because, maybe it's true.  I try not to think about it, but when I left, I probably really hurt them.
Where do you think they might be?
Where do you think anyone is?  Sokka, watch out!  It's Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man!
scene_description: [The assassin is seen walking across a rooftop behind them. Aang hears him inhaling and becomes shocked when he turns and sees him.]

character_words: Where do you think anyone is?  Sokka, watch out!  It's Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man!
scene_description: [He grabs Sokka as they dodge a blast from the assassin and take cover behind an Ozai statue.]

character_words: You know, I'm starting to think that name doesn't quite fit.
What are we gonna do?
I don't know. I wish we had some earth or water. We need bendables.
What about your meteor bracelet? You can make a saw.
I left it back at camp.  I was worried they would take it.
Um, Katara? Are you okay?
Just fine.
Well, what are you doing?
I'm making my own water.
Katara! You're a genius! A sweaty, stinky genius!
This guy is too good! He shoots fire from his brain!
We should split up. He can't chase us both.
Aang, get up!
scene_description: [She helps him up and they run away.]

character_words: Let's get out of here!
Hey, I got it! The perfect name for that guy: "Combustion Man!"
Good job, Sokka. Now let's get outta here before Combustion Man catches us.
See? It fits so well!
Well, I'm exhausted. Hawky, how about you, buddy?  Yeah. You're such a lazy little bird.
Well, I'm exhausted. Hawky, how about you, buddy?  Yeah. You're such a lazy little bird.
Katara? I need your help.
What is it, Toph?
I need you to write some things down for me. I wanna send a letter to my parents.
I'll be happy to help.
Hey, where'd Hawky go?
Previously on Avatar ...
You're looking at the only waterbender in the whole South Pole. This ship has haunted my tribe when Gran-Gran was a little girl. It was part of the Fire Nation's first attacks.
The legend said the moon was the first waterbender. Our ancestor saw how it pushed and pulled the tides, and learned how to do it themselves.
I always noticed my waterbending is stronger at night.
What are you doing?
I'm making my own water!
Suddenly, they heard something down the hall in the dark. Oooh ... It came into the torchlight ... and they knew the blade of Wing Fung was haunted!  Ooh-aaah!
Suddenly, they heard something down the hall in the dark. Oooh ... It came into the torchlight ... and they knew the blade of Wing Fung was haunted!  Ooh-aaah!
scene_description: [Draws sword, stands up and points it toward the fire; yells dramatically.]

character_words: I think I like "the man with a sword for a hand" better.
Water Tribe slumber parties must stink.
No, wait! I've got one! And this is a true Southern Water Tribe story.
Is this one of those "a friend of my cousin knew some guy that this happened to" stories?
No, it happened to Mom.

One winter when Mom was a girl, a snowstorm buried the whole village for weeks. A month later, Mom noticed she hadn't seen her friend Nini since the storm. So Mom and some others went to check on Nini's family. When they got there, no one was home.  Just a fire flickering in the fireplace. While the men went out to search, Mom stayed in the house. When she was alone, she heard a voice.  "It's so cold and I can't get warm!"  Mom turned and saw Nini standing by the fire. She was blue like she was frozen. Mom ran outside for help, but when everyone came back, Nini was gone.
scene_description: [Cuts to ground-level shot of the group sitting around the fire, the camera panning slightly to the right.]

character_words: One winter when Mom was a girl, a snowstorm buried the whole village for weeks. A month later, Mom noticed she hadn't seen her friend Nini since the storm. So Mom and some others went to check on Nini's family. When they got there, no one was home.  Just a fire flickering in the fireplace. While the men went out to search, Mom stayed in the house. When she was alone, she heard a voice.  "It's so cold and I can't get warm!"  Mom turned and saw Nini standing by the fire. She was blue like she was frozen. Mom ran outside for help, but when everyone came back, Nini was gone.

One winter when Mom was a girl, a snowstorm buried the whole village for weeks. A month later, Mom noticed she hadn't seen her friend Nini since the storm. So Mom and some others went to check on Nini's family. When they got there, no one was home.  Just a fire flickering in the fireplace. While the men went out to search, Mom stayed in the house. When she was alone, she heard a voice.  "It's so cold and I can't get warm!"  Mom turned and saw Nini standing by the fire. She was blue like she was frozen. Mom ran outside for help, but when everyone came back, Nini was gone.
Where'd she go?
No one knows. Nini's house stands empty to this day, but sometimes, people see smoke coming up from the chimney, like little Nini is still trying to get warm.
Wait! Guys, did you hear that?  I hear people under the mountain. And they're screaming.
Wait! Guys, did you hear that?  I hear people under the mountain. And they're screaming.
scene_description: [Aang, Katara, and Sokka clutch each other tightly, too stiff to move, with Toph standing alertly.]

character_words: Pft! Nice try, Toph.
No, I'm serious. I hear something.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the campsite viewed through the ominous looking tree branches.]

character_words: You're probably just jumpy from the ghost stories ...
It just ... stopped.
All right, now I'm getting scared.
scene_description: [Cuts back to him and Katara, still hugging, Sokka sitting close by.]

character_words: Hello, children.
Sorry to frighten you. My name is Hama.  You children shouldn't be out in the forest by yourselves at night.  I have an inn nearby. Why don't you come back there for some spiced tea and warm beds?
Sorry to frighten you. My name is Hama.  You children shouldn't be out in the forest by yourselves at night.  I have an inn nearby. Why don't you come back there for some spiced tea and warm beds?
scene_description: [Cuts to ground-level shot of Hama standing over the fire.]

character_words: Yes, please.
Thanks for letting us stay here tonight. You have a lovely inn.
Aren't you sweet?  You know you should be careful. People have been disappearing in those woods you were camping in.
Aren't you sweet?  You know you should be careful. People have been disappearing in those woods you were camping in.
scene_description: [Walks over to her seat and sits down.]

character_words: What do you mean "disappearing"?
When the moon turns full, people walk in and they don't come out.  Who wants more tea?
When the moon turns full, people walk in and they don't come out.  Who wants more tea?
scene_description: [Stand up and holds up her teapot; cheerfully smiling.]

character_words: Don't worry, you'll all be completely safe here.  Why don't I show you to your rooms and you can get a good night's rest?
I know, Momo.  This place is creepy!  I don't know if I'm gonna be able to fall asleep!
scene_description: [Places sword back inside holster and sets it down.]

character_words: I know, Momo.  This place is creepy!  I don't know if I'm gonna be able to fall asleep!
scene_description: [Lies back down on the pillow and pulls the covers over him.]

character_words: Wakey, wakey!  Time to go shopping!
Wakey, wakey!  Time to go shopping!
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the innkeeper, standing brightly over him.]

character_words: That Mr. Yao seems to have a thing for you. Maybe we should go back and see if he'll give us some free komodo sausages?
You would have me use my feminine charms to take advantage of that poor man?  I think you and I are going to get along swimmingly!
You would have me use my feminine charms to take advantage of that poor man?  I think you and I are going to get along swimmingly!
You won't have any ash bananas till next week?
Well, I have to send the boy to Hing Wa Island to get them, and it's a two-day trip.
Oh, right. Tomorrow's the full moon.
Exactly. I can't lose another delivery boy in the woods.
People disappearing in the woods, weird stuff happening during full moons? This just reeks of Spirit World shenanigans.
I bet if we take a little walk around town, we'll find out what these people did to the environment to make the spirits mad.
And then you can sew up this little mystery lickety-split, Avatar style!
Helping people ... that's what I do.
Why don't you take all those things back to the inn? I just have to run a couple more errands. I'll be back in a little while.
This is a mysterious little town you have here.
Mysterious town for mysterious children.
That Hama seems a little strange. Like she knows something, or she's hiding something.
That's ridiculous. She's a nice woman who took us in and gave us a place to stay.  She kinda reminds me of Gran-Gran.
That's ridiculous. She's a nice woman who took us in and gave us a place to stay.  She kinda reminds me of Gran-Gran.
But what did she mean by that comment, "mysterious children"?
Gee, I don't know. Maybe because she found four strange kids camping in the woods at night? Isn't that a little mysterious?
I'm gonna take a look around.
scene_description: [Walks away and up a flight of wooden stairs.]

character_words: Sokka! Sokka, what are you doing?  You can't just snoop around someone's house.
scene_description: [Appears along with the others at the bottom of the stairwell.]

character_words: Sokka! Sokka, what are you doing?  You can't just snoop around someone's house.
scene_description: [Off-camera as Sokka peers around the inn.]

character_words: It'll be fine.
She could be home any minute.
scene_description: [Off-camera while Sokka peers into a room.]

character_words: Sokka, you're gonna get us all in trouble and this is just plain rude!
scene_description: [Walking down hallway with the rest of the team.]

character_words: I'm not finished yet.  Come on ...
I'm not finished yet.  Come on ...
scene_description: [Grunts, as he tries to pull it free.]

character_words: Okay, that's pretty creepy.
So she's got a hobby. There's nothing weird about that.  Sokka, you've looked enough.  Hama will be back soon.
scene_description: [Walks over and closes the cupboard; a bit weirded out.]

character_words: So she's got a hobby. There's nothing weird about that.  Sokka, you've looked enough.  Hama will be back soon.
So she's got a hobby. There's nothing weird about that.  Sokka, you've looked enough.  Hama will be back soon.
scene_description: [Off-camera as Sokka ascends into the attic.]

character_words: Just an ordinary puppet-loving innkeeper, huh? Well then why does she have a locked door up here?
Probably to keep people like you from snooping through her stuff!
We'll see.  It's empty, except for a little chest.
scene_description: [Peers through the keyhole into the room. Cuts to shot of the attic from his perspective. Through the keyhole, a small room can be seen, with a chest lying on the ground in the middle. The camera zooms in on the chest.]

character_words: Maybe it's treasure!
Sokka, what are you doing? You're breaking into a private room!
I have to see what's in there.
We shouldn't be doing this.
Maybe there's a key here somewhere ...
Ooh! Hand it over!
Come on, come on!
This isn't as easy as it looks!
scene_description: [Annoyed; Katara appears from behind her, peering nervously over her shoulder.]

character_words: Guys, I don't know about this ...
This is crazy! I'm leaving!
Suit yourself! Do it, Toph!
I'll tell you what's in the box.
An old comb?
It's my greatest treasure. It's the last thing I own from growing up in the Southern Water Tribe.
You're from the Southern Water Tribe?
Just like you.
How did you know?
I heard you talking around your campfire.
But why didn't you tell us?

I wanted to surprise you! I bought all this food today so I could fix you a big Water Tribe dinner. Of course, I can't get all the ingredients I need here, but ocean kumquats are a lot like sea prunes if you stew them long enough.
Great ...
I knew I felt a bond with you right away.
And I knew you were keeping a secret, so I guess we're both right.  But I'm sorry we were sneaking around.
scene_description: [Grimaces as Katara hits him in the arm.]

character_words: Apology accepted.  Now, let's get cooking!
scene_description: [Turns to the side and motions with her hand.]

character_words: I'd steer clear of the sea prunes.
I thought they were ocean kumquats.
Close enough.
Who wants five flavor soup?
You're a waterbender!  I've never met another waterbender from our tribe!
You're a waterbender!  I've never met another waterbender from our tribe!
That's because the Fire Nation wiped them all out. I was the last one ...
So how did you end up out here?
I was stolen from my home.
It was over sixty years ago when the raids started.
They came again and again, each time rounding up more of our waterbenders and taking them captive.
We did our best to hold them off, but our numbers dwindled as the raids continued.
Finally, I too was captured.
I was led away in chains. The last waterbender of the Southern Water Tribe.
They put us in terrible prisons here in the Fire Nation. I was the only one who managed to escape.
How did you get away? And why did you stay in the Fire Nation?
I'm sorry. It's too painful to talk about anymore.
We completely understand. We lost our mother in a raid.
Oh, you poor things.
I can't tell you what it means to meet you. It's an honor. You're a hero.
I never thought I'd meet another Southern waterbender. I'd like to teach you what I know so you can carry on the Southern tradition when I'm gone.
Yes! Yes, of course! To learn about my heritage, it would mean everything to me.
Growing up in the South Pole, waterbenders are totally at home surrounded by snow and ice and seas. But as you probably noticed on your travels, that isn't the case wherever you go.
I know! When we were stranded in the desert, I felt like there was almost nothing I could do.
That's why you have to learn to control water wherever it exists.
I've even used my own sweat for waterbending.
That's very resourceful, Katara. You're thinking like a true master. But did you know you could even pull water out of thin air?
You have got to keep an open mind, Katara.  There's water in places you never think about.
scene_description: [The water around her fingertips freezes, creating ice claws.]

character_words: This has got to be the nicest natural setting in the Fire Nation. I don't see anything that would make a spirit mad around here.
Maybe the Moon Spirit just turned mean.
The Moon Spirit is a gentle, loving lady. She rules the sky with compassion and ... lunar goodness!
Excuse me, sir. Can you tell us anything about the spirit that's been stealing people?
scene_description: [Catches sight of a villager walking past.]

character_words: Only one man ever saw it and lived and that's Old Man Ding.
Where does Old Man Ding live?
Wow, these flowers are beautiful.
They're called fire lilies. They only bloom a few weeks a year, but they're one of my favorite things about living here. And like all plants and all living things, they're filled with water.
I met a waterbender who lived in a swamp and could control the vines by bending the water inside.
You can take it even further.
That was incredible!  It's a shame about the lilies, though.

They're just flowers. When you're a waterbender in a strange land, you do what you must to survive. Tonight I'll teach you the ultimate technique of waterbending. It can only be done during the full moon, when your bending is at its peak.
But isn't that dangerous? I thought people have been disappearing around here during the full moon.
Oh, Katara. Two master waterbenders beneath a full moon?  I don't think we have anything to worry about.
Old Man Ding?
Huh?  Ow, dang blame it! What? Can't you see I'm busy? Got a full moon rising. And why does everyone call me that? I'm not that old!  Well, I'm young at heart.
Huh?  Ow, dang blame it! What? Can't you see I'm busy? Got a full moon rising. And why does everyone call me that? I'm not that old!  Well, I'm young at heart.
scene_description: [Attempts to lift a wooden plank off the ground, but fails to do so. Sighs.]

character_words: Not ready to get snapped up by some moon monster yet at least.
We wanted to ask you about that.
scene_description: [Proceeds to nail the board to the window frame.]

character_words: Did you get a good look at the spirit that took you?

Didn't see no spirit, just felt something come over me, like I was possessed. Forced me to start walking toward the mountain.  I tried to fight it, but I couldn't control my own limbs. It just about had me into a cave up there.  And I looked up at the moon for what I thought would be my last glimpse of light.  But then the sun started to rise and I got control of myself again! I just high-tailed it away from that mountain as quick as I could!

Didn't see no spirit, just felt something come over me, like I was possessed. Forced me to start walking toward the mountain.  I tried to fight it, but I couldn't control my own limbs. It just about had me into a cave up there.  And I looked up at the moon for what I thought would be my last glimpse of light.  But then the sun started to rise and I got control of myself again! I just high-tailed it away from that mountain as quick as I could!

Didn't see no spirit, just felt something come over me, like I was possessed. Forced me to start walking toward the mountain.  I tried to fight it, but I couldn't control my own limbs. It just about had me into a cave up there.  And I looked up at the moon for what I thought would be my last glimpse of light.  But then the sun started to rise and I got control of myself again! I just high-tailed it away from that mountain as quick as I could!
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the trio, Sokka quivering in fear.]

character_words: Why would a spirit want to take people to a mountain?
Oh no!  I did hear people screaming under the mountain. The missing villagers must still be there!
I can hear them. They're this way!
Can you feel the power the full moon brings?
For generations it has blessed waterbenders with its glow, allowing us to do incredible things!
I've never felt more alive.
This is the place.
I can't see anything down there.
That's why you have me. Let's go!
We're saved!
I didn't know spirits made prisons like this. Who brought you here?
It was no spirit.
It was a witch!
A witch? What do you mean?
She seems like a normal old woman, but she controls people like some dark puppetmaster!
Hama!
Yes, the innkeeper!
I knew there was something creepy about her!
We have to stop Hama!
I'll get these people out of here. You go!
What I'm about to show you,  I discovered in that wretched Fire Nation prison.
scene_description: [Cuts to close-up of Hama glaring menacingly.]

character_words: The guards were always very careful to keep any water away from us. They piped in dry air and had us suspended away from the ground. Before giving us any water, they would bind our hands and feet so we couldn't bend.  Any sign of trouble was met with cruel retribution.  And yet each month, I felt the full moon enriching me with its energy.  There had to be something I could do to escape.  Then I realized that where there is life, there is water.  The rats that scurried across the floor of my cage were nothing more than skins filled with liquid and I passed years developing the skill that would lead to my escape.  Bloodbending.  Controlling the water in another body,  enforcing your own will over theirs.  Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men.

The guards were always very careful to keep any water away from us. They piped in dry air and had us suspended away from the ground. Before giving us any water, they would bind our hands and feet so we couldn't bend.  Any sign of trouble was met with cruel retribution. Controlling the water in another body,  enforcing your own will over theirs.  Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men.
scene_description: [A side-view is shown of Fire Nation guards giving water to a tied up prisoner.]

scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the full moon in the sky during present day.]

Controlling the water in another body,  enforcing your own will over theirs.  Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men.
scene_description: [Scene fades to flashback of the prison.]

Controlling the water in another body,  enforcing your own will over theirs.  Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men.
scene_description: [A younger Hama is shown bending the water inside an elephant rat that had wandered its way into her cage.]

character_words: The guards were always very careful to keep any water away from us. They piped in dry air and had us suspended away from the ground. Before giving us any water, they would bind our hands and feet so we couldn't bend.  Any sign of trouble was met with cruel retribution. Controlling the water in another body,  enforcing your own will over theirs.  Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men.
scene_description: [A close-up is shown of Hama smiling at her discovery. The scene fades back to present day. Ominously.]

Controlling the water in another body,  enforcing your own will over theirs.  Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men.
scene_description: [Cut to ground shot of both Hama and Katara.]

character_words: The guards were always very careful to keep any water away from us. They piped in dry air and had us suspended away from the ground. Before giving us any water, they would bind our hands and feet so we couldn't bend.  Any sign of trouble was met with cruel retribution.  And yet each month, I felt the full moon enriching me with its energy.  There had to be something I could do to escape.  Then I realized that where there is life, there is water.  The rats that scurried across the floor of my cage were nothing more than skins filled with liquid and I passed years developing the skill that would lead to my escape.  Bloodbending.  Controlling the water in another body,  enforcing your own will over theirs.  Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men.
scene_description: [The scene fades back to a flashback of young Hama controlling a horde of rats using bloodbending.]

character_words: And during the next full moon, I walked free for the first time in decades.  My cell unlocked by the very guards assigned to keep me in.  Once you perfect this technique, you can control anything or  anyone.

And during the next full moon, I walked free for the first time in decades.  My cell unlocked by the very guards assigned to keep me in.  Once you perfect this technique, you can control anything or  anyone.
scene_description: [The guard attempts to get up, but Hama quickly forces him back down to the ground. She walks unsteadily away.]

character_words: And during the next full moon, I walked free for the first time in decades.  My cell unlocked by the very guards assigned to keep me in.  Once you perfect this technique, you can control anything or  anyone.
scene_description: [Scene changes back to present day; camera focuses on a close-up of Hama.]

character_words: And during the next full moon, I walked free for the first time in decades.  My cell unlocked by the very guards assigned to keep me in.  Once you perfect this technique, you can control anything or  anyone.
scene_description: [Looks at Katara from the corner of her eyes sadistically.]

character_words: But ... to reach inside someone and control them?  I don't know if I want that kind of power.
But ... to reach inside someone and control them?  I don't know if I want that kind of power.
scene_description: [Casts unsure glance off to the side.]

character_words: The choice is not yours. The power exists. And it's your duty to use the gifts you've been given to win this war.  Katara, they tried to wipe us out, our entire culture, your mother!
scene_description: [Camera zooms out to the two standing in the forest.]

character_words: The choice is not yours. The power exists. And it's your duty to use the gifts you've been given to win this war.  Katara, they tried to wipe us out, our entire culture, your mother!
I know.
Then you should understand what I'm talking about! We're the last two waterbenders of the Southern Tribe.  We have to fight these people whenever we can, wherever they are, with any means necessary!
Then you should understand what I'm talking about! We're the last two waterbenders of the Southern Tribe.  We have to fight these people whenever we can, wherever they are, with any means necessary!
It's you ...  You're the one who's been making people disappear during the full moons!
It's you ...  You're the one who's been making people disappear during the full moons!
They threw me in prison to rot, along with my brothers and sisters! They deserve the same! You must carry on my work!
scene_description: [Close-up of her face, as she tilts her head downward.]

character_words: I won't! I won't use bloodbending and I won't allow you to keep terrorizing this town!
scene_description: [Points to Hama, stretching out her left hand.]

character_words: I won't! I won't use bloodbending and I won't allow you to keep terrorizing this town!
scene_description: [Her hand suddenly twists to one side. She tries desperately to stop it, but fails to do so.]

character_words: You should've learned the technique before you turned against me!  It's impossible to fight your way out of my grip! I control every muscle, every vein in your body!
scene_description: [Now using bloodbending to subdue to her.]

character_words: You should've learned the technique before you turned against me!  It's impossible to fight your way out of my grip! I control every muscle, every vein in your body!
Stop! Please ...
You're not the only one who draws power from the moon!  My bending is more powerful than yours, Hama. Your technique is useless on me!
You're not the only one who draws power from the moon!  My bending is more powerful than yours, Hama. Your technique is useless on me!
Aahhh!
We know what you've been doing, Hama!
Give up!  You're outnumbered!
No!  You've outnumbered yourselves.
Katara, look out!  It's like my brain has a mind of its own! Stop it arm, stop it!
Katara, look out!  It's like my brain has a mind of its own! Stop it arm, stop it!
scene_description: [Forced to walk like a puppet, while waving the blade back and forth rapidly.]

character_words: This feels weird!
I'm sorry, Aang!
scene_description: [Using waterbending to freeze him to a nearby tree.]

character_words: It's okay!
Don't hurt your friends, Katara! And don't let them hurt each other!
No!
You're going to be locked away forever.
My work is done.  Congratulations, Katara. You're a bloodbender.
This is it! The official rendezvous point for the invasion force.
How did you pick this place?
Before we split up, my dad and I found this island on the map. It's uninhabited, and the harbors surrounded by the cliffs seemed like the perfect secluded place.
Nice choice, Sokka. And we're here four days ahead of schedule.
Wait! Four days? The invasion's in four days?
Whatever. That's like four days from now. Let's just calm down and-
Sokka's got the right idea, Aang. We're here. We're ready. The best thing we can do now is get plenty of rest.
I guess.
Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord! I'm bringing you down.
scene_description: [He makes some fast and dramatic ninja-like moves as he speaks.]

character_words: Really?  How do you plan on doing that when you're not even wearing pants?
Oh no!
It was just a dream, Momo. I still have my pants.  Well, I better keep training.
Fresh fruit, Prince Zuko?
May I wash your feet, sir?
Head massage?
Hot towel?
Prince Zuko, is something wrong? You didn't take the palanquin.
I'm just going to Mai's house. It's not far.
It's not a prince's place to walk anywhere, sir.
Hey. How long have you been up?
A couple hours. I got a lot more skills to refine if I'm gonna fight Ozai.
You know, there is such a thing as over-training.
You don't get it, do you? My form is bad, I'm sloppy, and I still don't know any firebending. Not even the basics.
That's okay, Aang. The eclipse will block off firebending anyway. You don't need to know it.  Plus, it's a stupid element.
Okay, well I still have to work on everything else. I better spend the whole day training.
Good night, Katara. Good night, Sokka. Good night, Toph. Good night, Appa. Good night, Momo. Good night, Appa and Mo-
scene_description: [Wide shot of the group on the cliffside with the camera slowly zooming out.]

character_words: Go to sleep already!
scene_description: [With chibi face in a speech bubble that appears above her; angrily.]

character_words: Go to sleep already!
Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord.  I'm bringing you down!  And this time, I brought pants.
Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord.  I'm bringing you down!  And this time, I brought pants.
Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord.  I'm bringing you down!  And this time, I brought pants.
So it seems, but are you prepared for your ... mathematics test?
Math test? Oh no! I forgot all about the math test!
I've gotta be ready.
Aang, it's the middle of the night. You need to go back to sleep.
But I forgot my pants and my math test.
Aang, sleep. Please. For me.
Tell me, if you could have anything you want right now, what would it be?
Hm ... A big fancy fruit tart, with rose petals on top.
You know, being a prince and all, I might just be able to make that happen.
That would be impressive.
Do you think you could find a fresh fruit tart for the lady, with rose petals on top?
Excellent choice, sir.
I guess there's some nice perks that come with being royalty.  Though there's annoying stuff, too. Like that all-day war meeting coming up.
scene_description: [Pushing him Zuko to lay down with her.]

character_words: War meeting? What are you talking about?
Azula mentioned something. I-I assumed you were going, too.
I guess I wasn't invited.
Wake up, Aang. Wake up, sleepy head!  Rise and shine! You overslept.  You missed the invasion.
scene_description: [Cut to an out of focus swaying shot of the Fire Lord standing over Aang.]

character_words: Wake up, Aang. Wake up, sleepy head!  Rise and shine! You overslept.  You missed the invasion.
scene_description: [The Fire Lord bends in close and then even closer.]

character_words: Sokka, get up! I needa know what day it is!
What? Who's talking?
Relax! It's still two days before the invasion!
Sokka, you've gotta get up drill your rock-climbing exercises.
What?
In one of my dreams, you were running from Fire Nation soldiers, trying to climb this cliff,  but you were too slow and they got you!
scene_description: [Camera turns to show an annoyed look on Sokka's face.]

character_words: But that was just a dream. I'm a great climber!
Then climb that cliff! Climb it fast!
Stupid Avatar! Stupid cliff! Stupid dream! I can climb fast!
Don't drink that!
Why? Is it poisoned?

In my dream, we were right in the middle of the invasion, and you had to stop to use the bathroom!  We died because of your tiny bladder.  And you need to start wearing your hair up. In my dream, your hair got caught in a train, and-.
scene_description: [He puts his hands between his legs and squeezes them together.]

character_words: In my dream, we were right in the middle of the invasion, and you had to stop to use the bathroom!  We died because of your tiny bladder.  And you need to start wearing your hair up. In my dream, your hair got caught in a train, and-.
Aang! I know you're just trying to help, but you really need to get a grip. You're unraveling.
scene_description: [Putting a hand on the side of his face.]

character_words: You're right. I'm losing my mind.
scene_description: [He takes a deep breath before finally speaking.]

character_words: It's like every time I think about how stressed I am, I just end up more stressed. I'm like a big growing snowball of nerves.
Of course you are. That's 'cause you gotta fight the Fire Lord, the baddest man on the planet. And you better win or we're all done for.
Sokka! You're not helping!
What? It's true. That's the deal. He knows it.
You know what, I've got just the thing! Get ready to be de-stressified!
These yoga stretches can really work wonders if you do them in extreme heat. Reach up.  Reach for the sun.  Feel your chi paths clearing.  Now close your eyes. How are you feeling?
scene_description: [Katara puts her hands above her head together, Aang follows along.]

character_words: These yoga stretches can really work wonders if you do them in extreme heat. Reach up.  Reach for the sun.  Feel your chi paths clearing.  Now close your eyes. How are you feeling?
scene_description: [They wave their hands and upper bodies side to side.]

character_words: These yoga stretches can really work wonders if you do them in extreme heat. Reach up.  Reach for the sun.  Feel your chi paths clearing.  Now close your eyes. How are you feeling?
scene_description: [Both bend over so their heads touch the ground, grabbing their legs.]

character_words: I feel ... really warm.
Good, good. Go on.
Like there's this warm feeling all around me. This heat.  Like I'm in the Fire Lord's palace and he's shooting a bunch of fireballs at me! And the whole world is being engulfed in flames!
Maybe your stress is the kind you need to talk out.
Why don't you get right down to business and tell me what's been bothering you.
You know what's bothering me. I have to fight the Fire Lord in a few days.
Tell me more about this "Fire Lord". Why are you so afraid of him?
You said it yourself! He's the baddest man on the planet! I'm supposed to defeat him and save the world!
Life does feel that way sometimes, doesn't it? Like we're all trying to save the world from evil.
Okay! But what can I do to feel better?
Want to try screaming into this pillow?
Hello, Zuzu. If you've come for a royal hair-combing, I'm afraid you'll have to wait.
So I guess there's a big war meeting coming up, huh? And apparently I'm not welcome there.
What do you mean? Of course you're welcome there!
Oh, yeah?! I guess that's why no one bothered to tell me about it!
Oh, Zuko. Don't be so dramatic. I'm certain Dad wants you there. You probably just weren't invited because it's so obvious you're supposed to be there.
Well, were you invited?
Of course! I'm the princess.
And I'm the prince!
Exactly, so stop acting like a paranoid child! Just go to the meeting.
Forget it! I'm not going!
All right! What you need is a good old-fashioned back pounding to relieve your stress.
Pound away.
Ow! Toph ... I ... think ... this ... is ... bruising ... me!
Sorry. I forgot you had baby skin.  Well, there's one other thing we can try.  Acupuncture!
scene_description: [Aang grabs onto the edge of the pillars and gets up.]

character_words: Sorry. I forgot you had baby skin.  Well, there's one other thing we can try.  Acupuncture!
scene_description: [She stomps the ground, sending a distant boar-q-pine to her. She catches it and holds it out to Aang with a wide grin.]

character_words: Zuko, it's just a dumb meeting. Who cares?
I don't.
Well, good. You shouldn't. I mean, why would you even want to go? Just think about how things went the last meeting you went to.
I know.
You know what will make you feel better?  Ordering some servants around. I might be hungry for a whole tray of fruit tarts. And maybe a little palanquin ride around town. Double time.
Thanks for everything, guys.
So, do you feel less stressed? Ready for a good night's sleep?
Uh, I kinda think I sorta might slightly feel a little better.  Maybe.
Uh, I kinda think I sorta might slightly feel a little better.  Maybe.
Then our work here is done.
What happened, Aang?
It's the nightmares. They just get worse and worse.
Looks like it's time for another ...  therapy session.
scene_description: [He turns around and puts his Wang Fire disguise on and voice.]

character_words: No. That won't help. Nothing helps. There's only one thing I can do! I'm going to stay awake straight through to the invasion!
Invasion. All aboard for the invasion.
You don't look so good. You sure you can't just lie down for a little nap?
I told you, I can't go back to sleep.
Aang, staying up all night can't be good for you.
Actually, staying up all night has given me some time to think. And I've realized some big things, Katara.
scene_description: [Walking toward the cliff edge. Katara turns and moves a bit to follow.]

character_words: What big things?

I see everything so clearly now. What really matters. Why I'm really doing this.  I'm doing it to save the world. But more than that. I'm doing it for the people I love.  I'm doing it for you, Katara.
scene_description: [He turns around to look at Katara.]

character_words: I see everything so clearly now. What really matters. Why I'm really doing this.  I'm doing it to save the world. But more than that. I'm doing it for the people I love.  I'm doing it for you, Katara.
scene_description: [Side shot of Aang and Katara near each other.]

character_words: Aang, what are you saying?
I'm saying, I love you!
scene_description: [He kisses her. After he pulls back, she embraces and kisses him back.]

character_words: What are we doing?
scene_description: [After kissing for a while she pulls back, whispering slightly.]

character_words: What our hearts have been telling us to do for a long, long time. Baby,  you're my forever girl.
scene_description: [He moves Katara down to the side.]

character_words: What our hearts have been telling us to do for a long, long time. Baby,  you're my forever girl.
scene_description: [Aang puckers up his lips for another kiss.]

character_words: Aang!  I was just saying you should take a nap.
scene_description: [Aang realizes he was just daydreaming, and realizes he is not holding Katara anymore.]

character_words: Oh, I guess I kinda drifted off into a daydream.
scene_description: [He quickly turns around to face Katara.]

character_words: What was your dream about?
Uh, living underwater?
scene_description: [He pauses to think for a moment.]

character_words: Sounds neat!
Prince Zuko,  everyone's waiting for you.
What?
The high admirals, the high generals, the war ministers, and the princess have all arrived. You're the only person missing.
So, my dad wants me at the meeting?
The Fire Lord said he would not start until you arrived, sir.
Put 'em up, Fire Lord!
Hey! I'm tryin' build Appa some armor here so he doesn't have to go into the invasion naked. He's your bison.
Ozai's defense is impeccable. I'll have to try a different approach.
scene_description: [Standing in front of the "Ozai" tree in a fighting stance.]

character_words: You think you're untouchable, don't you, Mr. Fire Lord?
Boy, you are really starting to lose it, kid.
Momo, did you hear something?
No, but I said something.  You, my friend, are just a few plums short of a fruit pie.
No, but I said something.  You, my friend, are just a few plums short of a fruit pie.
scene_description: [Aang becomes shocked and gets close to Momo.]

character_words: No, but I said something.  You, my friend, are just a few plums short of a fruit pie.
scene_description: [Aang stares at Momo in disbelief, his jaw wide open. He quickly stands up, shakes his head, and covers his eyes. He peeks through them, at which point Momo begins chittering normally again. Aang walks up to him and pets him.]

character_words: That's more like it. I'm so tired that for a second there, I imagined you were talking to me.  Oh, Momo, let me explain.
scene_description: [Momo tilts his head in confusion. Everyone is seen walking forward and watching Aang.]

character_words: That's more like it. I'm so tired that for a second there, I imagined you were talking to me.  Oh, Momo, let me explain.
scene_description: [Aang begins chattering like Momo. Katara and Sokka share a look of confusion, as Toph merely stands there with a slightly annoyed look. Momo chitters back, in which Aang laughs before chittering again. Katara interrupts him.]

character_words: Aang? We're all starting to get a little worried about you.
You've been awake too long.
And you're acting downright weird.
You've got to take care of yourself. You can't go on like this.
Look, I appreciate what you guys are saying, but the stress and the nightmares. They were just too much. Staying awake is the best way for me to deal with it.
Yeah! Leave the kid alone!
Hey, who asked you?
Hey, who asked you?
You guys, come on.
No! I am sick of this guy always mouthing me and telling me what to do!
Oh, you don't like it? Well, let's go right now!
Sokka, what do we do?
About what?
About that!
Appa! Appa! Appa!  Momo! Momo! Momo!
scene_description: [Cut to a group of koala sheep.]

character_words: Appa! Appa! Appa!  Momo! Momo! Momo!
Come on, guys. We're all on the same side.
Chakras, chakras, everybody loves chakras. Chakras, chakras, chakras sandwich tastes good. Yum!
Yay! Yay! Yay! Yay! Yay!
I just need to jump in a cold waterfall!
So, how did it go?
When I got to the meeting, everyone welcomed me. My father had saved me a seat. He wanted me next to him. I was literally at his right hand.
Zuko, that's wonderful! You must be happy.
During the meeting, I was the perfect prince. The son my father wanted.  But I wasn't me.
Oh, look. Another hallucination. An imaginary bed made out of clouds.
Hey! It's real! We spent hours working on it.
We made it for you. A good night's sleep will probably take the crazy away. We hope.
Look! You guys keep telling me that I need to sleep, but I can't! The invasion's tomorrow!
Aang ...
No, Katara! There's still so much I haven't learned. I don't need sleep. What I need is practice. Quick, hit me!
I'm not going to hit you.
You want me to do it?
Listen, you've been training for this since the day we met.  I've seen your progress. You're smart, brave, and strong enough.
scene_description: [Approaching Aang, placing a hand on his shoulder.]

character_words: Listen, you've been training for this since the day we met.  I've seen your progress. You're smart, brave, and strong enough.
scene_description: [Moves behind him, talking over his shoulder.]

character_words: You really think so?
We all do. You can do this. You're ready.
You're the man, Twinkle Toes!
Thanks, guys.  You know what? I think I am ready.  Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord!
scene_description: [He nods, yawns, and rubs his eyes. Katara aids him to the bed, where he lies down.]

character_words: Thanks, guys.  You know what? I think I am ready.  Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord!
scene_description: [The other three watch as he falls asleep quickly. He falls into another dream, meeting with Ozai again.]

character_words: Really? You're gonna take me out? You're not even wearing pants!
No, Fire Lord Ozai. You're not wearing any pants.
No! My royal parts are showing.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Thank you, Sokka. It's okay why don't you take a break?  Let me just clarify a few points for everyone.  Today, is the day of black sun, and I want to thank you all for your self-sacrifice, and your courage. There are two steps to the invasion, a naval stage, and then a land stage.  To gain sea access to the Fire Nation capital, we need to get past our first major obstacle here,  The Great Gates of Azulon. Next, we hit the land, and we hit hard. We must fight past their battlements and secure the plaza tower. Once we do that, it's up to the Royal Palace. At that point, the eclipse will begin.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Thank you, Sokka. It's okay why don't you take a break?  Let me just clarify a few points for everyone.  Today, is the day of black sun, and I want to thank you all for your self-sacrifice, and your courage. There are two steps to the invasion, a naval stage, and then a land stage.  To gain sea access to the Fire Nation capital, we need to get past our first major obstacle here,  The Great Gates of Azulon. Next, we hit the land, and we hit hard. We must fight past their battlements and secure the plaza tower. Once we do that, it's up to the Royal Palace. At that point, the eclipse will begin.
scene_description: [Shot of Sokka looking down, sad, Katara, Momo and Aang looking at Hakoda and Toph.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Thank you, Sokka. It's okay why don't you take a break?  Let me just clarify a few points for everyone.  Today, is the day of black sun, and I want to thank you all for your self-sacrifice, and your courage. There are two steps to the invasion, a naval stage, and then a land stage.  To gain sea access to the Fire Nation capital, we need to get past our first major obstacle here,  The Great Gates of Azulon. Next, we hit the land, and we hit hard. We must fight past their battlements and secure the plaza tower. Once we do that, it's up to the Royal Palace. At that point, the eclipse will begin.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Excuse me. The Boulder is confused. Isn't the point to invade during the eclipse, when the firebenders are powerless?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: The eclipse only lasts eight minutes, not enough time for the whole invasion. And the Royal Palace is heavily guarded by firebenders. So that's where we'll need the eclipse's advantage the most. When this is finished, the Avatar will have defeated the Fire Lord. We will have control of the Fire Nation capital, and this war will be over!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: We've been looking everywhere for you. The boats are ready to leave.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: I messed up, Aang.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: What?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: The invasion plan was my moment of truth and I completely flubbed it. I just fell apart.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Sokka, that speech wasn't your moment of truth. That was just public speaking, and nobody's really good at that.
scene_description: [Approaches, putting a hand on his shoulder.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: My dad is! He explained the plan perfectly and inspired everyone, like a real leader should.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Look, your moment of truth isn't gonna be in front of some map; it's gonna be out there on the battlefield.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: You seem so confident about everything, how do you know we're gonna win?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Because I already failed the world once at Ba Sing Se. I won't let myself fail again.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: There they are, the Great Gates of Azulon.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: I don't see any gates.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Katara, you and the swamp benders whip up a fog cover.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: We'll sneak by them statues just like we sneak by that Fire Navy blockade!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Keep it up, we're almost through!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Everyone below deck!  Let's hope your invention works.
scene_description: [Everyone goes into the boats; to Sokka.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: No one's on board, sir.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Where'd they go?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: You've really outdone yourself this time, son.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Yeah, congratulations, Sokka. You managed to invent a worse way of travel than flying.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Yeah, congratulations, Sokka. You managed to invent a worse way of travel than flying.
scene_description: [She holds her mouth, about to throw up.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Helmet?
scene_description: [Takes off his helmet and offers it to Toph.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Well, I just came up with the idea. The mechanist did all the work.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Now don't sell yourself short, my boy.  It was your idea to use waterbending to make the subs sink and float, brilliant!  Though your original designs were a bit difficult to decipher. Unfortunately there is one problem I couldn't fix.  The subs have a limited air supply. Before we land on the beaches, we'll need to resurface.
scene_description: [Cut briefly to Katara and Huu waterbending.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Lunchtime, General Iroh.  And this time, I brought you an extra bowl of rice.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Thank you, Ming. Your little gestures of kindness have made my days in prison bearable.  I think you should take the rest of the day off.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: What?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: You don't look well. Maybe you should go home and rest.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: No, I feel fine.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Trust me. It is better that you are not here this afternoon.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: So, this is it huh?
scene_description: [To Toph, Sokka, and Katara, who approach him.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Are you ready for the Fire Nation to know the Avatar is alive?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: I'm ready.
scene_description: [Sokka and Aang shake hands and the group hugs.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: I hope you kick some serious Fire Lord butt, Twinkle Toes.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Everyone listen up.  The next time we resurface, it'll be on the beaches. So stay alert, and fight smart. Now break times over, back in the subs.
scene_description: [Team Avatar comes out of the hug.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Everyone listen up.  The next time we resurface, it'll be on the beaches. So stay alert, and fight smart. Now break times over, back in the subs.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Katara, I ...

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Aang, I ...

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: You go first.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: We've been through so many things together, and I've seen you grow up so much. You're not that little goofy kid I found in the iceberg anymore.  I guess what I'm trying to say is, I'm really proud of you.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Everything's gonna be different after today, isn't it.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Yes, it is.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: What if ... what if I don't come back?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Aang, don't say that, of course you'll-
scene_description: [Katara is cut off as Aang kisses her. After the kiss, Katara blushes and stares sadly after Aang as he confidently snaps his glider and flies away.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Katara, what are you doing? It's time to submerge.

character_words: What? Right, I'm on it.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: I'm sorry Mai.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: What do you know? It did come in handy.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Everyone in position. Earthbenders, into your tanks. This is gonna be a rough ride.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Ready the torpedo.  Launch!

character_words: We're a man down. Where in tarnation is Huu?
scene_description: [He and Due continue waterbending, launching a tank into the water.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Hey Huu! Where you been?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Hey Huu! Where you been?
scene_description: [The seaweed opens to reveal Huu standing inside.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Communin' with nature. Takes a while to collect this much seaweed.
scene_description: [Closes the seaweed again as he sees a large fireball coming straight toward him.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Dad, look out!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Sokka, we've gotta take out those battlements! It's our only chance.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: I've got an idea.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: You two take out that battlement.  I got this one. Watch each other's backs.
scene_description: [Pointing to a battlement in the distance before leaving to another.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: You two take out that battlement.  I got this one. Watch each other's backs.
scene_description: [Cut to Sokka and Katara, shown breaking into their battlement, Katara freezing the soldiers inside. Sokka uses his sword to cut through the launcher, causing part of it to fall out and explode outside as Katara and Sokka exit the battlement. They see Hakoda on the roof of his as he climbs inside. They hear noises from the ensuing fight until the launcher shoots and explodes, hearing Hakoda yelling out in pain. Cut to Sokka and Katara's worried faces as Hakoda exits, wounded, and falls to the ground.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Dad?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Dad!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: I know I've made some bad choices, but today, I'm gonna set things right.
scene_description: [He rises, picks up his sword, covers his head with the hood of his robe, turns his back to the camera and leaves.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: How does that feel, dad?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Ah, a little, better. I need, to get back to the troops.  Ahh!
scene_description: [Attempts to stand but is too weak to.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: You're hurt, badly. You can't fight anymore.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Everyone's counting on me to lead this mission Katara, I won't let them down.  Ahh!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Can't you heal him any faster?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: I'm doing everything I can.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: I'll do it.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: No offense Sokka, but you're not exactly Mr. Healing Hands.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: No.  I'll lead the invasion force.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Don't be crazy Sokka.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Maybe I am a little crazy, but the eclipse is about to start and we need to be up that volcano by the time it does.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: You can do this.  I'm proud of you son.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: I still think you're crazy, but I'm proud of you too.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Yip yip.
scene_description: [Nods, puts his helmet on and boards Appa.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: Listen up, everyone. I want the tanks in wedge formation. Warriors and benders in the middle. We're taking that tower, and heading for the royal palace.  Charge!
scene_description: [All the tanks come together in wedge formation behind Appa, soldiers protected in the middle. Cut to Sokka, on Appa, who draws his sword and thrusts it forward.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: That's strange.  The Avatar is back!  Hello? Anyone home?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: That's strange.  The Avatar is back!  Hello? Anyone home?
scene_description: [He continues onto the Royal Palace, breaks open the door, and takes a fighting stance.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: That's strange.  The Avatar is back!  Hello? Anyone home?
scene_description: [Realizing no one is around he relaxes, looking confused.]

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
character_words: The Fire Nation is falling back!
