Look, I have to do this. The invasion plan was my idea, it was my decision to stay when things were going wrong.  It's my mistake, and it's my job to fix it. I have to regain my honor. You can't stop me, Zuko.
scene_description: [Pushes Zuko aside and begins to climb up Appa on Appa's saddle.]

character_words: You need to regain your honor? Believe me, I get it. I'm going with you.
No. I have to do this alone.
How are you going to get there? On Appa? Last time I checked, prisons don't have bison daycares.  We'll take my war balloon.
scene_description: [Sokka stops climbing, sighs, and looks back at Zuko.]

character_words: How are you going to get there? On Appa? Last time I checked, prisons don't have bison daycares.  We'll take my war balloon.
scene_description: [They walk off to the war balloon.]

character_words: What does it say?

"Need meat. Gone fishing. Back in a few days. Sokka and Zuko."  One more thing. "Aang, practice your firebending while I'm gone. Do twenty sets of fire fists and ten hot squats every time you hear a badgerfrog croak. Zuko."
scene_description: [As she says this, Aang yawns and turns around to lie back down.]

character_words: Nobody else has homework.  One hot squat, two hot squat, three hot squat, four hot squat ...
Nobody else has homework.  One hot squat, two hot squat, three hot squat, four hot squat ...
scene_description: [Stands up and walks to a spot and starts hot squatting while Katara and Toph walk away.]

character_words: Pretty clouds.
Yeah ... fluffy.  What?
What? Oh, I didn't say anything. You know, a friend of mine actually designed these war balloons.
No kidding.
Yep, a balloon ... but for war.
If there's one thing my dad's good at, it's war.
Yeah, it seems to run in the family.
Hey, hold on. Not everyone in my family is like that.
I know, I know, you've changed.
I meant my uncle. He was more of a father to me. And I really let him down.
I think your uncle would be proud of you. Leaving your home to come help us? That's hard.
It wasn't that hard.
Really? You didn't leave behind anyone you cared about?
Well, I did have a girlfriend. Mai.
That gloomy girl who sighs a lot?
scene_description: [Smiles and looks at Zuko with interest.]

character_words: Yeah. Everyone in the Fire Nation thinks I'm a traitor. I couldn't drag her into it.
My first girlfriend turned into the moon.
That's rough, buddy.
scene_description: [Shocked for a moment. Looks up at the sky briefly, before glancing back at Sokka.]

character_words: There it is!  There's plenty of steam to keep us covered. As long as we're quiet, we should be able to navigate through it without being caught.
We're going down! The balloon's not working anymore!
We're going down! The balloon's not working anymore!
The air outside is just as hot as the air inside so we can't fly!
So what are we supposed to do?
scene_description: [Falls to the side as the balloon tips.]

character_words: I don't know! Crash-landing?
How are we gonna get off the island if the balloon won't work?
We'll figure something out! I suspected it might be a one-way ticket.
You knew this would happen and you wanted to come anyway?
My dad might be here! I had to come and see!
Uncle always said I never thought things through. But this ... this is just crazy!
Hey, I never wanted you to come along in the first place! And for the record, I always think things through! But my plans haven't exactly worked, so this time, I'm playing it by ear. So there.
Hey, I never wanted you to come along in the first place! And for the record, I always think things through! But my plans haven't exactly worked, so this time, I'm playing it by ear. So there.
scene_description: [After the hot water on the balloon burns his hand, Sokka kicks it into the water.]

character_words: What are you doing?
It doesn't work anyway, and we don't want anyone to find it.
I hope you know what you're doing.  There's no turning back now.
scene_description: [They both turn to look at the prison.]

character_words: I hope these disguises work.
We just need to lay low and find my dad as soon as possible.
Guards! There's a scuffle in the yard. Come on.
I didn't do anything! I'm going back to my cell.
Stop right there, Chit Sang.
We can't blow our cover.
I've had it with your unruly behavior!
What did I do?
He wants to know what he did.  Isn't that cute?
He wants to know what he did.  Isn't that cute?
scene_description: [Gives them a look when they say nothing.]

character_words: Uh, very cute, sir.
Super cute.
You didn't bow down when I walked by, Chit Sang!
What? That's not a prison rule.
Do it!
Make me.
Tsk, tsk. Firebending is prohibited. You're going in the cooler.  You! Help me take him in.
Meet back here in an hour.
Meet back here in an hour.
scene_description: [Runs up to Chit Sang and the guard.]

character_words: The warden will deal with you soon.  Can you believe this guy?
Prisoners! Am I right?
Ugh. Tell me about it.
Hey, new guy! I know it's the rule to have your helmet on at all times, but this is the lounge. Relax.
But what if there's an incident? If I'm not prepared, someone could strike me on the head.
Give it a week, he'll loosen up.
Can the new guy ask you veterans a few questions about the prison?
No, you can't date the female guards.
Trust me, you don't want to.
scene_description: [The female guard throws a cup at him, which causes the guard sitting behind him to laugh.]

character_words: No, that's not it. The Boiling Rock, it holds the Fire Nation's most dangerous criminals, right?  So what about war prisoners?
It sure looks cold in there.
That's why we call it the cooler. He won't be firebending there.  It's the warden!  Look alive!
That's why we call it the cooler. He won't be firebending there.  It's the warden!  Look alive!
So Chit Sang, I hear you used firebending to try to escape. You should know better.
I wasn't trying to escape.
He's lying! I saw it with my own eyes.
scene_description: [He is pushed aside by one of the warden's bodyguards.]

character_words: No one has ever, ever escaped from here. I'd sooner jump in the Boiling Lake myself than let that record fall. Don't forget it. Now go back to your shivering.
Hey there, fellow guard, how goes it?
Zuko?
Shhh! Listen, I asked around the lounge. There are no Water Tribe prisoners.  I'm afraid your father's not here.
What? Are you sure, did you double-check?
Yeah, I'm sure.
No. No!
scene_description: [Bangs his fists against the wall in frustration.]

character_words: I'm really sorry, Sokka.
So we came all this way for nothing? I failed ... again.

Ah,  what would Uncle say?  Sometimes, clouds have two sides,  a dark and light, and a silver lining in between. It's like a silver sandwich!  So ... when life seems hard ...  take a bite out of the silver sandwich!

Ah,  what would Uncle say?  Sometimes, clouds have two sides,  a dark and light, and a silver lining in between. It's like a silver sandwich!  So ... when life seems hard ...  take a bite out of the silver sandwich!
scene_description: [Cut to a frog-view as he looks up at the sky.]

character_words: Ah,  what would Uncle say?  Sometimes, clouds have two sides,  a dark and light, and a silver lining in between. It's like a silver sandwich!  So ... when life seems hard ...  take a bite out of the silver sandwich!

Ah,  what would Uncle say?  Sometimes, clouds have two sides,  a dark and light, and a silver lining in between. It's like a silver sandwich!  So ... when life seems hard ...  take a bite out of the silver sandwich!

Ah,  what would Uncle say?  Sometimes, clouds have two sides,  a dark and light, and a silver lining in between. It's like a silver sandwich!  So ... when life seems hard ...  take a bite out of the silver sandwich!
Maybe we haven't failed after all!
That's the spirit!  I can't believe that worked.  I didn't even know what I was saying.
That's the spirit!  I can't believe that worked.  I didn't even know what I was saying.
No, what you said made no sense at all. But look ...  It's Suki!
scene_description: [As he points, the camera shifts to an overhead view of the yard, before rapidly zooming in on a dejected-looking Suki.]

character_words: Prisoners,  back in your cells!
Prisoners,  back in your cells!
What is it? Did I do something wrong?
You mean you don't recognize me?
You people all look the same to me.
Oh? Then maybe you'll recognize this.
Sokka!  It's you!
scene_description: [Runs up to him; cut to a side-view.]

character_words: The other Kyoshi Warriors, are they here?
scene_description: [They both stand up, not releasing each other.]

character_words: No. I don't know where they are. They locked me in here because I'm the leader.
Well, you won't be here for long. I'm busting you out.
scene_description: [Places his right hand on her left cheek.]

character_words: I'm so glad  to see you Sokka.  I knew you'd come.
I'm so glad  to see you Sokka.  I knew you'd come.
scene_description: [Places her hand over Sokka's on her face and closes her eyes.]

character_words: I'm so glad  to see you Sokka.  I knew you'd come.
Excuse me.  I need to get into that cell.
scene_description: [Cut to a shot from behind Zuko.]

character_words: No, you can't go in there!  The lights are out.  The prisoner could sneak up on you.
No, you can't go in there!  The lights are out.  The prisoner could sneak up on you.
No, you can't go in there!  The lights are out.  The prisoner could sneak up on you.
Step aside, fool.  Hey, hey, what are you doing?
Step aside, fool.  Hey, hey, what are you doing?
scene_description: [She raises her left arm to push Zuko out of the way, though before she can touch him, he grabs hold of the arm and turns her around, slamming her face first against the door.]

character_words: Guard, help!  I think he's an impostor!  Arrest him!
scene_description: [Instantly cut to a frontal shot of Sokka, who freezes over.]

character_words: Guard, help!  I think he's an impostor!  Arrest him!
scene_description: [He turns to look at the struggle.]

character_words: Guard, help!  I think he's an impostor!  Arrest him!
Get him off me and arrest him!
You're under arrest!  Don't worry, I'll figure it out.
scene_description: [Grabs Zuko and throws him down on the floor.]

character_words: You're under arrest!  Don't worry, I'll figure it out.
Well, well, well. I never thought I'd find you in here,  Prince Zuko.
scene_description: [Smiles evilly and walks into the cell.]

character_words: How did you know who I am?
How could I not? You broke my niece's heart.
You're Mai's uncle? I never meant to hurt her.
Quiet! You're my special prisoner now. And you'd best behave. If these criminals found out who you are, the traitor prince who let his nation down, why they'd tear you to shreds.
So what's in it for you? Why don't you just tell my father to come collect a reward?
Oh, in due time, believe me, I intend to collect.
Oh, good, you guys have met.
Actually, we met a long time ago.
We did?
Yeah, you kind of burned down my village.
Oh, sorry about that. Nice to see you again.
So, listen, I think I have an escape plan. I checked out the coolers again, and the point of them is to keep firebenders contained, right?
Yeah ...
So, they're completely insulated and sealed to keep the cold in. Well, to keep the cold in, it also has to keep the heat out, right?
Just get to the point, Sokka.
It's a perfect boat for getting through the boiling water.
The cooler as a boat? Are you sure?

I'm telling you, it'll work.  I walked around the perimeter. There's a blind spot between two guard towers. It's the perfect launching point.  I already tested it out. We'll roll the cooler into the water and just float with the current. It'll take us straight across. As long as we don't make a sound, no one will notice.  And bing-bang-boom, we're home free.
scene_description: [Flashes back to Sokka walking around the island; voice-over.]

character_words: I'm telling you, it'll work.  I walked around the perimeter. There's a blind spot between two guard towers. It's the perfect launching point.  I already tested it out. We'll roll the cooler into the water and just float with the current. It'll take us straight across. As long as we don't make a sound, no one will notice.  And bing-bang-boom, we're home free.
scene_description: [Sokka puts a miniature boat in the water and watching it float away.]

character_words: I'm telling you, it'll work.  I walked around the perimeter. There's a blind spot between two guard towers. It's the perfect launching point.  I already tested it out. We'll roll the cooler into the water and just float with the current. It'll take us straight across. As long as we don't make a sound, no one will notice.  And bing-bang-boom, we're home free.
scene_description: [Fade back to Sokka talking to Zuko and Suki.]

character_words: But how are you going to get the cooler out?
Yeah, how are you going to get the cooler out?
Yeah, how are you going to get the cooler out?
What? We didn't ... w-we didn't say that.
Yeah, you heard wrong.
I heard you hatching an escape plan, and I want in.
There's nothing to get in on.
Yeah, the only thing we're hatching is ... an egg?
Okay, well, I come with you or the warden  hears about this egg, too.
Okay, well, I come with you or the warden  hears about this egg, too.
scene_description: [Camera pans from a serious-looking Zuko to Suki.]

character_words: I guess we have no choice.
Okay, you're in.  Now first we need someone to unbolt the cooler, from the inside.
Oh, I can get you inside.
Hey! What are you, stupid? Watch where you're going!
Hey, you watch who you're shoving!
I think you mean whom I'm shoving!
I need backup over here!
No firebending!  Into the cooler!
I can take you back to your cell if you've learned your lesson.
Yes, I have ... completely.
scene_description: [Raises his head slightly and releases a small breath of fire to warm himself up.]

character_words: Yes, I have ... completely.
scene_description: [Reveals all the removed bolts and screws, which makes Sokka smile.]

character_words: I got Suki and Chit Sang out of their cells a few minutes ago. They'll be waiting for us at the shore.
Someone's coming!
scene_description: [Takes Sokka into the cooler and closes the door.]

character_words: Yeah, new arrivals coming in at dawn.
Anybody interesting?
Nah, just the usual. Some robbers, a couple traitors, some war prisoners,  though I did hear there might be a pirate.
scene_description: [Sokka looks at Zuko with shock and worry.]

character_words: No fooling!
War prisoners. It could be your father.
I know.
Well, what should we do? Are we going ahead with the plan or are we waiting another night?
I don't know! Is it right for me to risk Suki's freedom, all of our freedom on the slim chance that my dad is gonna show up?
It's your call, Sokka.
Took you guys long enough.  This here's my girl and my best buddy, they're coming too.
scene_description: [Cut briefly to two other prisoners, a male sitting on a rock, and a female waving.]

character_words: Fine. Everybody in the cooler. Let's go.
scene_description: [They move the cooler into the water. Cut to Sokka lifting a rock hiding his Water Tribe outfit.]

character_words: Are you sure you wanna go? You're the one who said you wanted to redeem yourself. Redeem your honor. Rescuing your dad is your chance.
Your dad?
If I had just cut my losses at the invasion, maybe we wouldn't be in this mess. Maybe sometimes it's just better to call it quits before you fail.
No, it's not. Look Sokka, you're going to fail a lot before things work out.
That supposed to make me feel better?
Even though you'll probably fail over and over and over again ...
Seriously, not helping.
You have to try every time. You can't quit because you're afraid you might fail.
Hey, if you two are done cuddling, can we get a move on?
No. I'm staying. You guys go.  You've been here long enough.
I'm not leaving without you, Sokka.
I'm staying, too.
Not me, I'm out. Let's roll, baby.
scene_description: [Pushes the cooler into the lake and jumps in.]

character_words: We gave up our only chance of escaping. I hope we haven't just made a huge mistake.
Aah, this current is so slow. I can use this to paddle.
scene_description: [Rips off a piece of the cooler. When he puts the piece of metal in the water, the steaming water splashes on to his hand, causing him to scream loudly.]

character_words: Guards! Secure the perimeter and lock down the prisoners! Now!
The plan failed! They're caught!
Get the fugitives and throw them in the cooler!
Uh ... they are in a cooler, sir.
scene_description: [The guard in charge of the steering wheel turns toward the warden.]

character_words: One that's bolted down and not floating in the water! This is a lockdown! We have new prisoners arriving! Everything must be completely secure!
The gondola's moving.  This is it.  If my dad's not there, we've risked everything for nothing.
scene_description: [Cut to a side-view of the gondola approaching the prison. Cut to a view of the prison yard as the gondola nears its stop. Cut to Sokka and Suki now in the yard.]

character_words: The gondola's moving.  This is it.  If my dad's not there, we've risked everything for nothing.
scene_description: [Cut to the gondola arriving. Cut to Sokka, Zuko and Suki in the yard.]

character_words: We had to.
Come on, come on ...
Is that him?
My dad doesn't have a nose ring.  Where is he?  That's it? That can't be it.
scene_description: [Cut briefly to the gondola as several men step off.]

character_words: My dad doesn't have a nose ring.  Where is he?  That's it? That can't be it.
scene_description: [Cut to the gondola briefly as we see one more prisoner exit. Hakoda does not appear.]

character_words: I'm sorry, Sokka.
Oh, no.
Hey, you! Get off the gondola!
Dad ...
Line 'em up for the warden!
Dad ...  Excuse me, coming through. The warden wants me over there.  Sorry!
scene_description: [Exiting a stairway and passing through a lineup of guards, surprising them a bit.]

character_words: Dad ...  Excuse me, coming through. The warden wants me over there.  Sorry!

Welcome to the Boiling Rock. I'm sure you've all heard the horrible rumors about our little island. Well, I just want to tell you that they don't have to be true, as long as you do everything I say.  Look me in the eye when I'm talking to you.
scene_description: [Walking past the line of prisoners starting from the left.]

character_words: Welcome to the Boiling Rock. I'm sure you've all heard the horrible rumors about our little island. Well, I just want to tell you that they don't have to be true, as long as you do everything I say.  Look me in the eye when I'm talking to you.
scene_description: [He stops in front of Hakoda who looks downward; looks closer at Hakoda.]

character_words: No.
scene_description: [Averting his gaze slightly off to the side; firmly.]

character_words: Oh? You'd rather look at my shoes?  Then take a look!
I know exactly who you are, Hakoda of the Water Tribe. So strong-willed.  But don't worry, we'll get rid of that in time. Now look me in the eye!
See, isn't that better?  You will all do as I say or pay the price. You will all-
See, isn't that better?  You will all do as I say or pay the price. You will all-
Are you okay, sir?
I'm fine! Get these prisoners out of my sight!
Thank goodness you're okay.
If you take one step closer, you'll see just how "okay" I am.
scene_description: [Rises to his feet and extends his right arm out, clenched in a fist, not realizing the guard is his son in disguise; Sokka backs up a bit.]

character_words: Dad, it's me.
Sokka,  my son.  You know Sokka, you should be more careful with that guard outfit on. I almost punched you in the gut.
Sokka,  my son.  You know Sokka, you should be more careful with that guard outfit on. I almost punched you in the gut.
scene_description: [The two embrace; Sokka drops his helmet to the floor.]

character_words: Sokka,  my son.  You know Sokka, you should be more careful with that guard outfit on. I almost punched you in the gut.
Yeah, I ran into that problem earlier.
scene_description: [Rubs the back of his neck sheepishly.]

character_words: Are you comfortable, Chit Sang?
If you're trying to get me to talk, forget it!  I'm not a squealer!
If you're trying to get me to talk, forget it!  I'm not a squealer!
Chit Sang, I only asked if you were comfortable.
scene_description: [Cuts to close-up of his face; casually.]

character_words: Well, yeah, actually I am pretty comfortable.
Are you still comfortable?
No.
I know you and your cronies are not smart enough to come up with that little escape plan. So you're gonna tell me ...  who is?
So where's Bato?  Where's everyone else from the invasion?
So where's Bato?  Where's everyone else from the invasion?
scene_description: [Cut to inside the prison cell; Sokka turns away from the door.]

character_words: The others are being held at a prison near the Fire Nation palace. They singled me out as their leader and sent me here.  But before I left, I met some young women who said they knew you. The ... Oshinama Fighters?
scene_description: [Sokka comes by his father and sits down.]

character_words: You mean the Kyoshi Warriors?
That's right.
Their leader Suki is here and she's gonna escape with us.
Good. We'll need all the help we can get.
And you know Prince Zuko?
The son of the Fire Lord? I don't know him, but I know of him.
Well, he's here too.
Sounds like a major problem.
Actually, he's on our side now.  I know. I had the same reaction. After all he's done, it was hard to trust him. But he's really proven himself, and I never would've found you without his help.
scene_description: [Cut to Hakoda, who gives his son a suspicious look.]

character_words: Actually, he's on our side now.  I know. I had the same reaction. After all he's done, it was hard to trust him. But he's really proven himself, and I never would've found you without his help.
scene_description: [Hakoda nods his head at Sokka, indicating that he understands.]

character_words: So, do you have a plan?
We had one, but some of the other prisoners got involved and ruined it.  I dunno if there's another way off this island.
We had one, but some of the other prisoners got involved and ruined it.  I dunno if there's another way off this island.
scene_description: [Leans forward and rests his face in his arms.]

character_words: Sokka, there's no prison in the world that can hold two Water Tribe geniuses.
scene_description: [Smiles and pats a hand on Sokka's back.]

character_words: Then we'd better find two.
Zuko, are you there?
I'm here.
scene_description: [A view of Zuko's eyes appears in the slit from inside the cell.]

character_words: I just got done talking to my dad. We came up with an escape plan together.
What are you doing here?
I was just telling this dirty lowlife what I think of him!
scene_description: [Pointing to the cell and trying to act gruff.]

character_words: Well, you'll have to do that later. He's coming with us.
Why?
Because we have orders straight from the warden, that's why!
Could I just get ten more seconds to rough him up a bit?
Fine, ten seconds.
Take that ... and this!
Take that ... and this!
Newbie.
We have a new plan, but it's gonna need a big distraction.  Be in the yard in one hour.
scene_description: [In a hushed voice while still punching the mattress.]

character_words: We have a new plan, but it's gonna need a big distraction.  Be in the yard in one hour.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of Zuko who peers from behind the blanket; off camera.]

character_words: All right, that's enough.
What are you doing? Where are you taking me?  I didn't do anything wrong!
What are you doing? Where are you taking me?  I didn't do anything wrong!
scene_description: [He is thrown into a chair in an interrogation room.]

character_words: Come on,  Zuko.  We all know that's a lie.
scene_description: [Zuko looks to the source of the voice.]

character_words: Come on,  Zuko.  We all know that's a lie.
scene_description: [Emerges from the corner of the room; annoyed.]

character_words: Mai!
How is he?
I think he's ready to talk.
Have you had enough time to think about what I asked?
Yes.
And?
You're right. There was another person involved in the escape plan.
Who?
scene_description: [Places his hand on Chit Sang's shoulder.]

character_words: It's a guy who's disguised like a prison guard. Only he's not a prison guard. He's the mastermind. He came up with the plan.
How did you know I was here?
Because I know you so well.
But, how-
The warden's my uncle, you idiot.  The truth is, I guess I don't know you. All I get is a letter? You could have least looked me in the eye when you ripped out my heart.
scene_description: [Zuko sighs; Mai shows him a letter.]

character_words: I didn't mean to -
You didn't mean to?  "Dear Mai, I'm sorry you that you have to find out this way, but I'm leaving."
Stop! This isn't about you. This is about the Fire Nation!
Thanks Zuko, that makes me feel all better.
Thanks Zuko, that makes me feel all better.
Mai, I never wanted to hurt you. But I have to do this to save my country.
Save it? You're betraying your country!
That's not how I see it.
Sokka, what's going on?
I don't have much time. If I'm seen with you the guards might think something's up.  I just talked to my dad.
I don't have much time. If I'm seen with you the guards might think something's up.  I just talked to my dad.
scene_description: [Walks over to the door and peers outside.]

character_words: That's great.
Yeah, and we're escaping today, on the gondola.
What?
My dad and I came up with the plan together. We're gonna commandeer the gondola  and we're gonna take a hostage with us so they won't cut the lines.
We'll never make it onto the gondola. There's too many guards.
My dad already thought of that. He said we'll need a distraction. That's why we're gonna start a prison riot.
Okay, let's say by some miracle this all works and we make it on the gondola. The warden will still just cut the lines, even if we have a captive.
Not if the warden is the captive.  I have to go.  I'll find you before we start the riot.
scene_description: [Nearby noise occurs. Moves to look outside.]

character_words: Not if the warden is the captive.  I have to go.  I'll find you before we start the riot.
Not if the warden is the captive.  I have to go.  I'll find you before we start the riot.
scene_description: [Cut to outside the cell, where he slides out of the cell.]

character_words: Hey, you, the warden wants to see you!
Why?
I don't know, I didn't ask.
Maybe I could schedule another time with him? How's tomorrow?
He wants to see you ... now.
Put him in the line-up.
One of you is an impostor who thought he could fool me.  But now, that person is going to be in a lot of trouble. Who is it?
That's him, warden. He's the impostor!
That's him, warden. He's the impostor!
scene_description: [The camera shifts to Chit Sang, who is pointing at the bully guard.]

character_words: What?
I am not!  He's lying!  He's a liar!
I am not!  He's lying!  He's a liar!
scene_description: [Chit Sang just raises his hands nonchalantly in defense.]

character_words: I am not!  He's lying!  He's a liar!
I'm telling you ... it wasn't me!
Save your breath! I know you were working together.  You threw Chit Sang in the very cooler they used to escape. It was all part of your plan.
scene_description: [Turns around and moves in closer to the guard.]

character_words: That was just a coincidence!
Sir, there's someone to see you.
Who told you to interrupt me?
I did.
Princess Azula.  Ah ... It is an honor to welcome you to the Fire Nation's most exemplary prison.  I didn't realize you were coming.
Princess Azula.  Ah ... It is an honor to welcome you to the Fire Nation's most exemplary prison.  I didn't realize you were coming.
Princess Azula.  Ah ... It is an honor to welcome you to the Fire Nation's most exemplary prison.  I didn't realize you were coming.
Who is this?
scene_description: [Walks in and notices the guard sitting in the chair.]

character_words: He's a guard who was involved in a recent and feeble escape attempt.
scene_description: [Cut to the bully guard, who looks away.]

character_words: It wasn't me!
Quiet, you!
You're wasting your time. That's not one of them.
You're wasting your time. That's not one of them.
How do you know?
Because I'm a people person.
Because I'm a people person.
Hey, I just got orders. Let the prisoners out into the yard.
But we're in the middle of a lockdown.
Oh, okay, I'll just go tell the warden you said that.  I'm sure he'll be glad to hear about you undermining his authority.  What's your name again?
scene_description: [Walks off-screen; the guard raises his mask and looks at him speechless.]

character_words: Oh, okay, I'll just go tell the warden you said that.  I'm sure he'll be glad to hear about you undermining his authority.  What's your name again?
scene_description: [Guard grows more nervous. Walks back on-screen, lifting his helmet mask.]

character_words: Wait! Don't tell the warden. I'm just a little confused.
Hey, I'm confused too, but the warden's in a bad mood, and ... irrational, so if you ask me, it's best not to question it, and just do what he says.
scene_description: [Places his arm around the guard's shoulder.]

character_words: Yeah ... you're right. We're letting them out!
This is it! We have to start a riot.
Okay. But how do we do that?
I'll show you.
I'll show you.
Hey! What'd you do that for? That hurt my feelings.
Aren't you mad at me?
Uh, well, normally I would be, but I've been learning to control my anger.
This isn't working.
Hey you! You're lucky I didn't rat you out,  but my generosity comes with a price. I know you're planning another escape attempt, and I want in.
Actually, we're trying to escape right now, but we need a riot.  You wouldn't happen to know how to start one, would you?
Actually, we're trying to escape right now, but we need a riot.  You wouldn't happen to know how to start one, would you?
A prison riot? Please.  Hey!  Riot!
scene_description: [Grabs a prisoner and lifts him in the air, bouncing him up and down.]

character_words: A prison riot? Please.  Hey!  Riot!
Impressive.
Forget about controlling my anger ...  let's riot!
Forget about controlling my anger ...  let's riot!
scene_description: [He is taken down by another prisoner. The riot is in full swing. Cut the floor of the yard as chaos and dust ensues everywhere. Cut to a prisoner sitting on another prisoner's shoulders, attempting to choke him. Cut to the bottom of a tower as various guards look down at the scene.]

character_words: Who let these prisoners into the yard?  This is supposed to be a lockdown!
scene_description: [Cut to the warden on a balcony.]

character_words: Ma'am, there's a riot going on! I'm here to protect you!
I don't need any protection.
Believe me, she doesn't.
I'm sorry, but I'm under direct orders from your uncle to make sure nothing happens.
Get off of me!
scene_description: [She throws the guard away from her and chases Zuko.]

character_words: Zuko! Good, we're all here. Now all we need to do is grab the warden, and get to the gondolas!
And how do we do that?
I'm not sure.
I thought you thought this through!
I thought you told me it's okay not to think everything through!
Maybe not everything, but this is kind of important!
Hey, uh, fellas. I think your girlfriend's taking care of it.
You wouldn't dare.
Sorry, warden. You're my prisoner now.  We've got the warden! Now let's get out of here!
scene_description: [Ties his hands together and uses his headband as a gag.]

character_words: Sorry, warden. You're my prisoner now.  We've got the warden! Now let's get out of here!
scene_description: [Slams the warden against the wall; the rest of the escapees arrive.]

character_words: That's some girl.
Tell me about it.
We're almost there!
Back off! We've got the warden!  Let's go!
scene_description: [The guards see the warden on Chit Sang's shoulder, bound and gagged, and clear the way.]

character_words: Everyone in!
What are you doing?
I'm making it so they can't stop us.
Way to think ahead.
We're on our way!
Wait! Who's that?
That's a problem. It's my sister and her friend.
This is a rematch I've been waiting for.
Me too.
There's the warden! I see him!
Cut the line!
scene_description: [Frees himself and runs to look out of the gondola.]

character_words: Cut the line!
scene_description: [Chit Sang notices and grabs the warden.]

character_words: He wants us to cut the line.
But if we cut the line, there's no way he'll survive!
He knows that.
They're about to cut the line!
Then it's time to leave.  Goodbye, Zuko.
Then it's time to leave.  Goodbye, Zuko.
Then it's time to leave.  Goodbye, Zuko.
They're cutting the line! The gondola's about to go!
I hope this thing floats.
What are you doing?
Saving the jerk who dumped me.
Who's that?
It's Mai!
What is she doing?
Sorry, warden. Your record is officially broken.
Well, we made it out. Now what?
Zuko, what are you doing?
My sister was on that island.
Yeah, and she's probably right behind us, so let's not stop!
What I mean is she must have come here somehow.  There!  That's our way out of here!
scene_description: [Walks up to a large hill by the sea.]

character_words: What I mean is she must have come here somehow.  There!  That's our way out of here!
Leave us alone.  I never expected this from you.  The thing I don't understand is "Why?". Why would you do it? You know the consequences.
scene_description: [The guards give the Fire Nation salute and exit. Mai raises her head a little, looking defiant.]

character_words: Leave us alone.  I never expected this from you.  The thing I don't understand is "Why?". Why would you do it? You know the consequences.
scene_description: [Cut to a side view of Mai, followed by a frontal shot of Ty Lee, who looks from one to the other, tears in her eyes, and back to Azula.]

character_words: I guess you just don't know people as well as you think you do. You miscalculated. I love Zuko more than I fear you.
No, you miscalculated! You should have feared me more!
scene_description: [Her intrigued expression contorts into one of absolute rage.]

character_words: Come on! Let's get out of here!
scene_description: [Runs to a shocked Mai, shaking her from her stupor.]

character_words: You're both fools!
What shall we do with them, princess?
Put them somewhere I'll never have to see their faces again, and let them rot!
What are you doing in this thing? What happened to the war balloon?
It kind of got destroyed.
Sounds like a crazy fishing trip.
Did you at least get some good meat?
I did. The best meat of all. The meat of friendship and fatherhood.
I'm new. What's up, everybody?
Dad?
Dad?
Hi, Katara.
How are you here? What is going on? Where did you go?
We kind of went to a Fire Nation prison.
Seriously? You guys didn't find any meat?
Watch out!
scene_description: [As he runs and pushes her out of harm's way.]

character_words: What are you doing?
Keeping rocks from crushing you.
Okay, I'm not crushed. You can get off me now!
I'll take that as a thank you.
Come on! We can get out through here!
What are you doing?
Go ahead! I'll hold them off. I think this is a family visit.
Zuko! No!
scene_description: [In the background, Sokka and Katara run up to him.]

character_words: Come on! We've gotta get out of here!
What are you doing here?
You mean it's not obvious yet? I am about to celebrate becoming an only child!
I can't get him to go in there! Appa hates tunnels!
Aang, there's no way we can fly out of here.
We'll have to find a way!
We need to split up.  Take the tunnel and get to the stolen airship.
No!  The Fire Nation can't separate our family again!
No!  The Fire Nation can't separate our family again!
It'll be okay. It's not forever.
I can clear that away and we can fly out through there!
Um, there's an awful lot of fire in that general direction ...
We'll get through. Let's go.
She's ... not gonna make it ...  Of course she did.
scene_description: [Azula uses her firebending to propel herself toward the wall, stopping her fall with her hair pin and saving herself.]

character_words: Wow, camping ... it really seems like old times again, doesn't it?
If you really want it to feel like old times, I could, uh ... chase you around a while and try to capture you.
If you really want it to feel like old times, I could, uh ... chase you around a while and try to capture you.
scene_description: [He smiles and the rest of the group laughs, except for Katara.]

character_words: Ha, ha.
To Zuko! Who knew after all those times he tried to snuff us out, today he'd be our hero?
Hear! Hear!
scene_description: [Everybody except Katara holds up their cups.]

character_words: Hear! Hear!
scene_description: [Aang nudges him with his elbow, before Toph lightly punches him.]

character_words: I'm touched.  I don't deserve this.
I'm touched.  I don't deserve this.
Yeah, no kidding.
Yeah, no kidding.
What's with her?
I wish I knew.
What's with him?
This isn't fair! Everyone else seems to trust me now! What is it with you?
Oh, everyone trusts you now! I was the first person to trust you!  Remember, back in Ba Sing Se.  And you turned around and betrayed me, betrayed all of us!
Oh, everyone trusts you now! I was the first person to trust you!  Remember, back in Ba Sing Se.  And you turned around and betrayed me, betrayed all of us!
scene_description: [Places her left hand on her heart.]

character_words: Oh, everyone trusts you now! I was the first person to trust you!  Remember, back in Ba Sing Se.  And you turned around and betrayed me, betrayed all of us!
What can I do to make it up to you?
You really want to know? Hmm, maybe you could reconquer Ba Sing Se in the name of the Earth King.  Or, I know! You could bring my mother back!
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of her and Zuko standing on the cliff as she approaches him while snapping at him angrily.]

character_words: You really want to know? Hmm, maybe you could reconquer Ba Sing Se in the name of the Earth King.  Or, I know! You could bring my mother back!
scene_description: [Cuts to side-view of her and Zuko.]

character_words: Oops, wrong tent!
Sorry, do you need to talk to Sokka, too?
Nope, not me!
Well, hello ...  Uh, Zuko! Yes, why would I be expecting anyone different?  So what's on your mind?
scene_description: [Holding a rose in his mouth, surrounded by lit candles.]

character_words: Well, hello ...  Uh, Zuko! Yes, why would I be expecting anyone different?  So what's on your mind?
scene_description: [Surprised to find Zuko in his tent, destroying the rose in his mouth.]

character_words: Well, hello ...  Uh, Zuko! Yes, why would I be expecting anyone different?  So what's on your mind?
Your sister. She hates me! And I don't know why, but I do care what she thinks of me.

Nah, she doesn't hate you. Katara doesn't hate anyone. Except maybe some people in the Fire Nation.  No, I mean, uh, not people who are good, but used to be bad. I mean, bad people. Fire Nation people who are still bad, who've never been good and probably won't be, ever!
scene_description: [His eyes widen as he realizes his mistake.]

character_words: Stop. Okay, listen. I know this may seem out of nowhere, but I want you to tell me what happened to your mother.
What? Why would you want to know that?
Katara mentioned it before when we were imprisoned together in Ba Sing Se, and again just now when she was yelling at me. I think somehow she's connected her anger at that to her anger at me.
It's not a day I like to remember.
I'm going to find Mom!

Many of the warriors had seen the black snow before and they knew what it meant: a Fire Nation raid.  We were badly outnumbered, but somehow, we managed to drive them off. As quickly as they came, they just left.

Many of the warriors had seen the black snow before and they knew what it meant: a Fire Nation raid.  We were badly outnumbered, but somehow, we managed to drive them off. As quickly as they came, they just left.
scene_description: [A battle scene is depicted of Water Tribe Warriors and Fire Nation soldiers charging and attacking one another.]

character_words: I was so relieved when it was over, but that's because I didn't know yet what had happened. I didn't know we had lost our mother.
Wait. Can you remember any details about the soldiers who raided your village? Like what the lead ship looked like?
Yeah ... sea ravens.  The main ship had flags with sea ravens on them.
scene_description: [Scene shows flashback of three red flags waving in the breeze, bearing sea ravens.]

character_words: The symbol of the Southern Raiders. Thanks, Sokka.
No problem. Thanks for stopping by!  I'd thought he'd never leave.  Suki!
scene_description: [Urging Zuko hurriedly out of the tent.]

character_words: No problem. Thanks for stopping by!  I'd thought he'd never leave.  Suki!
No problem. Thanks for stopping by!  I'd thought he'd never leave.  Suki!
You look terrible.
I waited out here all night.
What do you want?
I know who killed your mother,  and I'm going to help you find him.
I need to borrow Appa.
Why? Is it your turn to take a little field trip with Zuko?
Yes, it is.
Oh. What's going on?
We're going to find the man who took my mother from me.
Sokka told me the story of what happened. I know who did it and I know how to find him.
Um ... and what exactly do you think this will accomplish?
Ugh, I knew you wouldn't understand.
Ugh, I knew you wouldn't understand.

Wait! Stop! I do understand. You're feeling unbelievable pain and rage. How do think I felt about the sandbenders when they stole Appa? How do you think I felt about the Fire Nation when I found out what happened to my people?
She needs this, Aang. This is about getting closure and justice.
I don't think so. I think it's about getting revenge.
Fine, maybe it is! Maybe that's what I need! Maybe that's what he deserves!
Katara, you sound like Jet.
It's not the same! Jet attacked the innocent. This man, he's a monster.
Katara, she was my mother, too, but I think Aang might be right.
Then you didn't love her the way I did!
Katara!
The monks used to say that revenge is like a two-headed rat viper. While you watch your enemy go down, you're being poisoned yourself.
That's cute, but this isn't air temple preschool. It's the real world.
Now that I know he's out there ... now that I know we can find him, I feel like I have no choice.
Katara, you do have a choice: forgiveness.
That's the same as doing nothing!
No, it's not. It's easy to do nothing, but it's hard to forgive.
It's not just hard, it's impossible.
scene_description: [Cuts to overhead shot of the field as she walks away, Zuko following behind.]

character_words: So you were just gonna take Appa anyway?
Yes.
It's okay, because I forgive you.  That give you any ideas?
Don't try to stop us.
I wasn't planning to. This is a journey you need to take. You need to face this man.  But when you do, please don't choose revenge. Let your anger out, and then let it go. Forgive him.
Okay, we'll be sure to do that, guru goody-goody.
Okay, we'll be sure to do that, guru goody-goody.
Thanks for understanding, Aang. Yip-yip.
scene_description: [Appa takes flight; Aang and Sokka look up at the departing bison, their backs facing the camera.]

character_words: You know, you're pretty wise for a kid.
Thanks, Sokka.
Usually it's annoying, but right now, I'm impressed.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the two standing together looking up.]

character_words: I appreciate that.
So, can I borrow Momo for a week?
Why do you need Momo?
We need to find the Fire Navy communication tower. All the navy's movements are coordinated by messenger hawk. And every tower has to be up to date on where everyone is deployed.
So once we find the communication tower, we bust in and take the information we need.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the communication tower situated on an island in the middle of the ocean; off-camera.]

character_words: Not exactly. We need to be stealthy and make sure no one spots us,  otherwise they'll warn the Southern Raiders long before we reach them.
Not exactly. We need to be stealthy and make sure no one spots us,  otherwise they'll warn the Southern Raiders long before we reach them.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of the communication tower, the camera panning downward.]

character_words: Okay, Southern Raiders.  Bam.  On patrol near Whaletail Island.
Okay, Southern Raiders.  Bam.  On patrol near Whaletail Island.
Whaletail Island, here we come.
scene_description: [Cuts to shot of Zuko and Katara looking at the map.]

character_words: You should get some rest. We'll be there in a few hours. You'll need all your strength.
Oh, don't you worry about my strength. I have plenty. I'm not the helpless little girl I was when they came.
I'm going to find Mom.
Mom!
Just let her go and I'll give you the information you want.
You heard your mother. Get out of here!
Mommy, I'm scared.
Go find your dad, sweetie. I'll handle this.
I ran as fast as I could.
Dad, Dad! Please, I think Mom's in trouble! There's a man in our house!
scene_description: [Arrives to where her father is battling Fire Nation soldiers.]

character_words: Kya!
But we were too late. When we got there, the man was gone.  And so was she.
Your mother was a brave woman.
I know.
There!  See those sea raven flags?  It's the Southern Raiders.
There!  See those sea raven flags?  It's the Southern Raiders.
Let's do this.
So there I was, and I was like, 'You know ...'
This is it, Katara. Are you ready to face him?
Who are you?
You don't remember her? You will soon, trust me.
What's ...  happening to me?
scene_description: [He attempts to control his arm which bends about uncontrollably.]

character_words: Think back. Think back to your last raid on the Southern Water Tribe.
I don't know what you're talking about. Please, I don't know!
Don't lie! You look her in the eye and you tell me you don't remember what you did.
It's not him.  He's not the man.
What? What do you mean he's not? He's the leader of the Southern Raiders! He has to be the guy!
If you're not the man we're looking for, who is?
You must be looking for Yon Rha. He retired four years ago.
Yon Rha! You lazy piece of work, I need something.
Yes, Mother. What is it?
scene_description: [Stops his work and attempts to placate.]

character_words: The tomato-carrots from your garden are too hard for my gums. I need something soft and juicy!
Would you like something else from the garden? I would be happy to ...
Forget your stupid garden!  Get your grimy hind to the market and buy me some real food!
scene_description: [Angrily. Her fists clench as she interrupts.]

character_words: Forget your stupid garden!  Get your grimy hind to the market and buy me some real food!
scene_description: [Cut to a close-up of her as she yells at him; irritatingly.]

character_words: Hello?  Did you see someone?
Hello?  Did you see someone?
Hello?  Is someone there?
scene_description: [Camera view shifts to show someone hiding.]

character_words: That was him. That was the monster.
Nobody sneaks up on me without getting burned!
scene_description: [Drops basket of vegetables and firebends at a nearby bush.]

character_words: We weren't behind the bush.  And I wouldn't try firebending again!
scene_description: [Cut to a side view of the confrontation as Zuko takes a step forward to threaten Yon Rha.]

character_words: Whoever you are, take my money. Take whatever you want. I'll cooperate.
scene_description: [Cut to Yon Rha on the ground with his arm shielding his face. Frightened.]

character_words: Do you know who I am?
No. I'm not sure.
Oh, you better remember me like your life depends on it! Why don't you take a closer look?
scene_description: [Camera focuses on front view of her face.]

character_words: Yes, yes, I remember you now.  You're that little Water Tribe girl.
Yes, yes, I remember you now.  You're that little Water Tribe girl.
Just let her go and  I'll give you the information you want.
scene_description: [Camera zooms out to show Kya kneeling on the floor in front of Yon Rha.]

character_words: You heard your mother. Get out of here!
Mommy, I'm scared.
Go find your dad, sweetie. I'll handle this.
Now tell me, who is it? Who's the waterbender?
There are no waterbenders here. The Fire Nation took them all away a long time ago.
You're lying. My source says there's one waterbender left in the Southern Water Tribe. We're not leaving until we find the waterbender!
If I tell you, do you promise  to leave the rest of the village alone?  It's me.  Take me as your prisoner.
scene_description: [She lowers her head and closes her eyes to make a decision.]

character_words: If I tell you, do you promise  to leave the rest of the village alone?  It's me.  Take me as your prisoner.
scene_description: [Cut to a side view of Yon Rha who nods.]

character_words: If I tell you, do you promise  to leave the rest of the village alone?  It's me.  Take me as your prisoner.
I'm afraid I'm not taking prisoners today ...
scene_description: [Cut to a close-up of Yon Rha who smiles evilly.]

character_words: She lied to you!  She was protecting the last waterbender!
scene_description: [Cut to a close-up of Katara who turns away from Yon Rha as she closes her eyes sadly.]

character_words: What? Who?
Me!
scene_description: [Cut back to Katara who turns to face him again as she opens her eyes and looks back furiously.]

character_words: I did a bad thing! I know I did and you deserve revenge, so why don't you take my mother? That would be fair!
I did a bad thing! I know I did and you deserve revenge, so why don't you take my mother? That would be fair!
I always wondered what kind of person could do such a thing, but now that I see you, I think I understand. There's just nothing inside you, nothing at all. You're pathetic and sad and empty.
Please, spare me!
Please, spare me!
But as much as I hate you ... I just can't do it.
Katara? Are you okay?
I'm doing fine.
Zuko told me what you did. Or what you didn't do, I guess. I'm proud of you.
I wanted to do it. I wanted to take out all my anger at him, but I couldn't. I don't know if it's because I'm too weak to do it or because I'm strong enough not to.
You did the right thing. Forgiveness is the first step you have to take to begin healing.
But I didn't forgive him. I'll never forgive him.  But I am ready to forgive you.
But I didn't forgive him. I'll never forgive him.  But I am ready to forgive you.
scene_description: [Smiles at Zuko and walks up to him.]

character_words: You were right about what Katara needed. Violence wasn't the answer.
It never is.
Then I have a question for you.  What are you gonna do when you face my father?
Doesn't it seem kind of weird that we're hiding from the Fire Lord in his own house?
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: I told you,  my father hasn't come here since our family was actually happy. And that was a long time ago. It's the last place anyone would think to look for us.
scene_description: [Cut to Zuko sitting on a dry fountain and wiping his head with a cloth.]
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: You guys are not gonna believe this! There's a play about us.
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: We were just in town and we found this poster!
scene_description: [Cut to close-up of her and Sokka.]
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: We were just in town and we found this poster!
scene_description: [Sokka shows the poster for the play to the team. It depicts Katara, Aang, and Sokka with Zuko's scarred face in the background.]
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: What? How is that possible?
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Listen to this ...  "The Boy in the Iceberg is a new production from acclaimed playwright Pu-on Tim,  who scoured the globe gathering information on the Avatar, from the icy South Pole to the heart of Ba Sing Se.  His sources include singing nomads, pirates, prisoners of war, and a surprisingly knowledgeable merchant of cabbage."
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Listen to this ...  "The Boy in the Iceberg is a new production from acclaimed playwright Pu-on Tim,  who scoured the globe gathering information on the Avatar, from the icy South Pole to the heart of Ba Sing Se.  His sources include singing nomads, pirates, prisoners of war, and a surprisingly knowledgeable merchant of cabbage."
scene_description: [Cut to a close shot of the poster as the camera pans up.]
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Listen to this ...  "The Boy in the Iceberg is a new production from acclaimed playwright Pu-on Tim,  who scoured the globe gathering information on the Avatar, from the icy South Pole to the heart of Ba Sing Se.  His sources include singing nomads, pirates, prisoners of war, and a surprisingly knowledgeable merchant of cabbage."
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: "Brought to you by the critically acclaimed Ember Island Players."
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Ugh! My mother used to take us to see them. They butchered Love Amongst the Dragons every year!
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Sokka, do you really think it's a good idea to attend a play about ourselves?
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Come on, a day at the theater? This is the kind of wacky time-wasting nonsense I've been missing!
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Come on, a day at the theater? This is the kind of wacky time-wasting nonsense I've been missing!
scene_description: [He holds up the poster anxiously and smiles sheepishly; Katara looks away, appears nonplussed.]
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Hey, uh ... I wanted to sit there.
scene_description: [To Zuko; points to his seat and tries to act casual.]
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Just sit next to me. What's the big deal?
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: I was just, I wanted to ... okay.
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Why are we sitting in the nosebleed section? My feet can't see a thing from up here!
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Don't worry, I'll tell your feet what's happening.
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Sokka, my only brother! We constantly roam these icy South Pole seas, and yet never do we find anything fulfilling!
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: All I want is a full feeling in my stomach! I'm starving!
scene_description: [Cut to Actor Sokka, a thin, lanky man.]
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Is food the only thing on your mind?
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Well, I'm trying to it get out of my mind and into my mouth! I'm starving!
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Well, I'm trying to it get out of my mind and into my mouth! I'm starving!
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: This is pathetic! My jokes are way funnier than this!
scene_description: [Leans forward in his seat; clearly annoyed.]
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: This is pathetic! My jokes are way funnier than this!
scene_description: [Extends his arm in a dramatic gesture.]
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: I think he's got you pegged!
writer: Tim Hedrick, Joshua Hamilton, John O'Bryan

character_words: Every day, the world awaits a beacon to guide us, yet none appears!  Still, we cannot give up hope! For hope,  is all we have! And we must never relinquish it, even ...  even to our dying breath!

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
character_words: What are you suggesting, sir?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
character_words: When the comet last came, my grandfather, Fire Lord Sozin, used it to wipe out the Air Nomads.  Now, I will use its power to end the Earth Kingdom ...  permanently.  From our airships, we will rain fire over their lands, a fire that will destroy everything; and out of the ashes, a new world will be born, a world in which all the lands are Fire Nation and I am the supreme ruler of everything!

character_words: There's one technique you need to know before facing my father - how to redirect lightning.  If you let the energy in your own body flow, the lightning will follow it.  You turn your opponents' energy against them.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: In my life, I tried to be disciplined and show restraint, but it backfired when Fire Lord Sozin took advantage of my restraint and mercy.  If I had been more decisive and acted sooner, I could have stopped Sozin and stopped the war before it started.  I offer you this wisdom, Aang: You must be decisive.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Not just any old people.  These are great masters and friends of ours.  Pakku.
scene_description: [Camera pans and zooms in on Katara and Pakku as she bows to Pakku.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: It is respectful to bow to an old master,  but how about a hug for your new grandfather?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: It is respectful to bow to an old master,  but how about a hug for your new grandfather?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: That's so exciting!  You and Gran-Gran must be so happy to have found each other again!
scene_description: [Frontal view. Surprised and overjoyed, as is Sokka behind her.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: That's so exciting!  You and Gran-Gran must be so happy to have found each other again!
scene_description: [Frontal view of Pakku as she hugs Pakku.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: I made her a new betrothal necklace and everything.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Welcome to the family, Gramp-Gramp!
scene_description: [Runs up and hugs Pakku. Camera zooms in on Pakku.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: You can still just call me Pakku.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: How about Grand-Pakku?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: No.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: No.
scene_description: [Side-view of Zuko and Pakku as Sokka walks away behind Katara sadly. Camera zooms out to show Jeong Jeong.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: And this was Aang's first firebending teacher.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Jeong Jeong.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Master Piandao.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Hello, Sokka.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: So wait. How do you all know each other?
scene_description: [Cut to over-head view from behind the masters.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: All old people know each other. Don't you know that?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: All old people know each other. Don't you know that?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: We're all part of the same ancient secret society. A group that transcends the divisions of the four nations.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: The Order of the White Lotus.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: That's the one.
scene_description: [Frontal view of Piandao and Jeong Jeong. Bumi slides in front of the camera.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: That's the one.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: The White Lotus has always been about philosophy and beauty and truth.  But about a month ago, a call went out that we were needed for something important.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: It came from a Grand Lotus: your uncle,  Iroh of the Fire Nation.
scene_description: [Cut close-up behind Zuko with Pakku and Katara in the background. To Zuko.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: It came from a Grand Lotus: your uncle,  Iroh of the Fire Nation.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: It came from a Grand Lotus: your uncle,  Iroh of the Fire Nation.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Well, that's who we're looking for.
scene_description: [Camera zooms out to show Toph behind Zuko.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Then we'll take you to him.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Wait! Someone's missing from your group.  Someone very important.  Where's Momo?
scene_description: [Appears behind Piandao and Jeong Jeong and pushes them out of the way.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Wait! Someone's missing from your group.  Someone very important.  Where's Momo?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Wait! Someone's missing from your group.  Someone very important.  Where's Momo?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: He's gone.  And so is Aang.
scene_description: [Side-view. Leaning backward almost all the way, as Bumi is right in his face.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: He's gone.  And so is Aang.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Oh well.  So long as they have each other, I'm sure we have nothing to worry about. Let's go!

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Oh well.  So long as they have each other, I'm sure we have nothing to worry about. Let's go!
scene_description: [Pats Sokka on the chest, which causes him to almost fall back.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Oh well.  So long as they have each other, I'm sure we have nothing to worry about. Let's go!
scene_description: [Slams in to the ground. Cut to underneath Bumi as he launches himself away using earthbending while laughing and snorting.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Avatar Kyoshi. I need your wisdom.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: In my day,  Chin the Conqueror threatened to throw the world out of balance.  I stopped him.  And the world entered a great era of peace.
scene_description: [Flashback to frontal view of Chin the Conqueror. Cut to close-up of Avatar Kyoshi.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: In my day,  Chin the Conqueror threatened to throw the world out of balance.  I stopped him.  And the world entered a great era of peace.
scene_description: [Kyoshi enters the Avatar State briefly and begins to earthbend. Cut to wide shot as a dust cloud appears as she separates the land.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: In my day,  Chin the Conqueror threatened to throw the world out of balance.  I stopped him.  And the world entered a great era of peace.
scene_description: [Cut to side-view of Kyoshi as she uses airbending to push the land apart.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: In my day,  Chin the Conqueror threatened to throw the world out of balance.  I stopped him.  And the world entered a great era of peace.
scene_description: [Cut to aerial view of the land separating.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: You didn't really kill Chin.  Technically, he fell to his own doom because he was too stubborn to get out of the way.
scene_description: [Voice-over; Side-view of Chin as he falls to his death.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: You didn't really kill Chin.  Technically, he fell to his own doom because he was too stubborn to get out of the way.
scene_description: [Camera cuts back to close-up view looking up at Aang.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Personally, I don't really see the difference, but I assure you, I would have done whatever it took to stop Chin.  I offer you this wisdom, Aang: Only justice will bring peace.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Personally, I don't really see the difference, but I assure you, I would have done whatever it took to stop Chin.  I offer you this wisdom, Aang: Only justice will bring peace.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Personally, I don't really see the difference, but I assure you, I would have done whatever it took to stop Chin.  I offer you this wisdom, Aang: Only justice will bring peace.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: I knew I shouldn't have asked Kyoshi.
scene_description: [Close-up. Disappointed. Side-view as he leans back.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: So, Bumi ...  how did you end up escaping your imprisonment in Omashu?
scene_description: [Cut closer, side-view. Camera follows them as they walk.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Escape? I didn't escape. Everybody else escaped.  There I was back in Omashu,  waiting for just the right moment.  I didn't know what or when, but I knew I'd know it when I knew it.  An eclipse. That'll do it.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Escape? I didn't escape. Everybody else escaped.  There I was back in Omashu,  waiting for just the right moment.  I didn't know what or when, but I knew I'd know it when I knew it.  An eclipse. That'll do it.
scene_description: [Flashback of Omashu while under control of the Fire Nation during the Day of Black Sun.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Escape? I didn't escape. Everybody else escaped.  There I was back in Omashu,  waiting for just the right moment.  I didn't know what or when, but I knew I'd know it when I knew it.  An eclipse. That'll do it.
scene_description: [Cut to close-up of Bumi suspended in a metal box.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Escape? I didn't escape. Everybody else escaped.  There I was back in Omashu,  waiting for just the right moment.  I didn't know what or when, but I knew I'd know it when I knew it.  An eclipse. That'll do it.
scene_description: [Camera pans round as he looks up to see the solar eclipse. Speaking in flashback.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: What do you think you're doing?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Taking back my city! You've got no firepower. And it's payback time!

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Wow! You took back your whole city all by yourself!

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: So what about you guys? Did you do anything interesting on the day of the eclipse?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Nah.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: No, not really.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: I need to look deep inside myself.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: I am Avatar Kuruk.  When I was young, I was always a go-with-the-flow kind of Avatar.  People seemed to work out their own problems, and there was peace and good times in the world.  But then,  I lost the woman I loved to Koh, the Face Stealer.  It was my fault. If I had been more attentive and more active,  I could've saved her. Aang,  you must actively shape your own destiny and the destiny of the world.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Well, here we are. Welcome to Old People Camp.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Where ... where is he?
scene_description: [Side-view of Jeong Jeong, Piandao, and Pakku. As Zuko speaks, Jeong Jeong and Pakku walk off and Appa stops behind Zuko and Piandao.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Your uncle's in there, Prince Zuko.
scene_description: [Points to a tent on the other side of the camp. Camera cuts and zooms in showing a tent.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Are you okay?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: No, I'm not okay. My uncle hates me, I know it.  He loved and supported me in every way he could, and I still turned against him. How can I even face him?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: No, I'm not okay. My uncle hates me, I know it.  He loved and supported me in every way he could, and I still turned against him. How can I even face him?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Zuko, you're sorry for what you did, right?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: More sorry than I've been about anything in my entire life.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Then he'll forgive you. He will.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Uncle?

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: All these past Avatars.  They keep telling me I'm gonna have to do it. They don't get it.  You're right. Maybe an Air Nomad Avatar will understand where I'm coming from.  I know you can't really talk. Pretending you can just helps me think.  I'm going to pretend I didn't pretend to hear that.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters

I know you can't really talk. Pretending you can just helps me think.  I'm going to pretend I didn't pretend to hear that.
scene_description: [Close-up of Momo, who stares at him. Frontal view of Aang as Momo jumps to his other side.]

I know you can't really talk. Pretending you can just helps me think.  I'm going to pretend I didn't pretend to hear that.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: I am Avatar Yangchen, young airbender.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Avatar Yangchen,  the monks always taught me that all life is sacred. Even the life of the tiniest spider-fly caught in its own web.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Yes. All life is sacred.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: I know, I'm even a vegetarian. I've always tried to solve my problems by being quick or clever. And I've only had to use violence for necessary defense. And I've certainly never used it to take a life.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Avatar Aang, I know that you're a gentle spirit, and the monks have taught you well, but this isn't about you.  This is about the world.
scene_description: [Cut to behind Aang as the camera pans up to show Yangchen.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Avatar Aang, I know that you're a gentle spirit, and the monks have taught you well, but this isn't about you.  This is about the world.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: But the monks taught me that I had to detach myself from the world so my spirit could be free.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Many great and wise Air Nomads have detached themselves and achieved spiritual enlightenment,  but the Avatar can never do it. Because your sole duty is to the world. Here is my wisdom for you:  Selfless duty calls you to sacrifice your own spiritual needs, and do whatever it takes to protect the world.
scene_description: [Side-view of Aang and Yangchen. Camera pans slowly to the right.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters

Here is my wisdom for you:  Selfless duty calls you to sacrifice your own spiritual needs, and do whatever it takes to protect the world.

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: I guess I don't have a choice, Momo.  I have to kill the Fire Lord.
scene_description: [Momo appears behind a tree and approaches Aang. Close-up aerial view of Aang. Sorrowfully.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: I guess I don't have a choice, Momo.  I have to kill the Fire Lord.
scene_description: [Camera zooms out as Aang looks up.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
character_words: Uncle,  I know you must have mixed feelings about seeing me.  But I want you to know,  I am so, so, sorry, Uncle. I am so sorry and ashamed of what I did. I don't know how I can ever make it up to you. But I'll-  How can you forgive me so easily? I thought you would be furious with me.
scene_description: [Cut to view of Iroh from behind.]

chapter: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters

I don't know how I can ever make it up to you. But I'll-  How can you forgive me so easily? I thought you would be furious with me.
scene_description: [Cut to view of Zuko over Iroh's shoulder.]

scene_description: [Cut briefly to view of Iroh from behind before back to a frontal view of Zuko.]
